Dialog.Text: Hello, dude.

Dialog.Title: Sorry, man. I mistook you for somebody else.
Dialog.Text: No problem.

Dialog.Title: Hey. What do you do?
Dialog.Text: I make different sorts of potions from local ingredients.

Dialog.Title: Potions?
Dialog.Text: Yes. Wanna buy some?

Dialog.Title: What for?
Dialog.Text: Who cares? Take some and get high. It's the best treatment for a man who's laid low by the most serious illness ever.

Dialog.Title: What illness?
Dialog.Text: Boredom. By the way, I'm running of the ingredients and soon all people will plunge into the quagmire of the crisis and depression. I need at least a dozen of blyak tongues.

Dialog.Title: I'll get you some.
Dialog.Text: That's great, man, thank you! Remember, only stupid blyak toungues will do!

Dialog.Title: Here are the tongues.
Dialog.Text: Du-u-ude! You're a real jedi. Now the world is a little better to live in.

Dialog.Title: Why?
Dialog.Text: Well...we do it them, right? And eating resonable creatures is a sin, man.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for the 'White'.
Dialog.Text: Oh, I know the guys. Listen... I used to think scientists were the White. Thay're always dressed in white, you know. They came here, lots of peopple with equipment and quard force. Guess what! They wanted to go round the volcano...Brave lads. It was soooo awesome! But then, the real White came later on. That's who're REALLY insane! Do you know Timokha?

Dialog.Title: Who?
Dialog.Text: Timoha. He's a loner, lives in the swamp. He managed to sell one of his bottles to a member of the White Brotherhood.

Dialog.Title: Is that Timokha guy having sort of business with the White?
Dialog.Text: Dunno, man. You never have business with the White, just trade once or twice, if you have the nerve to, of course. Timokha, apparently, does.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about this place.
Dialog.Text: Duuuuude! It's a freaking place! Volcano's been sleeping so far, but we all know it's gonna blow up. The day will come and lava will wash out everything! It's gonna be awesomne, man! Just like Vesuvius, man.

Dialog.Title: I got some questions.
Dialog.Text: Ok. Feel free to ask anything.

Dialog.Title: What other ingredients do you need?
*Treatment for Temon*|One stalker went absolutely nuts.
Dialog.Text: Bad luck, man. I know one reliable medicine that can help. I'll need a Shelled Verliock leg as a main ingredient.

Dialog.Title: Will you make it?
Dialog.Text: Of course. It's my duty.

Dialog.Title: Here is a Shelled Verliock leg.
Dialog.Text: Dude! It's freaking poisonous.

Dialog.Title: Well, now what?
Dialog.Text: We'll try a special treatment. Need to get lots of extracts. Here is the list. Ask Timoha to help.

Dialog.Title: OK.
Dialog.Text: Cheer up, bro. We'll pull him trhough.

Dialog.Title: I brought what you asked for.
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: Did you manage to make the potion?
Dialog.Text: Yea! I tried it already. It's awesome, dude. I'm still high.

Dialog.Title: Will you share with me?
Dialog.Text: No problem. Listen, if you need any drugs or you find ingredients I need, come over.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: Sorry, man. I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: I brought the tongues.
Dialog.Text: Duuuude! Now the world is gonna be better. You're a real jedi.

Dialog.Title: What is that? On the closet.
Dialog.Text: Duuude... IT'S!... it's...a medical equipment...

Dialog.Title: I see.
Dialog.Text: You may ask something else...

Dialog.Title: I met Litowski. Do you know who that is?
Dialog.Text: Dude, I know many men. Why are you asking?

Dialog.Title: What kind of man is he?
Dialog.Text: Listen, I'm busy here. But I'm gonna find a minute for such a big wig as you are and get you a pill for curiosity.

Dialog.Title: You've met him too, right?
Dialog.Text: I have. He knows a lot about medicine.

Dialog.Title: What kind of man is he?
Dialog.Text: Listen, I'm busy here. But I'm gonna find a minute for such a big wig as you are and get you a pill for curiosity.

Dialog.Title: What kind of man is he?
Dialog.Text: Listen, I'm busy here. But I'm gonna find a minute for such a big wig as you are and get you a pill for curiosity.
Stop! Who-o-o-o-o-o-o-o-o lives on the ocean floor?

Dialog.Title: What? Are you drunk?
Dialog.Text: A voice louder than thunder: RRRRUM! RRRRRUM!!! GIVE US RRRRUM!

Dialog.Title: Pretzel sent me.
Dialog.Text: Oh, yes! My old friend. What he asked you to tell me?

Dialog.Title: Er... Clutch...
Dialog.Text: Sooooo.

Dialog.Title: ...Veritas
Dialog.Text: A-a-a-and?

Dialog.Title: ...Nikki!
Dialog.Text: Are you sure these are the words?

Dialog.Title: Almost.
Dialog.Text: Well, it's okay. Me, myself, don't understand a word Pretzel tells me. Thanks, pal. Go look for a tourniquet.

Dialog.Title: What?
Dialog.Text: *Indistinctly muttered something about the forest.*

Dialog.Title: Have you heard about the alcohol facility?
Dialog.Text: Yes I have.

Dialog.Title: Main engineer trying to stop drinking.
Dialog.Text: It's a good reason to drink! Cheers!

Dialog.Title: And what about you?
Dialog.Text: Ummm... I can get sober too. Let me drink that last one.

Dialog.Title: Hey. I thought you've sobered up.
Dialog.Text: Nah. I'm gonna kill all that mutant scum.....yeah. First -- kill, then sober.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Ex-master says hello.
Dialog.Text: No kidding, huh?

Dialog.Title: Cards on Friday he says.
Dialog.Text: Poker or bridge? Tell me. Quick.

Dialog.Title: I told you what I was supposed to tell. I'm gonna take off.
Hey, do you know Litowski?
Dialog.Text: Hey, don't get on my nerve, you rat!
Hey, wait a minute.

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: It's very urgent. You see, I can't go anywhere from here. But I have to send the message.

Dialog.Title: Sorrw, I don't have time.
Dialog.Text: Get out of here, then!

Dialog.Title: Use a phone.
Dialog.Text: Don't joke like that. It's the Zone. Any means of communications do not work. Unless it's the military'sAnd I don't wanna turn to them. Will you help me?

Dialog.Title: No. Tale care of that yourself.
Dialog.Text: Oh man.

Dialog.Title: Okay.
Dialog.Text: Excellent. You need to find the captain Feck-o on the abandoned side of the village. Tell him: "The Clutha, Verato, Nikkto." Understand?

Dialog.Title: Yes, yes, you got it.
Dialog.Text: Great. Good luck!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello.

Dialog.Title: Hello.
Dialog.Text: My name is Ahhhhhmed.

Dialog.Title: Ahmed?
Dialog.Text: No, no. Listen - A-H-M-E-D.

Dialog.Title: Is it just Ahmed?
Dialog.Text: No, No. Ahhhmed. Could you help me, my friend?

Dialog.Title: No. Not interested.
Dialog.Text: Too bad.

Dialog.Title: It depends what you need.
Dialog.Text: It won't take you long. This place is no longer sacred. It's soiled and invaded by filthy mutants. They must DIE! They all must be killed!

Dialog.Title: Easy, easy.
Dialog.Text: ...where was I? Oh yes. Boars destroy the harvest and I have six children to take care of. Could you kill all of 'em? Boars, I mean.

Dialog.Title: Yes, sure.
Dialog.Text: Ten boars will do.

Dialog.Title: No thanks. I don't like pork.
Dialog.Text: No one does, my friend.

Dialog.Title: I killed the boars.
Dialog.Text: You did?

Dialog.Title: Here, boar legs.
Dialog.Text: Yuck! It's gross! I believe you, just take 'em away from me.

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me about this place?
Dialog.Text: Shaitan led you to this place, my friends. It's called Vesuvius, the land of ashes.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about this place.
Dialog.Text: Shaitan led you to this place, my friends. It's called Vesuvius, the land of ashes. It's full of sadness and those filthy mutants. Hey, do you think you could help me?

Dialog.Title: Hey, Ahmed! Do you know any riddles?
Dialog.Text: Of course I do! But before Ahmed proposes you one, do him a favor, my friend.

Dialog.Title: What favor?
Dialog.Text: I see you're a brave soldier. Could you kill at least ten boars for Ahmed? Those filthy mutants are everywhere, it's very hard to live in fear. Do that and Ahmed will reward you.

Dialog.Title: I sorted out your problem.
Dialog.Text: You're a nice man, my friend! Here's your reward and a riddle from Ahmed, as promised. "I have four so I can run, I have two so I can see, I have one which dangles behind, I have two to chase away dogs. Always dirty, what am I?" That's it. Take care, my friend.

Dialog.Title: Deal. I will help you.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, my friend!

Dialog.Title: Thanks, Ahmed!
Dialog.Text: Ahmed wishes you good luck.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: Ahmed doesn't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: As-salamu alaykum, Ahmed!
Dialog.Text: As-salamu alaykum, my friend! I admire your manners, stalker. People don't usually greet me like this. What can I do for you?

Dialog.Title: Save yourself, Ahmed. Omens are everywhere, can't you see them?
Dialog.Text: Ain't the Zone an omen itself, my friend? Allah knows I have doubts...Who is right? Who should we trust and believe?

Dialog.Title: Calm down. Do you not remember Al-Anfal?
Dialog.Text: What? Of course I remember. "Remember ye were on the hither side of the valley, and they on the farther side, and the caravan on lower ground than ye. Even if ye had made a mutual appointment to meet, ye would certainly have failed in the appointment: But (thus ye met), that Allah might accomplish a matter . For to Allah do all questions go back (for decision)".

Dialog.Title: You see? You do know all answers yourself.
Dialog.Text: You're right, my friend! So right! Allah showed me the way, but I was blind. You lit my route and now I see everything is up to Allah. Do you happen to know anyone who could interpret the omens?

Dialog.Title: I do. It's Fedor the Prophet. He can be found in Liubech.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, my friend!
I'm in trouble! TROUBLE! TROUBLE!! TROUBLE-E-E!

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: I lost Sanya's hat. He told me if I borrowed his stuff one more time he'в jerk me up. It can't be good...

Dialog.Title: Are you nuts?
Dialog.Text: A am noooot!

Dialog.Title: You're right. It's not good.
Dialog.Text: Where is his ha-a-a-a-a-a-at?

Dialog.Title: Stop whining.
Dialog.Text: I'm not whining. Could you find the hat for me? Don't wanna be jerked up...

Dialog.Title: Alright. Wait here, I'll get you the hat.
Dialog.Text: Please, hurry!

Dialog.Title: Nope, I'm too busy.
Dialog.Text: Oh no....

Dialog.Title: I found your hat.
Dialog.Text: Ha-a-at! Thank you. I'll never lose it again.

Dialog.Title: Who is Sanya by the way?
Dialog.Text: My older brother. Once I damaged his rifle, he almost kill me for that. And this hat was grandma's gift..Hey...where did I put it again??

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Are you a hunter or a victim? How many have you already killed?

Dialog.Title: I'd better leave.
Dialog.Text: Coward!

Dialog.Title: You're so right!
Dialog.Text: Do you know why I'm here?

Dialog.Title: Surprise me.
Dialog.Text: You and me, we have the same reason to be here. To KILL mutants.We must eliminate every little bastard to free the world..

Dialog.Title: How did you get here in the first place?
Dialog.Text: When the Zone was formed I realized it was my destiny...something I'd been prepared for...My mission is to clear the world off all the monsters.

Dialog.Title: What made you think this way?
Dialog.Text: It an opportunity to fight not against people but against mutants. We mustn't kill each other. It's not right. I hope you get what I mean. Will you help me, stalker?

Dialog.Title: Do you want me to help you clear the Zone off the mutants? Hell, yeah, I will help you.
Dialog.Text: Great! Here's a mission for you to start...kill a dozen of verliocks. When you're done, come back to me.

Dialog.Title: Verliocks? No thanks.
Dialog.Text: Are you afraid or what? Pull yourself together, little girl!

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: You're the one I've been waiting for.

Dialog.Title: I killed 'em all.
Dialog.Text: You're a real warrior.

Dialog.Title: Is there anything else I can do?
Dialog.Text: Sure! It will be a real battle. We'll go through it shoulder to shoulder.

Dialog.Title: What are you up to?
Dialog.Text: Oh...I've been working on something of late.. I called my project "Wild Hunt". This is for all the people inside the Zone, they need to be motivated to make war. So I kinda counted how many mutants we must eliminate to scare the hell out of them. This is our own and true aim, all people must be aware.

Dialog.Title: And how are you gonna do that?
Dialog.Text: There're thousands of 'em, right? And they never lash out at each other, right? But the very second they see a human being they immediately attack. So, there is a hypothesis that they're all a part of the same, so to speak, organism, like immune system, for example. So, I wanna check how strong this organism is.

Dialog.Title: That will be freaking dangerous!
Dialog.Text: So what? Is it supposed to be bad or something? There's no life in the Zone without risking your ass. But I'm gonna need people who will help me accomplish this.

Dialog.Title: You're lucky to have me. then.
Dialog.Text: You're a real warrior ready to fight for our mutual idea. So here's my plan...

Dialog.Title: Good luck with that.
Dialog.Text: You'll see I will accomplish my mission.

Dialog.Title: I'm all ears.
Dialog.Text: I'll tell you the places where we must eliminate as many mutants as we can. The place number one on the list is Big Spiders Cave. Creatures called Brutors live nearby. I want you to start with killing fifteen brutors, then thirty monsters named Stupid Blyaks. When you're done, come back to me. I'll tell you what to do next.

Dialog.Title: You got it.
Dialog.Text: Off you go.

Dialog.Title: I've never worked at the butchery...
Dialog.Text: Where do you think we all are?

Dialog.Title: Mission accomplished
Dialog.Text: Did you do everything like I told you?

Dialog.Title: I did.
Dialog.Text: Well done. Now you're ready for the stage two.

Dialog.Title: Not now. I gotta prepare first.
Dialog.Text: Don't be long!

Dialog.Title: Can't wait!
Dialog.Text: Now I want you to kill at least fifteen Slow Fiends on the Vesuvius. Don't forget to collect their paws! There're also lots of Silvans in the wood near the Vesuvius. Kill thirty of 'em, that will be enough for now. They will be scared, I'm sure. And we'll be lucky if they become even more aggressive than they're now.

Dialog.Title: You're trying to instigate war, ain't you?
Dialog.Text: Sure I am. Didn't you see that coming? War is everywhere. Everyday stalkers kill each other...but they don't realize we gotta fight against our mutual enemy.

Dialog.Title: You're so right.
Dialog.Text: I'm glad you understand that. We help others see what's going on here.

Dialog.Title: You're insane.
Dialog.Text: Who do you think you are to judge me? Coward.

Dialog.Title: I'm on your side.
Dialog.Text: To arms, soldier!

Dialog.Title: The storm is coming, Tacklberry.
Dialog.Text: Very well. Here's your reward. You will go through this shoulder to shoulder.

Dialog.Title: I'm ready for the next step!
Dialog.Text: Now your aim is Tinguska. There're lakes where Jellies live. Kill at least twenty of them. After that kill couple of dozens of verliocks.

Dialog.Title: Give me a break...to take a breath.
Dialog.Text: Breathe as long as you're alive.

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: I gotta warn you, stalker. There's a Colonel in Tunguska, an old cunning man. Don't ever talk to him! If he finds out what we're up to, he'll brainwash you right away and then will put a bullet in your back.

Dialog.Title: That's too dangerous!
Dialog.Text: Pull yourself together, little girl, and make up your mind.

Dialog.Title: Got it. I'll avoid talking to him.
Dialog.Text: Good.

Dialog.Title: I'll stay away from him! (lie)
Dialog.Text: Great.

Dialog.Title: All the monsters are dead.
Dialog.Text: You're a real warrior, if I was looking for soldiers to regiment, I'd definitely pick you. And here's the reward for your job. I feel the tension growing. There's one last step left.

Dialog.Title: Погоди, мне нужен отдых...
Dialog.Text: Ну ясное дело. Не забудь проснуться, а то все веселье пропустишь!

Dialog.Title: Let's end what we started.
Dialog.Text: There're creatures called Seeing Sages. They have kinda psychic power and they're freaking dangerous. Kill thirty of those monsters. And finally, there's a Bid Spider creature for dessert. Kill one and get me all his six legs. Remember, soldier, that's a final battle, no mistakes are allowed.

Dialog.Title: Gotcha. Be ready to medal me.
Dialog.Text: Action!

Dialog.Title: This mission is impossible.
Dialog.Text: You're right...it's impossible if you're a coward! Pull yourself together and make up your mind!

Dialog.Title: It was tough but I'm back alive.
Dialog.Text: I didn't expect you to be so soon! well done. Now all will see what we gotta fight against. Now REAL war is about to start. They told me so...

Dialog.Title: They? Who are they?
Dialog.Text: Nobody, forget it. Here. take this, you'll find it useful. Don't sit on your hands, you gotta fight.

Dialog.Title: I'd love to!
Dialog.Text: You're one of us, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Hunting season ended, It's over, Tacklberry.
Dialog.Text: What did you just say?

Dialog.Title: I spoke to the Colonel.
Dialog.Text: WHAT DID YOU SAY? I knew you'd let me down. I knew it! You're such a coward. What do you choose, to kill or to be killed? You're just a rat, fleeing from a sinking ship. This war is between human beings and mutants, why can't you see that?

Dialog.Title: It's for us to decide. Don't try to tell us all what to do.
Dialog.Text: You think you're a tough guy, stalker. You're just a thief, that's who you are. You'd better get out of here, stalker. GET OUT until I blow your brains out.

Dialog.Title: Calm down, I'm leaving.
Dialog.Text: I will wait, stalker until all the fuss comes to an end. I will find people who'll be ready to side with me. You'll see. You all will see!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Not everything but working on it. Here are blyak tongues.
Dialog.Text: Well done.

Dialog.Title: I did. Here are Brutor bones. That's all for now.
Stage two is on.
Dialog.Text: Hey, my companion. How is it going?

Dialog.Title: I'm back.
Dialog.Text: So fast! How is it going?

Dialog.Title: I'm back with the final report.
Dialog.Text: Did you succeed?

Dialog.Title: Here are big spider legs. It was easy to collect 'em.
I got the bones and tongues.
Dialog.Text: Ну, все точно как я говорил, сделал?

Dialog.Title: I'm ready for the next step.

Dialog.Text: Ты охотник или жертва? Скольких ты уже убил?

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Try to kill ten verliocks. These creatures don't deserve to be living. Kill 'em!

Dialog.Title: With pleasure!
Dialog.Text: I see you're a real warrior. Have a nice hunting.

Dialog.Title: The verliocks are dead.
Dialog.Text: Great! Now the world is much better without 'em. And your pockets are much heavier...Come back when you wanna go hunting again.

Dialog.Title: I killed a lot.
Dialog.Text: Tell me, which do you prefer to kill, people or beasts?

Dialog.Title: People.
Dialog.Text: You like looking into their eyes, when they're dying, don't you? Feeling the biggest fear in the world, sticky like a web. I see. But today I offer you to shot some creatures.

Dialog.Title: Beasts.
Dialog.Text: You have a taste for hunting, don't you? Constant blood-lust is what we inhereted after our ancestors! I think you'll gladly make it hot for mutants.

Dialog.Title: Don't really care.
Dialog.Text: We all are beasts inside. People just pretend they're civilized until they unleash their inner true self. Are you ready to unleash the beast locked up inside?

Dialog.Title: Tell me more.
Dialog.Text: I decided to declare war against beasts all over the Zone. They're mutants and they must die. I don't give a shit how they appeared in the Zone, all I want is kill as many as I can. Are you ready for the Wild Hunt?

Dialog.Title: Why do you hate 'em so much?
Dialog.Text: They killed my last group. They literally ate my comrades, tore 'em apart. I saw how my people suffered and couldn't do anything to help 'em. That was the time when I swore I'll avenge 'em. Are you with me?

Dialog.Title: What do you know about mutants?
Dialog.Text: I've heard stuff. They're said to be similar to anomalies with the only difference that they appear inside living beings. I also heard about so-called immune system of the Zone...But the most important is that mutants can be killed.

Dialog.Title: Let the Wild Hunt begin!
Dialog.Text: Right! The first stage...Let's start by killing brutors and stupid blyaks. Get me blyak tongues and bones of brutors. They must suffer before they die....

Dialog.Title: Got it!
Dialog.Text: Have a nice hunt!

Dialog.Title: First stange is on...
Dialog.Text: Did you bring the trophies?

Dialog.Title: Stage one is over.
Dialog.Text: We'll make a good totem out of these trophies, the one that will make mutants feel the fear of their relatives. Are you ready to spill more dirty mutated blood?

Dialog.Title: I'm ready for the next step.
Dialog.Text: Great. Next step is to head for Vesuvius for creatures called fiends and silvans. Get me fiend hands and silvan hairs. Hope you'll like seeing 'em suffer before they die.

Dialog.Title: You bet!
Dialog.Text: We're similar, you and me.

Dialog.Title: The second stage is on...
Dialog.Text: Did you kill 'em?

Dialog.Title: Stage two is over.
Dialog.Text: Do you feel how the world is changing? The Zone knows we're provoking it. You're not afraid, right?

Dialog.Title: I'm ready for the next stage.
Dialog.Text: Now your target is creatures called jellies and shield verliocks. Tunguska is teeming with 'em. Be prepared!

Dialog.Title: Always prepared!
Dialog.Text: One more thing..when in Tunguska you may meet a man known as Colonel. Don't listen to him, he can't be trusted. He's a coward and ain't worth talking too. Try to avoid him.

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: You're a real warrior and a nice man.

Dialog.Title: Sure! (Lie and turn to the Colonel).
Dialog.Text: You're a real warrior and a nice man.

Dialog.Title: The third stage is on...
Dialog.Text: What beast did you kill?

Dialog.Title: The third stage is over.
Dialog.Text: Nothing is too hard for you. Soon we'll take the last crack. Are you ready to fight against the most vicious hellbounds?

Dialog.Title: Let the Zone flame!
Dialog.Text: We have challenged the Zone and now we're about to see who's stronger. You next target is monsters named sages, as awful as a nightmare itself. You are also gonna face the Big Spider, a living legend of the Zone.

Dialog.Title: I need time to get prepared.
Let all monsters die!
Dialog.Text: Remember, you are the hunter, mutants are the game.

Dialog.Title: Final straight...
Dialog.Text: How is the hunting going?

Dialog.Title: The Zone has convulsed.
Dialog.Text: We have...You have challenged the Zone and overtook it. The creepy monsters will hide in their holes from now on, people will rule the world. You earned my respect and you do deserve to be rewarded.

Dialog.Title: It was a glorious battle.
Dialog.Text: So was the victory. I'm sure you'll have a bright future.

Dialog.Title: Open season is over.
Dialog.Text: What the...? You spoke to the Colonel, didn't you?! Do you know why he's a former Colonel? Huh? He's a floppy jerk, okay? So are you! Cowards! All you do care about is self interest.You don't give a shit about future! The world will go down because of such jerks! But that's alright...soon the Zone will go at you, when you get used to everything...

Dialog.Title: Oh stop it.
Dialog.Text: Get the hell out of here! Coward.

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: For such a worm? Go dig the ground, worm.

Dialog.Title: The verliocks are dead.
Dialog.Text: Oh really? You dared to kill your dearest creatures? Nice. Now get the hell out of here.

Dialog.Title: I need protection.
Dialog.Text: Protection? I thought a real warrior could stand for himself!

Dialog.Title: Woolf threatens me.
Dialog.Text: You're wrong, You don't need protection. Cause there's no way to hide from him. Unless you fly to the Moon.

Dialog.Title: Woolf threatens me.
Dialog.Text: Woolf is a man. A man can be killed. Squeeze his eyes into his head, make him eat his own guts! I know it's hard to get him, but it's not fair to die not seeing your enemy's eyes. I won't let it happen. Tell Woolf if he doesn't fight with honor, Tacklberry will gut him himself!

Dialog.Title: Tell me about the war.
Dialog.Text: War...I know a story which is terrible and glorious at the same time. There was a soldier by the name of Denis Ovcharenko. He was delivering supplies in 1941 when Germans boxed him in. He was about to be interrogated but he killed the officer with an axe. Then he killed a couple of dozens Germans more when he threw grenades at them, which made them flee. Do you even understand with what price the victory came?

Dialog.Title: I met Litovski. Do you know him?
Dialog.Text: I do.

Dialog.Title: What kind of man is he?
Dialog.Text: A mercenary. Listen, I'm here not for chatting, but for dealing with mutants. Get busy too.

Dialog.Title: He's an unsual man, ain't he?
Dialog.Text: Do you wanna know what I think of him? He pisses me off! It's not about his ability to kill people, it's about the way he does that.

Dialog.Title: Well...
Dialog.Text: "Well"? Do you appreciate the way he does that? As for me, I'm for a quick and fair battle.

Dialog.Title: What kind of man is he?
Dialog.Text: A mercenary. Listen, I'm here not for chatting, but for dealing with mutants. Get busy too.

Dialog.Title: What kind of man is he?
Dialog.Text: A mercenary. Listen, I'm here not for chatting, but for dealing with mutants. Get busy too.
Hey! Wait a minute!

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: ...I'm not a coward, believe me, I've seen stuff. But it seems I've been going crazy of late. I'm a researcher. I examine the mucus I find in the swamp. I do not do any harm to anyone...Local soldiers make fun of me though ... they know I'm too sensitive. Yesterday one lad told me he has seen an incredibly tall silvan. He said he'd never seen anything as big before....Listen, could you go there and check..if that's true?

Dialog.Title: Do you also want me to get you some mucus?
Dialog.Text: Of course not! You don't know what kind of mucus exactly I need. Just check. Square H8.

Dialog.Title: All right. I'll check.
Dialog.Text: Thank you.

Dialog.Title: No. I do not like the swamp.
Dialog.Text: O-oh.

Dialog.Title: Everything is fine. No frightening silvan.
Dialog.Text: Really? Are you sure?

Dialog.Title: Only usual monsters.
Dialog.Text: Well, that's fine. Thank you. This is for your help by the way.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
A long time ago, when I was just a little boy, I thought forest was the best gift that the nature could ever give us...

Dialog.Title: I'll better be going...
Dialog.Text: What a pity. Good luck, my friend. Be happy.

Dialog.Title: What forest?
Dialog.Text: Forest is a peaceful green island of joy in the middle of almost lifeless, concrete deserted cities. There's such place not far from here. I want you to explore the place, to see it with your own eyes. Money is nothing, but I'll reward you.

Dialog.Title: Alright. I'll take a look at it.
Dialog.Text: Take your time there, don't rush. Absorb its beauty by your heart and soul. Come back enlightened!

Dialog.Title: This place is indeed full of loonies...
Dialog.Text: That's so untue...

Dialog.Title: I saw the forest.
Dialog.Text: And...?

Dialog.Title: It's just a regular ordinary forest.
Dialog.Text: I knew it! I knew there was nothing special about that place. Not a thing. What are you staring at? Take your reward and leave.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: What forest?
Dialog.Text: Forest is a peaceful green island of joy in the middle of almost lifeless, concrete deserted cities. There's such place not far from here. I want you to explore the place, to see it with your own eyes. Money is nothing, but I'll reward you.

Dialog.Title: Alright. I'll take a look at it.
It's just a regular ordinary forest.
Dialog.Text: I knew it! I knew there was nothing special about that place. Not a thing. Whjat are you staring at? Take your reward and leave.
Hey, my friend. Tell me, do you have anything you'd love to give away?

Dialog.Title: No.
Dialog.Text: I see.

Dialog.Title: I have a lot of such stuff. What exactly do you need?
Dialog.Text: Well...how to explain..it's a thing with wires...lamps...handles. It's very heavy.

Dialog.Title: Do you mean flashlight?
Dialog.Text: Yes! YES! YES! Flashlight. I need two. Two flashlights. I always leave them everywhere. Please, get me those. Will you?

Dialog.Title: OK.
Dialog.Text: I'll be waiting for you.

Dialog.Title: Too far. I'll not go.
Dialog.Text: Too bad...

Dialog.Title: I brougfht you the flashlights.
Dialog.Text: Where? Where are they?!

Dialog.Title: You're nuts.
Dialog.Text: /twisting the flashlights in his hands and muttering/

Dialog.Title: Take them.
Dialog.Text: Ooh! My flashlights. Thank you, thank you. Now I need to find someone who will take them back...

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Wait a minute. Don't pass by.

Dialog.Title: I don't have time for you.
Dialog.Text: Why so rude?

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: I need you help.

Dialog.Title: I'm busy right now.
Dialog.Text: I see. Whatever.

Dialog.Title: What help?
Dialog.Text: I have an appointment with one friend of mine, he's gone to Ryabinushka. He owes people...wrong people, I'd say, so he cant' show up here. I know he was going to leave a note for me and tell me where we'd meet. I can't leave this place, but you can. Could you go to the stadium and find the note? There's an old fridge next to the wall, the note must be inside. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: I think I can do it.
Dialog.Text: Thank you very very much.

Dialog.Title: I'm afraid that would be no.
Dialog.Text: Too bad. I thought you'd help me out.

Dialog.Title: The fridge is empty.
Dialog.Text: Yeah? Strange. Something happened. I hope he is alive. Thank you anyway. Here, take this.

Dialog.Title: Do you know anything about the crashed copter?
Dialog.Text: I don't. I had lunch in the town that day. When I came back, the copter was already wrecked. One trader told me he'd seen how it crashed. I wish I had seen it too, it's not something you see everyday, you know...Listen, I need you help with something.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Would you like to make some extra cash?

Dialog.Title: Not interested.
Dialog.Text: Up to you.

Dialog.Title: By doing what?
Dialog.Text: I'm an inventor. I've been working on my latest project, but there's something missing in it. All I can tell you is that I need some components ro finish my work. You get me the components, I pay you well for that. If you agree, you should start searching the house on a hill. You may well find something in garages and warehouses all over Liubech.

Dialog.Title: Okay.
Dialog.Text: You have no idea how grateful I am.

Dialog.Title: I'm fed up of running about.
Dialog.Text: Up to you.

Dialog.Title: I brought you the parts.
Dialog.Text: Wonderful, wonderful. Where are they?

Dialog.Title: Here you go.
Dialog.Text: Thanks a lot. Throw them onto that pile. Here's the money.

Dialog.Title: Can you lead me to Tunguska?
Dialog.Text: Dear friend, who told you I could be of any help? Wait.. I know, Nicheporenko did! Listen, I don't take people there, Ok? I just lead 'em to the anomaly and affect 'em with one of my devices, so that they dissapear. Tha's it. I don't know if they ever reach Tunguska or whatever. And don't ask me to take you back. it's not my problem. Come back on your own,

Dialog.Title: Reassuring...
Dialog.Text: I need at least 5 electronic parts.

Dialog.Title: I brought you the parts.
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: Lead me to Tunguska.
Dialog.Text: Ready?

Dialog.Title: Hi. I need your help.
Dialog.Text: What can I do for you?

Dialog.Title: Can you assemble this?
Dialog.Text: Let me see it first. Wow! I'm impressed, such an interesting device it is! Sure, I can assemble it, but what do you need it for?

Dialog.Title: I can't tell you. Will you help or not?
Dialog.Text: I think I will...but I need something from you in return.

Dialog.Title: I knew you'd say so.
Dialog.Text: I will need the following components: 20 bimetal plates, 20 electronic parts and 5 repair kits. Tools are always needed, you know.

Dialog.Title: I'll get you the components.
Dialog.Text: I'll be waiting here.

Dialog.Title: I'm back.
Dialog.Text: Did you succeed?

Dialog.Title: Here are the components for you.
Dialog.Text: Thank you! These magnifiers are so powerful! The signal strength will be enough to communicate with the haven itself!

Dialog.Title: What can such signal be used for?
Dialog.Text: Practically for anything. But hardly anything works here in the Zone.

Dialog.Title: Why? What's wrong?
Dialog.Text: I was just think aloud, my friend. I have just one idea of implementing the magnifier. That's a radio tower in Tunguska. But I'm afraid that won't work.

Dialog.Title: Why not?
Dialog.Text: I tend to believe everything is possible here, in the Zone. That is why our rational methods we used to are not working.

Dialog.Title: I understand.
Dialog.Text: Come over again if you need help.

Dialog.Title: It's me again. I got some questions.
Dialog.Text: I do remember you. Has anything happened?

Dialog.Title: Radio catches a strange signal that has impact on people's mind.
Dialog.Text: Well well. As far as I know Morse is in charge of maintaining the radio tower. Was it him who had been affected by the signal?

Dialog.Title: You're right. Can you help?
Dialog.Text: I fear I cannot. I can understand HOW the signal works. But I can't tell you where it came from. I may just suggest it's quite dangerous and unpredictable. You gotta find a man named Chereshnikov. I think he might help you.

Dialog.Title: Thank you. I'll find him.
Dialog.Text: Good luck.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: There's a part for you in a play!
Dialog.Text: What? Are you looking for a lightning technician? That's out of my line.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for an actor!
Dialog.Text: Oh really? An actor? Me? I would love to be one!

Dialog.Title: Do you have any transistors?
Dialog.Text: I do, for now. I will give you some only in return for radio or electronic parts. Get me those and then we'll talk.

Dialog.Title: Speaking of the transistor...
Dialog.Text: Did you bring anything in return?

Dialog.Title: Electronic parts.
Dialog.Text: Not bad. Here, take ten transistors.

Dialog.Title: Radio parts.
Dialog.Text: Not bad. Here, take ten trastistors.

Dialog.Title: Are you kidding me?
Dialog.Text: Nope.

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Oh, you're just in time! You'll need to get some parts. As you already know, that kind of job is boring and I won't pay you a lot, but can give you some transistors in return.

Dialog.Title: I brought the parts...
Dialog.Text: I've been waiting for you! Show me what you got!

Dialog.Title: Nuts...
Dialog.Text: Okay.

Dialog.Title: Springs...
Dialog.Text: Very well.

Dialog.Title: Screw-nuts...
Dialog.Text: Excellent.

Dialog.Title: I gave you all.
Dialog.Text: Thanks you a lot! Here're the transistors as I promised.
Hey you! Come closer.

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: Are you wearing proper boots?

Dialog.Title: What do you mean?
Dialog.Text: I mean, how fast will you run up to the chemical waste disposal?

Dialog.Title: How fast do you want me to run?
Dialog.Text: Like you never ran before. There's one moron named Hare..I want you to send him back here. You can kick his ass if needed.

Dialog.Title: Ok.
Dialog.Text: You'd better move. Don't be long!

Dialog.Title: No way! It's too way far from here!
Dialog.Text: Get out of my sight!

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: Oh, it's you... nothing...

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: Are you the guy that's collecting riddles? If so, I can help you but only if you do me a favor. There's a guy named Bald, who had the nerve to mess with me. I want you to find him and..you know...threaten him a little...

Dialog.Title: Can't you do it yourself?
Dialog.Text: Hey, who needs a riddle, me or you? Besides, I'm not gonna waste my time on such a ragtag like Bald.

Dialog.Title: Ok. You win. I'll do it.
Dialog.Text: You'd better move on then.

Dialog.Title: Coming. I've spoke to Bald.
Dialog.Text: Did he get it?

Dialog.Title: I think he did.
Dialog.Text: Good. Here's the riddle for you. "They hit me, they dig me, they cut me. But I'm always kind and quite and repay them with good'.

Dialog.Title: Thanks man! Take care.
Dialog.Text: Watch yourself.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Coming already. Hey, are you looking for a job?
Dialog.Text: I'm never bothered to look for it. If always finds me. Since you're asking...Artifacts will be available only tomorrow and If you're hunting for someone's head, there's a list of stuff I don't do.

Dialog.Title: There's a military order. Bandits wanted.
Dialog.Text: I see. Any specific names?

Dialog.Title: No.
Dialog.Text: Let me see the paper. Well Well...Anyway, play it off the cuff.

Dialog.Title: Up to you. You gotta find Drachuk in Liubech later on.
Dialog.Text: I know.

Dialog.Title: Чего надо?
Dialog.Text: Кое-что... На сначала разберись с Лысым.

Dialog.Title: I talked to the Bald.
Dialog.Text: Did he get it?

Dialog.Title: Yes, I think so.
Dialog.Text: Very well. As promised, this is a riddle from me - They hit me, cut me, but I'm always kind to them.

Dialog.Title: Thanks. Good luck!
Dialog.Text: Don't die out there.
Oh! Scared me! Fool!

Dialog.Title: Bye?
Dialog.Text: Go away!

Dialog.Title: Quiet!
Dialog.Text: What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Go home. Yuriy worried.
Dialog.Text: Yeah? Already? I don't have a clock.

Dialog.Title: Quickly!
Dialog.Text: Coming, coming. I'll go to the toilet and than will come. If to work with artifacts for him than I can do it at least for the day. And if I want to go for a walk then must return immediately.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Do you have rounds?

Dialog.Title: Don't you have enough rounds?
Dialog.Text: I do. I kill mutants all around the town, so I need lots of rounds. Everyday I must kill hundreds of mutant dogs and I just can't do that along. If you have nothing to do, why don't you join me? Take you gun along and go to square Ж12. kill the dogs at the stadium.

Dialog.Title: Just a few. I'm busy.
Dialog.Text: Good luck.

Dialog.Title: I'm too busy.
Dialog.Text: Take care then.

Dialog.Title: No problem.
Dialog.Text: Cool. Come back when you're done. I'll reward you.

Dialog.Title: I shot the dogs.
Dialog.Text: You helped me out. Thanks. Take your money.

Dialog.Title: Give me that.
Dialog.Text: Come again tomorrow.

Dialog.Title: I'll give you some in return for a riddle.
Dialog.Text: Deal!

Dialog.Title: What rounds do you need?
Dialog.Text: Three packs of 12/76 0000 will do.

Dialog.Title: I'll be back soon.
Dialog.Text: Don't be long.

Dialog.Title: Here are your rounds.
Dialog.Text: Cool. Here's a riddle for you, then "They're silent when alive, touch them dead, they'll growl".

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: You're welcome.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: How about spending your own rounds?
Dialog.Text: I do. What do you want, stalker? You're wasting my time.

Dialog.Title: Mokrukh's gang is too big...
Dialog.Text: You're not the only one who wants to execute its members, but I'm not an avenger.

Dialog.Title: Here's a paper. Money later.
Dialog.Text: It's too bad, isn't it? I bet Drachuk is afraid that even more people will join Mokrukh. You win. I'm in. With the condition that you pay for rounds and equipment.

Dialog.Title: You got it.
Dialog.Text: Agreed.

Dialog.Title: Говорят, вы состязание затеяли?
Dialog.Text: Ты про "Сезон охоты" что ли? Да, есть такое дело.

Dialog.Title: На кого нынче охота?
Dialog.Text: На молодых кабанов. Нужно десяток их клыков собрать.

Dialog.Title: А награда?
Dialog.Text: Ну, награда стандартная. Однако, тем сталкерам и охотникам, кто натаскает больше всех - полагается дополнительная премия. Только учти - в соревновании участвует еще и Капитан Шперлинг - он мускулы бруторов собирает. Наши заказы равнозначны и считаться будут вместе. А значит победит тот, кто натаскает больше всех ему и мне суммарно. Берешься?

Dialog.Title: Я принес клыки кобанов!
Dialog.Text: Отлично! Давай я их отсортирую... Приходи через часок с новой порцией.

Dialog.Title: А где можно посмотреть результаты?
Dialog.Text: А вон - рядом со мной доска для объявлений на заборе - там я вывешиваю списки...
Hey, you. Come closer.

Dialog.Title: I'm too busy.
Dialog.Text: I don't believe you.

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: Do you wanna earn 300? Go over there, to an abandoned village in square И10, find a man in a white coat and tell him he's an idiot.

Dialog.Title: I have something better to do.
Dialog.Text: Well..well. Another idiot on my way.

Dialog.Title: That's it? Wait for me, I'll be back.
Dialog.Text: Good boy!

Dialog.Title: Now what?
Dialog.Text: Did you hand the message?

Dialog.Title: Long ago.
Dialog.Text: Good. Listen, I want you to do something for me. You may well laugh at the whole situation but I am in no mood for laughing. One idiot broke down a very expensive device that I can't work without...Besides, if the professor learns about it, he'll bury us alive right here.

Dialog.Title: So..what do you want from me?
Dialog.Text: I need money, 300 000 to be precise. That's how much a new device costs. I know that's a lot and you may not agree...but that'll be it for me if I don't find money. If you help me out, I'll tell Simonov about your good deeds.

Dialog.Title: I don't have that much.
Dialog.Text: I see. Anyway, I appreciate your sympathy.

Dialog.Title: Here....take 300 000.
Dialog.Text: Are you serious? That's...so unlike stalkers. Thanks, man. Know what, I'll tell Simonov the truth. That'll be fair.

Dialog.Title: Do you wanna ask me about money?
Dialog.Text: How did you....Oh yes. I've already asked you.

Dialog.Title: I saw a scientist locked in a cage not far from here.
Dialog.Text: Don't remind me about that idiot.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Watch your tongue.
Dialog.Text: You'd better watch yourself. If you have nothing to do, help me with samples.

Dialog.Title: What samples?
Dialog.Text: Stuff for my experiments. I call 'em samples. I need a dozen of polar dog jaws. Can you get those for me?

Dialog.Title: Alright.
Dialog.Text: Waiting for you here.

Dialog.Title: I brought the jaws.
Dialog.Text: Give me these. It wasn't that hard, was it? Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: Thanks. I'd wish you well, but I'm afraid it won't help.
Dialog.Text: What? Do you think it's funny, smart man? Come again tomorrow, I'll need the samples again.

Dialog.Title: Do you wanna be an actor?
Dialog.Text: Actor? Me? I don't have time for that. Got to get med kits for one stalker. No time for fooling around.

Dialog.Title: А если я принесу тебе аптечки?
Dialog.Text: Тогда - дело другое.

Dialog.Title: Here are med kits.
Dialog.Text: Great, now I'm in!
Be quick!

Dialog.Title: One doctor asked me...
Dialog.Text: ...to tell me I'm an idiot. I know. You're not the first who's told me so today.

Dialog.Title: Sorry, man.
Dialog.Text: Yeah...Have a nice day.

Dialog.Title: Why is the doc so angry with you?
Dialog.Text: I was unlucky to damage a very expensive device...it drowned in lava.

Dialog.Title: Can I do anything to help you out?
Dialog.Text: I fear there's nothing we both could do...I AM an idiot and I'm good for nothing. I wish I could do something to deserve professor's admiration. I guess I could try to get him artifacts.

Dialog.Title: What artifacts do you need?
Dialog.Text: Are you ready to get me them? That would be just great! I need at least four "Screens α", six "Pillows α" and two "Stabilizer α". That would be enough.

Dialog.Title: I brought the artifacts.
Dialog.Text: All of them??

Dialog.Title: I've already given you all.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, you helped A LOT. Listen, I don't have any money to reward you but I will tell Simonov that you helped me to get the arts. Anyway, he won't believe I managed to do that without any help.

Dialog.Title: Do you provide Patisson with water?
Dialog.Text: Yes, I do...

Dialog.Title: Stop then. Doctor Flayer has a plan.
Dialog.Text: But he'll die without water...what kind of plan is that? Okay, take this canteen I was going to give him today. Not it's up to you. I wash my hands of him.

Dialog.Title: You may give it to me, I'll bring it.
Dialog.Text: Okay, take the flask.

Dialog.Title: Don't tell anything to Zhivoderov.
Dialog.Text: Got it. ...I have not seen you, and I dropped the flask while was running away from the mutants.

Dialog.Title: Not yet. But I'm working on it.
Think of a riddle for me.
Dialog.Text: I guess I know one. Why do you think I should tell you that for free?

Dialog.Title: You're a sly dog, Whatman.
Dialog.Text: Calm down, I'm not asking for the moon. I see you're a skilled stalker, so that would be easy for you. Get me ten verliock legs. That'll help me to get in good with Doctor House. Help me out, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Alright, alright. But you promised to propose me a riddle!
Dialog.Text: I remember that. In fact, I'll give you some cash as "thank you".

Dialog.Title: I brought you the legs. What about the riddle?
Dialog.Text: Thanks, man! Here's you riddle "Stiff is my spine, And my body is pale. But I'm always ready to tell a tale. What am I?"

Dialog.Title: Cool, thanks. Take care, man.
Dialog.Text: I'll try.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I'm Shtaket. I know a great deal about local trade. What can I do for you?

Dialog.Title: I need money.
Dialog.Text: So does everyone. I have something to offer. Taxidermists from outside the perimeter are waiting for a bear head. They pay well. Here's the deal, you get me a head, I pay you. That'll be enough for the first time.

Dialog.Title: No problem! Just wait for me here.
You don't seem to understand me.|| I want to do some job, but not here.
Dialog.Text: Ok, nevermind, then.

Dialog.Title: I brought you the bear head.|| That bear tried to rip MY head off.
Dialog.Text: I'm impressed.

Dialog.Title: Да вот, прикупить барахлишка твоего пришел.
Dialog.Text: Но-но! У меня тут качество почти швейцарское! Ну…не совсем, но уж точно не фуфло какое-то. Выбирай.

Dialog.Title: Got some job?
Dialog.Text: I have one special contract for you. You need to find 4 different artefacts. And I'll thank you. A big "thank's" with several zeroes.

Dialog.Title: Got it. I'll come back with those artefacts.|| Don't forget my cash.
Dialog.Text: C'mon, come back soon.

Dialog.Title: Not now. I don't have time for this.
Speaking of the arts...
Dialog.Text: I'm listening.

Dialog.Title: Я от Метрофана, он просил сорок коробок патронов подготовить, 5,45x39, он вечером зайдет.
Dialog.Text: Фига!!! Никак наш кулинар на войну собрался? Ну да ладно, вечером зайдет - попытаю, спасибо, что передал. Кстати, тебе ружье не нужно? Сегодня, можно сказать, твой счастливый день, у меня тут скопился ящик - никто их не покупает, так вот решил раздать часть, а то место занимают, полезные вещи ставить некуда.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо, лишний ствол никогда не помешает.
I need a cheap and cool gun.
Dialog.Text: Will my six-barrelled plasma-laser-nuclear gun do for you? I'll give it away for free...Just kidding. I do have something for you. I'll give you a gun if you kill the damn dogs that bother me. Those mutants scare clients away.

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: To begin with kill at least five or eight dogs. Come back when you're done.

Dialog.Title: No. Dog is a best friend!
Dialog.Text: Have you seen local dogs? That bastards can nip your legs off.

Dialog.Title: I did what you asked. Now give me the gun.
Dialog.Text: Here you go.

Dialog.Title: The cargo will arrive today. All in old place.
Dialog.Text: Why today? We agreed on the day after tomorrow? Is it some kind of a trick? I can't collect money so soon...

Dialog.Title: Blacksmith said you'll pay me.
Dialog.Text: Pay to you? To delivery man? No, bro, as you see, I myself need all the money I can get. You can have these ammo clips though. If you still aren't happy, talk to Blacksmith.

Dialog.Title: I'll take them.
Dialog.Text: Here.

Dialog.Title: Take Acid's debt out in these artifacts.
Dialog.Text: It's too late. I've already set a price on his head. There's no way back. You may give me these arts and I promise I won't seek for people to kill him. But he's already wanted and many people are hunting for him.

Dialog.Title: Take them anyway.
Dialog.Text: Ok. Now let's talk business. One friend of mine named Sanya the Old Coon needs help. He injured his leg and he has a lot of work that must be done. He makes souvenirs and sell them to people from outside the perimeter for a very good price. Now he's not able to work, help him out, stalker, he'll pay you back.

Dialog.Title: I need money, so let's pretend|| I never told you about him.
Dialog.Text: Fine by me. But I'm short on money right now. So you need to find Metrofan. He is in the old Palace of Culture building. It's in the square З12. I'll send him a message and he'll give you the money. One street to the north from here, you'll se the square. Turn right on the first floor, there you'll find him.
Что еще?

Dialog.Title: Нет, сейчас я занят.
Dialog.Text: Ну смотри, зайдешь к нему, как время будет.

Dialog.Title: Yup! I want to ask you something.
Do you have anything else to offer?
Need a help?
Dialog.Text: Not me, but I have a pal, Sanek the Wise. He makes very good souvenirs. And good money, by the way. But he told me that his leg is injured. And he has a looooot of things to do. So, go help him. He'll give you cash.

Dialog.Title: Where can I find that Sanya guy?
Dialog.Text: He's not far from the tower in square И12. it's to the north-east from the square, you'll see the route if you turn right after the Lenin monument. Do you think you know where the square is?

Dialog.Title: Кузнец тебе передать велел
Dialog.Text: Говори, что передал?

Dialog.Title: Blacksmith asked to tell you...
Dialog.Text: What is it?

Dialog.Title: No, I don't.
Dialog.Text: Go out of the building, turn left and you'll see a gate in a fence, go through it and turn left again, then straight ahead along the street until you reach the second crossroad. Then turn right.

Dialog.Title: OK. I got one more question.
Tell me about local hucksters.
Dialog.Text: Be ready to pay for information.

Dialog.Title: Here's 1000.
Dialog.Text: Thank you very much.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about local hucksters.
Dialog.Text: Hucksters you're saying..They're always ready to buy pup heads and tails, which they sell like souvenirs to people from outside the perimeter. They set a very good price for those, much bigger than you get selling heads and tails here. There're some places where they "work", First of all, there's a kindergarten, although you won't be able to get a lot of money there, the place is teeming with mutants. Then, there's a former militia station and the Palace of Culture, where you can earn much more. The station is the most profitable place for trading, but you'll have to try to get there. And there's also a man named Gourmet . He lives in a village, where anomalies are much more dangerous. Pup heads and tails are of no interest for him. He's interested in bigger and more vicious monsters. At the same time he's ready to offer bigger price.

Dialog.Title: Thank's!
Dialog.Text: Wait a bit. I can share a secret with you.

Dialog.Title: I'm listening.
Dialog.Text: Wind puffes away rumours...and pockets can't be filled with the wind...

Dialog.Title: Here, 500 more.
Dialog.Text: Great.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more.
Dialog.Text: There's a rumor, that one old stalker from New Land decided to quit, so he's selling all his armory out. He's an experienced stalker who isn't used to firing with no urgent need. So, you can imagine how many rounds he's got. His "collection" also includes very rare stuff that you might not find anywhere else.

Dialog.Title: Go on.
Dialog.Text: The leader of one trade fraction has been seen in the tunnel near the Palace of Culture. No one knows what he's done. I bet he's gonna swing a huge deal.

Dialog.Title: Thanks for the information.
Dialog.Text: Wait a minute, I have even more information for you, It'll cost you 500 rubles.

Dialog.Title: Here you go.
Dialog.Text: He-he-he...

Dialog.Title: Is Acid still wanted?|| I'm worried about him.
Dialog.Text: I told you I can't change anything. Unless...since we're working together now, I can inform you if I see someone looking like...let say, bounty hunter. I do wanna help, believe me. I'm sorry I overreacted...

Dialog.Title: I understand. Tell me if you see anyone suspicious.
Have you not seen anybody like that yet?
Dialog.Text: Oh yeah. Almost forgot. I know one bounty hunter and have seen him recently. He seemed to go toward the station.

Dialog.Title: Why did you not tell me that earlier ?|| I'm gonna save Acid.
Dialog.Text: Yeah, you gotta be going if you don't want him dead.

Dialog.Title: I brought one bear head.
Dialog.Text: At least something. Next time bring a bigger head.

Dialog.Title: Where is my money?| Give me my money.
Dialog.Text: Here you are.

Dialog.Title: I brought one red bear head.
Dialog.Text: Cool. Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: Where is my money?
Dialog.Text: Here you are.

Dialog.Title: Where's my money?
Dialog.Text: Yup. Here you are. Nice reward for the nice job.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for sale.
I've already given you all.
Dialog.Text: Oh, right. Thanks.

Dialog.Title: I'm still looking for the stuff you need.
Dialog.Text: Why did you come round, then? Don't come to me with empty hands ever again. I'm waiting for the arts.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for barter.
Morozov wants his package back.
Dialog.Text: Ah yes! His package is outside. Take it and bring it back to him. But do it as fast as you can.

Dialog.Title: There was a bomb in that box? Man, what a F***?
Dialog.Text: Ah. It was a mistake. Sorry. I hope nobody get hurt.

Dialog.Title: This is a totally bullshit!!!!!!
Dialog.Text: Calm down. That was a bad idea to ask you to do that.

Dialog.Title: Where is the Morozov's REAL package?
Dialog.Text: Ask Alex about it. He has the stuff.

Dialog.Title: Vadim Stupka sent me. I'm here to figure out about his brother.
Dialog.Text: He's always been someone's bitch so is he now. You need to find Vitya Borovikov to speak for that guy.

Dialog.Title: Here's a letter for you.
Dialog.Text: Let me see that. Wait...what the hell...? What have they done to you, guys? Damn it! Panya, Scoopnet, Timur, Zinger...They all get panished for what I'd done. Bummer! Bastards!

Dialog.Title: What should I tell 'em?
Dialog.Text: Tell 'em we'll settle down for a while, I'll call off my people...but only гша they don't try to go at us...

Dialog.Title: You got uit.
Dialog.Text: Watch your back, man. Don't trust everybody.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: What do you mean you don't remember?
Dialog.Text: Whatever you want from me. stalker, I ain't gonna explain myself to you.

Dialog.Title: Soldiers and bandits were killed in the wood.
Dialog.Text: ..I'm thinking the military wanted to push off the loot and there was a brigade waiting for 'em. The soldiers must have disliked something and opened fire..

Dialog.Title: If it's gonna be war, it'll turn out badly for everyone.
Dialog.Text: People will sacrifice their lives.. but soldiers must understand that they'd better respect our wishes.

Dialog.Title: You don't seem to know...Two people survived.
Dialog.Text: You must be kidding! Who are they?

Dialog.Title: Deserters. In fact, they didn't find the loot.
Dialog.Text: People think we had planned it all еркщгпрюююещ kill our people and go back without them. We have to find the deserters and give 'em a hard time.

Dialog.Title: How to inform people about everything?
Dialog.Text: They pobably won't listen.. you gotta whet their appetite first..Do you get what I mean?

Dialog.Title: Why don't you do it yourself?
Dialog.Text: That's your task, stalker. That's not the way the things are done here.

Dialog.Title: Ok. So whatt do I do?
Dialog.Text: I'll speak for you with my people to let 'em know you're one of us. And you get some tea, cigarettes and canned food to our safe house by the lake. When you arrive, talk to Mokruch, he's a top dog there.

Dialog.Title: Ok. Understood.
Dialog.Text: See you later.

Dialog.Title: Two soldiers. In fact, they had the cargo. (lie)
Dialog.Text: No way! No I know... Tell me, stalker, why are you helping us?

Dialog.Title: Two reasons. I love the truth and I love money.
Dialog.Text: Here what we're gonna do..We gotta show the military where they belong...I'll tell my people you're one of us. As to you, go and find Mokrukh, he'll tell you what to do.

Dialog.Title: Understood.
Dialog.Text: You'd better be going.

Dialog.Title: Hey, wanna see the stuff from Beluga?
Dialog.Text: Not so loud! Hey, are you nuts? It's not the right place for that...Show it to me quckly. Good. Now get away.

Dialog.Title: I need protection.
Dialog.Text: Protection from what?

Dialog.Title: Woolf is threatening me.
Dialog.Text: Man, you're in trouble! I'm not gonna meddle in that.

Dialog.Title: Woolf is threatening me.
Dialog.Text: Don't worry.The lads will protect you. Tell that sly Woolf to back off till it's too late.

Dialog.Title: I know who attacked the bandits.
Speaking of bear heads...
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: What is going on between the bandits and the military?
Dialog.Text: Who do you think you are to be told such stuff? I don't remember we had any sort of business with you.

Dialog.Title: Let's go down to business, then.
What do you know about Mr. Big?
Dialog.Text: Erm...

Dialog.Title: He spoke about you...
Dialog.Text: Hey, it's none of your stalker business, okay?

Dialog.Title: So, you know him, right?
Dialog.Text: He's an "old gangster" and I'm just a simple huckster. That's you need to know.

Dialog.Title: He wants to know how it's going with your business...
Dialog.Text: Listen, tell him I have all I need and don't wanna stick my neck out...Since you're so interested in this, go to the swamps and tell Tatar what you told me.

Dialog.Title: He wants to know how it's going with your business...
Dialog.Text: Listen, tell him I have all I need and don't wanna stick my neck out...Since you're so interested in this, go to the swamps and tell Tatar what you told me.

Dialog.Title: I'm back form Tatar. What's wrong with Mr. Big?
Dialog.Text: No Mr. Big is better than one...I didn't say that!

Dialog.Title: Hey, Shtaket.
Dialog.Text: Hey, are you here for a chat or...?

Dialog.Title: I brought you the money.
Dialog.Text: What money? Did we have a deal of any kind? What are you talking about?

Dialog.Title: Let's make a deal now.
Dialog.Text: Hey, be quiet. Do you see the sign saying "Buying up arts"? No? That's right, cause I don't do that.

Dialog.Title: Give me the money back, then.
Dialog.Text: Calm down! What's the deal about?

Dialog.Title: (tell the same thing Mr. Big told you)
Dialog.Text: Чё это за "серьезные люди"? Хотя, можешь не говорить - я усек уже откуда ветер дует. Я в такие дела никогда не лез и не хочу. Палевно это слишком. Тут, блин, такое дело: чуть тема изменится и я могу огрести от тех же вояк - они церемониться не будут, если узнают, что я у них буквально под носом кручу-верчу, да не по мелочи, а с какими-то редкими "цацками". Так что передай своим серьезным людям, что я не при делах. Если будет какой подгон... Или если они реально покажут, что могут что-то - тут и я подтянусь. Короче, скажи, что мое дело маленькое. Хата моя с краю и я в козыри не лезу.

Dialog.Title: Any ideas who I can talk to?
Dialog.Text: No idea (reluctantly)..

Dialog.Title: Нет мыслишек, кто с "цацками" работает?
Dialog.Text: Раньше я бы ответил, мол, к Филину тебе надо... Да только Филин ныкается где-то. Кое-кто из братвы уже шепот пустил, что кранты Филину. Но я за то точно не скажу. Слышал я еще один вариант: есть барыга, кликуха у него "Шрам"... Но как на него выйти - я не в курсах. Он вроде с наемниками работает напрямую - типами, которых "Вороний лес" кличут. Те еще типы. Не стал бы с ними связываться.

Dialog.Title: Do you know who's working with so-called "blings"?
Dialog.Text: If you'd asked me before, I would've told you to turn to filin, but now...I heard about a man called "Scar", have no idea where he might be, though. As far as I know he works with mencenaries, the ones that call their clan the "Raven Wood". I wouldn't mess with them myself...

Dialog.Title: Есть для меня что-нибудь?
Dialog.Text: Для тебя-то? Что например? А тебе, кстати, Кислый или Кузнец для меня ничего не передавали? Тогда дуй к ним.
Hi. Can I help you?

Dialog.Title: Blacksmith told me you'd help me to get a gun.
Dialog.Text: Blacksmith has a big mouth.

Dialog.Title: I always get the job done.
I brought the heads.
Dialog.Text: I'm impressed. Well done. Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: I was just passing by...
Dialog.Text: Keep your eyes open, man.

Dialog.Title: How can I pay for that?
Dialog.Text: I'll ask you to find my friends to return the favor. Their names are Mitya and Split. No idea where they might be. Heard they had been seen first on New Land, then in Tunguska. Anyway, when you find both, help 'em with anything they'll need. Tell 'em I'm really worried.

Dialog.Title: Agreed.
Dialog.Text: If you have questions, ask Ivy the barman. He can answer any question. You'll find his frequenters nearby: the Old Stalker and Misha the Hunter. Misha knows everything about mutants and weapons. And the Old Stalker gladly tell about Zone, about artefacts and always can give you some good advice. He'll ask few coins though or a full glass at least.

Dialog.Title: Уважаемый, а как бы мне патронов раздобыть?
Dialog.Text: Ты их че, жуешь что - ли? Мы с собой много не брали, тут и отстреливаться- то особо не от кого. У Кузнеца спроси, может у него еще остались? У меня точно нет. Если и у него нет, тогда дуй к ближайшему торговцу, один в бывшем здании милиции торгует.

Dialog.Title: The gun's working fine.
Dialog.Text: Hey, did rats bite you? I see a huge scratch on your leg. Here. take this med kit. Next time, be more careful if you don't wanna lose your leg, Oh, I nearly forgot to tell you..Blacksmith were looking for ya..

Dialog.Title: Where can I get some rounds?
Dialog.Text: I got some, if you need. They're venomed and extremely effective against mutants. I'll give you some if you do me a favor, as usual. Kill couple of mutant dogs outside the village and get me two heads as trophy. A guy named Pechkin will give you the rounds in reward for your help. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Blacksmith told me you needed this..
Dialog.Text: Oh that...That's how Blacksmith makes fun of newbies. See, there're lots of non-working artifacts that appear in anomalies near the station. We call 'em "broken screens". Neither useful nor valuable. Throw it away.

Dialog.Title: Silly joke!|| ...I risked my ass to get this one.
Dialog.Text: Take it easy, man...I've got nothing to do with it. I'll give you a Magnetic Grip Device to prettify his joke. It's a special tool to pull artifacts out of anomalies. How do you like it?

Dialog.Title: Why are artifacts so valuable?
Dialog.Text:
There's nothing much to tell about 'em as they ain't studied well. Almost all arts have an unusual impact that change our knowledge about the course of nature. As I say not all artifacts are studied well, but we already know how to take advantages of the impact they cause. Their price is extremely high if you wanns sell it to people outside the perimeter. Some arts are worth kiiping for yourself as they can even serve as a cure for many illnesses. The biggest challenge is that all artifacts are hidden inside anomalies. That's what really pose hazard. In one word...hunting for artifact is a profitable but dangerous job.
I don't know much about them. Most of them has special abilities, which makes you rethink your attitude to nature laws. Some artefacts produce energy and some absorb it. Not all of these abilities are discovered, but we already found some ways to use them. The price for them is rather high. Some of them are better to be kept, as they are useful for a stalker. For example, they may enlarge your metabolism. The problem is that all artefacts are appearing in anomalies. And anomalies may easily turn you into dust. So, making money with artefacts is quite hard.

Dialog.Title: What do you need artifacts for?
Dialog.Text: I owe Shtaket a lot. He found a nice armor for me once, the one you won't be able to get in the Zone. I promised to give him a vast amount of artifacts for that. However, I came across an anomaly and got severely ingured...I heard that Shaket has already set a price for my head...Listen..how about helping me out? Get these artifacts to Shtaket, tell him I'll soon pay the debt.

Dialog.Title: No thanks. Sort it out yourself.
I failed to deliver the artifacts. Forgive me..|Man, I've been mugged. I didn't manage to deliver the artifacts. Sorry.
Dialog.Text: Who mugged you? Anyway, who cares...Now it's not important. Now I must think who can help me out.

Dialog.Title: I gave the arts to Shtaket||, but he said it was too late... someone had already put a price for your head.
Dialog.Text: Shit! Now I'm in real trouble. Hope I'll get out off the hook. Blacksmith is the one who can help me.. he's well respected in the Zone, don't think anyone will have the nerve to go against his will.

Dialog.Title: About money you owe... ||Sanek the Old Coon said he'd speak for you.
Dialog.Text: That would be nice, he's good Shtaket's friend.

Dialog.Title: Speaking of the task you gave me
Dialog.Text: What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Sanek the Old Coon can.|I spoke to Sanek. He asked me to find the exact same artifacts for him. Ain't you got them? In that case he'd speak for you with Shtaket.
Dialog.Text: That's the worst of it..I did have only one each. It's very hard to get proper "Screens".

Dialog.Title: I see. I'll try to do my best to help you.
Dialog.Text: That would be nice!

Dialog.Title: I've found your friend Mitya.
Dialog.Text: Great! How's he doing?

Dialog.Title: I've found your friend Spit.
Dialog.Text: Great? How's he?

Dialog.Title: He doesn't remember you at all.|He's doing well, he's a hunter in Tunguska. But when I mentioned you.. he couldn't remember you at all.
Dialog.Text: What a shame! Well.. he'd always been weird..anyway, I'm glad he's alright. Here's your reward. You did well.

Dialog.Title: Thanks. It's sad story with Mitka.
Dialog.Text: I think that it could be an anomaly, that boiled his brains. I need to think about it.

Dialog.Title: Spit is doing well.|Spit is doing business on New Land...giving rounds in exchange for artifacts.
Dialog.Text: I see. That's where he headed for after he lost his business. Well.. he's always had good commercial sense. I'm glad he's ok. Here's your reward. You did well.

Dialog.Title: About that PM you gave me...
Dialog.Text: You gotta adjust it first. You may try using those mutants rats as targets. There're lots of 'em nearby.

Dialog.Title: I forgot what you'd asked me to do.
Dialog.Text: Oh man..I have two comrades missing. Don't know where they might be, but heard they were seen first on New Land and then in Tunguska. Anyway, if you come across Mitya or Spit, help 'em with anything the'll need and find out how they've been doing. Tell 'em I'm really worried.

Dialog.Title: I got some questions...
Dialog.Text: Questions, huh?

Dialog.Title: Have you heard about the accident on the bridge?
Dialog.Text: I have. Those were trucks full of supplies, too bad they crashed.

Dialog.Title: Do you know what the destination was?
Dialog.Text: Those were the trucks with supplies that must have been delivered to the military posts not far from this place. That's too bad we won't get any supplies..we're running out of food and ammo. I would have sent people to the place of the wreck but there was no use. I also heard there were some "free-riders" inside but they're all dead now.

Dialog.Title: Never heard about that.
Dialog.Text: I don't believe it either..but who knows where the truth lies, you know. Newcomers appear here evryday, wherever they're coming from.But I'm sure it's not possible to steal by the control point!

Dialog.Title: Some of 'em are alive.
Dialog.Text: How do you know?

Dialog.Title: I've met couple of them.
Dialog.Text: I don't believe it! That's how people spread rumors. Had there been people, how whould they have passed through the posts? They must have been inspected!

Dialog.Title: I am one of them.
Dialog.Text: You must be kidding! Man, are you being serious? And how did you steal by the control point?

Dialog.Title: Don't remember...
Dialog.Text: This is bullshit!

Dialog.Title: There were a lot of soldiers.
Dialog.Text: Ahhh... I hope there is no conspiracy.

Dialog.Title: I told you the truth.
Dialog.Text: Hmm...there're too many newcomers lately..are you saying they all got here inside the trucks? That would explain a lot...To tell the truth, I noticed that Sergeant Dibenko had behaved very odd couple of days before the wreck. I know he had been preparing for that convoy to arrive, he'd gathered soldiers, gave them weapon and rounds...

Dialog.Title: Where are those soldiers?
Dialog.Text: They headed for the north. It's been such a mess since mutants atacked us here..If you wanna talk to Dibenko, he's at watch. His post is inside the former Militia Station. Besides, he likes helping stalkers as far as I know.

Dialog.Title: Ok. Thanks.
Dialog.Text: But promise you won't tell him it was my idea that you speak to him...Say you found his name in Prokhor's notes or heard someone mentioning it..make something up. He mustn't know I smelled a rat.

Dialog.Title: Smelled a rat?
Dialog.Text: Well..yeah..I don't feel too good about people being secretly delivered to the Zone, especially behind my back! There're lots of things you'd better stay away from.. And now I'm having rather dark thought. you know....illigal experiments..slavery..

Dialog.Title: That means at some point people were lucky not to reach the destination.
Dialog.Text: Well...Anyway the supplies didn't reach the place either. Which ain't good.

Dialog.Title: How did you get in here?
Dialog.Text: I remember this place even before the walls round the perimeter were put up. Blacksmith is one of the "veterans" too. Those who found the way to survive are still alive, but there're few of them. Most people who're cominng to the Zone now are aware of all the strange shit that's going on here - the mutants, anomalies. When it all started we weren't prepared to anything at all, you know. We had to struggle and fight.

Dialog.Title: Don't you wanna leave this place?
Dialog.Text: The Zone is my home now. I'm nobody and have nothing outside the perimeter.

Dialog.Title: Take care.
Dialog.Text: You too.

Dialog.Title: Куда ехал ?
Dialog.Text: Сюда. Это поезд с провизией, оружием, медикаментами для солдат... Военные посты всего в паре километров, на севере. Совсем недавно тут, на вокзале, тоже было много военных, но когда мутанты ломанули в Любеч, началась операция по выдворению тварей из города. Здешние отряды рассредоточились, укрепились в старой ментовке да в ДК. Меня оставили за старшего. Кузнец мне помогает. Плохо, что припасов не будет. Начнутся заморозки — передохнем как зяблики. Я бы людей отправил к месту крушения, но там, говорят, уже все догорело да стервятники-мародеры прошлись. Еще прошел слух, в паре вагонов какие-то безбилетники ехали, но все до последнего погибли.

Dialog.Title: What do you think about it?
Do you know what the destination was?
Dialog.Text: Those were the trucks with supplies that must have been delivered to the military posts not far from this place. That's too bad we won't get anything..we're running out of food and ammo. I would have sent people to the place of the wreck but there was no use. I also heard there were some "free-riders" inside but don't think it's true.

Dialog.Title: Do you know anything about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: I remember the guy. He asked lots of question about the Zone and seemed to be waiting for someone...Then he said he needed a gun, so I gave him one, but warned that he had to train killing rats first. He didn't listen to me and left. The next morning his body was found in a dumpster... To tell the truth, I didn't think anyone would be worried at all. But you're not the first who's asking me about him. Sanek the Old Coon was furious when he found out what happened and seemed very upset.. they must have been close friends..

Dialog.Title: Was there anything on him?
Dialog.Text: Dunno. Anyway, raiders got to him first..I found his PM..but it's not working.

Dialog.Title: Are you gonna find the murderer?
Dialog.Text: I think I could..but..Everyday someone dies here, especially arrogant newbies, green and immature. You'd better not listen to Sanek the Old Coon, he's too upset now. Believe me, Temon couldn't have been killed near the station, I'm in charge here, I would have noticed. He was killed somwhere on the way to the Militia station..I'm sure. Then his body was just brought here and left in one of the dumpsters.

Dialog.Title: What for?
Dialog.Text: I know it sounds crazy...But if the murderer wants to get rid of a body, a dumster is a perfect place for that..cause we destroy refuse..

Dialog.Title: Sanek the Old Coon promised to speak for you...
Dialog.Text: That's cool. Very good!

Dialog.Title: Can you help me to find Temon's murderer?
Are you gonna find the murderer?
Dialog.Text: I think I could..but..Everyday someone dies here, especially arrogant newbies, green and immature. You'd better not listen to Sanek the Old Coon, he's too upset now. Believe me, Temon couldn't have been killed near the station, I'm in charge here, I would have noticed. He was killed somwhere on the way to the Militia station..I'm sure. Then his body was just brought here and left in one of the dumpsters.

Dialog.Title: What for?
Dialog.Text: I know it sounds crazy...But if the murderer wants to get rid of a body, a dumster is a perfect place for that..cause we destroy refuse..

Dialog.Title: I'm a newbie here..
Dialog.Text: Have you talked to Blacksmith?

Dialog.Title: Not yet..
Dialog.Text: Talk to him first. He'll be waiting at the entry. Then you can go back to me.

Dialog.Title: The White want you to leave the Zone.
Dialog.Text: Well...most people hate them but I do respect 'em, anyway they're more honest than the military. You should never trust soldiers, you know. The White say the Zone ain't a place for everyone and they're right, however there're people, so-called "veterans", whose home is here. I'm one of 'em and I'm not to leave cause "the white want me to". I wish we could live together in peace...but if they're gonna be agressive...so are we.

Dialog.Title: Did anyone ask about me?
Dialog.Text: Blacksmith did. I think he's got a job for you. You'd better talk to him yourself.

Dialog.Title: How can I pay you for that?
Dialog.Text: I'll ask you to find my friends to return the favor. Their names are Mitya and Split. No idea where they might be. Heard they had been seen forst on New Land, then in Tunguska. Anyway, when you find both, help 'em with anything they need. And tell 'em I'm really worried.

Dialog.Title: Agreed.
Dialog.Text: If you have any more questions, you can always turn to a local bartender, his name's Ivy. You can also find two regular customers at his bar, by the names of Old Stalker and Misha the Hunter. Misha knows pretty much everything about mutants and weapon to fight against 'em. Old Stalker can tell you a lot about The Zone and artifacts. They always ask something in return for information, but that's worth it.

Dialog.Title: Where can I get some rounds?
Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Ух, ты! Не забывает Артур своих друзей! Если его встретишь, то от меня непременно поздравь с Новым Годом! Спасибо тебе за весточку от друга, сталкер! Прими и ты мои поздравления, и небольшой Новогодний подарочек.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Пожалуйста! А вот если отгадаешь загадку, то достанется тебе ещё небольшой приз. Слушай. У мутанта много лап, из них: две правые и две левые, две лапы спереди и столько же сзади. Сколько всего лап у мутанта?

Dialog.Title: Одна
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты! Не угадал! Четыре! Ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Шесть
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты! Не угадал! Четыре! Ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Две
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты! Не угадал! Четыре! Ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Четыре
Dialog.Text: Молодец! На мякине не проведёшь! Держи подарочек - фейерверк! Повеселись в Новый Год!

Dialog.Title: Восемь
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты! Не угадал! Четыре! Ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Nothing.
Dialog.Text: Так вот. Идет он осторожно, ступает мягко. Снайперка у него с глушителем, меткими выстрелами он снимает затаившихся мутантов на пределе видимости... Ловко обходит аномалии, которые замечает почти на зверином инстинкте...

Dialog.Title: Any news from Mitya or the Spit?
Dialog.Text: It's funny that you're asking. I've recently got a letter from the Spit, he says he's looking for a man to do an assignment for him. Interested?

Dialog.Title: What assignment?
Dialog.Text: It's nothing, especially for such an experienced stalker as you. The task is to collect 20 alfa screens and get them to the Spit.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a stalker with a blot shaped scar.
Dialog.Text: I know that guy, he's known as 'Scar". Haven't seen him for a while. What do you want from him?

Dialog.Title: The military say he's a murderer.
Dialog.Text: Don't believe everything you're told.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a stalker with a blot shaped scar.
Dialog.Text: Sorry man, you have a bad reputation among stalkers. I don't blame you but won't tell you anything.

Dialog.Title: I heard he sells some rare stuff...
Dialog.Text: Think twice before you meddle into this.

Dialog.Title: Do you know where he's now?
Dialog.Text: No idea. I thought he was dead anyway.

Dialog.Title: Do you know who can help me?
Dialog.Text: Do you remember my old friends, Spit and Mitya? I think they may know something...Even though Mitya says he doesn't remember me, he might well remember him.

Dialog.Title: It seems that you don't likeScar.
Dialog.Text: Well, I don't actually.

Dialog.Title: А что с ним не так?
Dialog.Text: Скользкий он какой-то тип. Мне все время казалось, что он что-то вынюхивает. Распрашивать уж больно про все любил. Вцепится как клещ и давай всю поднаготную из тебя вытаскивать. Помню, остались мы ночевать как-то в полуразвалившейся избе. Сообразили жратвы. Расслабились. Выпили по стопочке. Шрам сначала с нами пил, а потом...
