Вобщем, такая картина: сам он не пьет, а другим водяры все подливает. Ну и вопросы, вопросы... О Зоне, о том где и что встречал, о знакомых... Короче, наводит на размышления. А в остальном - вроде нормальный мужик.

Dialog.Title: Do you know who can help me?
Dialog.Text: That's a good question. I have a mission for you, you may find something out about the Scar as well. Two friends of mine are missing. As far as I know they were seen first on New Land, then in Tunguska. If you see the Spit and Mitya, tell them I'm worried.

Dialog.Title: Do you know who can help me?
Dialog.Text: Do you remember I asked you to find my friends that were missing? They can tell you more I guess.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about yourself.
Dialog.Text: What exactly?

Dialog.Title: You haven't always called Acid, right?
Dialog.Text: That's true. You may have herad that story where I woke up having that green stuff all over me. I thought I wouldn't live to be honest. If it hadn't been for Sanya the Old Coon, I wouldn't be standing here now.

Dialog.Title: What's your real name?
Dialog.Text: This is my real name now. Anyway, my first name is Kolya, this one hasn't changed. My last name was Rozhin. That was how all stalkers used to call me, Kolya Rozhin. I used to be a widely known stalker...

Dialog.Title: How about a story from your childhood?
Dialog.Text: Why do you need it?

Dialog.Title: Неужели не вспоминаешь?..
Dialog.Text: Как же. Вспоминаю. Не вспоминал бы - с катушек бы, наверное, съехал. Хорошее у меня было детство. Доброе. Родители у меня были славные люди. Ученые, интеллигентные. Меня любили. А я тот еще был шалопай. То курил на чердаке, то яблоки из садов тырил. Все бабки про меня гудели во дворе: "Шпана! Шпана!" Но какая из меня шпана! До нынешней гопоты мне как до Австралии... Родители меня на научную фантастику подсадили - те еще были фантасты, хе-хе... "Туманность Андромеды" - слыхал? Или Станислава Лема? Я и Стругацких перечитал... Еще одна книжка мне очень нравилась: "Голубятня на желтой поляне". Ее Владислав Крапивин написал...

Dialog.Title: А после школы?
Dialog.Text: В политех я пошел. Да только не закончил его - выгнали...

Dialog.Title: За что?
Dialog.Text: А-а... Не важно. Я на "военке" полез куда не надо. Любопытный был сильно. Ну и выгнали со скандалом.

Dialog.Title: What did you do before you came to the Zone?
Dialog.Text: I did lots of stuff...Once I got into a a real scientific expedition as a technician. Have you heard of Putorana Plateau? That's a beautiful place I must say.

Dialog.Title: Кислый, расскажи байку про Шёпота!
Dialog.Text: Вот прямо так? С наскока? Не стану я эту байку рассказывать. Сначала зарекомендуй себя как настоящий сталкер.

Dialog.Title: Это же байка. Что в ней такого?
Dialog.Text: Разные бывают байки. Я не хочу, чтобы у меня на совести была жизнь еще одного несмышленыша, который залезет в заведомо опасное место. Тут зрелость нужна и здравое отношение. Знание Зоны. Надо понимать, что это всего лишь легенда и не более...

Dialog.Title: Значит не расскажешь?
Dialog.Text: Нет. Зарекомендуй себя как сталкер - тогда и приходи.

Dialog.Title: Кислый, я уже зарекомендовал себя. || Разве нет? Ты же меня прекрасно знаешь.
Dialog.Text: Ладно-ладно. Я просто не хочу, чтобы какой-то новичек попал в переделку по моей вине. Принеси бутылку самогона, чтобы было чем горло промочить, и будет тебе байка про Шёпота.

Dialog.Title: Я принес самогон.
Dialog.Text: Ну тогда садись. Давай по стаканчику...

Dialog.Title: Так что это за байка про Шёпота?
Dialog.Text: Слушай. Один сталкер, очень опытный и крутой шел однажды... по Тунгуске. Тогда там еще не было этой башни, которую называют "Башня Тесла"...

Dialog.Title: А что, было такое время?
Dialog.Text: Говорят было, хотя утверждать не стану. Откровенно говоря, у этой истории есть различные варианты начала. Кто-то настаивает, что дело было на небезызвестном вулкане (который, кстати, тоже когда-то появился почти на пустом месте - ну, разве что там была какая-то гора раньше или холм)... Слышал я начало и с аномалией, которую нынче называют "Проводник"...

Dialog.Title: Плевок говорил, с вами такое тоже было.
Dialog.Text: Мы и правда как-то в неприятности попали на "Проводнике", но я отключился и ничего не помню. Плевок тогда много нарассказывал... Я, откровенно говоря, до сих пор не верю в его россказни. Думаю аномалия меня просто "выплюнула". Она так делает иногда. Что меня Шрам вытащил - я тоже не слишком верю... Ладно, давай вернемся к рассказу.

Dialog.Title: Ну прям сверхчеловек...
Dialog.Text: Да ты не перебивай. Все, казалось бы, у него хорошо, день задался... Как вдруг - бац! Понимает - недоглядел. Залез в какую-то аномалию. А она на месте не стоит, а как бы обволакивает его. Ну, сталкер думает: все - конец. Назад не шагнуть, вперед не шагнуть, пошевелишься - разорвет к чертовой матери! И тут видит: стоит перед ним пожилой мужик в потертом бронике песчаного цвета и руку протягивает. И вроде как он полупрозрачный, как призрак, висит будто в воздухе, и говорит что-то, говорит, но беззвучно - губы просто шевелятся. Ну, делать нечего, времени на раздумья нет. Сталкер решает: "Была ни была!", и тихонько так ме-едленно протягивает призраку руку...

Dialog.Title: Это и был "Шепот"?
Dialog.Text: Да. Погоди. Протягивает он призраку руку и... Дзынь! Будто лопается струна. Сталкер открывает глаза и видит: стоит он в какой-то степи, то ли пустыне, ветер несет пыль и песок, перекати-поле катаются. Думает: "Ну екарный же бабай! Телепортануло в какую-то, прости Господи, задницу мира!" Пошел он вперед - надо же как-то определиться, где ты находишься и чего ждать? Снаряга вся при нем, винтовка, рюкзак. "Значит", - думает, - "не пропаду. Не в такие места заносило". Но скоро он понимает, что не просто переместился в какую-то там Африку. В небе камни летают, куски каких-то строений, в земле бездонные разломы... А потом, вообще, заворачивает он за скалу, а там лужайка с травой, дом стоит, качели из шины, которая веревкой к суку привязана, и дождик моросит грибной... Вокруг камни, песок, а тут... И дом-то, главное, знакомый - он в таком доме не одно лето провел у бабки в деревне...

Dialog.Title: Он что же, в параллельный мир попал?
Dialog.Text: Да фиг его знает. Это же история. Байка.

Dialog.Title: А закончилось чем?
Dialog.Text: Вроде как он блуждал там, блуждал... Потом нашел какое-то ущелье с огромной плотиной посередине. А в этом ущелье летает призрачная баба. Ну она давай ему загадки загадывать, как сфинкс из Древнего Египта, слыхал про такое мифологическое создание? Он на те загадки ответил благополучно и в тот же миг оказался обратно в обычном нашем лесу с обычными нашими мутантами... ха-хах.. Пока в себя приходил, ему чуть кабан под зад хорошего пенделя не отвесил - только рефлексы и спасли: схватил винтовку и прямо промеж глаз пулю клыкастому зарядил.

Dialog.Title: А Шепот?
Dialog.Text: А что Шепот? Про Шепота больше ничего не говорится в этой истории. Есть только одна забавная подробность на закуску. Изнанка истории, говоря иначе. Вроде как пока тот сталкер по пустыне шарашился, якобы... Его видели в лесу, где он такое выделывал!.. Хе-хех... То ляжет, то сядет, то винтовку достанет, то спрячет, то делает вид будто у него бутылка в руках и он пьет, то побежит и в дерево врежется! В общем - концерт по полной программе. С клоунами и конями... Хе.
Yes?

Dialog.Title: How does it happen?|| I am from Eizenshtein.
Dialog.Text: Hello. It nothing special in my work, but thank you for the help anyway. Tell Eizenshtein that the work is in progress. I will come to him tomorrow.

Dialog.Title: What are you doing here?
Dialog.Text: I am carrying out important researches. Have you all decided to bother me? You are the 5th who come to me with stupid questions today.

Dialog.Title: Is it so hard to tell?
Dialog.Text: Not hard, but if you continue to interrupt me -- I won't do my work on time. There are also mutants around and they want some attention too.

Dialog.Title: That's all?
Dialog.Text: Yes, and what did you expect? I have nothing to give to Eizenshtein except words. I will meet him tommorow and give him all samples at once. I am sending a telegraph to him about your help at the moment. The next time you meet him, he will surely reward you from the behalf of our entire team.
O, god! O, GOD! Spiders! Over there! Don't stand still, do something!

Dialog.Title: Stay calm. I'll deal with it.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
God damn it!

Dialog.Title: Good morning, sir!
Dialog.Text: Here we go..another one. What do you all expect to find here? Do you want to be dead so much?

Dialog.Title: I'm not a rookie.
Dialog.Text: Of course you're not! But what will you do, when you leave the city? Have you got some diapers with you? You need more practice if you wanna live.

Dialog.Title: Er....
Dialog.Text: Listen, stalker, here's an order. Go to the kindergarden and kill five spiders and a couple of rat mutants. Dismissed.

Dialog.Title: Mutants have been eliminated.|I shot the mutants. There're still thousands of them left!
Dialog.Text: They're coming out of the basement...dunno what exactly attracts them there but we use the kindergarten as a training area.

Dialog.Title: Another time.
Dialog.Text: If you're still alive another time...

Dialog.Title: I'm so in mood for killing couple of mutants.|Morning, sir! Are you still looking for someone to kill mutants?
Dialog.Text: Still alive, stalker? Are you ready to warm up a bit?

Dialog.Title: Sure!
Dialog.Text: Here's an order. Location - kindergarten, aim - five spiders, couple of rats. Quickly and quietly.

Dialog.Title: Beg to report. |Beg to report, Sir.
Dialog.Text: Listening.

Dialog.Title: Mutants are dead...|| but there'are still lots of' em left.
Dialog.Text: Well done, stalker! At ease!

Dialog.Title: Morning, sir!
Dialog.Text: Here's an order. Go through the right gate, turn right and go straight until you get to the end of the road, then turn right again, go past the post. After a while you'll see our soldiers, who guard the wall. Find out if they need reinforcement.

Dialog.Title: Morning, sir!
Dialog.Text: There's a warehouse nearby. Your mission is to explore the area and clear it off mutants so that we could launch an assault landing.

Dialog.Title: Assault landing?
Dialog.Text: That's right, stalker! At last we managed to get permission to clean-up the grounds here, in Liubech. So go, go, go!

Dialog.Title: I shot the mutants inside the warehouse.
Dialog.Text: Belay, stalker! The landing is cancelled. Well done, anyway. Find Sergeant Dibenko, he's at the militia station. He'll give you orders.

Dialog.Title: I'm ready for a race.
Dialog.Text: Are sure you're ready for a race, stalker? Run through the left gates, then down the street and then round the kindergarten three times. Then run back. Stay the distance and don't leave the sidewalk.You have 5 minutes. Ready, set, go!

Dialog.Title: Mission...accomplished...
Dialog.Text: Well done. At ease! Go and have some rest.

Dialog.Title: Have you heard of Dark Stalker?
Dialog.Text: Who? All kidding aside, stalker!

Dialog.Title: Have you seen Temon?
Dialog.Text: This name sounds familiar. Oh, yes, I remember him. He didn't seem to be a brave soldier. He was sent to me for a training, so I was about to make him go to the kindergarten...and that chicken sprinted like billy-o toward the Palace of Culture. I heard he's dead, it is no wonder.

Dialog.Title: The White want you to leave the Zone.
Dialog.Text: Are you one of them? Didn't think you'd go over to the enemy...Either go away or things are gonna get tough, white brother...

Dialog.Title: Good morning! I'm ready for your tricky question.
Dialog.Text: Wait a minute, stalker! Let me collect my thoughts first. I bet you wanna know more about the war, history, that sort of things. Are you sure you're ready?

Dialog.Title: Sure!
Dialog.Text: Well, you must know, that six different countries among those that participated in World War II, faught for and against anti-Hitler coalition at different times. I'll name the countries and you try to say which didn't.

Dialog.Title: Iraq.
Dialog.Text: Wrong. In 1941 there was a pro-Nazi military coup that overthrew the regime of Regent 'Abd al-Ilah. The new regime secretly began negotiations with the Axis Powers. The Nazis responded quickly and sent military aid...So think better.

Dialog.Title: Italy.
Dialog.Text: Wrong again. Where do you think Mussolini is from? Try again.

Dialog.Title: Hungary.
Dialog.Text: Right! They'd always been a significant German ally. Well done, stalker!

Dialog.Title: Still remember couple of facts. Got more qusertions?
Dialog.Text: Go to Blacksmith, he'll have some, I'm sure. Good luck, stalker!

Dialog.Title: Thanks. I'm gonna be off now.
Got a minute, sir?
Dialog.Text: I have no intention to talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Good morning, sir. I got some questions.
Dialog.Text: And why do you think I'm gonna answer them?

Dialog.Title: Well, I herad your people shot it out with thieves in the wood.
Dialog.Text: What did you just say? Damn it! And they call it "secrecy". Now stalkers are gonna stick their noses into our business...All right, let's talk, then. Shit!

Dialog.Title: Where could have a thief taken so many supporters from?
Dialog.Text: What do you think yourself? From checkpoints and patrols, of course. There's no connection, so is the discipline.

Dialog.Title: Were your people first to open fire?
Dialog.Text: Does it really matter? They may have to or may not. Due to the report, there were about seven of deserters, in fact, there were only five bodies. Bandits are all found dead. But who took the truck, then? So, our people did. But why or what for? I've no idea. They had an order to find the deserters and shoot to kill if they threw obstacles. I hope we'll find the stock but stalkers will be ahead, I'm afraid.

Dialog.Title: What does the inquiry show?
Dialog.Text: Nothing at all. Everybody keeps pretending that nothing happened! Listen, stalker, you seem to be looking for something as if you were making your own investigation. If it's so, I have a suggestion for you. If you find anything that will stabilize the situation a bit, I'll be happy to return the favor...Is it a go?

Dialog.Title: It would be stupid to refuse...
Dialog.Text: That's exactly what I think.

Dialog.Title: Ладно, давай. Передам им новость.
Dialog.Text: Вот спасибо-то тебе!

Dialog.Title: Bad news.
Dialog.Text: What's up? Did you find out anything new?

Dialog.Title: You'll be attacked soon. Gotta be prepared.
Dialog.Text: What? Right here? Tell everything you know!

Dialog.Title: Patrols are to be attacked. This place will be sabotaged.
Dialog.Text: I see. Bandit rats did find the courage to go at us...Thanks to you, we're ready to stand against. We'll tighten security and set an ambush inside the warehouses, stalkers will be also involved. We're ready to pay for such support.

Dialog.Title: Not bad. But I think you'll need more than that...
Dialog.Text: Guess you're right. There's such a mess, stalker. The Zone is barely controlled, we gotta go to extremes and turn to contractors.

Dialog.Title: And where is money for all that?
Dialog.Text: Well...what do you think we do with all the marauding stuff?

Dialog.Title: Got it. Who will be our allies?
Dialog.Text: I do have some guys in view. They're brutal fellas, ready to fight for money.Here...I have the list of their names. You tell them that bandit hunting is open.

Dialog.Title: OK will do! I'd better be off now.
Dialog.Text: Good luck, stalker. Let's give them a hard time!

Dialog.Title: I managed to find the way...We don't have to fight.
Dialog.Text: Son of a gun! You're a diplomat! So what next? Don't tell me the thieves are just dropping back without wanting anything in return.

Dialog.Title: You're right, they want deserters' heads.
Dialog.Text: I expected that. Anything else?

Dialog.Title: If they find the cargo, they'll take two-thirds.
Dialog.Text: Son of a gun! What a nerve! Hope our people will be the first to find it anyway. It might be beneficial for you as well, if you get to it. Think about it, stalker,

Dialog.Title: I know.
Dialog.Text: Anyway, you did well, thank you. See you around.

Dialog.Title: Bandits have nowhere to go...hunters are catching up with 'em.
Dialog.Text: You're a nice fella...saving lives of our people. Here, this is your reward.

Dialog.Title: My pleasure, Sir.
Dialog.Text: Take care!

Dialog.Title: How's it going? Did you find the truck, sir?
Dialog.Text: Look at you! Safe and sound! We can't trace the deserters, no idea where they might have gone. You did well, stalker. Thanks for help!

Dialog.Title: My pleasure, Sir! Take care.
Dialog.Text: Don't let anything happen to you, stalker.

Dialog.Title: The task...is...accomplished.
Dialog.Text: At ease, soldier. You did well. Have rest.

Dialog.Title: I found the solution. There will be no war.
Dialog.Text: Son of a gun! You're a real diplomat, that's who you are! Now what? I don't believe they let you go just for a thank you.

Dialog.Title: Sure. They want deserters' heads.
Dialog.Text: Well...I can't say I'm surprised. Anything else?

Dialog.Title: If they find the loot, they'll take two thirds.
Dialog.Text: Son of the gun! What a nerve! All croocks feel at home in the Zone. We're gonna hope our people will get to it first. Don't forget, it's in your interests as well. I promised you, remember?

Dialog.Title: Да, конечно, все так.
Dialog.Text: Ну да ладно. Спасибо тебе, сталкер, в любом случае. Помог ты нам разобраться и людей уберечь. Подходи попозже, узнать, чем поиски увенчались.

Dialog.Title: The kindergarten...
Dialog.Text: What do you mean?

Dialog.Title: Beg to report, sir!
Dialog.Text: Granted.

Dialog.Title: Понял!
Dialog.Text: Тогда слушай мою команду! Расклад тот же: детсад, пара крыс, пять пауков. Пришел, увидел, пристрелил! Только противоядие в этот раз не дам - уже взрослый, сам должен о себе заботиться.

Dialog.Title: Rewarded?
Dialog.Text: Well done.

Dialog.Title: The mutants are dead...|they keep coming though.
Dialog.Text: Well done, soldier. At ease. You'll be rewarded for accurate fire.

Dialog.Title: Здравия желаю. Есть вопросы к тебе.
Dialog.Text: Я похож на справочную? Ты кто вообще такой, чтобы я тебе на вопросы отвечал? Не заслужил доверия.

Dialog.Title: I heard you had troubles...
Dialog.Text: That's true. Don't know how it actually happened, but we're run out of armor. So, if you're ready to help, feel free to get me us some. I'll return the favor.

Dialog.Title: What exactly can I do?
Dialog.Text: Get me "Rusk" armored vest.

Dialog.Title: I brought the armor vest.
Dialog.Text: Thank you. You really helped me out.

Dialog.Title: I met Lieutenant Still...
Dialog.Text: You're not lying to me, right? Do you know that he makes internal investigation? And I don't even want to think what'll happen if he shows up here...

Dialog.Title: Встретил тут лейтенанта Мирного...
Dialog.Text: И что ты от меня хочешь? Делом лучше займись. Дел что ли нету?..
Look out! Rats!

Dialog.Title: Are you alright?
Dialog.Text: Did you see it? It was a huge rat...over there. What do you know, I can kill a bear without any fear, but rats...drive me crazy. They'te gross...red eyes...long tails...yuck! Listen< why don't you help me? Kill at least a dozen of those gross creatures for me...

Dialog.Title: No problem. I'll do that.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, stalker. I owe you one.

Dialog.Title: I killed the rats. Here. take a look.
Dialog.Text: What have you got there? Rat tail?? Gross! Throw 'em away! It's not funny...Anyway, you did well and take the reward as agreed.This rifle is yours now. It's called "flute".

Dialog.Title: Will you pay me for the job?
Dialog.Text: I will give you my rifle.

Dialog.Title: No thanks. I need money not a gun.
Dialog.Text: I'm sorry, man.
What else?

Dialog.Title: It's a nice rifle.
Dialog.Text: You bet! It's served me a good deal. I haven't used it for a while though...I miss it...old times. Sorry, it's just an bout of nostalgia...

Dialog.Title: Let me help you. I can get you a gun or you can take mine if you want.
Dialog.Text: You must be kidding me! Are you really gonna give me that for free?

Dialog.Title: Not for free. For 200 rubles.
Dialog.Text: But I don't have any money.

Dialog.Title: Sure, take it.|Sure, take it. I'll get a new one today.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, man! Didn't expect such generosity.

Dialog.Title: I'll come back with it soon.
Dialog.Text: Really? That would be just great!

Dialog.Title: Here's a pistol for you.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, stalker. I appreciate your help. I must stand here like a fool, can't even do my doings, you now.

Dialog.Title: I think I take the rifle. I can sell it anyway.
Why don't you take of that yourself?
Dialog.Text: I'm on duty here, can't leave my post. Moreover I don't have extra rounds for that and my pistol is far beyond repair.

Dialog.Title: I do't envy your situation...
Dialog.Text: What do you say? Will you help me?

Dialog.Title: What's wrong with your PM?
Dialog.Text: It's far beyond repair.

Dialog.Title: Rats? Are they still bothering you?
Dialog.Text: Not really. It's more like an old habbit of mine. Thanks to you, now I can sleep peacefelly at nights...

Dialog.Title: I can kill more rats, if you need.
Dialog.Text: That's a good idea! If only you don't mind...of course.

Dialog.Title: ...you were saying..
Dialog.Text: Listen, I'm afraid I can't give you my "flute". I just can't. Take this sight instead...it's all I can give away..

Dialog.Title: You lied to me, buddy!
Dialog.Text: You must understand it's not easy to gift such stuff. But the sight is a good deal and it's a decent reward for your help. It can be attached to any rifle...and you always can sell it if you need some cash. It's serve you well.

Dialog.Title: Alright, I'm sold.
Dialog.Text: Don't get mad. The "flute" is too valuable for me..can't imagine living without it. I do have a PM pistol, but that one is far beyond repair.

Dialog.Title: I killed a dozen of rats.
Dialog.Text: Thanks! But I'm afraid tomorrow there will be lots of them again...

Dialog.Title: Tomorrow may never come...
Dialog.Text: Not very reassuring...

Dialog.Title: Wait. Can you propose me a riddle?
Dialog.Text: Sure."A red fox is tied up in a red cave and can't escape. What that?" Why?

Dialog.Title: Wow, thanks, man.
Dialog.Text: What for? Don't waste your time, you'd better shoot couple of rats instead.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
God bless you, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Can I help you with anything?
Dialog.Text: I used to have a dog, he was a nice faithful dog that protected me from vicious creatures. Unfortunately, I lost him the day he bit a mutant... he got infected and I saw him transformed to a monster with my own eyes. He got bigger, angrier, stronger...I know I should have killed him..but I couldn't. I left him in the forest but shortly after he came back...with a dozen of another mutated dogs. The dogs are infected and they tend to attack people. I know I'm to blame...

Dialog.Title: We must kill the monsters until they kill us all.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, stalker for you help.

Dialog.Title: Infected? I'd better be going..
Dialog.Text: Oh...

Dialog.Title: Your mutt is finally dead. I killed the whole pack.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, stalker. I'm gonna find the remains of my dog and commit them to fire.

Dialog.Title: I feel sorry for you loss.
Heyu..Did I say I was gonna do that? On the onther hand...why not.
Dialog.Text: Be rewarded for your faith.

Dialog.Title: The Ravens want you to pay the debt.
Dialog.Text: I'm broke, stalker. We're facing hard times ourselves, donations only save us...

Dialog.Title: Tell me where you hid the money. |I helped you deal with the dogs, didn't I? Now you tell me how you managed to get away with the Ravens.
Dialog.Text: I must confess I have sinned. The Ravens scared the hell out of me...I ran as I had never run before...I hid the money on a hill...where it still must be if noone took it..Be careful, satlker, there's an anomaly near that place.

Dialog.Title: Ok. I'll take it into account.
So, did you find the remains of your mutt?
Dialog.Text: I didn't. Are sure you killed him?

Dialog.Title: They look the same. |How do I know? They all look the same.
Dialog.Text: I know...that's what we're gonna do. My dog's wearing a collar, I'll certainly recognize it if I see it. If you kill dogs with collars, just bring me those, that's how I know if you killed the rigtht dog.

Dialog.Title: I can bring their heads too.
Dialog.Text: Oh, God, no! Only collars. That'll be more than enough.

Dialog.Title: I brought the collars...
Dialog.Text: Let me see... Alas, my dog is still alive, wandering somewhere. Anyway, you did well, stalker. But, please, don't desert us here. Since the alpha dog is alive, the monsters will come back.

Dialog.Title: What's new?
Dialog.Text: We're in trouble. Tho dogs you scared away..are back.

Dialog.Title: What do you mean they're back?
Dialog.Text: Something attracks them here, I think the issue is about old doghouses. As if they feel their relatives used to live in them. We must burn all the doghouses down. I think it's the only way to make the monsters live the village forever.

Dialog.Title: Burn 'em down. Got it.
Dialog.Text: Take this lighter. You may look for a gasoline in canisters in the village. There must be some left.

Dialog.Title: I have no time for this right now.
I burned down the doghouses.
Dialog.Text: Good, well done. Maybe now it'll be easier for us to live here.

Dialog.Title: Did you find your dog?
Dialog.Text: I didn't. That really bothers me, stalker. I think my dog is a mutant now...a strong one. The leader of the pack. I know he'll come for me...sooner or later he will. He's hiding somewhere. We must make him leave the lair. Talk to hunters, they may suggest how to do that.

Dialog.Title: I killed the mutt. Here's its collar.
Dialog.Text: Alas...it wasn't my dog that you killed.

Dialog.Title: Are you kidding me?
Dialog.Text: No kidding, God sees I didn't mean to mess with you. You did kell a huge dog, there're no doubts about that, but me dog is still wandering somewhere...wandering and waiting...

Dialog.Title: У Мастера ЛВЗ кризис веры.
Dialog.Text: Посмотри вокруг, сталкер. Темные, дикие места, дьявола обитель. Но люди находят свой путь, не бросают дома, продолжают жить по законам божьим. Разве это не есть доказательство бога? Этот Мастер... он ведь тоже помогает людям, следит за заводом, сдерживает мутантов. Не это ли его испытание, ниспосланное свыше?

Dialog.Title: I helped you deal with the dogs, didn't I? || Now you tell me how you managed tro get away with the Ravens.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Ты "воронам" задолжал.
Dialog.Text: Каюсь, грешен. Да только ты уже все деньги из моего схрона забрал... Нет у меня ничего боле. Ступай, сталкер, с миром.
Bon appe... I mean hello!

Dialog.Title: What are you up to?
Dialog.Text: Cooking as usual...

Dialog.Title: Can I help you with anything?
Dialog.Text: Well, yes you can. I'm very good at cooking but horribly bad at shooting. So I want you to kill eight rats so that I could cook 'em for dinner.

Dialog.Title: No, thanks.
Dialog.Text: Up to you.

Dialog.Title: I brought you the rats.
Dialog.Text: Yummy!

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Of course. I'm gonna cook spider legs, they're considered poisonous, but it's not true. Get me six legs, I'll show you how to cook 'em. But remember only wartless legs will do.

Dialog.Title: I brought spider legs.
Dialog.Text: Great. I'm gonna boil 'em right away.

Dialog.Title: I brought the heads.
Dialog.Text: Great. I'll add more spice to get rid of this awful smell..

Dialog.Title: Can I do anything else for you?
Dialog.Text: How about pork chops? Boar meat must иу perfect for this dishю Get me three boar legs, we'll try it out.

Dialog.Title: What are you gonna cook this time?
Dialog.Text: Now I'm gonna fry some dog heads over a fire. Four heads will be enough I guess. But be careful, I need those with large foreheads...

Dialog.Title: I won't help you this time.
What are you gonna cook next? The last dish was good.
Dialog.Text: Nice to know you liked it. Now I'm gonna cook verliock wing. Don't be surprised, it's very tasty. I need kust one wing, but it must be undamaged, elsewise it'll be poisonous.

Dialog.Title: Okaty, I'll get you the wing.
I won't help you this time.
It's so heavy!
Dialog.Text: Of course it is. You didn't clear it of all the bog mud. Now I'm gonna spend an hour or two preparing it...

Dialog.Title: After the last dish I don't wanna ask...but is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Why? It was delicious. Now I'm gonna need one bear head. It's very good if roasted. People say a monstrous bear was seen somewhere on the west.

Dialog.Title: This time I won't help you.
I brought one bear head.
Dialog.Text: Wow, it's just huge! You did very well, stalker, thank you. Here, take it, it's all I got. I don't need it anymore, my recipes will make me rich.

Dialog.Title: Enjoy your meal.
Dialog.Text: Thanks.

Dialog.Title: Gross.
Dialog.Text: Come on!

Dialog.Title: You are the chef.
Dialog.Text: You're right.

Dialog.Title: Gross!
Dialog.Text: t's very tasty.I could give you couple of recipes.

Dialog.Title: I brought some boar meat.
Dialog.Text: Great. I'll cook it right away.

Dialog.Title: Bon appetite.
Dialog.Text: Thanks.
What can I do for you?

Dialog.Title: The Ravens want you to pay the debt.
Dialog.Text: Oh, I'm SO scared...You know, I was wondering what long pig is like ... Got it?

Dialog.Title: The Ravens want you to pay the dept.
Dialog.Text: What a nerve, stalker! I already gave you 50 000. I think I even overpaid...for the ingredients and stuff..

Dialog.Title: I got an ingredient for you.
Dialog.Text: What ingredient?

Dialog.Title: One find arm. |Have you ever happened to cook find arms?
Dialog.Text: You've gotta be kidding me! Here, take my armor for that. I really owe you one.

Dialog.Title: Here you go.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, man.

Dialog.Title: Did I say find arm? I meant..fried ham...
Dialog.Text: Not funny.

Dialog.Title: What's new?
Dialog.Text: Writing a cokey book. The second one. I'm gonna be very rich soon. I got some nice ideas while I was writing it...now I'm thinking about cooking boar leg with vegetables and spier legs. There're only vegetables that I have. Will you get me the rest?

Dialog.Title: Talking of the dish you're making...
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: I brought the legs for the garnish.
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: I brought the ear.
Dialog.Text: Great! Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: What are we having for dinner today?
Dialog.Text: I'm gonna fry some jelly brains. I don't have an oil so I'll try to use blyak fat instead. Get me all these ingredients, jelly brains, blyak fat and solt. I wanna surprise my friends with something special, it's boring to eat the same stuff every day.

Dialog.Title: Brains, fat, salt. You got it.
I brought the jelly brains.
Dialog.Text: Give those to me.. I'll put 'em in the fridge.

Dialog.Title: I brought some blyak fat...
Dialog.Text: Great. Pour it here...

Dialog.Title: Got your spices.
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: Take some salt.
Dialog.Text: Strange salt. But give me that.

Dialog.Title: How's everything going?
Dialog.Text: Well..I screwed up, for lack of a better word. Could you get me...five rolls of toilet paper? I need to fix what I did.

Dialog.Title: I wont help you this time. I knew it would have gone this way.
I brought the toilet paper.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, stalker. Next time I'll stick to something more..traditional.

Dialog.Title: Hey, what are we having for lunch today?
Dialog.Text: Today I'm making brutor soup. So, I'm gonna need some brutor bones.

Dialog.Title: I won't help you this time. Enough cookery for me.
Wait here. I'll be back with the bones.
I brought bones of a brutor.
Dialog.Text: Great. A sick soup it's gonna be...

Dialog.Title: Any other ideas?
Dialog.Text: I wanna try to make a dish for dessert..... sugared verliock eye. It must be served with tea, so I'm also gonna need tea and glassholders. And also some hairs of the unique silvan that lives somewhere in square К5 and Л5..Come over when you get all that.

Dialog.Title: What do you need the hairs for?
Dialog.Text: You don't know a thing, stalker, do you? You can make a nice decent floss. If you wish you can even make a toothbrush.

Dialog.Title: That's...gross!
Dialog.Text: Will you get all these?

Dialog.Title: I brought the verliock eye.
Dialog.Text: The main ingredient! I'll just add some sugar...

Dialog.Title: I brought the tea.
Dialog.Text: Great! I'm gonna boil some water now.

Dialog.Title: I brought the glassholders.
Dialog.Text: Thank you.

Dialog.Title: I brought silvan hairs.|| I don't even wanna think what you need 'em for.
Dialog.Text: Think hair. Very well.

Dialog.Title: Talking of the dish you're making...
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: Talking of the dish you're making...
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: Talking of the dish you're making...
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: What else are we gonna cook?
Dialog.Text: Let's take a break. I've got to work, I need to finish my book.

Dialog.Title: We're gonna need festive dinner.
Dialog.Text: This is my annual duty... and I'll do the same this year...I think I'm gonna fry verliock meat...Come over later, I'll keep one portion for you.

Dialog.Title: How's it going with your New-Year special dish?
Dialog.Text: Not very well.Two local lads stole the food right from under my nose. The meat wasn't cooked enough yet.

Dialog.Title: Are they having a stomach-ache?
Dialog.Text: Even worse! They got intoxicated. If they kick off, I'm in trouble...I'll have to leave the village forever and have as little chance of seeing myself cooking again as of seeing my own ears. But I know who can help. I heard about a man by the name of Veterinarian, who lives in the village far away from here, in square П8. He's said to be good at making different sorts of antidotes.

Dialog.Title: I see. I'll help you and get an antidote.
Dialog.Text: Great. But hurry up, the guys may not live much longer.

Dialog.Title: I brought the antidote.
Dialog.Text: You saved my reputation..I mean, my friends' lives. Now I gotta make 'em take the antidote somehow...Anyway, I'll take care of that. Thanks, man. Listen, I heard you were collecting Cristmas-tree decorations, is that right? Look what I found when I gutted a verliock, it got stuck in its throat. You can take it.

Dialog.Title: When everything's ready, get the dishes to Morozov. He's in charge.
Dialog.Text: Okay.

Dialog.Title: I have some questions.
Dialog.Text: Ask away, I hve time till the pot boils.

Dialog.Title: What do you know about the White Brotherhood?
Dialog.Text: There're rumors, lots of rumors.. and not all of 'em are fiction. Living in the Zone is hard and I don't judge the white for their deeds, they even helped me out once. They're well aware of local mutants, herbs and plants, mushrooms, both edible and poisonous ones.

Dialog.Title: Do you where their base is?
Dialog.Text: Can't tell, man. Although their aint my friends, keeping in touch with 'em might be quite useful. And to be frank, I don't really trust you..if you turn out to be even more useful than them, come over again, we'll talk then.

Dialog.Title: Talking of the white..
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: Tell me about them.
Dialog.Text: Good hunters! And not good persons. But some of them are really cool guys. When I've started to collect recipes, they helped me with their knowledge. They know many things about mutants, plants and such...

Dialog.Title: Do you know where their base is?
Dialog.Text: It'll be a long journey to square П8. You can pass over the swamps if you come along the route to the north-east. When the route goes northward, you go eastward, go through the bush and then walk allong the bank. I don't reccomend that you walk along through the bogs, that's too dangerous. Those places are teeming with spiders and verliocks.

Dialog.Title: They took the heli pilot with them.|| I need to find him.
Dialog.Text: I don't know anything about it. They like to live in the woods. Very deep. But they don't have any conflicts with soldiers. If you told me the truth... Well... I have a veeeeery bad feeling about it all.

Dialog.Title: Have you seen "Temon"?
Dialog.Text: If I were younger, I'd be sure it was Dark Stalker who came over the other day...dirty as an imp, with wrapped head...He seemed to be exhausted after a long journey so I gave him roasted rat. You know, he looked more like a beast, not a human being.

Dialog.Title: Do you know where he is?
Dialog.Text: He set off for the north-east.

Dialog.Title: Pay the dept.
Dialog.Text: Racket is an art, just like cooking. One must now what to cut, what to smash, when it's time to add shugar or salt...I doubt the Ravens will atack the village, they just hoped you'd manage to return with the money..but it's not gonna happen, my friend. Now get out of here.

Dialog.Title: Pay the debt.
Dialog.Text: Racket is an art, just like cooking. One must now what to cut, what to smash, when it's time to add shugar or salt...I doubt the Ravens will atack the village, they just hoped you'd manage to return with the money..but it's not gonna happen, my friend. Now get out of here.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Let me see what you have for sale.
Do you know anything about "Mr. Big"?
Dialog.Text: Whay are you asking?

Dialog.Title: Слышал, ты от лица сталкеров говоришь
Dialog.Text: Заметь - я готовлю не бандитское филе, а деликатесы из местных зверушек... Вот, хочешь? Мой новый рецепт: собако-крысиная колбаса в кишке брутора. С семенами местной петрушки и перцем...

Dialog.Title: I'm sure you've crossed paths with bandits
Dialog.Text: I have. And I'm not obliged to do as any "Mr. Big" says
Keep well, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Sure. I discovered that spider and verliock legs are high enzyme food. I wanna try to make meds from them. Could you get me the main ingredients while I'm preparing the devices?

Dialog.Title: Is there any other job for me?
Dialog.Text: You're back! Were the med kits I gave you of any help? I can aemoe if you get the ingredients.

Dialog.Title: I brought all that you asked for.
Dialog.Text: Great. Give me all you got.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I'll be damned! I must be cursed...no skim, no cash..Hey! Stalker, how is it going?

Dialog.Title: I'm fine. How are you feeling?
Dialog.Text: Much better, thanks. I was thinking...could you do me a favor?

Dialog.Title: It depends...
Dialog.Text: Just hear me out. I know a guy who's ready to buy artifacts at a very high price. Which means we could earn a lot from the bargain. You get artifacts, I make a bargain. Does it sound fair?

Dialog.Title: I'm gonna say "no".
Dialog.Text: Up to you. I'll find somebody smarter..

Dialog.Title: It does.
Dialog.Text: Get me three "Screen a" artifacts, then. I don't care where you'll find 'em, just bring 'em here. Deal?

Dialog.Title: Hmmm....I'm...
Dialog.Text: Did you get the arts? No? Why are you still here, then? Come on! Move!

Dialog.Title: Fine. How are you doing?
Dialog.Text: To be frank, It's been hard of late. One problem leads to another..On the top of that I'm sick and tired of damn canned food. I'm this close to be laid up with gastritis. I'd give all I have away for a plate of soup...Listen, stalker, do me a favor!

Dialog.Title: What favor?
Dialog.Text: Get me some boar meat. I found a nice recipe by some "Gourmet", which I'd love to try out. I've seen some boars not far from here, so it won't take you long. I'll reward you in return. What do you say? I will pay you.

Dialog.Title: I brought the meat. Enjoy...
Dialog.Text: You are a clever boy. There'll always be a job for you.

Dialog.Title: I brought the artifacts. | As agreed, I brought the artifacts.
Dialog.Text: Well done! I got something for you ae well. Take it.

Dialog.Title: Don't mess with me.
Dialog.Text: It never crossed my mind. A deal is a deal.

Dialog.Title: Is there any other job for me?
Dialog.Text: Sure.This time the profit will be even bigger, but you've gotta get more artifacts.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more...
Dialog.Text: Need three "Screens α" and two "Pillows α". Payment at this time will be in rubles. In your best interest to move. More artifacts -- more money.

Dialog.Title: No, thank you. || I was consumed by vague doubts.
Dialog.Text: As you wish

Dialog.Title: No arts yet.
Dialog.Text: Listen, I've already promised 'em to one man. Hurry up.

Dialog.Title: I brought the arts.| I got the arts.
Dialog.Text: Cool. I'm gonna sell 'em out. Come over later.

Dialog.Title: Where's my reward?
Dialog.Text: What reward? Who are you?

Dialog.Title: Hey! We had a deal||, I got you the arts, now you give me my reward.
Dialog.Text: I don't know neither what you're talking about nor who you are. Do you think I should give money everyone who asks me to? Do you see a red cross on me? I'm a charity worker. Go away.

Dialog.Title: I see what you're doing here. Alright, we will meet again.
Dialog.Text: Oh I am SO scared. Get lost, biy.

Dialog.Title: I see you remember me.
Dialog.Text: I made a mistake, stalker. Don't get mad. I mistook you for somebody else. I see a lot of people every day, the come over, talk to me, argue sometimes. Besides, it was dark when you stopped by. No hard feelings, okay? I didn't mean too..And I didn't know you're friends with such powerful men...Look, take these. I didn't manage to sell 'em all out.

Dialog.Title: I brought the "Screens".
Dialog.Text: Give 'em to me!

Dialog.Title: What about the reward?
Dialog.Text: Come over later. After I tie up a deal.

Dialog.Title: I brought the"Pillows".
Dialog.Text: Give 'em to me!
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: I'm too busy right now.
Dialog.Text: Too bad...

Dialog.Title: Do you know Yuriy?
Dialog.Text: Which one? Dirty Yuriy, you mean? I've heard about him, why? Who is wondering?

Dialog.Title: The one that may well kill you.
Dialog.Text: Are you trying to scare me, stalker? Do you even know what's gonna happen to you, then? Don't try to be a hero.

Dialog.Title: I am already at death's door. Be ready to come along.
Dialog.Text: Easy, man. What are you, kamikaze? Why are you speaking for Yuriy?

Dialog.Title: I have a cancer, man. And Yuriy is my friend. And you...you're a dead man.
Dialog.Text: What? You're insane! Calm down, man. Take you gun away. Can't we just sort it out?

Dialog.Title: I doubt that.
Dialog.Text: Wait! Wait! Alright, take this...and tell Yuriy I got it. I got it.

Dialog.Title: Let's say I forgive you this time. But I'll be watching you.
Dialog.Text: I won't do anything wrong...

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello, fateful child. What brought you here?

Dialog.Title: What do you know about the new district?|I was in the new district lately and saw some creepy things there: a pile of mutants bodies placed as a circle.
Dialog.Text: The apocalypse is near, the mutants will rise against the people and will punish us for our sins. Men of science and their sacrilege experiments - that's the reason of our future fall. They gather in the Zone like flies, but the darkness will absorb them. Their perverted souls will break out of their bodies, transform their flesh and strike the remains of humankind. People will fall into darkness, will destroy the Mother Nature, and there will be no rest, neither on the earth, nor in water or the sky.

Dialog.Title: Are you...one of the white?
Dialog.Text: Yes and no. Our faith unite us, but I don't quite share the way Mikhail treats it...I'm just a missionary, whose aim is to spread the word and tell others the truth. People must be aware.

Dialog.Title: So...is your way better?
Dialog.Text: It's not for me to judge...Let me tell you about our believes and you'll decide what is better yourself..

Dialog.Title: Master craftsman at DSP is facing crisis of faith.
Dialog.Text: Mutant God is the only God we trust. People must turn to him or they will be doomed forever. If there's no faith in your heart, there's no place for you in the New World!

Dialog.Title: Артур с Новым Годом поздравляет
Dialog.Text: Значит не забыл Артур своего друга! Ох, как приятно... Даже слёзы на глаза навернулись... Спасибо тебе, сталкер, за поздравление от друга моего! В знак благодарности, прими от меня небольшой Новогодний подарочек.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Постой! Задам вопрос один! Коль истину ответишь - радость тебе будет! Я видел, как мертвое родило живое, и дыхание живого истребило мертвое. Что я видел, сталкер!?

Dialog.Title: Воду?
Dialog.Text: Нет. Истина где-то не тут. Прощай!

Dialog.Title: Дерево?
Dialog.Text: Нет. Истина где-то не тут. Прощай!

Dialog.Title: Огонь?
Dialog.Text: О, как ты мудр! Вот твоя награда! Прощай! И не бойся пылающего в небе огня!

Dialog.Title: Пулю?
Dialog.Text: Нет. Истина где-то не тут. Прощай!

Dialog.Title: Снегурочку?
Dialog.Text: Нет. Истина где-то не тут. Прощай!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: The Divine Scourage...God sees everything. You're sinner who crossed a line of the law. Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near!

Dialog.Title: Do tell me more.
Dialog.Text: Listen with your heart, not ears, my friend. God created everythig you see. His creation was a reflection of his heavenly thoughts and did he come to know his own essence through his creation. And they influenced one another as they had always been as one. And the God changed. It's our new God, the Mutant God. Sing, brothers! Sing, sisters! Sing along with a song of the New World. If we follow our new God, we will change and become better creations. There is no place for sinners in the New World, the hell will break loose and swallow them all! We will be New People of the New World!

Dialog.Title: Thanks. That was...fascinating.
Dialog.Text: Don't forget, my friend, time is running out!

Dialog.Title: I wanna join you!
Dialog.Text: I admire your decision, however I must make sure that you deserve to be one of us. You will have to pass the tests to prove it. If you succeed, we will be sure that your intentions are pure.

Dialog.Title: What kind of tests?
Dialog.Text: The trials. There will be three of them. The first will test your ability and readiness to help others. The second will test your courage. The final one will test how pure your intentions are. Mutant God bless you.

Dialog.Title: I think I am ready to start.
Dialog.Text: Here's your first trial. You have to spread the word. Find those who will hear the message.

Dialog.Title: I'm afraid I'll fail the task.
Dialog.Text: Don't be afraid, my friend. Listen to your gut and remember about the New World that's waiting for you.

Dialog.Title: Where will I find them?
Dialog.Text: Look everywhere and listen to your gut. Liubech, Tunguska, Airport, Vesuvius, New Land...let people from all the places hear you!

Dialog.Title: I will do my best.
Dialog.Text: Amen! There will be a place for you in the New World.

Dialog.Title: I spread the word.
Dialog.Text: Mutant God bless you! But it's only a start for you...you'll face many challenges on your way, my brother.

Dialog.Title: I'm ready for the next trial.
Dialog.Text: I'm happy to know that. The next challenge will test your will and strength. You're to fight for the best future in the New World we'll create. You will fight against the most dangerous monsters as they look like human beings...Kill them all, don't feel sorry for them as they all are hellhounds.

Dialog.Title: I will kill 'em all!
Dialog.Text: Amen!

Dialog.Title: I punished the hellhounds..
Dialog.Text: Amen! No you're one of us, my brother.

Dialog.Title: I'm ready for the final trial.
Dialog.Text: It's gonna be unusual and may seem too easy at first...I want you to spread the word about us. People must be aware. Here are leaflets, telling about our ideas and believes. Take them and lay them out around the Zone...Those who're bound to join us will understand the message.

Dialog.Title: I will do my best.
Dialog.Text: Amen! I believe in you, my brother.

Dialog.Title: I spread the word. People will hear.
Dialog.Text: You did it! Now I see that you're one of us, my brother. We will form a New World and will rule it! Altogether as one.

Dialog.Title: What now?
Dialog.Text: When the time comes I'll turn for you and all the brotherhood for help. Be ready to anything. Until then have a decent rest, you rdeserved it. Remember, we're grateful that you joined us.

Kolya's PDA message: "I've found a strange place. It's unmarked on my map. I saw there a lot of artefacts, but I couldn't grab it. A bunch of mutes attacked me and then something threw me right here. I'm injured badly. I think, I'm not gonna make it. Those, who find this message - you can check this freakin' place on your own risk."

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
What can I do for you?

Dialog.Title: What do you know about the secret experiments?|Tell me about the secret experiments that were carried out on mutants of the first wave of researchers.
Dialog.Text: Ah, young man, is it reasonable to ask about this so suddenly? What do you want me to say? This is of course all the rumors and speculation... Even one time -- there were rumors about some secret camp for mutants. The scientists there were engaged in almost everything from banal -- dissection, and the last crossing of Species. Access was only for specially selected personnel, and any leakage of information severely suppressed. You certainly know, mutants -- is of course mutants, but at the perimeter of the Zone they have a lot of defenders among the compassionate, including those in government circles...

Dialog.Title: Know something about "Black Target"?
Dialog.Text: One of these departments was "Black Target". Basically, it was intended to prepare special forces, but scientists have worked there, too. They improved the breed of mutants, so to speak... so that soldiers could practice on them. It also said that the result of those experiments was a monster that can bend to his will of mutants within a kilometer. According to rumors, the monster managed to escape to freedom, because of imperfections or by reason of the negligence of the military and contracted to a few creatures with psi-call.The scientists then tried to figure out how to protect themselves against the impact of the psi-mutant, but how successful were these studies, I do not knows.

Dialog.Title: And where is this department?
Dialog.Text: Nowhere. I tell you, it is a fiction, the legend of the Zone. Even if such departments exist, everything would have been looted and destroyed long time ago. I personally have not worked in a place like this, and my colleagues have never participated in such projects. If anyone can answer you this question, it's the military. But you will not get an answer from them. Because there is no such thing as "Black Target".

Dialog.Title: I see...
Dialog.Text: Good luck to you, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Just passing by.
Dialog.Text: Do not distract me, young man.

Dialog.Title: What do you know about secret experiments?
Dialog.Text: Nothing. Even if I knew something, why do you think I'm going to talk about these things with a stranger?

Dialog.Title: I found the "Black Target". | You may be interested to know that I found "Black Target" and even killed the mutant, which destroyed the camp.
Dialog.Text: No kidding? It is curious. It would be nice to get us a sample of the mutant... Oh, I should stop deceiving myrself... Perhaps you did no left even a wet spot of it.

Dialog.Title: I saved its arm. You need it?
Dialog.Text: Wonderful. Just wonderful. I will certainly tell my colleagues, how much have you done today for the science.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: How is it going with your research?
Dialog.Text: You must be kidding me, young man. How can I possibly do any research under such conditions? The only thing I managed to take away for the lab is my analyzer. Anyway, why bother listening to me? I bet you don't care.

Dialog.Title: Do carry on please.
Dialog.Text: Well...I wanted to check how artifacts would affect a rat....Listen, I got an idea. Why don't you work for me a little? I could check artifacts influence on you! That would be even more peculiar.

Dialog.Title: No thanks. I'm not a lab animal.
Sounds interesting.
Dialog.Text: You're a brave young man. Let me put this on you. You must find the following artifacts, one by one, in this very order: screen α, pillow α, screen α, pillow α. After you find them, you must wear them for some time one by one in the same order. When you're done, come back to me. Oh, yes. Almost forgot. You may well face some...side effects. Well, good luck, my friend!

Dialog.Title: I checked all the artifacts.
Dialog.Text: That's great! I hope we didn't bother you that much. You did well.

Dialog.Title: It's a pleasure to deal with you.
Is there anything else I can do?
Dialog.Text: Of course there is. But this time it'll be more dangerous...Are you sure you're still in?

Dialog.Title: I'm sure.
Dialog.Text: I want you to get some artifacts, four all together. However...erm...the problem is that I don't know what artifacts exactly we're looking for. My device will react by lightening if it "likes" an artifact...otherwise it may quite unstable and the consequences might be unpredictable.

Dialog.Title: I brought all the artifacts.
Dialog.Text: I didn't even dare to hope. You have no idea how thankful I am. I would be honored to work with you shoulder to shoulder...erm...where was I? Oh, right...Your reward...take this.

Dialog.Title: That would be quite a challenge!
It's a pleasure to deal with you.

Dialog.Text: Who are you? Where is salute and status report?

Dialog.Title: Allow me to address in the form, sir.
Dialog.Text: At ease. Permission to speak freely.

Dialog.Title: I want to know about the secret base|| "The Black Target", where the experiments were conducted on mutants.
Dialog.Text: Maybe you want me to give you the keys to my apartment where the money are hidden? You will receive your information if you are ready to perform an emergency mission of importance.

Dialog.Title: What kind of mission?
Dialog.Text: There is a stalker, he owes me a bear's head. Your task is to persuade him to give the head back and bring it to me. Understood?

Dialog.Title: Understood sir. May I proceed?
Dialog.Text: At ease. You may go.

Dialog.Title: Allow me to address in the form, sir.
Dialog.Text: At ease. Status report.

Dialog.Title: Sir, I brought the Crucian's debt.
Dialog.Text: Well done, soldier, keep it up. So what are you asking...? "Black Target", you say? There is no such place. But if it were, it would be built somewhere away from the perimeter, in a place such as Vesuvius, in the square Г2. But I did not say anything to you, understand? Don't go there, stalker, because it's a hell full of shit now. Textually.

Dialog.Title: ...I am a civilian.
Dialog.Text: Get out of here, "civilian". Civilians are not allowed to stay here. You should thank me for what I'm in a good mood today, and I will not report about you to authorities.

Dialog.Title: No, not ready yet.
Dialog.Text: Come back when you're ready.

Dialog.Title: Allow me to address in the form, sir.
I want to know about the secret base|| "Black Target", where the military trained on mutants.
Dialog.Text: Who are you? And what is this dirty rumor? Get out of here before you get stormed.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a stalker named "Temon."
Dialog.Text: What for?

Dialog.Title: He could be the murderer.
Dialog.Text: Did yoy just say murderer? Well....he must be punished, then. But there's a problem, you know. Temon got me a pachage from Courier. He did well, no bullshit. And you're saying now he's a criminal. Why should I trust you, not him? Where did you come from, stalker?

Dialog.Title: From Lyubich...
Dialog.Text: Go home, then.Ddon't snoop around here.

Dialog.Title: Tatarin sent me..
Dialog.Text: Right on time. Come! Excited to learn more

Dialog.Title: Он может оказаться убийцей.
Dialog.Text: Убийца, говоришь... Что же, убийцу надобно призвать к ответу. Но есть загвоздка: Темон доставил мне пакет от Курьера, с пакетом не обманул, все по форме и печати целы... А с твоих слов получается, что преступник. Я на слово поверить не могу. Вдруг ты клевету наговариваешь? Ты, вот, сам откуда прибыл, сталкер?

Dialog.Title: Tatarin sent me.
Dialog.Text: So what?

Dialog.Title: It was him who sent Temon to you.
You told him about the colonel.
Dialog.Text: Shit! I didn't. Temon was delivering packages from Courier. He had one for the colonel and wanted to head to Tunguska. He knew he oldman would justify him in return of a good favor.

Dialog.Title: So, now what?
Dialog.Text: You go to Tunguska. Find Kolya Tesla nearby. he'll lead you. But only for this once! I'm not working my ass for you here. Find Temon.

Dialog.Title: Yes sir!
Dialog.Text: Off you go.

Dialog.Title: I want to atone my sins.
Dialog.Text: Had enough of all that firing, huh? Good. So, here's what you're going to do: I give you a repair kit, you go to any transmission line tower and repair it. Then you get back to me, take another repair kit and use it for the next tower and so on. Got it?

Dialog.Title: The mission completed, sir!
Dialog.Text: Excellent! At ease, soldier.

Dialog.Title: Хочу предъявить талоны из тюрьмы!
Dialog.Text: Талоны для товарища Кожемяки, да? Индульгенции, блин! В наше-то время тебя бы сразу, того, самого... Ладно, сколько принес?

Dialog.Title: Один талон.
Dialog.Text: Так давай сюда!

Dialog.Title: Десять талонов.
Dialog.Text: Так давай сюда!

Dialog.Title: Держи один талон.
Dialog.Text: Все?

Dialog.Title: Держи десять талонов.
Dialog.Text: Все?

Dialog.Title: Слушай, а может договоримся?..
Dialog.Text: Добровольное пожертвование размером в пятьдесят тысяч рублей может многое изменить.

Dialog.Title: Вот твои деньги.
Dialog.Text: Не "мои", а общественные! Все?

Dialog.Title: Мне кажется про "Мету" ты загнул...
Dialog.Text: Что?? А не пошел бы ты! Был бы я не при исполнении, ох я бы тебе так засветил!.. Двигай и не подходи лучше ко мне!

Dialog.Title: I met Lieutenant Still...
Dialog.Text: Finally.He should have showen up long ago.Are you nor scared? You should be.He doesn't forgive faults.
What do you want? Get lost.

Dialog.Title: Don't be so nervous. I'm leaving.
You owe a bear head.|You owe a bear head to Nechiporenko. It is time.
Dialog.Text: That freaking fat prick got all he wants from the Army supplies, and here we should risk our asses to bring him even more!

Dialog.Title: Ты это, давай не задерживай, а то у меня диалог короткий, могу бабки и с бесчувственного тела снять...
Dialog.Text: Да на, держи бабки, нервный какой, что на свидание опаздываешь?

Dialog.Title: Ты давай лишние домыслы то не строй, твое дело маленькое, деньги отдал и свободен.
Hey. Don't wait for a Christmas.|| I'll collect the debt or your dead body.
Dialog.Text: Easy, man. You're late to a date or something?

Dialog.Title: Where is the head?
Dialog.Text: Right here.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Don't shoot!

Dialog.Title: Hey, what are you doing here?
Dialog.Text: Saving my head...I owe Metrofan some. Wanted to pay the debt out in the loot, but...

Dialog.Title: Metrofan has sent me. You owe him.
Dialog.Text: I'd be happy to pay the debt, but I'm in a real trouble. I need help.

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: I was coming back from the town with a backpack full of artifacts when a damn boar attacked me. I got rut out of ammunition and I had nothing else to do but running as fast as I could. The backpack was too heavy so I had to take it off. That freaking boar is still there.

Dialog.Title: I think I can help you.
Dialog.Text: No kidding? That would be awesome. The boar must be on a hill in square Е12. You'd better watch out, it you feel you can't take care of that, just ran away. I put the backpack in an old fridge. You'll find it in a pile of trash. Bul, there are anomalies all over the place...I didn't have time to choose a better place..

Dialog.Title: Don't worry. I'll take care of that.
I found your backpack.
Dialog.Text: You did? Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: Don't worry. I'll take care of that.
Why are you still here?
Dialog.Text: Oh, that's you, dude. Just back from a raid..having a rest.

Dialog.Title: I see. Did you get a lot of stuff?
Dialog.Text: Not too much, but it was enough to pay for the meal.

Dialog.Title: I'm gonna take off.
Dialog.Text: Good luck, stalker.

Dialog.Title: So what is your problem?
Dialog.Text: I left a backpack full of artifacts on my way back here...That damn boar attacked me when I was run out of ammunition. So I had to run as fast as I could, the backpack was too havy...

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: I was coming back from the town with a backpack full of artifacts when a damn boar attacked me. I got rut out of ammunition and I had nothing else to do but running as fast as I could. The backpack was too heavy so I had to take it off. That freaking boar is still there.

Dialog.Title: Могу помочь.
Dialog.Text: Да? Правда? Вот спасибо, он в квадрате Г8 бегает, на холме, там увидишь, ты тока там аккуратнее, если что, сразу на ногу. А рюкзак в холодильнике в куче мусора лежит. Осторожнее, там вокруг аномалии, уж куда успел сныкать, извини.

Dialog.Title: I'm back.
Dialog.Text: Hey! Did you find my backpack?

Dialog.Title: No yet. Can you remind me where it is?
Dialog.Text: On a hill..to the northwest from here. You can go across the stadium.

Dialog.Title: Is everything alright?
Dialog.Text: Not really. I lost my lucky amulet. I know it sounds stupid, but it was very valuable for me. When you brought my backpack back...the amulet wasn't where it was supposed to be. It must have fell off half way back. I don't believe you snatched it...it looks no more than a toy.

Dialog.Title: How doest it look like?
Dialog.Text: It doesn't matter, that's not the point. Anyway, I decided to get back and look for it. When I opened the fridge, I saw...my backpack inside! Don't look at me like this. I'm not insane and I was surprised as well. At first, I thought it was somebody's else backpack, that looked like mine, but then..I noticed the amulet was just there! That was MY backpack, I mean, like, another one, but still mine. The next day I came there again, opened the fridge..and took exactly the samer backpack out. I don't know what it means but I have shivers running up and down my spine...Could you check it out if one more backpack is in the fridge?

Dialog.Title: That's impossible. Stop messing with me.
Dialog.Text: I think I need some rest...not feeling well...

Dialog.Title: Sounds weird, but I believe you. I'll go and check.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, bro. It was also strange that my original backpack was full of arts and all of its copies were empty. What if it's a way to copy arts as well? We've gotta just find the way how...What if the next backpack in the fridge will be full of artifacts? I'm a little scared to go there on my own...I will pay you for this job.

Dialog.Title: I brought your backpack.
Dialog.Text: Thank you! Let's see...

Dialog.Title: Shall I get you one more backpack?
Dialog.Text: Great idea! I have a feeling this time it's gonna work...

Dialog.Title: Here it is.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, bro. You did help me out.

Dialog.Title: What's wrong?
Dialog.Text: This one is empty too...Let's try again tomorrow. You can keep this one.

Dialog.Title: Found something?
Dialog.Text: No, it's empty too. Better luck next time.

Dialog.Title: I brought the backpack.
Dialog.Text: Thanks! Let's see...

Dialog.Title: What's wrong?
Dialog.Text: This one is empty too...Let's try again tomorrow.

Dialog.Title: I found your backpack.
Dialog.Text: You did? Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: Here you are.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, bro. You did help me out.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Shall I get you one more backpack?
Dialog.Text: It's a good idea! Maybe this time we're going to be lucky!

Dialog.Title: I believe you.
Dialog.Text: Thanks man. I was thinking...My backpack was full of arts ans these copies are empty. But I'm stiil eager to check on emore time..what if you found the way to cope artifacts? Just imagine, what prospects we can open, then. To tell you the truth, I'm afraid to go there alone. I'd reward you if you could do that.

Dialog.Title: Wait here. I'll be back soon.
Here's your backpack.
Dialog.Text: Oh, great! Let me check it...

Dialog.Title: Wait here. I'll be back soon.
What's in there?
Dialog.Text: You won't believe it! All artifacts are still here! Listen, you really helped me out, Here, take the half.

Dialog.Title: That's odd, the backpack was too light...
Dialog.Text: I bet it's gonna appear again soon.

Dialog.Title: I brought a backpack...
Dialog.Text: Artifacts again? Great! Here's your part.

Dialog.Title: Thanks!
Dialog.Text: It's a pleasure to deal with you!
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: What's up?| Are you alright? You look sad.
Dialog.Text: My friend's missing. We were walking together along the village, everything seemed fine. Then we decided to split up, I turned right and he continued his way. I was unfortuned to bump into a dozen of dogs. I hardly managed to run away, I ran into an abandoned house and waited until they went away, stanched my wounds and now I'm here. But I haven't seen my friend ever since. I'm really worried. What if he's dead? I was thinking...maybe you go and try to find him? I'd do that myself, but I'm still too weak...

Dialog.Title: I will try.
Dialog.Text: I last saw him in square 311. That's all I can say. If you bring me any news about him, I'll generously reward you.

Dialog.Title: Your friend is dead. Here's his PDA.
Dialog.Text: They have finally tracked him down! All they care about is money. Shit. Thanks, man. You nailed it, you found Vitya. Take your reward.

Dialog.Title: I feel sorry for your friend. But I can't help you.
Have you heard of mutants in the new region?| I saw something strange...
Dialog.Text: I don't care..I have something more important to worry about.

Dialog.Title: Have you heard of the mutants in the new region?| I have been at one place, there are strange things going on: a lot of dead bodies, all laid down in a circle.
Dialog.Text: I know what place you're talking about. I saw it when I was passing by. If you hasn't helped me, I would'n tell you anything..but since you've been such helpful...Do you know about the "Dark Mark"? There's a local legend that says when athourities controlled the Zone, they formed several top secret bases, where they help experiments on the mutated. The Dark Mark was said to be on of such bases. According to the legend...a monstrous beast fled from it, killing all on its way. It placed the bodies in a special circle...th eone that you saw.

Dialog.Title: Yes. But they were dead mutants, not people.
Dialog.Text: I told you what I know myself. You should talk to scientists about that. But I doubt they'll tell you anything...

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Message from PPC: "Damn it -- it's a blowout, curse it... I just drifted apart from my friend... OK, I will hide in the house. What the hell? Who are those clowns? What do they want? I wish Stepka would be here. I can't fight them alone. They are holding me strongly. Bastards..."

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Hello, stalker!

Dialog.Title: Hey. I'm here to help you.|I was told you needed help.
Dialog.Text: I'm looking for skilled stalkers and hunters that can do some job for me. I don't leave this place much, you know..especially after the accident I had. Kisliy and I were on a mission, when he had acid all over him and I got into an anomaly...I must say we were lucky to survive..you never know where an anomaly will appear next time..

Dialog.Title: Do you know where I can get some cash?
Dialog.Text: Help me and I'll pay you.

Dialog.Title: What should I do?
Dialog.Text: I need 10 dog heads.

Dialog.Title: I brought the heads.
Dialog.Text: Well done, stalker.

Dialog.Title: I can get you more heads if you need.
Dialog.Text: Deal. That will be great.

Dialog.Title: Just wait for me here. I'll be back.
Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Yea, I have something. One friend of mine needs a decent equipment, I'm a bit tied up to look for it myself, so get me everything needed. As a favor for you, I'll pay you back the costs and reward for the job.

Dialog.Title: What equipment does he need?
Dialog.Text: Here's the list: 5 med kits, 6 packs of 12mm rounds and a "Kolobock" backpack.

Dialog.Title: Agreed. I'll be back when I collect everything.
I brought what you needed.
Dialog.Text: Let me see what you have here.

Dialog.Title: What else can I help the experienced stalker?
Dialog.Text: Something they say, in the vicinity of the stadium now restless. Go check out and then tell me..

Dialog.Title: There dogs at the stadium - a lо-о-ot.
Dialog.Text: Yes, the situation is. Well, especially for people like you. It will be where, to shoot heads.

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Come again later.

Dialog.Title: Is there a job for me?
Dialog.Text: There is one job, just for a steep stalker like you. Then nearby, outside the city, saw a wild boar. They say, heading to the city. Walk around, find your adversary and lead feed, that the more they, did not want here run.

Dialog.Title: Consider his head is on a platter.
I'll come over later. Wanna look around first.
Dialog.Text: Don't be long.

Dialog.Title: Wow...that's a lot. Well, I don't know. I would have to think about it
Dialog.Text: Don't be too long.

Dialog.Title: Not now.
Dialog.Text: Later then.

Dialog.Title: Not now.
Dialog.Text: Oh, he does a lot of bad.

Dialog.Title: Can I help you with anything?
Dialog.Text: I'm fine, thanks. If you have nothing to do, I know one place you can check. Haven't been there for a great while myself, but I remember that place being rich of anomalies, which means there're lots of artifacts hidden inside 'em. If you go to the east from the mountain, you'll find the place. There's a small hut in the swamp. So anomalies are all over the place. Be careful.

Dialog.Title: How's it going?
Dialog.Text: Nothing new. Have you been in the swamp?

Dialog.Title: I have. Never seen so many anomalies at one place.
Dialog.Text: Now you can be called a skilled stalker, I assume. Good luck, man.

Dialog.Title: Not now.
Dialog.Text: Up to you.

Dialog.Title: Так вроде все же отдал.
Dialog.Text: А, точно, извиняй, задумался.

Dialog.Title: I've given you everything.
Dialog.Text: Right.

Dialog.Title: I'm kinda busy. I'll come over later.
How did he have acid all over him?
Dialog.Text: It was an accident. Kolya is a skilled stalker, he wouldn't have done it on purpose.

Dialog.Title: *Tell how you let Acid down*|I think I screwed up and let him down...The thing is...Acid owed Shtaket money and he wanted him to take the debt out in artifacts..so he asked me to get those arts to Shtaket..and I..I claimed those artifacts as my own. I just needed money badly!
Dialog.Text: Why did you do that? That's exactly how you raise enemies here! You already have one, man. That's me.

Dialog.Title: I see. Tell me what to do.
Don't get mad, man. I said I'd needed money. It could have happened to anyone! Do you think I can sort it out somehow?
Dialog.Text: Let me think. Get me the same arts Kisliy gave you. I'll try to reason with Shtaket.

Dialog.Title: Whatever. I didn't want you to be my best friend anyway.
Alright. I'll get you the arts.
I brought the artifacts! When will you talk to Shtaket?
Dialog.Text: I already have. He's a nice man and he didn't mind waiting a little longer. Give me those.

Dialog.Title: Here you are. Can I help you with anything?
I'm busy now. I'll do it later.
Dialog.Text: Later?? Acid may be dead by that time.

Dialog.Title: Calm down! I'll be back soon.
How can I help Acid?| Hi, I'm back. So, tell me how I can help Acid.
Dialog.Text: Get me just the same artifacts you gave Shtaket, I'll talk to him myself.
Что надо?

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?

Dialog.Text: Что еще?

Dialog.Title: Let's talk.
Dialog.Text: About what?

Dialog.Title: Hey. Is there any job for me?
Я принес все, что ты просил.
Hey. I'm here to help you.
Hey. I'm here to help you.
What are you up to?
Dialog.Text: I'm looking for skilled stalkers and hunters that can do some job for me. I don't leave this place much, you know..especially after the accident I had. Kisliy and I were on a mission, when he had acid all over him and I got into an anomaly...I must say we were lucky to survive..you never know where an anomaly will appear next time..

Dialog.Title: How did he have acid all over him?
Dialog.Text: It was an accident. Kolya is a skilled stalker, he wouldn't have done it on purpose.

Dialog.Title: I see. I'd better be going now.
I thought nobody can leave the town.
Dialog.Text: Kvashina is my man. Tell him that I've sent you. He will let you out. And don't forget to give him 700 rubles. That's standart price. You can find a big pile of artefacts there. So your 700 cash can become a good investment.

Dialog.Title: What's up?
Dialog.Text: Do you remember I asked you to get some stuff for my friend? He never used it...he's dead...Listen, I have a suggestion to you. I can either give you all the stuff if you give me at least 10 000 or you can take all fo free if you find the bastard that killed my friend. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Remind me what stuff exactly?
Dialog.Text: 5 small medkits, 162 12/70 rounds, two repair kits and a backpack. So, will you find the bastard?

Dialog.Title: No. Here, take 10 000, give the stuff back.
I'll find the murderer.
Dialog.Text: His name is... was Temon... I was told that he'd successfully got into the Zone and had been seen in Liubech...The next morning his body was found in a dumpster. You should talk to Blacksmith, Prokhor or Kisliy, they're in charge there. They must have seen him...

Dialog.Title: I know who killed Temon.
Dialog.Text: I'm all ears.

Dialog.Title: He's on this photo. Standing right next to you.
Dialog.Text: Wait a minute...I don't get it. It's Temon himself!

Dialog.Title: So...It means...people at the station made a mistake. Temon's alive.
Dialog.Text: Does it mean he killed some guy, got rid of the body and ran away? Don't understand..

Dialog.Title: Yeah.... colonel amnestied him.
Dialog.Text: Good news..

Dialog.Title: Now he's on New Land...being delusioned
Dialog.Text: Oh man..

Dialog.Title: About my reward...
Dialog.Text: Oh yea...I know I promised to give you his stuff...but since he's alive, he must need it himself. Here, take 15 000 instead.

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: Now I need to collect my thoughts...

Dialog.Title: No way. Give me the stuff.
Dialog.Text: I need to collect my thoughts, man..

Dialog.Title: Good luck, man. I'm outta here.
Dialog.Text: I need to collect my thoughts...

Dialog.Title: I will find out who killed your friend.
Dialog.Text: I've already paid you. Don't expect me to give you money back.

Dialog.Title: Okay.
Dialog.Text: His name is... was Temon... I was told that he'd successfully got into the Zone and had been seen in Liubech...The next morning his body was found in a dumpster. You should talk to Blacksmith and Kisliy, they're in charge there. They must have seen him...

Dialog.Title: Have you talked to your friend?
Dialog.Text: Not yet..he's rather far away now. I've been thinking about what you said. I'm really worried about Temon and his condition. Do talk to him, try to find out more about what happened. Ask him if he needs help. I can find money and clothing for him if needed.

Dialog.Title: *Tell him about Temon*| Temon said he'd killed his own clone.
Dialog.Text: No I see why everyone kept saying he was dead. But still...it just doesn't make any sense. Although I heard about kinda anomalies that were capable of making clones of people, I never came across one. I think scientists must know more about such cases. In fact, I remember there was one that talked about the "cloning thing". But what was his name, Cherepkov..Cherniushev..?

Dialog.Title: Temon's getting better.
Dialog.Text: Goos news.

Dialog.Title: He wanted to have Ivy's cigarettes.
Dialog.Text: I'm trying to stay away from the station, you know..I had a quarrel with Blacksmith and Kisliy over Temon's case..but I do have a pack. Here, take it. Give it to him.

Dialog.Title: No problem.
Dialog.Text: Don't play with me stalker. If I learn you kept the cigarettes, I'll make you eat 'em.

Dialog.Title: He asked me to get him 20 bottles of spirit.
Dialog.Text: That's so Temon...funny man Llet him come here, we'll look for it together.

Dialog.Title: He's not coming back.
Dialog.Text: What a shame...anyway I'm glad he's alright.

Dialog.Title: Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Не забывает Артур своих друзей! Если его встретишь, то и от меня поздравь с Новым Годом! Спасибо тебе за весточку от друга, сталкер! Прими и ты мои поздравления! А вот тебе небольшой Новогодний подарочек.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Пожалуйста! Слушай, сталкер, отгадай загадку? Отгадаешь - выиграешь приз. А загадка вот какая. Однажды сталкера, изучавшего Зону, захватили в плен бандиты. И решили убить беднягу. Но главарю банды было мало его просто убить, ему хотелось его помучить. И он предложил сталкеру произнести одну фразу. Если то, что он скажет, окажется истинно, то его просто пристрелят. Если же сказанное будет ложным, его сожгут на костре. Казалось бы, песенка сталкера спета. Однако, он сказал нечто такое, после чего его пришлось отпустить. Что сказал сталкер?

Dialog.Title: Я не знаю
Dialog.Text: Да, непростая загадка! Но ты её не угадал. Сталкер сказал: "меня сожгут". Теперь, если его и в самом деле сожгут, то утверждение окажется истинным и, следовательно, бедолагу должны будут пристрелить. Но ведь если путешественника пристрелят, то сказанное станет ложным, и его следует сжечь! И так далее... Вот такой сообразительный сталкер! Ну, с Новым Годом тебя! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Будет дождь
Dialog.Text: Причём тут дождь? Сталкер сказал: "меня сожгут"! Теперь, если его и в самом деле сожгут, то утверждение окажется истинным и, следовательно, бедолагу должны будут пристрелить. Но ведь если путешественника пристрелят, то сказанное станет ложным, и его следует сжечь! И так далее... Вот такой сообразительный сталкер! Ну, с Новым Годом тебя! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Не убивайте меня!
Dialog.Text: Мда... Ты наверное так бы и сказал... Нет, не угадал ты. А сталкер сказал: "меня сожгут"! Теперь, если его и в самом деле сожгут, то утверждение окажется истинным и, следовательно, бедолагу должны будут пристрелить. Но ведь если путешественника пристрелят, то сказанное станет ложным, и его следует сжечь! И так далее... Вот такой сообразительный сталкер! Ну, с Новым Годом тебя! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Идите к чёрту!
Dialog.Text: Смело! Но ты не угадал. Сталкер сказал: "меня сожгут". Теперь, если его и в самом деле сожгут, то утверждение окажется истинным и, следовательно, бедолагу должны будут пристрелить. Но ведь если путешественника пристрелят, то сказанное станет ложным, и его следует сжечь! И так далее... Вот такой сообразительный сталкер! Ну, с Новым Годом тебя! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Меня сожгут
