Dialog.Text: Сообразил! Молодец! Конечно, он сказал: "меня сожгут". Теперь, если его и в самом деле сожгут, то утверждение окажется истинным и, следовательно, бедолагу должны будут пристрелить. Но ведь если путешественника пристрелят, то сказанное станет ложным, и его следует сжечь! И так далее... Вот такой сообразительный сталкер! Ну, с Новым Годом тебя! Бывай! И держи подарок - фейерверк!

Dialog.Title: Hey! Old Stalker sent me..I'm willing to answer one of your questions.
Dialog.Text: You're full of surprises, man! I don't meet such enthusiast every day!

Dialog.Title: Try me!
Dialog.Text: Not only couldn't two small German tanks pull This Soviet Tank out, but it was kick-started and enticed them into our layout.

Dialog.Title: КV-1
Dialog.Text: That's how you do that! I'm impressed.

Dialog.Title: IS-1
Dialog.Text: Close enough, but no. Think better.

Dialog.Title: Т-34
Dialog.Text: No, not even close. Think better.

Dialog.Title: Shit! Let me try again!
Dialog.Text: That's OK. You have another try.

Dialog.Title: I'm smart.
Dialog.Text: Let's carry on our marathon, then. Talk to Basmach, he must have some tricky questions for ya.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Ничего нового от Плевка или Митьки?
Dialog.Text: Забавно, что ты спрашиваешь. Недавно один сталкер мне письмо от Плевка принес. Предлагает заказ. Точнее, просит найти исполнителя - сам-то я не в состоянии по Зоне круги нарезать... Не интересуешься?

Dialog.Title: Что за заказ?
Dialog.Text: Да несложный. Для опытного сталкера вообще пустячный. Надо насобирать 20 Экранов Альфа и доставить Плевку. Возьмешься?
Welcome, stalker! Choose any table you like. We offer food and drink, anything you wish.

Dialog.Title: Торговля.
Dialog.Text: Да что ты сразу! Я ж по-доброму, по-хозяйски. Да и что уж там скрывать, ты явно не Бред Питт. Ты лучше расслабься, откушай тушеночки, запей чем-нибудь погорячее. У меня, благо, все есть.

Dialog.Title: Who are you? Where am I?
Dialog.Text: My name's Metrofan, I own this bar. I know, what you may think - The Palace of Culture is not the right place to drink at! But look around, there're no drunks, sluts or fighting. Everything's civilized and well organized. Plus, stalkers need to have a place where they can relax once in a while, don't tthey?

Dialog.Title: Ты кто?
Dialog.Text: Я Метрофан, хозяин сего прекрасного заведения. Не евроремонты, конечно, но уютненько.

Dialog.Title: Все есть, говоришь? А может, занятие мне подыщешь, а то я тут замаялся уже?
Dialog.Text: Да сколько угодно! Могу предложить пострелять пауков – лапы мне их очень пригодятся. А могу тебя и в пешее путешествие отправить. Что больше по душе?

Dialog.Title: По мне - так вполне приличный притон. Покажи мне харчи свои.
I'd like to kill some spiders.
Dialog.Text: Kill a spider, cut its legs off and bring 'em to me. I got legs, you got money. Is it clear?

Dialog.Title: A journey? That sounds interesting.
Dialog.Text: The thing is, I'm looking for a new place for our base. And there's a village called Ryabinushka, which is said to be a perfect place for that. I want you to explore tha area. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Ok. If I manage to leave the town, I'll check it out for you.
Прогулялся до Рябинушки. Да там прямо совковый рай. Есть на что посмотреть.
Is there a job for me?
Dialog.Text: There's always some. You can either kill couple of mutant spiders for me or "go on a journey". What do you choose?

Dialog.Title: I'm just back from Ryabinushka. Such a nice place it is!
Dialog.Text: I knew it would be a good place for the base.

Dialog.Title: I brought 10 spider legs.
Dialog.Text: Good.

Dialog.Title: I brought 30 spider legs.
Dialog.Text: Good.

Dialog.Title: I wanna know more about the town.|I haven't been here for long, so any information will do.
Dialog.Text: You're in Liubech. This place used to be modern and beautiful but those days are gone. Now you have to work hard to survive, that's your number one priority. You can always turn to me or Shtaket for help. I'm always here, keeping an eye on this polace and he must be somewhere inside the former Militia Station, it's to the south from here. Good luck!

Dialog.Title: I couldn't find that Shtaket guy.
Dialog.Text: Go one street down from the square and keep moving to the west. Soon you'll see a half-ruined building, it's a former Militia Station. Shtaket will be on the first floor.

Dialog.Title: Is there a job for me? |Do you know how I can make some money here?
Dialog.Text: Well...You can do something for me first.

Dialog.Title: What do you need?
Dialog.Text: One guy, named Yura Barabashka, is a very good friend of mine and he's missing. Help me find him. He was usually seen by the garages not far from the stadium, in square Ж13. And another thing...when you find him, remind him that he owes me a sum of money.

Dialog.Title: I brought news about your friend.
Dialog.Text: Do you know what has become of him?

Dialog.Title: I helped him out. |He ran into trouble and almost lost the loot. I helped him out.
Dialog.Text: Well done, stalker. You're a nice fella. Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: He's in his garage||, He lost all the loot and has no idea what he ought to do.
Dialog.Text: Do help him with anything he needs. Stalkers help each other. This is the way the things are done.

Dialog.Title: I'm too busy, Think he can take care of himself.
Dialog.Text: Up to you. Here's reward anyway.

Dialog.Title: I thought you only wanted to know what had happened to him.
Dialog.Text: I want him to give me my money back.

Dialog.Title: Ok. I'll see what I can do.
Shtaket sent me||, did you get his message?
Dialog.Text: Everything's fine. Money's here. So, how's Acid doing?

Dialog.Title: None of your business...
Dialog.Text: I won't tell anyone what you did...if you help one friend of mine.

Dialog.Title: What friend?
Dialog.Text: Sanek the Old Coon. He makes souvenirs that are delivered to the "Big Land". And he needs someone who can help him get mutant parts for his "toys".

Dialog.Title: Now Yura is fine, I helped him out. He'll give you money back.
Dialog.Text: Well done, stalker!

Dialog.Title: And where is your friend?
Dialog.Text: He's in square И12. Go out of the building, walk past Lenin monument and turn right. You'll see him next to the tower..

Dialog.Title: Ok. But I have one more question.
He can do it at his own.
I didn't have time to ask if he needed help.
Dialog.Text: Visit him again whenever you have time. As long as he's broke, I can't get my money back.

Dialog.Title: I think he can take care of himself without any help.
Can get you 10 spider legs more||, if you need.
Dialog.Text: That would be just great.

Dialog.Title: Can get you 30 spider legs more||, if you need.
Dialog.Text: Wow. You must have gotten a taste for that!
What else?

Dialog.Title: Ain't your friends name Sanek The Old Coon?|| Shtaket told me about him.
Dialog.Text: So since you're aware...What do you say? Will you help him out?

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Have you heard about the dead mutants in the new district?| I've seen a very strange stuff recently...Dead mutants placed in a kind of ritual circle. What the hell?
Dialog.Text: Have never heard anything like that before! The white must have something to do with it.

Dialog.Title: The white?
Dialog.Text: Yes...they're real fanatics, religious freaks, you know. They worship hell knows what and make strange rituals. But what you just said is gross! Din't know they were capable of anything remotely close to this..Listen, I do know a guy who might have seen something, his name's Stepan. He was injured and could bearly walk when he got here couple of days ago. Now he's under the care of a local doctor.

Dialog.Title: Ain't your friends name Sanek The Old Coon?|| I've already visited him..
Dialog.Text: I see. As you understood..a favor for a favor.

Dialog.Title: I thought it wasn't allowed to leave the town.
Dialog.Text: That's right. But skilled stalkers always find the way, you know. They also know right people to turn to. Sergeant Dibenko is in charge here, his post is inside the former Militia Station. I'm sure you've seen the biulding on the way here. A guy, named Shtaket is also hanging out there, he's my friend, although he's such a prick, ready to do anything illegal for money... Anyway, you need to find Courier, he must be somewhere not far from Divenko's post. He recruits stalkers for his needs, delivery stuff mainly. Courier's boys are alowed to go in or out, so that's your chance.. There's also one guy you can talk to. His name's Sanek the Old Coon, he's been outside the town a great deal. Now he can be found somewhere in square 311. So, what do you say? Will you help me?

Dialog.Title: I thought the town was closed.
Dialog.Text: That's right. Skilled stalkers always find the way, you know. They also know right people to turn to. Sergeant Dibenko is in charge here, his post is in the former Militia Station. I'm sure you've seen the biulding on the way here. A guy, named Shtaket is also hanging out there, he's my friend, although he's such a prick, ready to do anything illegal for money... Anyway, you need to find Courier, he must be somewhere not far from Divenko's post. He recruits stalkers for his needs, delivery stuff mainly. Courier's boys are aloud to go in or out, so that's your chance.. There's also one guy you can talk to. His name's Sanek the Old Coon, he's been outside the town a great deal. Now he can be found somewhere in square 311. So, what do you say? Will you help me?

Dialog.Title: Let me see what you have for sale.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Keepers will save you!

Dialog.Title: You too.
Dialog.Text: What brought you here?

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: I do have something for you.

Dialog.Title: What should I do?
Dialog.Text: Well, you do like a tough guy and you seem to have a decent equipment. But I'm not sure I can trust you. Listen what we're going to do. I'm gonna try you first, then, if you approve yourself, I'll give you a job. To the south from here there is aplace that's teening withg wild mutated boars. Kill one and get mу its leg. And don't mess with me, I will find out if you buy the meat. That will cost you a lot.

Dialog.Title: I killed the boar. Here's its leg.
Dialog.Text: Zone bless you!

Dialog.Title: У меня разряд по уничтожению мутантов.
Dialog.Text: Да, парень ты крепкий. Ну, слушай сюда. В общем, говорят, в Зоне, есть курган, который излучает таинственную энергию. По нашей теории, должно быть еще два таких же кургана, которые вместе образуют мистический треугольник. Тебе необходимо отыскать все три кургана и исследовать их. Координаты первого нам известны, а два остальных ты должен найти самостоятельно. Надеюсь, я не ошибся в тебе, и ты меня не подведешь, так как информация, об этих курганах, для нас очень важна

Dialog.Title: Есть еще работенка?
Dialog.Text: Найдется.

Dialog.Title: Listening.
Dialog.Text: There are places that radiate an unusual energy. We assume there're three such spots and they form a kind of triangle. I want you to find them all and collect the data. I'll give you the coordinates of the first spot, the others you gotta find yourself. I hope you won't let me down. This information is vital for us.

Dialog.Title: Got it. I'm gonna find those spots.
It's not where I was heading for.
Talking of the anomalous areas.|| All the information I got is on your PDA.
Dialog.Text: Zone bless you!

Dialog.Title: Tell me what's happened.
Dialog.Text: After you got back with the data, we sent a group of researchers, but they were killed by mutated spiders on their way. The light mentor ordererd to stamp out as many spiders as we could. There're lots of spiders in the places with high concentration of psi-energy. We can't continue our work until we clear the ares off spiders. Go and shoot as many as you can.Even if you dion't kill all spiders, at least their number will be eliminated.

Dialog.Title: Spiders are not a real problem.
I won't go. I would, but I ran out of ammo.
С пауками покончено.|Сделал, как ты просил, пауков больше нет. Можете продолжать работать.
Dialog.Text: Сохрани тебя Зона, сталкер. Мы продолжим наши исследования.

Dialog.Title: What's up?
Dialog.Text: Damn verliocks! The more we kill, the more appear again! Thy're freaking venomous, you know. One such creature bit one guy and now he's dying. We gotta find an antidote as soon as possible. I know Veterinarian can make the antidote but he's gonna need some ingredients for that. Hurry up! He lives not far from here, to the right from this place.

Dialog.Title: Мне б работенку, не шибко пыльную.
Dialog.Text: Ты с предыдущей закончи, а тогда я тебе новую дам!

Dialog.Title: I'm listening.
Dialog.Text: Deal with the boar first. Then I'll give you another task.

Dialog.Title: Listening.
Dialog.Text: Get me the information about anomalous areas first.

Dialog.Title: I'm all ears.
Dialog.Text: Complete your current task first.

Dialog.Title: Alright. I'll be back when I'm done.
Ready for new tasks.
Dialog.Text: Check you PDA, I sent you the papers for a man named Chaggy. I think he'll be able to discode the documents. Be careful, that loner lives on the swamland, it'll take you a while to get there. Don't let us down!

Dialog.Title: Alright. Don't forget to send me the coordinates.
No, thanks. I don't wanna go there. It's too far.
I'm ready!
Dialog.Text: Have you decoded the papers?

Dialog.Title: I brought the antidote.
Dialog.Text: Well done, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Nothing. I was just passing by. Leaving already.
Tell me what I should do.
Dialog.Text: Hurry up, one lad needs an antidote badly, he's dying of poisoning. Get the antidote from Veterinarian. Hurry up!

Dialog.Title: The pilot is here, isn't he?
Dialog.Text: Who told you that? We aren't hiding anything or anyone. If you don't trust me, talk to Michail the mentor.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a stalker by the name Temon.
Dialog.Text: He's a novice here.Talk to our mentor.

Dialog.Title: Did "Brother Temon" return?
Dialog.Text: Our mentor wants to talk to you about that in private. Go and see him.

Dialog.Title: Do you know any riddles?
Dialog.Text: I do. A favor for a favor, stalker. As always.

Dialog.Title: Let see what I can do.
Dialog.Text: There's a thief in Liubech called Shtaket. People that must be under his control have crossed the line and they must be punished. We don't want to start war, so could you please hand him this letter? We believe the things we wrote will help him take the right decision.

Dialog.Title: Deal. I will hand him the letter.
Dialog.Text: Zone bless you, stalker.

Dialog.Title: I handed the letter.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, stalker. here is a riddle for you now " What body part is pronounced as one letter but written three, only two different letters are used?"

Dialog.Title: Thank you. I gotta go now.
Dialog.Text: Zone bless you, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Can I help you?

Dialog.Title: I need an antidote to verliock's poison.|Amanita said that you can make an antidote to verliock's poison?
Dialog.Text: Yes, I think it would not be difficult, but I need verliock's paws.

Dialog.Title: I brought everything.|Amanita warned me. Apparently not the first time. I brought everything.
Dialog.Text: Wonderful. Give me fifteen minutes. I'll make the antidote.

Dialog.Title: I have a few questions.
Dialog.Text: I'll try to answer all your questions!

Dialog.Title: Why do they call you a vet?
Dialog.Text: It's a long story, I just like to treat animals. Though often, here, I have to save people from animals. Well, the nickname appeared after I had once, by inexperience, cured a bear, and he recovered, and have done troubles and the people remembered me for a long time afterwards. Good thing there were no casualties.

Dialog.Title: What are you doing here in the Zone?
Dialog.Text: For the most part, I treat people, but often have to cook a variety of decoctions, antidotes and other...

Dialog.Title: What are you doing here in the Zone?
Thank you.|| Now I know who to contact in case if anything happens.
Dialog.Text: I'll be glad to help.

Dialog.Title: Well, what about the antidote?
Dialog.Text: Everything is ready. Here, take this.

Dialog.Title: Maybe I can help with something?| On the contrary, maybe I can do something?
Dialog.Text: I think you can. I'm working on a very interesting decoction, which should significantly increase blood clotting, but I do not have enough ingredients. Could you bring them to me?

Dialog.Title: I brought what you asked.
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: Got it, I'll be back with the paws.
Dialog.Text: Just hurry up, your patient can die soon.

Dialog.Title: In the nearby village people were poisoned.|In the nearby village people were poisoned with verliock's meat.
Dialog.Text: Well, they are idiots. Whose idea was it to eat verliock's meat? Probably fry is bad? I need the paws. Paws of verliock. I need them for each portion of the antidote, if you do not know or forgot.

Dialog.Title: Here's paws.
Dialog.Text: Here is the antidote from my reserves. With these paws I'll prepare a new one.

Dialog.Title: You already have the antidote?|| Why have I brought a new one?
Dialog.Text: Calm down, stalker. It's true, I already had the paws and I used them to make the potion. But I need new ones as replacement. By the way, I thought you're in a hurry to save someone.

Dialog.Title: *Drug for Temon*| One stalker has gone nuts!
Dialog.Text: umph...Potion with Verliock's paws may help.

Dialog.Title: Will you make it?
Dialog.Text: If you get me ingredients only. And surely not for free. I wanna have some artefacts. If I'm right they're called "Shield α" and "Stabilizer α". And more... Brothers asked me to cook boar soup. But they didn't bring me anything.I cannot cook without ingredients, you know! I need boar's leg and tooth.

Dialog.Title: Talking of the potion for Temon...
Dialog.Text: Collected all ingredients?

Dialog.Title: Is the potion ready?
Dialog.Text: Here, take this. If this doesn't help him, nothing will.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello. God bless you. I hope you're not going to waste my time.

Dialog.Title: Pardon me.
Dialog.Text: The Almighty will if your intentions are pure.

Dialog.Title: Talking of the documents of the Flybane guy.
Dialog.Text: What is up?

Dialog.Title: Shaggy decoded the papers. |Shaggy decoded the papers, although he said it was the last favor he did for the White.
Dialog.Text: It doesn't matter..What does matter is that we can read the papers now.

Dialog.Title: Может, я чем смогу помочь?
Dialog.Text: Думаю, сможешь. Сегодня ночью, пауки напали на наш полевой госпиталь, убили нескольких человек, включая охрану. Нельзя позволить паукам и дальше бесчинствовать в нашем лагере. Убей их столько, сколько сможешь!

Dialog.Title: Нет, пауков я убивать не буду.
I will get you the parts!
I brought the artifacts you asked for.
Dialog.Text: Very well! Give 'em to me, I'll assemble them right away. Now we're able to help our brother recover.

Dialog.Title: Id love to help, but I can't do it now.
А может, еще кто со мной на пауков пойдет?
Dialog.Text: Извини, сейчас каждый человек на счету. Ты уж как-нибудь сам.

Dialog.Title: Right, I'm happy to be helpful.
Артефакт заряжен. Надеюсь, он действительно так силен, как вы о нем говорите.
I don't wastу time.
Dialog.Text: That's true. You have approved yourself and now I want you to experience the Way of Knowing.Yyou will expand your knowledge about the Zone and become stronger. Your starting point is the stadium in Liubch, from which you should head for Ryabinushka and then back to Liubech, to the new discrict. Kill anyone who will stand on your way. You must prove you are a Great warrior.

Dialog.Title: I'll be honored to travel that way.
I made my own Way of Knowing.
Dialog.Text: Now you're one of us. I name you our brother as God is my witness. Welcome!

Dialog.Title: I am ready for new challenges!
Dialog.Text: Listen up, then. There're creatures called verliocks, I want you to kill some of 'em and feel what the powerful energy they possess. It won't be easy to find 'em, but the Almighty will show you the way and reward you generously for your pains.

Dialog.Title: Good morning, master.
Dialog.Text: I was just thinking of you, my brother. As you might know, there's a vast amount of artifacts in the Zone, they serve to help us either bring our talents to light or see the true inner self. However, most of the arts are split apart and scattered all over the Zone. I want you to collect the parts of one artifact. We're going to put 'em back together, endue the artifact with the bigger force than it ever had and cure our brother who was badly injured by an anomaly.

Dialog.Title: I heard you'd been looking for me.
Dialog.Text: I had, This place is teeming with mutants now. I think they might be drawn by our energy. The Zone is dangerous as it as, but mutants...that's too much. Go round the base and kill every creature you see on your way.

Dialog.Title: No problem! I'll take care of that.
Dialog.Text: I trust you. Go back when you're done.

Dialog.Title: Maybe some other time. |Unfortunately, I'm a bit preoccupied now, I'll come over later and take care of that.
Dialog.Text: Understood. Do come back when ready.

Dialog.Title: Killed the mutants.| It was tough.
I shot the verliocks.. |Next time make sure I'll be given a machine gun for that.
Перебил пауков.| С пауками никогда особой сложности не возникало.
I found the hand of the Great!
Dialog.Text: Very well! What a glorious day! Give it to me, I wanna see it with my own eyes.

Dialog.Title: Alas, I lost it.
Dialog.Text: Get out of my sight, pagan. How dare you mess with the sanctity?!

Dialog.Title: Here you go.
Dialog.Text: The hand of the Great is finally found! I will spread the word about you, stalker. The Brothers must be aware.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a pilot. He's missing.
Dialog.Text: You've lost your way. You're wandering in the darkness.

Dialog.Title: I know the White kidnapped the guy. There's a witness.
Dialog.Text: We're tied together. We try to live as one. Unfortunately, not everyone think equal. The Zone is getting bigger and bigger every day and more people keep coming. The Brothers decide to stand up against the newcomers without telling me. Although I was against it, they did harm those people. We're not to decide who to stay and who to leave. It's for the Zone to decide.

Dialog.Title: How can I find those brothers?
Dialog.Text: It will not be easy. I have driven them out of the village for a misdemeanor. Through the marshes, they moved on in the land of fire and ashes to enter into the mouth of the volcano and to atone for their sins. But I did not see the pilot with them. I'm sorry, stalker, but it is likely that your pilot is dead...

Dialog.Title: One master has the crisis of faith.
Dialog.Text: White Brotherhood is ready to accept the lost soul. He must open eyes and take the Zone as the only truth in the world. If the Master will come to us, we allow him pass the test, strengthen his faith, his body and his mind. There is no way out of the Zone you have to become one with it, to make it a part of yourself and become part of it. This is our way and that the only way which id predestined to man.

Dialog.Title: I will send him to you.
I'm searching stalker "Temon."
Dialog.Text: Do you need Brother Temon? Why?

Dialog.Title: On suspicion of murder.
Dialog.Text: You can find truly innocent children in the Zone . We will not give you brother Temon , no matter what he had done in his worldly life. He is now dedicated to one of us. Temon embraced the faith of the White Brotherhood and makes the path of knowledge. He is under my protection, as well as all of my flock. Forget about him. Go in peace.

Dialog.Title: An old friend is worried about him.
Dialog.Text: Brother Temon makes his way of knowing. As one of the initiated you have to remember this way.

Dialog.Title: An old friend is worried about him.
Dialog.Text: Brother Temon makes his way of knowing. You're not one of the initiated and I can not tell you where he went.

Dialog.Title: Did "Brother Temon" return?
Dialog.Text: I have cast outTemon from our Brotherhood. Temon lied to us. He did not accept the faith and do not let God come into his heart.

Dialog.Title: Where is he now?
Dialog.Text: A true believer would direct his foot towards the land of fire and ashes to surrender to the flames in the crater of Vesuvius and clean gis soul. But I do not know how darkness deep in Temon . He could trample all ideals and escape to the swamps as a pathetic bandit.

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: I sent Temon to search verlioks but he expressed his anger and violent disagreement with my decision. He attacked me and tried to rob us. Then I told him to get out.

Dialog.Title: I have questions about the Brotherhood.
Dialog.Text: Listening.

Dialog.Title: The philosophy of the Brotherhood.
Dialog.Text: The Zone is our home. Learn to hear the Zone's voice, to live in harmony with it, try to understand what the Zone wants. Its growth ain't an infection like many people think, the Zone is trying to embrace us, its children. All mutated creatures are neither more nor less than the reflestion of our imperfection. The true member of the Brotherhood learns to coexist with every living being. He kills beasts only to defence himself or for sovereign ceremonies, not for hunting or self entertaining. Do not sin, let your soul and intention be pure.

Dialog.Title: The history of the Brotherhood.
Dialog.Text: The Brotherhood was formed in memory of the very first stalker. When the apocalypse came, the first stalker discovered the Source and started to pray for the mercy. The Zone heard his pray and retrieved the humanity from certain death. When people saw the bright flash above, they didn't have a clue they had a close squeak. However comrades of the first stalker who were left on the Bog Land knew what his mission was. They were the ones to form the Brotherhood. The heroic deed of the first stalker must not have been forgotten. All that you see now is the result of the miracle he called. He saved our lives at the expense of his own.

Dialog.Title: Did the Zone appear before the flash?
Dialog.Text: The Zone never appeared. it has always existed. The only person who did cognized it was the first stalker. He became the Creator, the Almighty. He is the Father and Protector. He is the Mother, the eternal Source.

Dialog.Title: The activities of the Brotherhood.
Dialog.Text: The Brotherhoos spread the will of the Zone. We are the intermediary between the Almighty and the unconsecrated. We seek for the unity with the Zone, we accept its gifts and we are patient to its anger.

Dialog.Title: That's all I wanted to know...
Where can I find kidnappers?
Dialog.Text: Are you still looking for a pilot? Go soth-east, through swamps. You'll understand when you step on hostile land.

Dialog.Title: They went there?
Dialog.Text: Yes. I made 'em leave. If their fait is strong enough they'll be enlightened on Vesuvius.

Dialog.Title: Got a letter from your obedient.
Dialog.Text: Well... I'm confused. Anyway it's good that those who lost their way repented and laid to rest. But I don't assume a dead pilot could help us live in peace with new-comers. Listen, I know you're helping the military from Lyubich. Convince ' em to leave the Zone. They still have a choice. They either show reaspect to the zone, leave it forever or die. The Zone could't bare 'em evermore.

Dialog.Title: It's bullshit. don't you scare me.
Dialog.Text: I mean it, stalker. We aren't enemies to new-comers. Their own greed will kill ' em. They must learn to live in harmony with the Zone, to be as one. If they aren't ready they must live. Noone can prevent the Zone from spreading. Those who don't see the light will live in darkness to their death.

Dialog.Title: OK.
Dialog.Text: I'm concerned about the man menshioned in the message. We do know that conflist is inevitable, but we don't want it. That man... he could fuel the war.

Dialog.Title: Do you wanna deal with it peacefully?
Dialog.Text: You may not tak a notice, Stalker, but the Zone is alive. It's growing, changing. It's already harmed. The war won't help it. It'll harm it even more.

Dialog.Title: I'm on business here.
Dialog.Text: Carry on.

Dialog.Title: Do you wanna sort everything out peacefully?
Dialog.Text: listen, I know you're helping the military from Liubich. Convince 'em to leave the Zone. Tell them they don't fit in here. Yet they still have a choice. They can either show their respect to the mighty Zone and leave it forever or die. The Zone couldn't bare 'em evermore.

Dialog.Title: Talking of new-comers....
Dialog.Text: How did negotiations go?

Dialog.Title: Neither Acid nor Dibenko will retreat.
Dialog.Text: I knew they wouldn't! It was worth trying though. I'll try to hold my people back as long as I can...

Dialog.Title: Dibenko kicked me out of the town.
Dialog.Text: Too bad. At least you tried. I'll restrain my Brothers as long as I can. God bless you.

Dialog.Title: I've heard you mugged a courier...
Dialog.Text: We ain't thieves, stalker, Ok? In the neigbourhood there're lots of muggers and looters, who're ready to do anything for the profit. We follow the rules of The Zone. We don't kill unless it's vital.

Dialog.Title: Not all brothers share this idea, right?
Dialog.Text: Right. But don't seek for enemies among your friends. The Almighty will punish all siners one day, we musn't interfere into God's will. Those, who passed away, couldn't commit that. And I believe other Brothers. But I know about gang under "Philin''s authority. They're real murderers, they often abuse stalkers, take their money. They aren't afraid of the military. Their spies are in Lyubich. They know who is the deliver and wat they're carrying.

Dialog.Title: *Showing threatening letters*|Someone keeps sending me treatening letters. May I count on Brothers' help?
Dialog.Text: Your fait isn't strong enough. We can't help you. Go and pray.

Dialog.Title: *Showing threatening letters*|Someone keeps sending me treatening letters. May I count on Brothers' help?
Dialog.Text: Brothrhood is with you. Your enemy is our enemy. The Zone is out true and only home. That man will meet God's visitation.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Я пришел помочь.
Dialog.Text: Человек, который говорит такое, достоин уважения. Хотя бывает, что благими намереньями выложена дорога в ад... Но это не про тебя, брат, я уверен. Для тебя всегда найдется работа. Мутанты продолжают стягиваться к нашей стоянке. Продолжай поддерживать безопасность в непосредственной близи от деревни и будешь вознагражден. Ты готов начать?

Dialog.Title: В округе все спокойно.
Dialog.Text: Ты не подводишь нас. Мы благодарны.
What are you snoopin' around here?

Dialog.Title: The "Whites" sent me.|| I'm here to collect the debt...
Dialog.Text: Damn them... You tell them, this is the last time! If someone else comes from them, I'll hang him on his guts... So... what do they need?

Dialog.Title: Don't be rude...|| You never know who you may meet here.
Dialog.Text: Get out, bum, or you will meet my friend -- the 5.45 caliber.

Dialog.Title: Here are the documents.|| I need you to decode it.
Dialog.Text: Let's see... Hmm, very similar to the M14-42 code, let me try... Yes that's it. You take it back, and don't come here any more.

Dialog.Title: I have a couple of questions.
Dialog.Text: Ask and get out.

Dialog.Title: What do you know about the "Whites"?
Dialog.Text: They're all thugs. This sect is most cruel of all I've seen. You better not joke with them around. They live only in sectarian notions. They can pull you out from the clutches of a bear and to sacrifice you in some bloody ritual soon after that. I won't recommend you spend your time in local places. You know why they have gray hair? It's a rite of passage every newcomer must take. I myself least of all would like to know more about the ceremony, and I advise you not to sniff.

Dialog.Title: What do you know about the "Whites"?
Dialog.Text: Maybe you should ask them? As I see it, you and them are almost relatives!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Yes?

Dialog.Title: I was told to speak with you.
Dialog.Text: You must be a newbie then. First of all, noone's gonna babysit with you, so get used to dealing with troubles yourself. This place's called Luibech-1. The second one - no matter where you go, take your weapon along. Without reliable firearm do not even try to go anywhere - the town is full of mutants. Then you find a gun... Get a second one! The weapon has a nasty habit to malfunction exactly at the wrong moment, ask Kolya Acid, he will help resolve that problem.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about this place.
Where to find the guy and what to tell him?
Dialog.Text: You need to find a guy, named Shtaket and tell him that the cargo will arrive tonight at a usual place. Go to the northwest until you bump into the former Militia Station, he'll be waiting for you on tthe first floor.

Dialog.Title: Do I look like a delivery boy?
Dialog.Text: So, that's who you are! Pompous ass. You don't need money, right? No problem, man, There're lots of people who'll be happy to hand couple of messages for cash. Are you looking for trouble, stalker?

Dialog.Title: Acid told me you were looking for me.
Dialog.Text: I was. I want you to hand a message to one guy from me. I would do that myself, but I'm waiting for people here, so I can't leave my "post".When you get to him, he'll reward you, don't worry.

Dialog.Title: I'm a fair man. Thanks for the jacket.
I brought you the heads as we agreed.
Dialog.Text: Give them to me!

Dialog.Title: I've been afraid of dogs since I was a child. Ask somebody else.
Where can I find a weapon... |Well, where to find weapon, how to to die, who is my friend, who is my enemy, and how to get some money...
Dialog.Text: Wait, wait, wait. I have time but I am not a directiry service. Get used to the fact that everything has its price here, even information. Only our barman is doing it for free as he loves to talk. His bar is right here at the station.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for rounds. Do you have any?
Dialog.Text: I do. But they ain't usual, they're poisonous and extremely effective against mutants. I'll give you a pack, but I want a favor in return. There's a military warehouse nearby teeming with mutant dogs. I want you to clean the warehouse of the mutants, they're getting on my nerves. Corporal Kapustin will give you ammo for the mission.

Dialog.Title: You win. Where to find the guy and what to tell him?
Ok. I'll do it a little later.
Shtaket is broke.||Shtaket didn't give me any money, he said he was broke. Although he did give me 3 boxes of rounds, I was kinda looking forward to getting some cash.
Dialog.Text: Shall I feel sorry for you? You got the rounds almost for free and still complain. Anyway, if you need cash, I'll tell you where to get some. Don't know if you noticed or not, but there're anomalies along the railroad. What's more interesting is that you find artifacts inside those anomalies. They're unique and some of 'em are even expensive. The arts you find here are cheap, but the ones you find outside Liubech can be sold at a very high rate. Don't forget that you're gonna need a MGD device to extract artifacts from anomalies.

Dialog.Title: What MGD?
Dialog.Text: Magnetic Grip Device.

Dialog.Title: I did deliver your message to Shtaket.|Your message is delivered. Do you know where to get more money?
Dialog.Text: Shtaket didn't give you any money, did he? Well.. I can tell you where to get some. Don't know if you noticed or not, but there're anomalies along the railroad. What's more interesting is that you find artifacts inside those anomalies. They're unique and some of 'em are even expensive. The arts you find here are cheap, but the ones you find outside Liubech can be sold at a very high rate. Don't forget that you're gonna need a MGD device to extract artifacts from anomalies.

Dialog.Title: What MGD?
Dialog.Text: Magnetic Grip Device.

Dialog.Title: About anomalies.
Dialog.Text: Anomalies! There is a lots of them in the Zone, they are different, but in one, almost all of them are same - for the ignorant person they promise death or just a bunch of troubles. Without the need, try to to bypass them, but it can be not so simple though, not every anomaly man be detected easily.

Dialog.Title: I forgot what message I needed to hand.
Dialog.Text: Are you kidding? If you wanna help, mind what I say. Tell Shtaket that the cargo will be delivered tonight. He'll be waiting for you on the first floor of the former Militia Station, that's to the northwest from the station, in square 313.
Anything else?

Dialog.Title: Do you happen to know why Prochor's so angry?
Dialog.Text: Take it easy, man. Prochor does sound rude sometimes, but his life is not a bed of roses, you know.

Dialog.Title: OK, let's start with basics.|| Where can I find a weapon?
Dialog.Text: Go to Acid, he is the one who likes to help newcomers...and use them as a low labor. Oops, mustn't have said that. Anyway, go to the station, he'll be somewhere around.

Dialog.Title: Here you are.
Dialog.Text: I see you're a man of his word. To be honest, I was afraid you'd bail on me. Here, take this jacket. I bet you need it more than I do.

Dialog.Title: Why not calling him? |Haven't you tried to telephone him?
Dialog.Text: Don't be stupid, anomalies interrupt almost every signal in the Zone.

Dialog.Title: You're Blacksmith, right?
Dialog.Text: Let's say yes... Why?

Dialog.Title: I was told you can help...
Dialog.Text: A newcomer? Listen up, nobody will be nursed with you here so don't relax. You are in the Anomaly Zone Lubech-1 now. Everything that you see here can become the last that you ever see.

Dialog.Title: What is the Zone?
Dialog.Text: You don't know a thing, do you? Where did you come from?

Dialog.Title: It's a long story.
Dialog.Text: You surprised me, man. Most people coming to the Zone do know at least something about what's going on here. They have their own reasons to in this place. I've seen a good deal in my life, believe me, but I've never seen a guy, who doesn't know a thing about this place.

Dialog.Title: I do know rumors. I wanna get more specific information.
Dialog.Text: Well...in brief, the Zone is literally an incredible place. Or it seems so. It appeared a long time ago. Strange places here ... Strange and dangerous... Mutants and anomalies ... in the first place. And people, of course, because the Zone are full of gentlemen of fortune, adventurers, miserable, crazy, who have no place for them in a normal society, and, there is nothing to shame of... murderers, convicts, exiles ... eager for gain, rogues, adrenaline junkies ... However, the Zone likes giving gifts sometimes...

Dialog.Title: What gifts?
Dialog.Text: So-called "artifacts". Haven't you heard about 'em yet? They're valuable stuff that people found use for in different areas such as medicine, military arts or everyday life. They may give a second chance to the humanity...Imagine, the Zone can provide the treatment for incurable diseases and many other things. Do you see why so many people are attracted to the idea of getting inside the perimeter?

Dialog.Title: You said this place's dangerous.
Dialog.Text: Of course it is. It's full of anomalies and mutants that can easily kill you. Most people who come here are criminals, who can kill you as well without any second thoughts. So you have to stay sharp.

Dialog.Title: Now I have even more questions. But thanks anyway.
Dialog.Text: You're welcome.

Dialog.Title: Tell me...
Dialog.Text: What do you want to know?

Dialog.Title: What do you know about accident?
Dialog.Text: I heard there was an accident on the bridge about ten km from here. People say the convoy was delivering something from outside the perimeter. Sometimes, migrants try to sneak into the Zone hiding in the trucks, you know. So, at some point, it's for the best, that noone survived in the crash. We don't need that many newbies here...

Dialog.Title: Did you say migrants?
Dialog.Text: You know, people who don't like sitting still. They have some business here, always cross the boarder back and forth. Some people call 'em "young generation", I call 'em "dead generation". Smart stalkers know there's no rush, they come to the Zone, they settle here, following so-called law of the Zone. Migrants are always looking for easy money, so you may guess why the mortality rate is high among them.

Dialog.Title: Where is it possible to get by the train?
Dialog.Text: This is the final stop. You won't go further, the road is blocked. If you wanna learn more about the railroad, you sould ask Prochor the Trackman, he's in charge of repair and maintenance work.

Dialog.Title: How to get out of the Zone?
Dialog.Text: Listen, first of all, it's very hard to get into the Zone, but it's even harder to get out. However, there're ways. Firstly, there're communities, so-called "fractions", which members cooperate with people outside the perimeter. Secondly, there're some freaks among stalkers, who're ready to risk their lives for a fair reward.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about the fractions.
Dialog.Text: The authorities sent groups of scientists to the Zone and developed transport communication between the perimeter and "the big world" to deliver valuable samples. However, the "white coats" reluctantly leave their labs...Why bother if there're freaks who're ready to risk their own lives for money? Stalkers help "the white coats" get artifacts and get paid for that. So, as you see...crossing the perimeter is illegal, but if you did get into the Zone, try to fit in and find the ways to cooperate with the locals. If you do, noone will ever touch you.

Dialog.Title: I didn't get how it would help to get out...
Dialog.Text: Well...Certain stalkers get real jobs. They're sometimes offered to become members of the fractions. If you do, you'll get all the privilege as a official fraction member, including a permission to cross the boarder. Got it?

Dialog.Title: And then what?
Dialog.Text: Save some money, wait a little and then dissapear. At first. other members will be searching for you...but if you think everything through and pay the right people in advance, they won't be searching for you at all. That's a safe and proven method to get out but it'll take you at least couple of years to prepare everything needed. I do know people who did it. But I also know the guys, who stayed here and chose to work illegally. And I'm telling you, they have a good thing going.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about stalkers.
Dialog.Text: If you want to get out faster and you don't mind a bit of risk... find a professional stalker. The skilled stalker knows all tracks and paths, he knows which guards take bribes and has contacts. But it will cost you, as your guide taking serious risks... Compensation will be essential. Most likely in advance and in full charge. There is little trust among us as you could see... It would be ideal to find a stalker who himself decided to retire and to get out of the Zone. However, he will most likely succeed alone, than with a ballast... But if you'll manage to find such guide and to convince him to go and agree about payment... Well, even then it wouldn't be easy. There are always risks, what even the skilled stalker will run into patrol or step in an anomaly. And he can double-cross you, of course, as any other.

Dialog.Title: Do you know such stalker?
Dialog.Text: All the stalkers I know prefer to stay here, in the Zone. And the migrants... Let's just say you don't want to be with them. Crazy bastards...

Dialog.Title: Is i the only way?
Dialog.Text: Yep. As far as I know. You can try to make it on your own, but I believe it won't be long until we'll find you dead.

Dialog.Title: How about using the railroad?
Dialog.Text: No way! It's not a good idea, believe me. First, I heard the only way leading to the big world had been blocked by an anomaly. Furthermore, there was an accident with the trucks near the same road. So now all the area is under focused attention of the military.

Dialog.Title: How did you get into the Zone?
Dialog.Text: I'd been here before we started to call it "the Zone". Those were the days...We didn't know what we'd find here, so we weren't ready for anything at all. We fought against mutants using everything we could find...stones, sticks, different tools. Later I met Kolya Acid, he's my mentor and he ows me one.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about the station.
Dialog.Text: The railways are used to supply the Zone with food, ammo and meds. The military used this place as their base. However, when mutants appeared, the military had to leave the place and strain their troops along the Liubech boarder. While the military are gone, this place is under our control. Most people you see here are hucksters, they're always ready to buy something rare or precious, like artifacts or mutant parts. As for us, we welcome newcomers and help 'em fit in. Kolya Acid is in charge here. Ivy the Bartender is also one of us, he doesn't rat out.

Dialog.Title: What if the military are back?
Dialog.Text: Look around, man. They're quite busy at the moment, don't think they'll be back at all. Anyway, they must be grateful, cause we clean this area of the mutants. If they do come back, people will just leave the place quietly, except for me, Ivy and Acid, of course. It's kinda our home, you know.

Dialog.Title: I got more questions...
Dialog.Text: Wait a minute! Not so fast, man. I didn't know you'd have that many questions...Useful information does cost in the Zone, get used to it.

Dialog.Title: That's something at least. Thank you.
Dialog.Text: You'd better find Acid or Ivy the Bartender, they love chatting with newbies.

Dialog.Title: You mentioned "the gifts" that the Zone may give...
Now I have even more qusetions. But thanks anyway.
Do you know anything about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: Such a loser he was, that Temon guy...I sent him to Acid. Kolya gave him PM and told to kill some rats in the area. But Temon didn't listen to him and set off God knows where. The next day his body filled with bullets was found in a dumpster. Poor guy..Anyway, he had that coming, he shouldn't have gone alone.

Dialog.Title: I was told you were looking for me.
Dialog.Text: I was. Give the jacket to me.

Dialog.Title: What jacket?
Dialog.Text: The quilted jacket one local asked you to get. I know you found it in the wardrobe and took away. Listen...One man believes that those jackets "grow" in the wardrobe themselves. He sends someone to get him one every day. Then he sells the found one to us...and we put it back to the wardrobe at night.

Dialog.Title: What for?
Dialog.Text: Coz that's funny. We do pay him, right? So let him entertain us a bit. Anyway, give the jacket to me.

Dialog.Title: I brought the jacket.
Dialog.Text: Give me that. Now I need to convince our potato-head, that the "harvestless season" is over.

Dialog.Title: I have another plan. I'm selling it.
Dialog.Text: I can pay for that. The same price we always buy it for. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: The white want you to leave the Zone.
Dialog.Text: I do know that Acid won't agree. He does respect the white but...look around, stalker. All the area round Liubech is under control of the military. We have weapon, walls and real soldiers in here. What can those freaks do to us?

Dialog.Title: I do have a weapon. I need rounds.
I'm looking for rounds. Do you have any?
Thanks anyway.
Dialog.Text: I did answer your questions, now you do me a favor.I want you to hand a message to one guy from me. When you get to him, he'll pay you, don't worry.

Dialog.Title: I forgot what message I needed to hand..
Do you have a job for me?
Dialog.Text: Willing to work, huh?

Dialog.Title: Need money badly.
Dialog.Text: I see. It's hard to survive here without cash. Find a guy named Courier, he might have something for ya. He must be not far from the Palace of Culture, it's in square И12-1.

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: Да оставил бы ты его в покое... И правда тяжело мужику пришлось.

Dialog.Title: Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Ух, ты! Не забывает Артур своих друзей! Если его встретишь, то и от меня непременно поздравь с Новым Годом! Спасибо тебе за весточку от друга, сталкер! Тебя тоже с Новым Годом! И прими небольшой Новогодний подарочек от меня.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Пожалуйста! Просить стишок рассказазывать я не буду, не маленький ты уже! Ха-ха! Но, если отгадаешь загадку, то достанется тебе ещё небольшой приз. Слушай. На одном берегу реки стоит сталкер. На другом берегу туалет. Как сталкеру попасть в туалет?

Dialog.Title: Вплавь
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты! Не угадал! Чтобы попасть, надо прицелиться хорошенько! Охотник же, значит с ружьём! Из ружья попасть надо! Ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Найти лодку
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты! Не угадал! Чтобы попасть, надо прицелиться хорошенько! Охотник же, значит с ружьём! Из ружья попасть надо! Ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Искать мост
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты! Не угадал! Чтобы попасть, надо прицелиться хорошенько! Охотник же, значит с ружьём! Из ружья попасть надо! Ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Откуда в лесу туалет?
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты! Не угадал! Чтобы попасть, надо прицелиться хорошенько! Охотник же, значит с ружьём! Из ружья попасть надо! Ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Прицелиться получше
Dialog.Text: Ха! А ты смекалистый, сталкер! Молодец! Ну, держи награду! И с Новым Годом тебя!

Dialog.Title: I've been looking for you. Ready to asnwer one of your questions.
Dialog.Text: Let's see how smart you are.

Dialog.Title: Ask away!
Dialog.Text: He was a flying ace, a Marshal of Soviet Air Force, three times Hero of the Soviet Union whom Roosevelt officially called "the best fighter pilot" in 1944. The question is - what was his last name?

Dialog.Title: Popkov.
Dialog.Text: Well...You do know something but that wasn't him. Popkov was famous as well but your answer's wrong.

Dialog.Title: Kozhedub.
Dialog.Text: He was made a Hero of the Soviet Union on three occasions, you're right! But that's a wrong answer. Try to do your best, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Pokryshkin.
Dialog.Text: That's right! You can be proud of yourself, stalker. I see you're aware of the national history. Don't forget it.

Dialog.Title: Just a moment! Let me try again.
Thanks! Ain't you got other questions?
Dialog.Text: Find Misha the Hunter. He must have some.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I have no intention to talk to a criminal.

Dialog.Title: About some news.
Dialog.Text: News? Just look at the bulletin board, you'll find them there.

Dialog.Title: Bulletin board?
Dialog.Text: Yes, here it is. It is possible to learn about where and how to make money, who sells a commodity or bought and, what is important - you can place your own ads. For example, assign a bounty on your abuser.

Dialog.Title: Как это?
Dialog.Text: Как? Да очень просто! Вот, например, какой-нибудь бандит пальнул в тебя и поранил. Отвечать тем же? Но тогда испортишь отношение к себе со стороны других сталкеров. Ведь в Зоне подобное поведение не приветствуется. Что делать? А вот что. Идёшь к Доске Объявлений и размещаешь на ней объявление с указанием имени обидчика и вознаграждения за отмщение. И будь уверен, очень скоро накажут мерзавца! Кстати, можешь и сам, разыскивая и наказывая обидчиков других сталкеров, неплохо подзаработать. Благородное и одновременно прибыльное это дело, скажу я тебе! Такие объявления в разделе "Охота" вывешиваются.

Dialog.Title: Удобно
Dialog.Text: Ещё как! А если, например, появляется у тебя необходимость продать что-то или наоборот купить, то это в разделе Торговля находится. Подходишь к Доске, выбираешь нужную тебе вещь, смотришь, где она выложена на продажу, сколько стоит, если всё устраивает, то прямо тут же и оплачиваешь. Затем спокойно идёшь и забираешь её в том Хранилище, в котором она была выложена на продажу. Хранилища, это такие заведения в Зоне, что-то типа камер хранений. В них сталкеры свой хабар оставляют, чтобы лишний вес на себе не таскать. Ну, а если сам продать что-то решишь, то двигаешь в любое Хранилище, выкладываешь свою вещь на продажу и всё – информация о ней на всех Досках в Зоне появится. Останется только дождаться, когда кто-то её купит и забрать деньги из того же Хранилища.

Dialog.Title: Лихо!
Dialog.Text: Ха! Я же говорю, очень нужная вещь оказалась эта Доска Объявлений. Кстати, на ней сталкеры даже карту расположения всех Зон разместили! Причём с пояснениями, из какой, в какую и как быстрее в нужную Зону добраться можно. Так что, настоятельно рекомендую тебе изучить Доску Объявлений. Вон она стоит, на пироне у ограждения.

Dialog.Title: What shall I do then?
Dialog.Text: The easiest way - to throw a stone. This not only helps to detect an anomaly, but it may help find the artifact. They are the wealth of the Zone.

Dialog.Title: Artifacts?
Dialog.Text: Yup! They are. I do not even know how to say you... they looks like products of anomaly.. or something. Some say, they have incredible properties. And "the incredible properties" attracts scientists. Ttrying to "study" фкешафсеы, but judging by the non-decreasing demand for them, the study-required material are well-needed. And needance, giving rise to offer for the stalkers, making a price tag for the loot.

Dialog.Title: How do I get an artifact?
Dialog.Text: You can use a gadjet, made by... stalkers... or scientists... on both of them, named Magnetic Grip Device. Only with his help it is possible to get an artifact from the anomaly with a minimum of harm to your health.

Dialog.Title: How do I get this device?
Dialog.Text: You may call it ... "MGD" ... it's simplier. If you want to get, I have a local technician familiar to me, tell him I sent you and that you want to get the MGD, I think. if you help him he will find what to do.

Dialog.Title: Where do I find him?
Dialog.Text: Ah, yes! He locates in one of the five-story building nearby. More specifically, in one of those three, that the angle to the road, if I remember correctly.

Dialog.Title: Who's who in the Zone?
Dialog.Text: It's right that you wanna know who's your friend and who's your enemy.

Dialog.Title: Расскажи про военных и бандитов...
Dialog.Text: Тут все просто. Военные контролируют периметр и поддерживают в Любече-1 и других стратегических пунктах порядок. Ты же понимаешь, что все мы тут вне закона? Все держится на негласном уговоре, что мы тут как бы "беженцы", гражданские, а вовсе не сталкеры. Хотя кому надо - всё прекрасно понимают, просто закрывают глаза, пока мы оказываем помощь и не нарушаем порядок. А вот бандиты - эти как раз и нарушают порядок. Это беглые преступники, которые скрываются в глубине Зоны. Они беспредельничают, марадерствуют и убивают. Поэтому если военные решат, что ты с ними спелся - жди беды. Веди себя осторожно.

Dialog.Title: Расскажи про наемников...
Dialog.Text: Что тут сказать? Наемники - это либо бойцы частных охранных подразделений, типа "Вороньего леса", либо просто наемная охрана, например, бывшие менты, которую набирают ученые и прочие деятели, что правдами и неправдами выбили у властей разрешение проникнуть в Зону ради каких-то эсперементов или... по-правде говоря, по мне - так они просто лезут в Зону ради частной наживы.

Dialog.Title: Старые сталкеры не любят наемников?
Dialog.Text: Прямо в лоб вопросы задаешь? Так? Ладно... Мы шли в Зону не только за наживой. Сталкерство - это образ жизни. Зона непознана и неизведанна. Она опасна, да - но это чудо, так или иначе. Чудо природы. Наемникам на это наплевать. Они ищут только прибыли. Ты видал, во что люди, готовые на все ради наживы, превращают мир за периметром? Слышал, как корпорации вырубают леса, где местные племена жили столетиями в гармонии с природой? Зону нужно изучать - да, но не уничтожать. Что останется сталкерам, если такие люди повалят в Зону? И не удивляйся, что мы не любим наемников, а они нас...

Dialog.Title: Как наладить отношения с учеными?
Dialog.Text: Ученые? Ученые разные бывают. Но все они сходны в одном: им подавай артефакты и части мутантов для исследований... И еще они очень любят ссылаться на плохое финансирование... Если, конечно, речь идет об официальных ученых, которые командируются сюда государственными учереждениями. В общем, если решишь с ними наладить взаимопонимание - готовься стать подопытной крысой или таскать им хабар без передышки. Да, вот что еще учти: они недолюбливают барыг, потому как те требуют с них за образцы втридорога и еще больше не любят разного рода насилие. Ну, это как все неженки - интеллигенты.

Dialog.Title: Расскажи о торговцах и барыгах...
Dialog.Text: Ты с этим вопросом лучше к Плющу сходи - он тут главный дока в торговых вопросах. В двух словах? Торговцы - это, можно так сказать, официальные снабженцы военных, ученых и иногда наемников. Ну, со сталкерами они тоже торгуют - мы же, как бы считаемся "беженцами"... Да и хабар они выкупают - опять же у "беженцев", хех. Барыги? "Свободный бартер" - так любят называть себя те из них, которые как раз менее всего свободны, потому что ходят под воровскими авторитетами. Это, говоря по простому, "черный рынок" - все, что продается и покупается в обход торговцев и переправляется из Зоны в обход военных... Мелкие барыги, которые прибились к вокзалу - они в основном местные, которые все потеряли. Вот они и пытаются выживать, ведя свой маленький бизнес на том, чем торговцы брезгуют. Типа хвостов крыс... Ну и, сам понимаешь, там где деньги - там и конкуренция. Так что барыги с торговцами не слишком дружат. Впрочем, барыги между собой тоже иногда цапаются...

Dialog.Title: Tell me about the hunters.
Dialog.Text: Misha is a hunter, he knows a deal about mutants and different sorts of creatures...hunting in the Zone is not the same that outside the perimeter, for you never know who's going to become the trophy. So, hunters have created a kind of brotherhood, they respect those who know how to hold a gun, trace nutants and shoot them down.

Dialog.Title: Хм...
Dialog.Text: Проникновение в Зону незаконно, но если ты уже тут, смешался с толпой, обзавелся связями -- никто тебя не тронет, пока не полезешь обратно. Ведь ты приносишь пользу. Потенциальный, так сказать, конвейер материалов. Лабораторная крыса, на худой конец. Ступишь в аномалию -- какой-нибудь кандидатишка напишет докторскую. Вернешься с артом или с башкой мутанта -- еще лучше. Заплатят, накормят, обогреют. Молодец, неси еще.

Dialog.Title: А барыги?..
Dialog.Text: Барыги? "Свободный бартер" - так любят называть себя те из них, которые как раз менее всего свободны, потому что ходят под воровскими авторитетами. Это, говоря по простому, "черный рынок" - все, что продается и покупается в обход торговцев и переправляется из Зоны в обход военных... Мелкие барыги, которые прибились к вокзалу - они в основном местные, которые все потеряли. Вот они и пытаются выживать, ведя свой маленький бизнес на том, чем торговцы брезгуют. Типа хвостов крыс... Ну и, сам понимаешь, там где деньги - там и конкуренция. Так что барыги с торговцами не слишком дружат. Впрочем, барыги между собой тоже иногда цапаются...

Dialog.Title: Поэтому он отправился на войну?
Dialog.Text: Я подробностей не знаю. Непростая вроде то была любовь - что-то типа "единственная" и "неповторимая". Ты ведь видел какой он? Хмурый, бурчит все время под нос, необщительный. Такие и друзей с трудом заводят и влюбляются как одержимые- напридумывают себе всякого... Одиночка он. Да и умом, если честно, не блещет - образование-то у него пара курсов сельхоз-техникума, а сам он из деревни какой-то. Да еще и заикается. Видать замкнуло у него что-то в конце концов. Начал свое место в мире искать и запутался. Так и в Зоне оказался.
Hey, cit!

Dialog.Title: Yes sir! What job?
Dialog.Text: A damn anomaly ruined my walkie-talkie. I want you to visit three posts and gather information from there. Will you cope with that?

Dialog.Title: Yup.|| Make some marks on my map.
Dialog.Text: Look. Kazakov is in the 312 area. You can go left from Lenin's monument. Druz is in 312 area too, but you need to go straight forward from that monument. Kvashina is right behind old police building. Got it? So go do it!

Dialog.Title: Not interested.
Dialog.Text: So piss of.

Dialog.Title: Я подумаю.
Dialog.Text: Не тормози только. Думай свою мысль быстрее.

Dialog.Title: What job?
Dialog.Text: Good job with posts. I've got another for you. Scientists need a "Screen α" artefact badly. Drachuk said that you know where the trigger is. I told Druz to open the gates for you.

Dialog.Title: I'll try to find it.
Dialog.Text: Good luck.

Dialog.Title: No. I don't want to go to anomaly.|| Find someone else for this.
Dialog.Text: As you wish.

Dialog.Title: I've asked 'em.
Dialog.Text: Great. What do they have there?

Dialog.Title: Here the report. |Kasakov's post is ok. Druz's too. But Kvashina asked for backup. He told that there are freakin' swarm of strange mutated bastards.
Dialog.Text: Ok. Great. Not much, but it's good. Take your reward.

Dialog.Title: Take your art.
Dialog.Text: Take your cash.

Dialog.Title: Wazzzzuuuuuup!?
Dialog.Text: Freakin' joker. Now you gonna go to the chemical burial site and look for one freakin beast. Our eggheads need this creature for some tests. But be careful. It can eat you with your shit and don't even choke a bit.

Dialog.Title: Ok.
Dialog.Text: Yup. Be careful.

Dialog.Title: No more mutants!| I've told you already. No more mutants!
Dialog.Text: So piss off!

Dialog.Title: I was at the chemical burial site...
Dialog.Text: So? Tell me about it.

Dialog.Title: I found nothing there.
Dialog.Text: Not cool. Ok, take your reward.

Dialog.Title: I need a job!
Dialog.Text: Oh, it's you. I don't have anything for you right now. Come back later.

Dialog.Title: Э не, я туда не попрусь, ищи кого нить другово!
Dialog.Text: Ну и ладно

Dialog.Title: Всё понял, уже иду расставлять
Dialog.Text: бывай

Dialog.Title: I killed 5 verliocks.
Dialog.Text: Well done. I thought I'd never see you again.

Dialog.Title: What job?
Dialog.Text: My scout is lost. You need to find him and take him back to me with his report. He's in the Л10 area.

Dialog.Title: You go look for him.
Dialog.Text: Someone surely will.

Dialog.Title: Imarek refused to go back.|| He has some job to do. He gave me his report.
Dialog.Text: Oh, cool. Big task -- big money.

Dialog.Title: Really?| Is there really nothig for me to do or you just don not trust me?
Dialog.Text: Of course I trust you, but I have no reason to set you for this job, anyway I'm sure you'd cope with that. Unless...I have an idea. Kill at least 20 verliocks on the north of the swamps. Get back when you're done.

Dialog.Title: No way.| I'm here not to roll over for you. Do that yourself.
Dialog.Text: Whatever.

Dialog.Title: This is much better!
Dialog.Text: Make it hot for them!

Dialog.Title: I saw a fat mutant.|| You told me not to shoot there. And you know, I don't even thought about it. This big thing looks like a tumid boxer in rotten duds.
Dialog.Text: Damn! I knew it! It can be the Blyak. EXPERIMENTS my ass! We need to kill this bastard. Take your cash. I need to think how we'll take him out...

Dialog.Title: I'm listening.
Dialog.Text: There's a job for you.

Dialog.Title: I have a question.
Dialog.Text: What now?

Dialog.Title: We need to talk.
Dialog.Text: What now?

Dialog.Title: And where the Palace of Culture is?
Dialog.Text: Oh. Rookies. You need to exit the building, then go through the fence gate, then go left and then to the right at the first road fork. There you'll see the Palace.

Dialog.Title: What about the radio?
Dialog.Text: Radio is switched off again. So you go visit the posts. Dismissed!

Dialog.Title: I've got all reports.
Dialog.Text: Good. But give me the papers by the way.

Dialog.Title: Ok. Take it.
Dialog.Text: Good. Come back tomorrow. I'll need your help if the radios will be still out of order.

Dialog.Title: Yes?
Dialog.Text: Sergeant Drachuk trains our newbies. Let him check your abilities. Only when he consideres you to be able-bodied, go back to me.

Dialog.Title: Kvashina is working for Tatarin.
Dialog.Text: Don't panic. I know it. Kvashina is working for ME. And he gives Tatarin only what I tell him to give. So Tatarin is gonna stay at the swamp forever. And I like how it sounds.

Dialog.Title: Where I can find this art?
Dialog.Text: That's not my problem. You're the stalker here.

Dialog.Title: I have some questions...
Dialog.Text: Belay!

Dialog.Title: I have some questions...
Dialog.Text: What questions?

Dialog.Title: Speaking of the wreck of the trucks...| Sir, is it true thet you knew the trucks were coming?
Dialog.Text: Of course, they were delivering supplies. They come every third month.

Dialog.Title: There were also delivering people. The military were taking them somewhere...
Sergeant?
Dialog.Text: How did you know that?

Dialog.Title: Acid told me.
Dialog.Text: Acid damn him! What else did he tell you?

Dialog.Title: Misha the Hunter told me.
Dialog.Text: Who? As soon as I look at him...What else did that "Hunter" tell you?

Dialog.Title: From Prokhor's journal.
Dialog.Text: You're lying!

Dialog.Title: From the people who were in the trucks.
It doesn't matter. People were transfered here againsted their will. How would you explain that, sergeant?
Dialog.Text: Bug off! I don't have to explain anything! It's confidential!

Dialog.Title: *Appeal to conscience*
Dialog.Text: Well...I may have overreacted.But I have nothing to say more...It was an order. I did know about the people inside that trucks, but the only thing I can tell you, stalker, if they were in those trucks, that was only because it was ordered so. we don't discuss orders.

Dialog.Title: Where were they supposed to be taken?
Dialog.Text: Can't say. I had to see them to be boarded on copters which never appeared. Neither did the trucks. We're trying to fix the connection, report the situation, get new orders...Flying over the Zone is always risky, since the copters were used, teh people were supposed to be taken outside the territory of Liubech, deeper in the Zone and farther from the perimeter...

Dialog.Title: Seriously?
Dialog.Text: Stop talking to me like this! You wanna know where they were delivering people, I wanna know where the copters, which must have been at least three, are and what happened to the pilots. I can't order you, but I can ask you...Find them all. If you fnd the copters, you'll find the pilots. If you agree, you can leave the town past the second post. It's corporal Druz's, he'll let you out. At ease, soldier! This conversation is over.

Dialog.Title: What kind of copters are we looking for?
Dialog.Text: Old ones, from Soviet times. We know that they must have come from the north-east, but they never crossed Luibech boarder. You should search the neighbourhoods, beyond the wall.

Dialog.Title: Where were the people supposed to be taken?
Dialog.Text: Can't say. I had to see them to be boarded on copters which never appeared. Neither did the trucks. We're trying to fix the connection, report the situation, get new orders...Flying over the Zone is always risky, since the copters were used, teh people were supposed to be taken outside the territory of Liubech, deeper in the Zone and farther from the perimeter...

Dialog.Title: What kind of copters are we looking for?
Have you seen Temon?
Dialog.Text: Temon? Let me think....Temon...Oh Yes! I remember that local, he wanted to get a permission to leave the town. I told him to get the hell out till I made it hot for him. Have no idea where that rag is, and I don't give a damn.

Dialog.Title: The White took one pilot... They tortured him to death and left him in a forsaken house in Novikovo. Here are his notes, by the way.
Dialog.Text: Novikovo? That's quite far from here...We haven't had the connection with the Echo-7 base, he wrote about, for a while. We keep sending out signals but there's no answer. I can tell you the co-ordinates so that you could find it. Your task is to walk all the way to the base, figure out what happened there and get back here.

Dialog.Title: Good luck with that.
Dialog.Text: Luck is not enough.

Dialog.Title: Tell me mote about that base.
Dialog.Text: The connection with the base has been lost for a long time, stalker. We keep sending out signals but there's no answer. I can tell you the co-ordinates but you gotta walk all the way to the base, figure out what happened and get back here.

Dialog.Title: Good Luck with that.
Dialog.Text: I wish luck could help.

Dialog.Title: All pilotes are dead.
Dialog.Text: ...I expected that.

Dialog.Title: I'm sorry...
Dialog.Text: Well done. At ease, soldier.

Dialog.Title: Did you manage to fix the connection?
Dialog.Text: It was in vain. The situation is tough, stalker, and I've gotta take the right decisions. To be frank, I don't know anybody who could cope with that better than you, you proved you're a brave soldier and I trust you. So get back here when you figure out more about the base.

Dialog.Title: Where were the people supposed to be taken?
Dialog.Text: According to one pilot's notes, they were supposed to be delivered at the secret base called Echo-7. However, I have no idea what for, that's what the High Command is in charge of...I do hope for the best, but won't be surprised if you mouse out something very unpleasant.

Dialog.Title: What else can I do to help?
Dialog.Text: All means of communication are damaged, the connection with the command staff is lost and the connection with inner posts is very unstable. I won't lie to you stalker...things are not so good. We keep losing people, the equipment isn't working properly. Some of my soldiers are even ready to use artifacts, although they used to be against it. If you just could get us those artifacts, that would be of great help.

Dialog.Title: What artifacts exactly?
Dialog.Text: Here's the list: one "Screen α" , four "Rubber α", ten "Mirage" artifacts.

Dialog.Title: Mirage?
Dialog.Text: Yes. The locals are ready to exchange rounds for this artifact, but I wanna offer them to join our troops.

Dialog.Title: I brought the arts.
Dialog.Text: Which exactly?

Dialog.Title: Gave you all.
Dialog.Text: I've seen stalkers like you. Brave and strong. I remember one who used to help us with radio and blot mutants out one after another. The old fool went on expedition led by Simonov. He followed those freaks to Visuvius. Dunno where he's now.

Dialog.Title: The White want you to leave the Zone.
Dialog.Text: Are you one of 'em now? Listen to me, stalker, I do appreciate what you've done for us, but keep your religious views down, elsewise I'll kick you out of the Zone forever.

Dialog.Title: I just told you what they'd told me.
Dialog.Text: I know what on their minds. They should be transfered to quarantine.

Dialog.Title: Come to senses! Locals have practically won the battle.
Dialog.Text: I'm warning you. Say it again and I'll kick you out of the town.

Dialog.Title: I am the voice of the Lord!
Pardon me, sir. I don't know what has come upon me...couldn't think straight
Dialog.Text: Oh..."white brother", it's you. This time I forgive you. We need help and you used to help us a lot until the White brainwashed you. Don't listen to them, soldier. They don't atack litteraly, they f*ck your mind. Don't let 'em carry you away. Got it?

Dialog.Title: Bad news, sergeant... Mutants attacked the Echo-7 base. There isn't a soul there. People must have left the place.
Dialog.Text: Damn it! Even so, I'm not surprised...It's no use waiting for reinforcemet......We stuck here, stalker...do you understand? What else did you find out?

Dialog.Title: *Tell about experiments*| Colonel Nekiforov knew and accepted expitements held in the Zone. They transfered people here from the "Big Land" and took them to New land., the Echo-7 provided security and trasportation.
*Hold your toungue*| That's all.
Dialog.Text: You did well and helped us a lot. At ease, soldier!

Dialog.Title: Sir?
Dialog.Text: Have you completely lost your mind? You don't talk about such stuff on every corner!...Alright, listen, I suspected something was going on...but I have to believe in system, this is my duty. The only advice I can give you - head for New Land and find the answers. We don't know what's really going on there yet. Don't jump to conclusions.

Dialog.Title: Isn't it a military secret?
Dialog.Text: The situation is tough, stalker, and I've gotta take the right decisions. To be frank, I don't know anybody who could cope with that better than you, you proved you're a brave soldier and I trust you. So, get back here when you figure out more about the base.

Dialog.Title: But isn't it a military secret?

Bad news...I found secret laboratories where not only animals, but also people were used as guinea pigs in medical experiments. After they mutated...they managed to get out of their cages...and killed almost all the workers...Only one "lab rat" survived and I have no idea where it is now.
Dialog.Text: Too bad....I've never heard of this crap before, stalker! But what can I do? People we took to the Zone must be all dead by now. That survivor you're talking about won't last too...I don't want to have anything to do with it anymore...If what you're saying is true...I will resign as soon as we provide security in Liubech. Are you with us, soldier?

Dialog.Title: Yes sir!
Dialog.Text: Excellent! Let's win this town back!

Dialog.Title: No.
Dialog.Text: Well, I don't blame you, stalker. I understand...Even if I didn't know about all those horrible things they were doing, I was still helping them.

Dialog.Title: *Show threatening letter*|Someone keeps sending me threatening letters. May I count on your help?
Dialog.Text: No. Move on. Don't waste my time.

Dialog.Title: *Show threatening letters*|Someone keeps sending me threatening letters. May I count on your help?
Dialog.Text: Why do you think you can possibly feel safe here? The Zone is vicious you kill if you wanna live... Wait a minute...I think I know who might be sending those letters - that man with a barrett who helped us. What a toad! Didn't expect such set-up from him...Alright, let see what I can do. I'll inform all the posts, if that crook shows up, we'll catch him.

Dialog.Title: Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Ух, ты! Спасибо тебе за весточку от друга, сталкер! Если увидишь Артура, то и от меня непременно поздравь его с Новым Годом! И тебя, сталкер, я тоже поздравляю с Новым Годом! Держи небольшой презент от меня.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Пожалуйста! Слушай, а отгадай загадку! Если отгадаешь, то достанется тебе ещё небольшой приз. Короче, слушай сюда. Вот скажи мне боец, у какого оружия есть и число, и года?

Dialog.Title: Автомат
Dialog.Text: Эх... Не угадал! Это пистолет! "Пи" - число Пи. И "столет" - сто лет! Число и года! Ха, ха! Ну, бывай!

Dialog.Title: Ружьё
Dialog.Text: Эх... Не угадал! Это пистолет! "Пи" - число Пи. И "столет" - сто лет! Число и года! Ха, ха! Ладно, бывай!

Dialog.Title: Пулемёт
Dialog.Text: Эх... Не угадал! Это пистолет! "Пи" - число Пи. И "столет" - сто лет! Число и года! Ха, ха! Ладно, бывай!

Dialog.Title: Пистолет
Dialog.Text: Ты глянь! Сообразительный! Конечно! "Пи" - число Пи, "столет" - сто лет! Число и года! Ха, ха! Вот тебе подарочек - фейерверк! Ну, с Новым Годом!

Dialog.Title: РПГ
Dialog.Text: Эх... Не угадал! Это пистолет! "Пи" - число Пи. И "столет" - сто лет! Число и года! Ха, ха! Ну, бывай!

Dialog.Title: Sir! Ready to answer your question, Sir!
Dialog.Text: At ease! Here's what we're gonna do. I ask one question, you give me one answer, Is that clear, soldier?

Dialog.Title: Yes sir!
Dialog.Text: There's a movie called "They Fought for Their Country" directed by Sergei Bondarchuk and starring Vasily Shukshin. Here is the qusetion, who was the author of the book the movie is based on?

Dialog.Title: Lev Gumilev!
Dialog.Text: Say again? Think better, soldier!

Dialog.Title: Andrey Platonov!
Dialog.Text: Wrong answer, soldier! Drop down and gimme!

Dialog.Title: Mikhail Sholokhov!
Dialog.Text: That's right! Great writer who wrote great books. Well done!

Dialog.Title: My mistake, sergeant! Let me try again.
What now?
Dialog.Text: Well, go to another sergeant, named Drachuk. You might know him already. He must have couple of questions for you.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I have no intention to talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Happy Defender of the Fatherland Day!
Dialog.Text: You too, stalker. Listen, since you're in that good mood, do me a favor.

Dialog.Title: What favor?
Dialog.Text: A colonel from Tunguska and I decided to honor the memory of the deceased. Their graves are on Vesuvius. I need your help to clean up the graves and clear the cemetery off the mutants. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Sorry, I don't have time for this.
I'll help you.
Dialog.Text: Very well! First of all, you have to kill sages that live in the cemetery and collect their medallions, it's on Vesuvius, square И8. Then, you need to get some flowers, I think simple daisies will do. When you're done, get all to Docent Krasnov, he'll be at scientists' camp in square 38. So, what are you waiting for?

Dialog.Title: I need protection.
Dialog.Text: You came to the right place!

Dialog.Title: Woolf threatens me.
Dialog.Text: Belay! Backward march! Don't want to hear anything about Woolf.

Dialog.Title: Woolf threatens me.
Dialog.Text: We must have brought this freak to justice long ago! Now we have a good reason to. If anything happens to you, he'll lose his job. Tell him so.

Dialog.Title: Happy Holidays, sir!
Dialog.Text: You too stalker...Although you ain't in the army. You stalkers are brave, there're no doubts about that, but undisciplined. Listen, actually I want you to do me a favor. Don't know why, but this day reminds me of my childhood. As a child I used to have a collection of toy soldiers...Know what would be just great? If I could get such toys here now. What if you help me to find those? I'll give you a recommendation for a holiday patch in return.

Dialog.Title: Here's one in parade uniform...
Dialog.Text: This one is so bright! Where did you get it from? Thanks!

Dialog.Title: You got it. I'll help you.
Here's one in khaki uniform.
Dialog.Text: Looks like me when I was much younger...Thank you, stalker. Here's your recommendation.

Dialog.Title: Here's one in camouflage gear.
Dialog.Text: Not bad...although the camouflage doesn't look as it should...

Dialog.Title: Does this collection seem to be good enough for you, sir?
Dialog.Text: It's fine, too small, but fine. Thank you for your help. Here's your recommendation.

Dialog.Title: I found a soldier...
Dialog.Text: Hum...this one is too plain and shabby...It would look much better with a new paint and alongside a couple of other statuettes.

Dialog.Title: Speaking of the soldiers...
Dialog.Text: What have you got there?

Dialog.Title: I'd want to help, but I'm really tied up at the moment.
I'll see what I can do...
I met Lieutenant Still.
Dialog.Text: What? Where did you meet?

Dialog.Title: What did he say?
Dialog.Text: Does it mean they'll finally send us reinforcements? Did you speak to him?

Dialog.Title: He asked about the present situation.
Dialog.Text: And what did you tell him?

Dialog.Title: What could I have said?
Dialog.Text: Well...just don't talk too much. He knows already everything he must know...and he doesn't have to know about such stuff as labs full of mutants...let sleeping dogs lie..
