Dialog.Title: The Zone is the Zone. There's nothing more to add.
Dialog.Text: You're right.

Dialog.Title: Встретил тут лейтенанта Мирного...
Dialog.Text: Кого? Ну и что? Тебя это не касается.
Hello, stalker, what do you need?

Dialog.Title: Dibenko sent me.|| I need a report about the situation.
Dialog.Text: Why the sergeant sends citizens here? I have no right to share information with a stranger.

Dialog.Title: Well, no problem. I'll tell him|| that his soldier does not know anything, did not see anything, because he is sleeping under the tree.
Dialog.Text: Hey! Wait a minute. Alright. Tell the sergeant, that all is quiet in our square. No incidents.

Dialog.Title: Good luck.
Dialog.Text: Yeah. Do not stumble on your way back.

Dialog.Title: I have a mail from the Courier.
Dialog.Text: Great. Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: I brought the vacuum tube.
Dialog.Text: Well, it's about time. Where is it?

Dialog.Title: I'm here to take the vacuum tube.
Dialog.Text: Okay. The radio broke again. You'll find this rubbish near the watchtower, on the table. When you'll visit all posts, go to Basmach, he will give you new tubes. Bring me a new one.

Dialog.Title: Hey. I am from Dibenko.|| I need a report about the situation.
Dialog.Text: No news here. As they say, it's too quiet.

Dialog.Title: This is good, right?
Dialog.Text: Well, guess so...

Dialog.Title: I need out.
Dialog.Text: The Courier said, you are allowed to pass. But if you want to walk out, you need to prove that you are not poor and can survive in the Zone. Do you have 500 rubles at least?

Dialog.Title: I need to leave the city.
Dialog.Text: You can't. Only the Courier's people are allowed to pass through these gates. And I don't remember you among his workers.

Dialog.Title: I'm working for the Courier.
Dialog.Text: If so, you need to work harder. He tells me himself, who can pass and who can not. And he never mentioned you.

Dialog.Title: I'm here to find Temon.
Dialog.Text: Ah, that creepy scary imbecile. He's working for Courier now. I haven't seen him for a while. I think he got killed somewhere.

Dialog.Title: Scary creepy imbecile.|| Why do you call him like that?
Dialog.Text: Ah, he was very nervous. I told him, that I can let him out of the city only if he works for the Courier. He yelled at me. Tryed to threaten me. Well, I kicked his ass. Then he got the Courier's job and left. Imbecile.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I'm listening.

Dialog.Title: Good day. I'm from Dibenko.|| I need a report about the situation.
Dialog.Text: Hey. Of course. Everything is fine here. But I thought I saw a bear behind the gate. I did not check. The orders were to observe only.

Dialog.Title: Sorry, my mistake.|| You, soldiers, all look alike.
Dialog.Text: You little...! Get out of here!

Dialog.Title: I'm from the Courier.|| He asked me deliver the package to you.
Dialog.Text: Just in time, give it here.

Dialog.Title: Good luck.
Dialog.Text: Take care.

Dialog.Title: I brought the vacuum tube.
Dialog.Text: That's it. Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: I'm here to take the vacuum tube.
Dialog.Text: The radio is on the table. Go there and take it. When you visited all posts, find Basmach, he will give you new tubes. I need one set of them.

Dialog.Title: Good day. I'm from Dibenko.|| I need a report about the situation.
Dialog.Text: Nothing to report. We saw and heard no one. Can't say we miss them, but it's almost boring.

Dialog.Title: I need out.
Dialog.Text: I have an order from Dibenko. You can pass. Don't die out there.

Dialog.Title: I need out.
Dialog.Text: No way. We neither let in nor let out. We secure this area. Too many mutants lately. To pass you'll need a special permission from sergeant Dibenko.

Dialog.Title: Maybe we can find a solution?
Dialog.Text: Leave before I'd kick your ass outta here.

Dialog.Title: Where is he?
Dialog.Text: Listen, he won't even listen to you if Sergeant Drachuk hasn't trained you yet. You're stalker, right? You should see the sergeants, their temporary stuff is at the militia station. They always need people to fight the mutants. They'll give you a mission or two ans this is the right thing to start with if you want to get the permission to leave the town.

Dialog.Title: What's new?
Dialog.Text: Nothing.

Dialog.Title: All clear?
Dialog.Text: What do you want?

Dialog.Title: I've got questions about the Zone.
Dialog.Text: I'm busy now.

Dialog.Title: What is the Zone?
Dialog.Text: I said I'm busy! Are you deaf or dumb?

Dialog.Title: Have you herad about crash on the bridge?
How can I get away from the Zone?
How did you get in here?
Tell me about the Culture Center
You don't seem busy.
Dialog.Text: That's it! Clear the way.

Dialog.Title: Know the joke about the quard and a stalker?
Are you on duty when sleeping?
Oh..And what if comes to the push?
Why so unfriendly?
Dialog.Text: What are you snooping around here? I'm on duty! Pprotecting the gates and radio equipment.

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: Clear the way or I'll clean your clock!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello, stalker, now tell why you came here.

Dialog.Title: I am from Dibenko.|Good day. I need a report for Sgt. Dibenko. I am from him.
Dialog.Text: Good, good. If you're from Dibenko, then listen. Tell this jerk, that if more supplies will not be sent here, we shall all be at least six feet under.

Dialog.Title: Why? It seems quiet to me.
Dialog.Text: It is now quiet, that's true. But I saw a herd of mutants at night. They didn't attack yet, but I don't know how much time we have. Maybe they're still decide with what sauce we would better be as a supper.

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: Aha. And… Well… You may skip the "jerk" part... That's a minor, unimportant detail.

Dialog.Title: Blacksmith said you'll give me ammo.
Dialog.Text: Yes, I still don't have time to shoot these creatures. Hey, leave it to me, and, in return, I'll tell where you can find even more ammo. Blacksmith himself takes the ammo there.

Dialog.Title: Кузнец сказал у тебя патроны забрать
Dialog.Text: Так ты уже и без них справился. Кузнец результатом доволен, а в чьем кармане патроны лежат ему и дела нет. Так что проходи давай, не толпись.

Dialog.Title: I brought the vacuum tube.
Dialog.Text: Give it to me. We have no communication here. It's not right at all.

Dialog.Title: Well... Tell me.|| I hope there is more than one pack!
Dialog.Text: The abandon base, to there Blacksmith had sent you for sure, was the military base for some time. There are lot of supplies left. Blacksmith tells that there is nothing there. But he himself sold a lot of goods from this base.

Dialog.Title: Got it. I'll search more closely.
You were right, I found the ammo.
Dialog.Text: See, we both win. Listen, I've been ordered to shoot these dogs and send samples to our scientists. But they need large bitches, you know, not these little puppies which runs around the neighborhood. I've seen a couple of big ones in the yard. We need to pass the samples to the doctor Zinoviev. He works in the old police building. Can you do it?

Dialog.Title: I'm here to take the vacuum tube.
Dialog.Text: It's about time.The radio is on the table, next to yonder fellow, which stands against the wall. Take the tube. When you'll visit all posts, go to Basmach, he will change broken tubes for new ones. Don't forget to bring me a new tube. Do not install it by yourself, you need a special skill here.

Dialog.Title: Нет новых заказов от ученых?
Dialog.Text: Кстати, хорошо, что ты тут. Зиновьев нахваливал твои образцы, я аж обзавидовался. Давай сделаем так. Ты сейчас еще крупных псин настреляешь. Они -- псины -- в тот двор часто захаживают. Но ухи мне отдашь. А уже я отнесу их Зиновьеву. Идет? Я тебе за них заплачу, монет 300 за две штуки

Dialog.Title: Нет.| Значит я буду собак отстреливать, а Зиновьев тебя похвалит? Нет уж.
Dialog.Text: Ну, как хочешь. Я бы тебе хорошо заплатил.

Dialog.Title: Here are dog ears.
Dialog.Text: Great! Give them to me.

Dialog.Title: Take them.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, pal. Here is your money.

Dialog.Title: You may take the ammo back.|Sorry, if I offended you. Here, take the ammo back.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, buddy! Now I'll tell you a secret as promised. The abandon base, to there Blacksmith had sent you for sure, was the military base for some time. There are lot of supplies left. Blacksmith tells that there is nothing there. But he himself sold a lot of goods from this base.

Dialog.Title: I'm from Dibenko.|I need a field report for Sgt. Dibenko. I am from him.
Dialog.Text: Somehow we still hold it. So far so good. As long as they do not forget about supplies.

Dialog.Title: Tatar sent me.
Dialog.Text: Here are new reports. It's a military secret, for god's sake, so keep it quiet.

Dialog.Title: I need out.
Dialog.Text: You helped Sanek the Skilled... I can let you pass, but the mutants will eat you in five meters behind these gates. You'll be dead and be free and I'll face the grand long paper work. There will be many explanations, apologies, the tribunal maybe... You know. But, let's say, 500 rubles partly cover these risks.

Dialog.Title: I need to leave the city.
Dialog.Text: Forget about it. Behind these gates there are more beasts than you can count... Only loonies go there: scientists, mercenaries, illegal stalkers, bandits... Dibenko will tear my head off, if I let you through.

Dialog.Title: Dibenko let me...
Dialog.Text: Yes? I didn't hear anything about it. But we have serious radio problems here. So maybe he send orders to another post.

Dialog.Title: Ok...
Dialog.Text: Be smart, stalker. Believe me, you don't want to go there.

Dialog.Title: I need to leave the city...
Dialog.Text: I heard you helped Sanek the Skilled... Look, I can let you through, but the mutants will eat you in five meters behind these gates. You'll be dead and be free and I'll face the grand long paper work. There will be many explanations, apologies, the tribunal maybe... You know. But, let's say, 700 rubles partly cover these risks.

Dialog.Title: 700 rubles? No problem.
Dialog.Text: You need a legend... I heard rumors that the stadium is noisy lately. You check it and tell me what is happening there. If someone asked -- I hired you for the job.

Dialog.Title: I'll be back later.
Dialog.Text: Okay, but the gates stay closed.

Dialog.Title: There is huge number of dogs near the stadium.
Dialog.Text: Not good. It's fine for your kind though. More dog heads to loot. I've heard other guards saw the Trapper behind the gate. It's a famous dog specialist, but it seems his knowledge doesn't help him anymore... Why is so many of these creatures around lately? There is no end to them. Inside, outside and now the stadium... Soon they will eat us all. And will not choke!

Dialog.Title: Is there other work for me?
Dialog.Text: There is one work, for a steep stalker like you. They saw a wild boar outside the city, nearby. They say, it heading to the city. Walk around, find this pig and feed it with bullets.

Dialog.Title: Consider his head already on a dish.
Dialog.Text: Stop joking around. There is one crazy cook near Lubech... We call him "Gourmet", because he loves mutants and knows how to cook them. But I don't understand such perversions.

Dialog.Title: I need out.
Dialog.Text: You may pass... But don't tell anyone that I've let you.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello, stalker. Do you need something?

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a job.
Dialog.Text: There is one task. We need samples for research. There are mutants in the laboratory, which we called "grey spiders" due to changes of human nature made to them. Someone should come down to the lab and take samples of their legs. We want to compare them with spiders that live in forests and swamps and to highlight the changes. But the lab now is in chaos. In addition to spiders, there are many different evil things, I do not know how they got there... So, I recommend a well-prepared group. We don't need new deaths on our conscience.

Dialog.Title: I'll return with the legs.
Dialog.Text: Excellent. I wait here.

Dialog.Title: No. Not interested.
Dialog.Text: Well, okay. We'll find someone else.

Dialog.Title: I brought spider's legs.
Dialog.Text: Nice timing. We wait appropriate samples for a long time now. Here is for your efforts.

Dialog.Title: Any tasks? I'm sure spiders are miss me.
Dialog.Text: There is a task. To move the science as they say. We all appreciate your work. It's obviously, you are pro in legs cutting. But this task is much more difficult. We want you to bring legs of spiders from different places. Can you do it?

Dialog.Title: I'll bring them.
Dialog.Text: I am waiting.

Dialog.Title: No, I need to do something else.
Dialog.Text: Too bad.

Dialog.Title: I brought you legs.
Dialog.Text: What legs?

Dialog.Title: I need more work.
Dialog.Text: Good. Now we need claws of the young bear for the important research. And we need at least a couple of intacted ones as there are several different stages of the mutation in them. Are you in?

Dialog.Title: Ok.
Dialog.Text: You can't kill a bear by yourself, so seek for companions first.

Dialog.Title: No way!|No way... flank your bear. Try to kill this giant on your own!
Dialog.Text: As you wish.

Dialog.Title: Here, I brought you claws. ||It was really fascinating. Especially when I nearly had my ass bitten off. Anyway, take your claws and research them as much as you want.
Dialog.Text: You can't imagine, what a great contribution to science you've done! Here is your reward, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Is there any more work?|| Can't sleep so want to kill something, tear it apart and bring these slimy parts to you. Again.
Dialog.Text: I have to disappoint you. We don't need any parts now. You should visit a place -- the chemical waste dump at Н14. There should be our collegue, doctor Voronin, nearby. Talk to him and ask about the progress in his assignment. Then come back here.

Dialog.Title: I could use a good walk.
Dialog.Text: Excellent.

Dialog.Title: It's a long road. Later.
Dialog.Text: As you wish.

Dialog.Title: It was a damn hard walk.|| Me and Voronin were nearly killed. I helped him to repel the attack. He said, that he not finished his work yet and he will return only by tomorrow.
Dialog.Text: Thank you. Tomorrow then. OK, let's wait.

Dialog.Title: Is there any other work?
Dialog.Text: We have another one, quite hard, but I think you can do it. We will give a special device to you. It is working automatically, so don't touch it or you'll break it. This device registrate special energetic waves, which come from the mutants in their moment of death. You need to kill the following monsters: a spider, a dog, a boar, a rat, a bear, a verlioka and a blyak. So... will you agree? The reward will be worthy, of course!

Dialog.Title: No, I won't do it!|You want to kill me or what? No, I won't take this job!
Dialog.Text: As you wish.

Dialog.Title: OK. Give me the device.|I love to kill mutants, of course. Give me the device.
Dialog.Text: Here.

Dialog.Title: I've had enough of those mutants.
Dialog.Text: Good job! Your reward is right here.

Dialog.Title: I brought 15 spider's legs from the Courier.
Dialog.Text: Excellent.
Yes?

Dialog.Title: Fine by me.
Dialog.Text: That's good.

Dialog.Title: I need some more.
Dialog.Text: Sorry, low budget.

Dialog.Title: Is there any work?
Dialog.Text: Unfortunately, we don't have any more tasks for you. Maybe later. We wait for a money receipt from our financing source. There will be more tasks after that. You've proofed yourself well.

Dialog.Title: So, when?
Dialog.Text: They promised next month. But you know our politicians.

Dialog.Title: I'm in!
Dialog.Text: Wait... Sorry, this is a mistake. Buch has promised me to bring them already. I absolutely forgot about it. So... We don't need so much claws at once, so settle this matter yourself. Or wait until we shall need them again.

Dialog.Title: I gave them to you already.
Dialog.Text: Yes, right. Good work.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello, stalker!

Dialog.Title: Я от Эйзенштейна.
Dialog.Text: Отлично. Спасибо за помощь. Передай ему, что все в порядке. Вернусь завтра, когда тут закончу.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello, stalker. What do you want?

Dialog.Title: I'm from Dibenko.|Sergeant Dibenko sent me to bring you back.
Dialog.Text: I'm not going anywhere, I have a lot of work. I need samples of spiders cocoons, but I hate these things. Can you help me?

Dialog.Title: No problem. I like to shoot spiders.
Dialog.Text: That's good!

Dialog.Title: Here's your samples.
Dialog.Text: You're back? I thought you dead for sure... Just kidding, let's see the samples. Here, I wrote this report for Dibenko. Here is the information about the work done. Tell him, that I'll be back in a couple of days. And one more thing... Do not tell him that you helped me get the cocoons. Ok?

Dialog.Title: Hi. I have the mail for you.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, I've been waiting for this.

Dialog.Title: No.
Dialog.Text: Well, if so, I can't give you the report for Dibenko.

Dialog.Title: I don't need them.
Dialog.Text: Goodbye.

Dialog.Title: Where are the spiders?
Dialog.Text: Not far, in the forest. The square M8. To the north from here, you'll see. Spiders females live there. They guard their laying, but you have to collect 10 spider cocoons.

Dialog.Title: I'm from Dibenko.|Sergeant Dibenko sent me to bring you back.
Dialog.Text: Here, I wrote this report for Dibenko. Here is the information about the work done. Tell him, that I'll be back in a couple of days. And one more thing... Do not tell him that you helped me get the cocoons. Ok?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hi there, stalker! Call me Courier. Do you need a job?

Dialog.Title: What kind of job do you offer?
Dialog.Text: Here's an easy task for you. Deliver this package to the post 2.

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: Don't be long.

Dialog.Title: I've already done the job.
Dialog.Text: Could you remind me what job exactly you did?

Dialog.Title: Is there a mission for me?
Dialog.Text: Sure! Take the vacuum tubes out on each posts and bring 'em to Basmach. He promised to give new tubes in exchange for the old ones. Be quick.

Dialog.Title: No, thanks. I'm not gonna run back and forth like one of your delivery boys.
New tubes are delivered.
Dialog.Text: Well done. Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: I need a job badly.
Dialog.Text: Here's a mission for you. Doctor Eizeinshtein is waiting for 15 spider legs. I did sent 'em with a courier, but he got mugged half way through. If you find 15 legs more and deliver them to the Doc, he'll reward you. The way will take you a good deal of time, the lab is outside the town, in square М12. Kazakov will let you pass through the gates.

Dialog.Title: No thanks.
Dialog.Text: As you wish.

Dialog.Title: You got it.
Dialog.Text: Deal.

Dialog.Title: I do need a job.
Dialog.Text: Here's a mission for you.. I have a package for a guy named Imarek, the problem is noone knows where he is. Ask stalkers about him, somebody must have seen they guy.

Dialog.Title: No way!|I'm not gonna waste my time searching for that guy, the Zone's big, you know. Find him yourself.
Dialog.Text: Up to you.

Dialog.Title: Deal, I will find him. Where's the package?
Dialog.Text: Here it is.

Dialog.Title: I've delivered the package.
Dialog.Text: Great! Would you like to take your reward now or later?

Dialog.Title: Do I look like a delivery boy?
Dialog.Text: You don't. Listen, man, if you don't wanna help, I won't insist. I'll ask somebody else, there're lots of those who're ready to cooperate. I would be happy to deal with everything myself, without bothering others, but I'm run out of the rounds. .

Dialog.Title: Here, take these PM rounds.
Dialog.Text: Thanks bro!

Dialog.Title: I delivered the package to the post 2.
Dialog.Text: Oh, right. Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: How's the connection working? Do you need new tubes again?
Dialog.Text: Yea...Go and inspect each post, take away the vacuum tubes and hand 'em to Basmach, he promised to give new tubes in exchange for the old ones.

Dialog.Title: I've seen a very strange shit recently in the new district...lots of dead mutants placed in a kind of ritual circle.
Dialog.Text: Are you serious, man? I should tell my people to stay away from that place...

Dialog.Title: Kazakov doesn't let anyone in or out for free.
Dialog.Text: You're right. I clean forgot to tell you that. The military are facing hard times so it's vital to share with 'em. If you have business in the Zone, be ready to pay taxes, this is the way the things are done. Liubech is under military control so you always kinda feel their presence. Pay for the permission to pass through the gate yourself, I'll return the expenses later when you're back..and..hrmph...IF you're back.

Dialog.Title: Have you seen Temon?
Dialog.Text: I remember him. Quite a nervous but responsible guy. I gave him several tasks. The last mission I gave him was to deliver a letter...but he never came back. Why are you asking?

Dialog.Title: No reason...
Dialog.Text: All my guys pass through the Kazakov's gates so Kazavov must be the last person who saw Temon. I do wanna know what became of him myself, he hasn't been seen or heard of for days.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a master generator.
Dialog.Text: We used to have an extra one which we send to Nicheporenko so that he could fix the connection. Unfortunately, our courier was mugged by the white freaks. They took all he had on him including the generator and.. his life.

Dialog.Title: I see..So I gotta find the white freaks then..
Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: There's a letter for you.

Dialog.Title: Who is it from?
Dialog.Text: One of the guys working on me gave me this. He said an old man had asked him to hand the letter to you. That's all I know. Take the letter.

Dialog.Title: Old man? How did he look like?
Dialog.Text: The courier didn't memorize him, all stalkers seem to be alike, you know. However, he did remember that the man had a barrett, that caught his eye.

Dialog.Title: Any news?
Dialog.Text: Here's a letter for you.

Dialog.Title: Again?
Dialog.Text: Check this out "I thought I was pretty clear last time. You must be really freaking stupid if you're chasing me. Don't stand on my way! You didn't let me to kill Mitya and I lost money! Beware, stalker! I'm coming for you!" Sign: G.O.B.

Dialog.Title: Oh man!
Dialog.Text: You seem to be having a "secret admirer"...Listen, if you're worried, find people who can help you deal with it. There're people you helped, I'm sure. Turn to them, they'll return you a favor.

Dialog.Title: Who should I ask for help?
Dialog.Text: You're in a better position to judge who your friends are. I do have a name in my mind...It's sergeant Dibenko. He's a retired colonel and a nice man. You must have heard of him. Don't know where he's now but I heard he'd gone to Tunguska. You may try turning to the white as well. Although, I think they're freaks, their mentor Mikhail seems to be smart enough.

Dialog.Title: What's up?
Dialog.Text: Here's a letter for you.

Dialog.Title: Again?
Dialog.Text: I'm amazed myself. Check it out "I gotta admit it, stalker. You won...I'm fed up and it's time for me to retreat. Don't try to find me. I gave up. No more death. I did sell the barrett...if you ever find it, take care of it, it's a nice gun and it did serve me well..." Look, this time the sign is G.O, so "B" must have stood for "Barrett". You must be happy, stalker, it seems we're not to hear about that crazy man ever again...

Dialog.Title: Yea..seems so
Dialog.Text: I wish I could have his barrett.

Dialog.Title: Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Ха! Помнит Артур своих корешей! Ну, ты его от меня тоже поздравь с Новым Годом! Благодарю за весточку от кореша, сталкер! А вот и тебе небольшой подарочек.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо
Dialog.Text: Слушай, сталкер, а отгадай загадку! Был у меня такой случай... Однажды сталкер, стоявший всю ночь в карауле, с самого утра подошёл к своему старшему и рассказал, что во сне этой ночью он видел, как бандиты готовятся сегодня вечером атаковать их лагерь с восточной стороны. Старший, хотя и не верил в вещие сны, всё же усилил оборону лагеря. Вечером бандиты и в самом деле напали, причём именно в том месте, о котором говорил сталкер. Благодаря усилению защиты атака была с отбита. После боя старший сначала поблагодарил караульного за предупреждение, но потом сразу же приказал его оштрафовать. За что?

Dialog.Title: От солдата перегаром несло
Dialog.Text: Не... Караульный не имеет права спать! Что если бандиты напали бы именно в ту ночь, когда ему снился сон!? Всех бы порешили! Такие дела! Ладно, бывай! До встречи!

Dialog.Title: Он не стрелял по бандитам
Dialog.Text: Не... Караульный не имеет права спать! Что если бандиты напали бы именно в ту ночь, когда ему снился сон!? Всех бы порешили! Такие дела! Ладно, бывай! До встречи!

Dialog.Title: Он в бандитов не стрелял
Dialog.Text: Не... Караульный не имеет права спать! Что если бандиты напали бы именно в ту ночь, когда ему снился сон!? Всех бы порешили! Такие дела! Ладно, бывай! До встречи!

Dialog.Title: У него мухоморы нашли
Dialog.Text: Причём тут мухоморы? Не... Караульный не имеет права спать! Что если бандиты напали бы именно в ту ночь, когда ему снился сон!? Всех бы порешили! Такие дела! Ладно, бывай! До встречи!

Dialog.Title: У него мухоморы нашли
Dialog.Text: Причём тут мухоморы? Не... Караульный не имеет права спать! Что если бандиты напали бы именно в ту ночь, когда ему снился сон!? Всех бы порешили! Такие дела! Ладно, бывай! До встречи!

Dialog.Title: Курил на посту
Dialog.Text: Не... Караульный не имеет права спать! Что если бандиты напали бы именно в ту ночь, когда ему снился сон!? Всех бы порешили! Такие дела! Ладно, бывай! До встречи!

Dialog.Title: Он не должен был спать
Dialog.Text: Всё верно! Караульный не имеет права спать! Что если бандиты напали бы именно в ту ночь, когда ему снился сон!? Всех бы порешили! Держи подарочек!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: С праздником!
Dialog.Text: Ты на солнышке перегрелся? 23 февраля уже давно отметили! Тут другой праздник на носу. Кстати! У меня срочная посылка, надо успеть до 8 марта доставить ее

Dialog.Title: I'll try to make it (in 40 mins).
Dialog.Text: You'll find Zinaida inside the airport on New Landa, she's a dispatcher there. Off you go! Quick!

Dialog.Title: I didn't manage to deliver the package to Vitya.
Dialog.Text: Why are you so slow?

Dialog.Title: I'd try again.
Dialog.Text: Anyway, there're lots of stuff waiting for being delivered. Try to make it this time.

Dialog.Title: There's something that needs to be delivered outside the perimeter.
Dialog.Text: My people don't usually spend much time outside the perimeter. But if you pay well, I'll take care of everything.

Dialog.Title: Сколько?
Dialog.Text: Десять тысяч мне. Десять курьеру. И еще тридцать на взятки.

Dialog.Title: I don't have that much.
Dialog.Text: Get away, then.

Dialog.Title: Here you go.
Dialog.Text: Great. Here's the deal...the courier gets to the nearest big town, finds a computer with an Internet access, send an email to an English man, waits for an answer and deliver it to us, right?

Dialog.Title: That's right.
Dialog.Text: It'll take a while. No less than two days.

Dialog.Title: How did the delivery go?
Dialog.Text: The courier hasn't returned yet! I'm really worried, what if he got into trouble? Listen, could you go and check what has heppened? He was planning to go through the Airport along the road from the east.

Dialog.Title: Вникаю, может и для меня работа есть?
Dialog.Text: Кто же не знает нашу удивительную диспетчершу!

Dialog.Title: Кузнец просил поговорить с тобой.
Dialog.Text: Да-да. Насчет работы? Так ты и так уже на меня работаешь. Если тебе это так важно - считай, что ты со мной уже поговорил.

Dialog.Title: Встретил тут лейтенанта Мирного...
Dialog.Text: Слышал, нормальный мужик. Больше ничего сказать не могу.

Dialog.Title: И это все?
Dialog.Text: Хотя знаешь... ТЕБЕ я кое-что скажу. Ты думаешь, командование наших бойцов сюда нагнало порядок поддерживать, отстоять Любеч у мутантов? Отчасти оно так, конечно. Кое-кто, даже из старших, до сих пор так думает. Не будем пальцем показывать. Наши бойцы зубами скрипят, но стоят. Хотя есть такие, кто давно по-уши завяз в местных делах. Я себя не обеляю. Я уже давно здесь трафиком разнообразным занимаюсь. И скажем так, бойцы наши тут стоят, чтобы местные не рыпались, сталкеры, бандиты... А пока они не рыпаются, отсюда немаленький поток идет артов и всякого прочего товара. Я уже не говорю про грузовики с гражданскими, которые идут СЮДА... Ты про это лучше меня должен знать... Короче, кому все это на руку и кто на этом наживается? Кто бойцов сюда послал? Почему подмога не спешит? Сам делай выводы, не мальчик вроде уже. Вот и весь твой Мирный.

Dialog.Title: Hey, Courier.
Dialog.Text: Hello. Talk business or leave, I have no time for chatting.

Dialog.Title: I have something for you. Paying in advance for your services...
Dialog.Text: I don't get it. Who is it for?

Dialog.Title: It's for you.
Dialog.Text: Still don't get it. Who's it from?

Dialog.Title: (say what Mr. Big has told you)
Dialog.Text: Take it back. I don't wanna be a part of this...You'd better stay away from this too. We all have our own sins and have done awful things, but I wouldn't do any sort of business with bandits under any circumstances. They're just parasites.

Dialog.Title: It's from Mr. Big...
Dialog.Text: Still don't get it..Why did you side with him? I thought you were keeping on the right side of the military. Listen to my advice, boy, be careful and remember that information can be useful...very useful if you know what I mean. Some can be ready to pay well for it. And take this "payment" back, sell it and buy a good decent ammunition.

Dialog.Title: Do you think I should tell all that to lieutenant Still?
Dialog.Text: Well, I think he's the only one man who can use your information wisely.

Dialog.Title: I'm not a whistler.
Dialog.Text: As you say. Let them do whatever they're up to, then...

Dialog.Title: I need some more information...
Dialog.Text: What kind of information?

Dialog.Title: What is the whole "blings" thing about?
Dialog.Text: Well, I can tell you anything specific about so-called "blings", but I did hear a rumor that has something to do with that stuff. I heard of a huckster being hunting down by troops for he'd been selling something forbidden. Those soldiers that were after him..are all dead now. They may have gotten into an anomaly, but I think it was the huckster who killed them all somehow.

Dialog.Title: I'll keep that in mind...
Dialog.Text: Good. Don't hurry..Firts you're gonna need to get more information...

Dialog.Title: Who would agree, then?
Dialog.Text: Ain't you listening to me at all? I don't wanna be a part of this. Take care, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Thanks for the information.
Dialog.Text: Don't talk too much about that, stalker. Take care.

Dialog.Title: That's okay. I'll come by later.
What is the whole "blings" thing about?
Dialog.Text: Well, I can tell you anything specific about so-called "blings", but I did hear a rumor that has something to do with that stuff. I heard of a huckster being hunting down by troops for he'd been selling something forbidden. Those soldiers that were after him..are all dead now. They may have gotten into an anomaly, but I think it was the huckster who killed them all somehow.

Dialog.Title: Where exactly did it happen?
Dialog.Text: I don't know.

Dialog.Title: (say what Mr. Big has told you)
Dialog.Text: Take it back. I don't wanna be a part of this...You'd better stay away from this too. We all have our own sins and have done awful things, but I wouldn't do any sort of business with bandits under any circumstances. They're just parasites.

Dialog.Title: It's from Mr. Big...
Dialog.Text: Still don't get it..Why did you side with him? I thought you were keeping on the right side of the military. Listen to my advice, boy, be careful and remember that information can be useful...very useful if you know what I mean. Some can be ready to pay well for it. And take this "payment" back, sell it and buy a good decent ammunition.
Hello, stalker. call me Tatar. What brought you here?

Dialog.Title: Вот принес тебе флешку от Курьера.
Dialog.Text: О, молодец!

Dialog.Title: I didn't expect to meet anyone here.
Dialog.Text: Life is impossible in Liubech. Mutants forced us to move closer to the borders, which the military guarded. So, when soldiers appeared in the city to secure the area, we had to flee to the swampland.

Dialog.Title: But there are even more mutants.
Dialog.Text: You know nothing about the Zone, don't you? The land we're standing is a "safety island", it's a place where you can' be harmed, neither by humans, nor by mutants. You're protected as long as you're here.

Dialog.Title: You're kidding, right?
Dialog.Text: Don't you feel it? It's easier to breathe. Sense of peace, stalker, that's how you call it. You may not have noticed, but no mutant can attack you in such places, more over, you can't attack anyone, there's no chance you'll open fire. Do you know why it is so?

Dialog.Title: Because of the law...
Dialog.Text: The law is no more than a thin line, stalker. The government come and go, but such "safety islands" have been always in the Zone. People instinctively find them and settle, they get used to one another and live with no disputes...Have you heard of "Strolling Musicians", by the way?

Dialog.Title: No. It hasn't been long since I arrived...
Dialog.Text: We used to hold the entire town in our hands. People had nowhere else to go, so they would put up with everything. We had all the power in our hands, the town used to dance to our pipe...till mutants attacked it. Only we could have saved the citizens, but we didn't. I gathered my people and led 'em here.

Dialog.Title: But why?
Dialog.Text: I'm a bad man, stalker. I'm a goon and so are my comrades. We didn't care about Liubech, we weren't responsible. We only milk it. When we got nailed down, we left the town. Know what? My people ain't loyal, but they followed me cause they thought I had a plan. I didn't. We wandered around in circles until we happened to find this "island". But it was when their patience had run out, they told me what they really thought about my leadership. My life hanged by a thread.

Dialog.Title: How did you survive?
Dialog.Text: "Safety Island", stalker! They were about to kill me, but suddenly they changed their minds...And I didn't want to leave, most of us had settled down. Now our base is here. We keep in touch with traders, we make money by selling verliock legs. We have a doctor who cures us and a guide who can show the way out of here. A guy named Sly resells arms to scientists, as to the Swampman...he's hiding on the second floor of that tottering house, must be off the wagon again, we don't bother him...

Dialog.Title: Remind me your story ...
Dialog.Text: What part of the story?

Dialog.Title: Who are you and where do you come from?
Dialog.Text: You're talking to a leader of "Strolling Musicians". We used to hold the entire town in our hands. People had nowhere else to go, so they would put up with everything. We had all the power in our hands, the town used to dance to our pipe...till mutants attacked it. Only we could have saved the citizens, but we didn't. I gathered my people and led 'em here.

Dialog.Title: But why?
Dialog.Text: I'm a bad man, stalker. I'm a goon. So are all my comrades. We didn't care about Liubech, we weren't responsible, we only milked it. And we fled when it got to tough. My people are not loyal people, but they still followed me as they thought I was the one who would lead the way. They thought I had a plan. But I didn't. I didn't have a plan and we just went around in circles till we bumped into this small piece of land. That was when they starteв questioning my qualities as leader. My life was hanging by a hair.

Dialog.Title: How did you survive?
Dialog.Text: "The island security," a stalker! They going to kill me, but changed their minds ... Suddenly ... I did not want to leave, many also remained. Now here the camp.

Dialog.Title: What does "safety island" mean?
Dialog.Text: You know nothing about the Zone, don't you? The land we're standing is a "safety island" itself, it's a place where you can' be harmed, neither by humans, nor by mutants.

Dialog.Title: Kidding?
Dialog.Text: And you did not feel it? Here a silence and breathe easier. Even the swamp stink, concerned not so much. Appeasement, stalker. What's it called. Maybe you have not noticed, but in places such mutants do not attack, and the man has no quarrel with their fellows. You can not raise a hand against another, injure or kill. Even a shot into the air. Never thought about why?

Dialog.Title: There are laws ...
Dialog.Text: Law - a thin line, stalker. The power comes and goes, but the islands are in the zone, always have been. Instinctively, people gather in them, grow roots, get used to each other and not think about the quarrels and feuds ... Never heard of a gang of "Wandering Musicians"?

Dialog.Title: How is it to live here?
Dialog.Text: We keep in touch with traders, we make money by selling verliock legs. We have a doctor who cures us and a guide who can show the way out of here. A guy named Sly resells arms to scientists, as to the Swampman...he's hiding on the second floor of that tottering house, must be off the wagon again, we don't bother him...

Dialog.Title: Let's talk later.
Dialog.Text: Good bye.

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: The question is - should I trust you? I need someone who can head for Liubech and find a corporal named Kvashina. I have no idea where he might be...but I need copies of his reports.

Dialog.Title: Are you spying on the military or..what?
Dialog.Text: Kind of...I'm not gonna sit here for the rest of my life. Things will change sooner or later. Either the military will chase mutants away or the mutants will make them flee. I must be informed in order to waste my chance when it comes...I'm thinking about returning to Liubech. Yet there're other options.

Dialog.Title: What options?
Dialog.Text: For example, I know that one retired colonel (you may have heard of him) sells sorts of amnesty. He keeps in touch with powerful people and those who wanna be amnestied return to him. The colonel gives them orders and they obey. I don't know why, but he's especially interested in studying bog spiders and everything related to them. He asked Nicheporenko to help him, and he in his turn hired us. Every day I watch the spiders and make some notes, unfortunately I can't order anyone of my comrades to get the notes to Nicheporenko, I trust them even less than I trust you...

Dialog.Title: And how are the spiders doing?
Dialog.Text: Who knows. I'm not insane to watch 'em closely. I make all the "stories" up. Know what? Surprisingly enough, it works! The Colonel just can't have enough of my "stories", he keeps asking for new ones. Have you heard about "The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes"? It was made up too! Such fuss around nothing...So, my fake spiders are no worse than real ones!

Dialog.Title: I brought Kvashina's repoprts
Dialog.Text: Very well.

Dialog.Title: I can get you more reports if you want.
Dialog.Text: That would be very nice. Kvashina's been silent for a while...Something might have happened.

Dialog.Title: I can get your notes to him...
Dialog.Text: Great! I'm right in middle of the finishing the first chapter...The military will be delighted.

Dialog.Title: No problem. I will get you the reports.
I see. I can't help you, too busy at the moment...
I can get your notes to the Colonel ...
Dialog.Text: Great! I'm right in the middle of finishing the first chapter...The military will be delighted!

Dialog.Title: Have you seen a stalker named "Temon"?
Dialog.Text: Isn't he the one that went out from the bog and scared the hell out of everyone? At first we thought it was a mutant,,,But mutants don't like "safety islands", they don't attack here. I invited him to warm at the fire...had never seen such demoralized man before...

Dialog.Title: What happened then?
Dialog.Text: Then I asked his name. Temon Dobronravov it was. He bought some food, water and left. I don't know what demons had been chaising that guy, but here he did manage to pull himself together and think everything over. He confessed he had done many bad stuff; We all have something to be ashemed for, you know...He looked like a man who had killed someone and then regreted. And I couldn't understand what was wrong with that guy, he was odd. I told him to take the road to Tunguska and find a retired colonel there. If you break the law, youк only hope is him.

Dialog.Title: Tunguska?
Dialog.Text: Many roads here lead to unpredictible places. I haven't seen the colonelmyself, but I know that a warrant officer Nicheporenko from Gourmet's village often visited that Tunguska.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: The world is changing, you must change as well.
Dialog.Text: I did already, stalker. Why are you saying this? If you had seen me before, you'd see I'm no longe the same person I used to be. Heh, but we're rotting here...we have no faith, no fear. Although I'm trying to be a fair man, to work hard...my gut tells me something bad is going to happen!

Dialog.Title: The Zone has notised you. So will God.
Dialog.Text: Your words are kind, stalker. But it seems to me we're gonna die here. Like free people...surrouded by the walls. Do you know something I don't? Are you one of the White? No, I don't think so... you don't look like one of them. Dunno why I have a strange feeling that you know me. Tell me, what news you brought along.

Dialog.Title: The end is near. The Old World will fall (fear).
Dialog.Text: Believe it or not, but I do sometimes have a feeling that the end is near. What if tomorrow the sun will die away? I think you're right. You're so right, stalker. Who can tell us what future we're about to face?

Dialog.Title: You can help those who're weaker. (sympathy)
Dialog.Text: I can and I will. I know how it feels when you need help and there's someone ready to land you a hand. It true... I used to be a bandit but I've never been a rascal and I'll prove I've changed. Thank you. stalker, you brought the light along. How can I learn more about the faith you're spreading?

Dialog.Title: Most people will turn to horrible monsters, but not you. (honor)
Dialog.Text: Oh, I have witnessed so many monsters! I could have become a monster myself but I resisted the temptation. I'll try to be a fair man. Thank you stalker. you removed the scales from my eyes. I owe you. Who can tell me more about the future we all are about to face?

Dialog.Title: Find Fedya the Prophet. He'll tell you everything.
Dialog.Text: Thank you stalker. You casted light upon everything.

Dialog.Title: Hey, wanna some Beluga's stuff?
Dialog.Text: Whoa! I thought he'd laid low. Of course I want! Give it to me! Alright, you can go now.

Dialog.Title: Ivan Hell says hello.
Dialog.Text: He's nuts for real! What does he want form me?

Dialog.Title: He offers a partnership.
Dialog.Text: And what do I get for that?

Dialog.Title: Is mutual assistance not enough for you?
Dialog.Text: Let it be this way - you both pay us and we cover you anytime you need.

Dialog.Title: How much?
Dialog.Text: I'm not talking about money. Get me ten guns.

Dialog.Title: What guns exactly?
Dialog.Text: АК-107 of course! Just kidding, PMs will do.

Dialog.Title: I brought you the guns.
Dialog.Text: Now you're talking!

Dialog.Title: I met Mr Big..
Dialog.Text: Got it. Now leave.

Dialog.Title: Is that it?
Dialog.Text: That's right.

Dialog.Title: It seems you don't get along with him.
Dialog.Text: That's not true. I'm sitting on the bog and believe me, I'm fine. It's peaceful and quiet here.
Hello, stalker, what's up? Don't be shy, tell me what brought you here.

Dialog.Title: I'm fine. Just passing by.|Fine, thanks. I was just passing by.
Dialog.Text: Good luck then.

Dialog.Title: Courier gave you this USB flash drive.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, just in time!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: What usually brings people here?
Dialog.Text: Different reasons. If you're looking for a job and heading for New Land, I have something to offer. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Yes, I'm gonna go that way.
Dialog.Text: Great! You'll find a man there named Selektevich. He owes me money. I've no idea where exactly you can find him but I want you to be quick. Do you think you can cope with that in 24 hours?

Dialog.Title: Я забрал долг у Селектевича.
Dialog.Text: Да? Ох, ну и выручил ты меня, сталкер! Так, а сколько там денег-то, а? Тысяч шестьдесят, ага?

Dialog.Title: I took the money from Selektevich.
Dialog.Text: Cool! How much? 20 000 if I'm not mistaken?
Cool! I didn't even expect...never mind. Here's 1500 as a reward for ya. Good luck, stalker.

Dialog.Title: 15 000 precise.
Dialog.Text: Oh yes....Dunno why I said 20 000. Thank you, stalker. Here's 1000 for ya as a reward.
Ten? Why ten? How is that possible? Whatever..thank you anyway. Here's 1000 for ya as a reward.
Welcome! I'll buy goods for a fair price. Come, don't be shy, suggest, choose.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I'm selling and buying stuff. C'mon, don't stay here if you're not going to do business.

Dialog.Title: What is this place?
Dialog.Text: Some guys lived here at one time. I was selling my junk to them. Recently, all got up at once and went away. By the way, someone could take care of this place. Location is good. Place is strengthen - a citadel really. The only problem is - someone must kill cockroaches lurking in the corners.

Dialog.Title: And how is it done?
Dialog.Text: You need people to gather. Alone, you can not do anything here. In general, would have found work great, people would be attracted, and would take this is place.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I'm selling and buying stuff. C'mon, don't stay here if you're not going to do business.

Dialog.Title: What is this place?
Dialog.Text: Some guys lived here at one time. I was selling my junk to them. Recently, all got up at once and went away. By the way, someone could take care of this place. Location is good. Place is strengthen - a citadel really. The only problem is - someone must kill cockroaches lurking in the corners.

Dialog.Title: And how is it done?
Dialog.Text: You need people to gather. Alone, you can not do anything here. In general, would have found work great, people would be attracted, and would take this is place.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello, young man. Ain't you got a coin or two for an old man?

Dialog.Title: Here, take ten.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, you're a nice man. Be kind to others and the Zone will be kind to you...There're many odd and mysterious places in the Zone, but some of 'em may be quite useful. The Zone is sometimes ready to give gifts, all you have to do is to know where to search for them. For example, look around. Everything looks usual, doesn't it? Let's take houses, they're just common houses, ain't they? But the Zone stroke kinda life into them. Go and check it out yourself, there're TV sets inside, they ain't objects anymore, they're alive like flowers or trees. Taking away parts from 'em is the same that plucking braches or leaves from trees....The next day parts "grow" back! The Zone feeds them. Don't think I'm nuts! Go and check yourself. By the way if you're there, get me some radio parts, it's a good way to earn money, I'll split gains with you.

Dialog.Title: Are you drunk or high?|You'd better sigh off drinking.
Dialog.Text: Don't be a fool. I did tell you my secret. And you're laughing at me. Shame on you!

Dialog.Title: hum...I'll go and see with my own eyes
Here are the radio parts.
Dialog.Text: Great. Here's your money. Give me the parts.

Dialog.Title: Do you know any other "rich of gifts" places?
Dialog.Text: I do.The wardrobe. Once I left a quilted jacket there and clean forgot about that. Things change in the Zone, you know. You look at a house for a minute, then you face away. If you turn back at it, it might not remain the same. The Zone tricks everyone...Anyway, my comrades came up to me the other day and showed me my jacket, I was lucky to find the loss. Then, guess what, they showed me another jacket that looked just the same that mine. Every patch-up, every hole - everythins's on its places! When I came to my senses, I realized that the jacket I left in the wardrobe became kinda part of the Zone...And it, so to speak, fruits. Jackets just keep on appearing in the wardrope. One per a day. Ain't it miracle? That's how I had an idea to sell quilted jackets, it's money for old rope, you know. I just have one problem..I don't leave the station anymore. So if you get me a jacket I'll split gains with you. Tomorrow you'll be able to get me another one, What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Sorry, I'm too busy for that.
I brought you a jacket.
Dialog.Text: Cool. Here's your money.

Dialog.Title: Do you happen to know why Prochor is so angry?
Dialog.Text: Cause he ain't a good man. Saw him torturing an infant rat once...not a pretty sight, you know. He was saying the rat could get into an anomaly and mutate, so he had to "deal" with it in advance. What the hell? He might have been right but there must be other ways, you know. He's such a jerk.

Dialog.Title: I need one of your jackets.
Dialog.Text: Forget about it, stalker. The miracle came to an end.

Dialog.Title: Hum...
Dialog.Text: By the way, Blacksmith was looking for ya. Don't forget to talk to him.

Dialog.Title: I brought you a jacket.
Dialog.Text: That's great! I didn't expect 'em to appear again.

Dialog.Title: Do sell it.
Dialog.Text: Of course I'll sell it. That's what I do for a living.

Dialog.Title: Blacksmith just made it all up...
Dialog.Text: I knew it! What a nerve!Here what we do...let's pretend we never had this conversation and I still don't know a thing. Give him this jacket, let him put it in the wardrobe again...

Dialog.Title: Do you know any other "rich of gifts" places?
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: Sorry, I don't talk to criminals.
Hello! Want to talk about clan creation?

Dialog.Title: I want to form a clan.
Dialog.Text: No problem. This service will cost you 5 000 000.

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: So?

Dialog.Title: Later.
Dialog.Text: Ну чтож....

Dialog.Title: How to invite other players to the clan?
Dialog.Text: Type a command in your chat window: /claninvite character_name.

Dialog.Title: Here's the money.
Dialog.Text: Make up a name for your clan.

Dialog.Title: I wanna buy some clan stuff
Thats the name for the clan.
Dialog.Text: You gotta control it from now on. Don't forget to invite your friends to join the clan. If you dont know how to do it, I can help you.

Dialog.Title: I cannot come up with a name...
Dialog.Text: That's ok. Take a time, there's no need to hurry. Come back whenever you're ready.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: А можно просто заплатить?
Dialog.Text: Почему бы и нет. С тебя семь миллионов.

Dialog.Title: I have a question about the clans...
Dialog.Text: Of course, ask whatever you want. And you may type /help command, this will show you the most common command you may need in.

Dialog.Title: How to dismiss a whole clan?
Dialog.Text:
Type a command in your chat window: /clandestroy
But notice what this command is available only for clan leader.

Dialog.Title: How to dismiss a clan member from the clan?
Dialog.Text: Type a command in your chat window: /clankick character_name

Dialog.Title: How do I leave the clan?
Dialog.Text: Type a command in your chat window: /clanleave

Dialog.Title: How to see the clan war list?
Dialog.Text: Type a command in your chat window: /clanwarlist

Dialog.Title: How to start a war with other clan?
Dialog.Text: Type a command in your chat window: /clanwar clan_name.

Dialog.Title: How to cancel the war with other clan?
Dialog.Text: Type a command in your chat window: /clanpeace clan_name

Dialog.Title: I've came up with the name.

Dialog.Text: Welcome, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for sale.
Do you know the guy named Dumpster?
Dialog.Text: Never heard of him. Listen, man, I don't meddle with your business, so don't meddle with mine.

Dialog.Title: What are you talking about?
Dialog.Text: I have no idea what he's doing for ya and how much he pays you, but I do know that there's such a thing like contract kill in the Zone. I don't care if you're gonna kill one or two people, just don't do that around my place, got it?

Dialog.Title: I don't know what you're talking about.
Dialog.Text: C'mon, don't fool around. I know how it works. Dumpster gives you a name, you "sort the things out" for him. But my reputation is being jeopardized here, you kill my clients, people will soon call this place "the road to hell". You're a reasonable man, try to understand.

Dialog.Title: Where am I?
Dialog.Text: Is it your first time here? Welcome to Vesuvius, man! That's a tricky place.

Dialog.Title: Why tricky?
Dialog.Text: There's a sleeping volcano not far from this place. I don't believe those who say it had been here before the Zone appeared, I'm sure it's something the Zone created. It's like time bomb, you know. You never can tell when it's gonna explode. Scary, isn't it?

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about the Vesuvius.
Dialog.Text: No one knows how it appeared just in the center of the Zone. White coats are trying to study its nature, but they don't have the nerve to get too close, they're too scared, you know. It's a spooky place, we all feel something is gonna happen..and very soon. Those who can't take this feeling anymore, get back to Liubech.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for "The White".
Dialog.Text: Ain't seen 'em here.

Dialog.Title: They must have gone another way...
Dialog.Text: Are you chasing 'em? Wouldn't recommend that you do that, they're real freaks. Just imagine, they get into the volcano and burn themselves there! Stay away form 'em, man.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for barter.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: I'm glad you asked. There's some stuff that must be delivered urgently, I'm keeping it in the fridge cause it's something perishable. The client is waiting in Novikovo village, square Ж3. You have 13 minutes to get to the place. Do you think you can make it?

Dialog.Title: How much will I get for this?
Dialog.Text: The client will pay you. His name's Ivan Hell. But what am I gonna do if you don't make it on time? You should pay 10 000 in gage.

Dialog.Title: I will make it.
Dialog.Text: Give me the money then and get going.

Dialog.Title: I have money for Radik.
Dialog.Text: Again? Alright, give it to me. I don't wanna even know what he's up to...Here, square И7-4, the eastern breast of a hill.

Dialog.Title: What's that?
Dialog.Text: Dunno. Off you go now, I'm busy.

Dialog.Title: I need to talk to you.
Dialog.Text: Your proofs do look believable. Appears Radik totally spoiled my reputation, Listen, man, I give you your money back and you keep your mouth shut about all the incident. Deal?

Dialog.Title: Give me my money back!
Dialog.Text: Why should I? No way, talk to Radik. I'm just an intermediary.

Dialog.Title: I think that's fair.
Dialog.Text: Go and make Radik "happy", tell him my people are coming for him. Don't kill him yourself, there's no way he'll flee. Anyway, I need to have words with him.
Hey! Can fix any of your stuff. That's easier than nicking someone else's, plus there's no risk. I accept even useless at first glance stuff, bring me anything, we'll work out how to use that.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for sale.
Fix it all.
Dialog.Text: I can fix all your stuff for %COMPLEX_COST% rubles. Deal?

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a special-purpose set of tools.
Dialog.Text: Actually I need it myself...But I'm ready to give it away, though. Let's say for 100 rubles.

Dialog.Title: What stuff can you assemble for me?
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Can you paint a statuette for me?
Dialog.Text: What do you mean? A toy soldier? That's easy!

Dialog.Title: Here it is.
Dialog.Text: How do you want it to be?
What's up? Are looking for a job?

Dialog.Title: Acid told me you'd share some rounds.
Dialog.Text: That's true, I will but only if you kill the dogs near the post.

Dialog.Title: I did. Give me the rounds.
What kind of job do you offer?
Dialog.Text: I need someone to check if there're any toys in the houses nerby. Now they're incredibly vanuable among the collectors. I need to find a tedy bear, a roly-poly and a Rubik's cube. If you find 'em I'll pay you well.

Dialog.Title: Got it. I'll get you the toys.
I found the toys.
Dialog.Text: All in good condition. Great!

Dialog.Title: Do you know why Prokhor's so angry?
Dialog.Text: I guess so. I bet he's freaking out coz he owes me money.

Dialog.Title: Have you got christmas decorations?
Dialog.Text: I've sold all out.

Dialog.Title: Have you seen Senya recently?
Dialog.Text: Nope. Why do you expect me to know stalkers' names? I remember one guy coming over not so long ago. I sold him the last decorations I had. He asked me where he could find fir trees and I told him there were some in square Д9. If he was the guy you're looking for, try to search him there.

Dialog.Title: I have some questions.
Dialog.Text: Fire away.

Dialog.Title: Have you heard of the wreck on the bridge?
Dialog.Text: Guess so, but I'm not all that interested. Such people as Blacksmith, Acid and the military are those who care about the supplies. I do my own business.

Dialog.Title: How do I get out of the Zone?
Dialog.Text: You're kidding, right? Here's how the things are done here. You're not allowed to cross the boarder. The Zone's held in quarantine and all the possible ways in or out are controlled by the military. People that you see here are thought to be local, who'd been here long before the walls were built up, but it's nor quite true. Most of 'em got here illegally and then just stayed. Noone's gonna control what you're doing here until you try to get away. So give up that idea and just enjoy being alive. Try to feel at home, stalker, and soon you'll belong here.

Dialog.Title: But how do huckstersntrade with outside the perimeter?
Dialog.Text: Bribes. They pay to the right people and that's how it's done. All sorts of stuff are sent to the Big World ourside the perimeter all the time. It's much easier to transport something there than to try to cross the boarder yourself. I know what you're thinking...that you could buy "your ticket" to get away..I think that's possible but you'll need a good deal of money.

Dialog.Title: How did you get into the Zone?
Dialog.Text: I got fed up with my life...family, commitments, it's a dead end, you know. So I ended up here. Made couple of friends, started to sell stuff. So I've been doing pretty well ever since. Now I'm not young anymore to hunt for "treasures" myself so I hire young stalkers. I'm pretty happy with everything.

Dialog.Title: That's all I wanted to know. Thank you.
Do you know anything about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: Who? Don't know anyone by that name.

Dialog.Title: Prokhor told me you had a quarrel with him.
Dialog.Text: Does it mean I killed him?? Don't be a jerk. Yes I did have a raw with one guy, so what? He tried to sell me some 'new' toys. I know where he found those "new" toys, in abandoned houses nearby, dirty liar. So I just flipped him off. Haven't seen him ever since. Don't know neither what his name was nor where he'd gone. I know why Prokhor wanted you to think this way about me. He owes me a good deal and doesn't want to give me money back...

Dialog.Title: I got a package from Senya.
Dialog.Text: Quite, man. Give it to me, take a bear and get back to Senya.

Dialog.Title: I came to grab the stuff for Senya.
Dialog.Text: Quite, man. Take a bear and go away.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
What?

Dialog.Title: I know you can teach me some "dirty tricks".
Dialog.Text: I may or may not. It depends.

Dialog.Title: *Tell about Bald*.|I did some job for Bald but he didn't pay me as it was promised. First, he told me to come again later, but when I did, he pretended he didn't know me at all.
Dialog.Text: Don't worry, I'll talk to him. It's not the first time he's tricked a newbie. Come up to him in an hour. He will pay you.

Dialog.Title: I brought the vacuum tubes.
Dialog.Text: Vacuum tubes? The ones from the posts? The damn tubes break down every day and no one can tell why. Give 'em to me.

Dialog.Title: Here you go.
Dialog.Text: Don't forget to take new tubes instead the old ones. Get 'em to the master at the post. Then tell Courier that you delivered all the tubes.

Dialog.Title: What about new tubes?
Dialog.Text: Oh, yes. Almost forgot. Here, take 'em to the posts. Give 'em away to the master, then inform Courier that you delivered all the tubes.

Dialog.Title: Thanks. How much do I owe you?
Dialog.Text: You owe me nothing. I've been trying to help Bald get rid of his old "habits" since he got to the Zone.

Dialog.Title: I know you can teach me some "dirty tricks".
I've been stiffed by the stockman...
Dialog.Text: I'm sorry, man. There're lots of rats in the Zone and I'm not talking about mutants, if you know what I mean. I'll talk to him. He'll give your stuff back.

Dialog.Title: Thank you.
Dialog.Text: What for? I haven't spoken to him yet...Remember, I don't trust anyone, so I'll check first if you really gave him your stuff.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a master generator.
Dialog.Text: It's a rare thing and we also wanna find it. What do you need it for?

Dialog.Title: Morze knows how to fix the connection.
Dialog.Text: That's a nice plan, but I fear my people won't understand. They think you'll never make a man of him, making fun of his failures. Listen, I have an idea. Luckily, sergeant Druz keeps an exstra generator at his post. Now that I've been thinking of getting back at him for his drunk behaviour anyway, we could "borrow" the generator. I'll nick it while you'll be disctracting him. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Do you have a generator?
Dialog.Text: Nope. You didn't distract Druz'. He's got a sharp eyes. Talk to him until he loses his attention.

Dialog.Title: Do you have a generator?
Dialog.Text: Yes. Here you are.

Dialog.Title: Thank you, man.
Dialog.Text: I think I can trust you, stalker. Don't let me down. Say hello to Morze.

Dialog.Title: Sanek the Old Coon sent me. I'm ready to answer your question.
Dialog.Text: Are you sure you know more than nothing? Be ready for a serious question.

Dialog.Title: Try me!
Dialog.Text: Why were the RAF aircraft of the 16th United States Navy squadrons painted with pink?

Dialog.Title: That was funny and the pilots were in a good mood.
Dialog.Text: What? They were pilots, not clowns. Think better.

Dialog.Title: They didn't have paint of another color.
Dialog.Text: Are you kidding? Sure they did. Think better.

Dialog.Title: To camouflage them at sunset and sunrise.
Dialog.Text: Bravo! Did you know that? I didn't expect you to give the correct answer. I'm impressed to be honest.

Dialog.Title: I'm much smarter than I seem to be.
Dialog.Text: Ask Sergeant Dibenko to pose you his question. I bet he'll try to catch you.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Have you ever met Litowski?
Dialog.Text: Why are you asking?

Dialog.Title: Встретил его недавно.
Dialog.Text: Ну, раз ты жив, стало быть встреча закончилась хорошо для тебя. Чего и впредь тебе желаю. Удачи.

Dialog.Title: I met him in prison.
Dialog.Text: So, you wanna know more about him, right?

Dialog.Title: He seemed a dangerous man.
Dialog.Text: He really is. Have you ever heard of so-called "elephant's memory"? Elephants are said to have a ready memory, expecially when they're offended. They never forgive. Litowski is like that. He NEVER forgets neither words or actions he didn't like. Not to mention those who had an actiual fight with him. They all must be dead. The fact he's in the Zone means some guys are gonna die.

Dialog.Title: Похоже, ты неплохо его знаешь...
Dialog.Text: К сожалению, да. Он никогда не показывает своей неприязни открыто и всегда ждет подходящего момента для удара. Может ждать десятилетиями. Не думаю, что с годами он изменился, разве что превратился в полного шизика... Слышал, он в наемники подался и от заказов нет отбоя. А раз так - руки у него развязаны и он, зная его проблемы с психикой, будет брать только ту работу, где есть его личный интерес. А интерес у него одни. Найти того, кто его когда-то задел и показательно уничтожить. В тот самый момент, когда жертва ничего не подозревает.

Dialog.Title: Друзьями вас не назовешь...
Dialog.Text: Если даже он что-то против меня имеет... За себя я не боюсь - в Любеч он не полезет - здесь просто нет таких задач, которые могли бы "стоить" тех денег, что ему платят. И потом - я уже перебоялся. Того, кто прошел Зону, даже такой гадиной, как Литовский не испугаешь.
Hey, you. Yes, you. Come here.

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: I have some work for you. I'll pay you.

Dialog.Title: Pay? Yes, it would be nice.
Dialog.Text: I like the way you think. Listen up. There is a guy near closed market at the square. My former assistant. I fired him for getting drunk. It would be OK, if he drank a bit in the morning, but he could barely stand at 11 a.m. So I fired him.

Dialog.Title: So what? I need to program him or what?
Dialog.Text: No. This bastard started to spread rumors about my business. I have nothing to hide. But I don't know who and how can use this information. Go and talk to him. Make him scared. But don't hit him. Just threaten.

Dialog.Title: OK. I will do it.
Dialog.Text: It would be nice. Come back to me when the job is done.

Dialog.Title: Not intersted.
Dialog.Text: Too bad. You could really help me out. Come back if you change your mind.

Dialog.Title: Problems with memory?
Dialog.Text: Ah, it is you. I didn't recognize you. So, how is my former assistant doing?

Dialog.Title: He understood your message.
Dialog.Text: Good job! Take your reward. Come back for work any time.

Dialog.Title: I don't need money.
Dialog.Text: What th... You are... A unique person.

Dialog.Title: *Blackmail Rashid.*| Valera has told a lot about you.
Dialog.Text: You...! He...! How can I trust peole after that?... How much do you want?

Dialog.Title: Well, not less than a 1000.
Dialog.Text: Take it, damn you...! Take everything! I wish Zone will kill you one day.
What?

Dialog.Title: *Blackmail Rashid.*| Valera told me about you.
Dialog.Text: He little...! I will kill this rat! ...How much?

Dialog.Title: Tax is the same. 1000.
Dialog.Text: Take it and never come back!

Dialog.Title: Keep calm. I won't take anything now.
I let him go.|| I don't want to get into your business.
Dialog.Text: You won't have money then.

Dialog.Title: He is talking about you with everyone.
Dialog.Text: OK, I will settle this matter myself. With 100% guarenty. But without you. Farewell.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
What?

Dialog.Title: I brought the samples.
Dialog.Text: Good, now I can return to my studies.

Dialog.Title: I brought the samples.
Dialog.Text: Excellent specimens!

Dialog.Title: Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Не забывает Артур своих друзей! Молодец! Ты, сталкер, если его встретишь, то и от меня непременно поздравь с Новым Годом! Прими и ты мои поздравления, самые наилучшие пожелания в новом году, и небольшой Новогодний подарочек.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Пожалуйста. А вот, если отгадаешь загадку, то достанется тебе ещё один небольшой приз. Слушай загадку. Не так давно стал известен факт попадания в большинство водопроводных систем химиката! Этот химикат бесцветный, безвкусный и не имеет запаха. Однако, население не информируется об этом происшествии! Боле того, не предпринимаются никакие попытки борьбы с этим заражением! И это при том, что химикат используется для следующих целей: В производстве как растворитель и охладитель. В ядерных реакторах. В производстве пенопласта. В огнетушителях. В химических и биологических лабораториях. В производстве пестицидов. В искусственных пищевых добавках. Опасность этого вещества заключается в следующем: Химикат присутствует в составе кислотных дождей. Вызывает эрозию почвы. Ускоряет коррозию металлов и вредит большинству электроприборов при попадании внутрь. Длительный контакт с химикатом в его твёрдой форме приводит к серьёзным повреждениям кожи человека. Контакт с газообразной формой химиката приводит к сильным ожогам. Вдыхание даже небольшого количества химиката грозит смертельным исходом. Химикат обнаружен в злокачественных опухолях, нарывах, язвах и прочих болезненных изменениях тела. Химикат развивает стойкую зависимость; жертвам при воздержании от потребления этого вещества грозит смерть в течение 168 часов. Несмотря на эти опасности, люди, работающие с химикатом, как правило, не получают спецодежды и инструктажа. Знаешь ли ты, сталкер, о каком химикате идёт речь?

Dialog.Title: CCl2O
Dialog.Text: Нет, сталкер. Не угадал. Это банальная вода - H2O! Ха-ха-ха! Ну, с Новым годом тебя!

Dialog.Title: H2SO4
Dialog.Text: Нет, сталкер. Не угадал. Это банальная вода - H2O! Ха-ха-ха! Ну, с Новым годом тебя!

Dialog.Title: C13H9NO
Dialog.Text: Нет, сталкер. Не угадал. Это банальная вода - H2O! Ха-ха-ха! Ну, с Новым годом тебя!

Dialog.Title: HCN
Dialog.Text: Нет, сталкер. Не угадал. Это банальная вода - H2O! Ха-ха-ха! Ну, с Новым годом тебя!

Dialog.Title: H2O
Dialog.Text: Конечно! Это банальная вода - H2O! Молодец! Держи приз! С Новым Годом!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hi. I can help you to get rid of useless stuff. Do you wanna to get rid of anything?

Dialog.Title: Spider legs.
Dialog.Text: How many?

Dialog.Title: One lag.
Dialog.Text: Give me that.

Dialog.Title: 5 legs.
Dialog.Text: Give me.

Dialog.Title: Rats.
Dialog.Text: How many?

Dialog.Title: One.
Dialog.Text: Give me that.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Oh! I haven't seen yo-o-ou here before. Wanna have a dr-i-nk?

Dialog.Title: No thanks.
Dialog.Text: Come on! I promise to tell something in return.

Dialog.Title: Tell me first.
Dialog.Text: Well, okay. There's a guy named Rashid. He's such a rat...I treated him as a real friend, helped him a lot, was at his beck and call...and how did he pay me? He just kicked me out. By the way, do you know what he did to the guys from the Raven Wood...?

Dialog.Title: Shut up!
Dialog.Text: Wh-a-at? I'm telling the truth.

Dialog.Title: Stop talking.
Dialog.Text: Why? What's wrong?

Dialog.Title: If you don't it's gonna really hurts.
Dialog.Text: What do you mean?

Dialog.Title: See my boots?
Dialog.Text: Yesss. Soo-o?

Dialog.Title: They're gonna leave a nice print on your ass.
Dialog.Text: No,no, please don't do that, don't hurt me. I won't tell anybody...

Dialog.Title: Ответ 2
Dialog.Text: Ответ2

Dialog.Title: I don't.
Dialog.Text: That rat nicked some arts from them...

Dialog.Title: Thanks for the information. I won't hurt you.
Dialog.Text: Thank God ... Well ... Goodbye ...

Dialog.Title: No. But I know one man...
Dialog.Text: What man?

Dialog.Title: Liquor factory's main engineer is sober!
Dialog.Text: I can't be sober with those assholes hanging around. I' m gonna kil em all If I ' ll get sober. And I'm not murderer! I' m trying to save their lifes, as long as I'm drinking.

Dialog.Title: Hey, I thought you were done with it!
Dialog.Text: Screw that....take this away from me...nasty poisonous shit...

Dialog.Title: It's never too late to start over again.

Dialog.Text: ...Stalker?

Dialog.Title: What's up?
Dialog.Text: No alcohol today... yet.

Dialog.Title: That's why you look so unhappy, right?
Dialog.Text: Yup.

Dialog.Title: Good for you.
Dialog.Text: ehhh...SCREW YOU!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Drunk again, huh?..
Dialog.Text: Noo-oo-o...or...you mean..you?

Dialog.Title: Ex-master says hello.
Dialog.Text: Is he hanging in there? I didn't think I could actually do that. No I'm sober, thanks to you. Don't be mad at me...So, how is he doing?

Dialog.Title: Cards on Friday...
Dialog.Text: Cards?..Poker or bridge?
Hey stalker! Whould you like to take part in the PvP event?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
What protects you from beasts and bullets? That's right. Decent armor. The one you can buy only here.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for sale.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: I want to modify my outfit.
What can you do with my armor?
Dialog.Text: Well, first of all, you can choose ane badge you like from my collection and sew it on any of your outfits for 500 gold rubles. This is how much my work costs, so if you need tp sew another badge on, you pay 500 rubles more. Second of all, I can make a brand-new badge based on your scetches for 2000 gold rubles. You should know, I accept only decent images.

Dialog.Title: Why so pricy?
Dialog.Text: Don't buy anything if you don't want to. The badges won't give you any benefits in combat.
Hey, how are you feeling? Fever? Headache? I have everything to fix you up. If you need to make any special med, bring me ingredients, I'll take care of everything.

Dialog.Title: Can you fix me up a bit?
Dialog.Text: I don't examine but for your money I can do any injection you need, for example general tonic or anti radiation.

Dialog.Title: *Medicine for Temon*|One stalker is completely out of his mind.
Dialog.Text: There's nothing I can do. I have no cure for madness.

Dialog.Title: I gotte bring him ti his senses...|| at least for a while.
Dialog.Text: Listen stalker, it's the Zone, not a hospital. I can fix up human body but not soul or mind. Anyway, you gotta find a very specific doctor.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for vitamins.
Dialog.Text: Well..I do have vitamins, but they're not for sale. This is for the first and the only time, stalker. I'll give you a pack for 500 rubles.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
The newest weapons. Excellent stock! What will protect you from attacks of bandits and mutants? That's right! An accurate shot from a weapon!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I sell different tools, all for the inquiring mind. I also can offer a fair barter.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
How are you? Alive?

Dialog.Title: Да. Я тут недавно.
Dialog.Text: А замечательно, еще один. Что, приключений захотелось? Или просто заработать решил? В любом случае, чтоб не помер сразу же, вот тебе оружие. А то ваш брат даже оружия с собой не берет.

Dialog.Title: Что мне делать?
Dialog.Text: Иди вперед, на станцию. Там тебе все объяснят. И экипировку выдадут походную, если ты, конечно, на нее заработаешь.

Dialog.Title: Alive like a ...
Dialog.Text: This is good ... Congratulations, brother. We can say, in the zone. I wanted to go - I think that almost ended. From Liubech it starts, and before Liubech on a trolley from the station can reach. Well, to the station - a stone's throw,

Dialog.Title: And that to me? Feet like cotton ...
Dialog.Text: Oh, brother ... I watch the local air is already hit your head. Then up way to the station itself is relatively safe. But I advise to get weapons so quickly. I, green shoots, drive here, not in order

Dialog.Title: The head is a cast-iron ...
Dialog.Text: Will soon pass. Or the military ... you touched? A cordon of ... I'll have spent more on its own. Here our paths diverge. Go ahead, the station is nearby. There is a doctor. Can you buy yourself something. Are you listening?

Dialog.Title: I like a little better ... | | I remember were the perimeter ...
Dialog.Text: Maybe you thought about the money, and? I'm you, illnesses, not for free I drive here.

Dialog.Title: I'm sorry, I have no money.
Dialog.Text: Something in your liver ... I felt that it was necessary to take forward. I've been risking his neck, and you cheated, then? Get out of here. I hope you had disappeared to hell, wise guy ... Well, nothing. Zone sees everything, you will take the zone...

Dialog.Title: That is 200 rubles, as agreed.
Dialog.Text: Go along the way, will not folding. You'll see a green vapor - not approach, and get poisoned. Everything has gone. Do not stand there like a lantern to the pharmacy.
Lets go...

Dialog.Title: oh-ho...
Dialog.Text: Heavily you hooked? When the bullets whistled through the bushes, I thought, too ashamed to say - everything, the end of the tale. No, broke. That's just go back even harder and more dangerous. I'm back to no one I drive, alone, is hardly my way,

Dialog.Title: Why did you not go?
Dialog.Text: Who of us needed more weapons? I'll wait here and pokaraulyu. I was exhausted our transition. And you, on the contrary, it will be useful to move.

Dialog.Title: Wait me. I return soon
Dialog.Text: In the water does not occur, if the legs of the road.

Dialog.Title: I found the PM, but without ammunition. | There's someone's remains. I found the PM, but without ammunition.
Dialog.Text: Okay, so be it, share with you the ammunition. Yet you and I together went through the perimeter.

Dialog.Title: Where do I find a weapon?
Dialog.Text: His gun I will not give, but I do not have too much. But if the colon is not thin, you can peek into the woods. Remember, shots heard in the morning? Seems to me there is someone the military killed. Maybe that remains useful. You understand, there is no guarantee. But it never hurts to check -- maybe you are lucky.

Dialog.Title: I've inspected the area round the wood but didn't find anything.
Dialog.Text: Next time you should look round better..anyway...take my PM. I'll get a new one in Liubech.

Dialog.Title: Headache is killing me!
Dialog.Text: You'll get better soon. Now you gotta come your own way. If you get to the station, you'll find a doctor there. Hey! Have you been listening?

Dialog.Title: Sure...
Dialog.Text: Every day in the Zone could be your last day, you know...

Dialog.Title: Feeling better now... ||I remember crossing the perimeter...
Dialog.Text: Do you happen to remember about money? I'm not risking my life for free...

Dialog.Title: Here's 200 rubles as we agreed.
Dialog.Text: Go straight ahead. If you come across kinda green smoke, don't get closer. Good luck!

Dialog.Title: Sorry, man. I'm broke.
Dialog.Text: Damn it! I knew I should have taken money in advance! You so crossed the line!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: The train belongs to you?
Dialog.Text: Yes, my. Want to get into the Zone -- prove that doesn't kill you. All transported -- difficult.

Dialog.Title: Do not look so.I'm leaving you.
Haron said that I could go.
Dialog.Text: It's you...Okay, sit down...Do not forget?This train is one way.

Dialog.Title: Wait, I need to do something.
