How did the train back here?|If the train one way, how it comes back here?
Dialog.Text: How? Travels in a circle. Only without the people. There is an anomaly on the tracks so the train goes into it is empty, and I had already stayed here, on the move, like in the movies.

Dialog.Title: Is this true?
Dialog.Text: No.More stupid questions?You sit down,or not?

Dialog.Title: On the trolley - so on a trolley.
Даже за деньги?
Dialog.Text: Хм... Если все еще при деньгах, значит что-то да стоишь... Хорошо. Проезд -- 140 рублей. Учти, что поезд в один конец. Если чему-то не научился или остались дела, разберись сперва с ними -- потом будет не до этого. В Зоне от тебя потребуются все твои умения и способности.

Dialog.Title: Вот деньги.
Dialog.Text: Раз так рвешься в объятия смерти, что даже платить готов, грех не помочь.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Do you buy rat tails?
Dialog.Text: Lets' say yes. Do yoy have any?

Dialog.Title: I do.
Dialog.Text: Let me see. Yea, this one will do.

Dialog.Title: Why do you need tails anyway?
Dialog.Text: I fry them and eat. Okay, just kidding. Are you a newbie here?

Dialog.Title: What gave me away?
Dialog.Text: You're being asking stupid qusetions. Besides, the military's looking for you. They say someone has gotten over the cardon. And it's not the best time to run back and forth across the perimeter, you know.

Dialog.Title: Why?
Dialog.Text: Mutants are getting closer every minute. At the same time there's always someone who tries to slip into the Zone. The military stay sharp but they're very nervous. You'd better go to Liubech, man. Go to the station, find a guy named Machinist, tell him I sent you. And head off to Liubech. Hurry up.

Dialog.Title: Thanks, man.
Dialog.Text: Listen, I'm not doing it for your sake. You're not supposed to be here. If the military start looking for you around this place, I'll lose all clients.

Dialog.Title: Do you still need tails?
Dialog.Text: Sure, give 'em to me. If I were you, I wouldn't stay here any longer. You'd better move on!

Dialog.Title: Wait a minute. I'll bring them.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I have no intention to talk to criminals.
Hello. Do you want to use the storage service?

Dialog.Title: What is it?
Dialog.Text: That's what I do in the Zone. I help stalkers keep their stuff safe. If you have just a few things you wanna keep here, I can keep my eye on 'em for free. I'm not the only person who does it. every storage is connected with the others and we provide special delivery service. You can leave your stuff in one storage and take it from another one. Ain't it convenient?

Dialog.Title: Yes, I have something of value.
How does it work?
Dialog.Text: It's very simple. There're different fractions, such as the military, scientists, bandits. each fraction has storages where its members keep stuff. You leave your stuff in any of the storages. when you need it again, you can take it out from any other storage. Couriers are in charge of delivering your stuff between the storages. But there're certain rules you gotta follow. Firstly, we provide the service only for those who belong to our fraction.

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: So? Do you want to leave here anything?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Who's there?

Dialog.Title: Hello.
Dialog.Text: What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Stick sent me.
Dialog.Text: He can do it. He offends everyone. I'm joking, just joking. So. First of all, I greet you in our humble abode... My name is Greek. I'm the commandant. So it's me who decide all major issues. Alex is the chief of security. Walk to him too, by the way. He'll tell you what is allowed here and what is not. And he can manage some work for you, if you need money.

Dialog.Title: Rules again? Oh man.
Dialog.Text: Where do you think you are, stalker, in a fairy-tale? Everything is possible here, the Phon is unpredictable. It can turn something dangerous into even more dangerous stuff.

Dialog.Title: Phon?
Dialog.Text: Have you lived in isolation all your life? Any newspaper article will tell you what the Phon is.

Dialog.Title: I don't read newspapers.
Dialog.Text: I don't have time for lectures. I just say there is another type of radiation, different from the usual one. At least. We call it "Phon". The way it influence on living and no-living things is rather interesting. Interesting because no one knows how the hell the thing do its work. Militaries brought a crowd of scientists. But they stay dull like a school boy before a naked woman. And they don't study the Rainbow anymore. On the other side is the Raven Wood. Damn tough bunch. Private army with enormous funding. At least their equipment is awesome. I have no idea what they need. That is why I don't recommend you to mess up with them. They pay good, but you know the story about 30 silver coins. Their scientists are really smart though. Discover secrets one by one. That's how it is. Any questions?

Dialog.Title: You talked about the Rainbow...
Dialog.Text: Yeah, but there are lot of nonsense and urban legends around this phenomenon. You better ask someone else. I don't want to waste time with it. So, come on. Go to Alex. And on behalf of all Lubech: "Welcome!" The military do not favor newcomers, but I say, the only way to get there is together. I hope you'll die not as fast as most of other losers. So here is... the starter kit of survival in a hostile environment. Don't laugh, you will thank me later. Good luck!

Dialog.Title: I'm leaving.
Dialog.Text: Yes, go away.

Dialog.Title: What is this place?
Dialog.Text: The place is not better, not worse, than any other place. We strengthen it, establish supply of ammunition, hold the ground successfully... I'm the head of the process. Sometimes newcomers come here, but they does not last long. Although now, with the military, things became far from quiet... Every day new guests are coming. The scientists, stalkers, clans leaders... Unexpectedly, but good for barter. There were not such traffic ever before.

Dialog.Title: The Army wasn't the first who come here?
Dialog.Text: Of course not! Lubech was quiet and relatively safe city until the mutants came from swamps and forests. The "safe" is a strong word for the Zone. But people lived here, on this side of the perimeter. The police station was also used as intended. Kept peace and order, as they say... Alex and I worked here... But then we was attacked by various creatures. Someone was killed, the rest are gone. We stayed. I had to release the prisoners. Seen Shtaket? He was behind the bars for some time. And he still would have sat if the creatures did not attack.

Dialog.Title: Isn't it dangerous to release prisoners?
Dialog.Text: To go out on the streets now is dangerous. Shtaket have his benefits for society. He's not a maniac. He is a thief. But his connections are very helpful. Of course, he still should answer for his crimes before the law... But later, when the mutants raids will end and life will return to normal.

Dialog.Title: Why should I register myself?
Dialog.Text: Because if you'll die in the Zone and someone will be looking for you, we'll always be able to confirm that you were here. Convenient? And rightly so. This, of course, is voluntary procedure. But if your conscience is clear and you have nothing to hide from the law, why not register yourself.

Dialog.Title: Have you seen Temon?
Dialog.Text: Let me look through the notes. Yes..he's been here. He smelled like shit, as if he'd spent a night or two inside a dumpster.

Dialog.Title: Are you sure it was Temon?
Dialog.Text: He told me so.

Dialog.Title: Where did he go?
Dialog.Text: He went toward the Palace of Culture. He just talked to Sergeant Dibenko and then vanished.

Dialog.Title: Have you seen the Dark stalker?
Dialog.Text: Ha-ha very funny.

Dialog.Title: I'm wondering what you're doing here.
Dialog.Text: Well...Call me Greek, I'm in charge here. If you're looking for a job, you'd better talk to a guy called Stick. He's standing at the entry. Alex is responsible for safety. You should talk to him too, he'll tell you about dos and don'ts.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: I met Mr. Big in the Zone...
Dialog.Text: That's a very amusing story.

Dialog.Title: Ты же в органах служил...
Dialog.Text: Я да, а ты - нет. Спасибо за информацию. За помощь органам. Иди вниз, получи у кого-нибудь благодарность.

Dialog.Title: По долгу службы с ним не встречался?
Dialog.Text: Лично - нет. Но наслышан. Чего ему в Зоне-то понадобилось? Его место - другие зоны. "Вор должен сидеть в тюрьме" - слыхал? А он вор уважаемый и сколько я о нем слышал, он из исправительных учреждений вообще не выходил. "Смотрящим" был в местах не столь отдаленных. Откинулся что ли? Не верится. Хотя, если подумать, коли уж он и вправду какими-то судьбами откинулся... Интересно, охрана что ли разбежалась? Проснулся наш Батя, а кругом свобода... Не смог он видать вынести такого финала - и на первом поезде в Зону. Чтобы ограда была. Душевно тут: бесхозные душегубы со всего района сюда собираются... Неужели он решил тут короноваться? Невесело это, сталкер. Бати, тьфу, только не хватало в нашей банке с пауками...

Dialog.Title: Ты же в органах служил...
Dialog.Text: Я да, а ты - нет. Я даже слышал, ты наоборот с местной шпаной вась-вась любишь устраивать. Но спасибо за информацию. За помощь органам. Иди вниз, получи у кого-нибудь благодарность.

Dialog.Title: Ты же в органах служил...
Dialog.Text: Я да, а ты - нет. Я даже слышал, ты наоборот с местной шпаной вась-вась любишь устраивать. Но спасибо за информацию. За помощь органам. Иди вниз, получи у кого-нибудь благодарность.
Hi there, rookie. What are you up to?

Dialog.Title: From here. Right there.|| I have some business.
Dialog.Text: Ah! Ice cold! So listen to me, ice cold hero. You better talk about your plans with our commandant.

Dialog.Title: You've got a commandant here?
Dialog.Text: For real! And you've got him too. You are here, so this is your problem too right now, huh.

Dialog.Title: I'm not going to stay here.
Dialog.Text: Cool. You should go see Greek anyway. I recommend you. Walking is good for your health. And go see Shtaket. He knows a lot about this scum pit.

Dialog.Title: Hey. And what is going on h...
Dialog.Text: All your questions bring to Greek. My job is to say "Hello!" and "Move along". And to send you to the Greek.

Dialog.Title: Nice job.
Dialog.Text: No shit? Now go. He is here, in the ex-police building. 24/7. Then you can come back. I'll have something for ya.

Dialog.Title: Ok. I'll be back.
Dialog.Text: That's my boy.

Dialog.Title: I'm on a rush.
Dialog.Text: So be it.

Dialog.Title: You wanted to see me.
Dialog.Text: So. They checked you?

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: I've got a job for you. An important one. I've seen a wild place not far from here. You could saw it too. There is a hole in the wall and dog mutes are jumping out from it. Soldiers are shooting 'em all the time. But I've heard a very strange noise from there. Militaries won't go there. I need someone to look what's going on there.

Dialog.Title: I don't have time for this.
There are some hogs right near the place.
Dialog.Text: Damn!.. If they are going to bring a visit... Maaan, right now I'm glad that militaries are here. I'll be damned.

Dialog.Title: Got some?
Dialog.Text: Ah, that's you. Can you keep the secret?

Dialog.Title: Nope.
Dialog.Text: So piss off!

Dialog.Title: Yup.
Dialog.Text: Hm...damn...I still need a hand. I won't do it by myself. One stalker used to bring me some nice stuff, but there is a whole freaking army right here these days.So I need someone to go to my man and to ask him about new place. I'll give you some cash. So what will you say?

Dialog.Title: Ok, I'll go there.
Dialog.Text: The stalker that you're looking for looks like a bum. You can find him on the railway station. Also you can check nearby area, behind the gates... But nobody will let you go out the town, so you can catch him only on the rail right now. Ask him about the stuff. He will say to you: "The skyes are crystal clear today". You answer: "But someone is calling". Don't laugh, pal.Then he'll mark the place with the stuff. If he'll ask you for some cash - give it to him. I'll pay you later. Seriously. I will.

Dialog.Title: He'll leave the package in the park. ||Under the bench.
Dialog.Text: Shhhh!... Are you nuts? So... We'll have a package weekly. If you go and pick it up, we'll share the cash.

Dialog.Title: Deal!
Dialog.Text: How much did he take from you, by the way?

Dialog.Title: I need to think about it...
What about the stuff?
Dialog.Text: Your stuff has been arrived. It's all like you said. In the park right under the bench. You should go there and check it. It is your cash too on a stake. Remember it.

Dialog.Title: Let's talk later.
Dialog.Text: Understood.

Dialog.Title: 300 rubles.
Dialog.Text: Well. Not a bad deal.

Dialog.Title: 500 rubles.
Dialog.Text: Ok. Here you are.

Dialog.Title: 1000 rubles.
Dialog.Text: Greedy bastard... Ok. That's not your fault. Take your money.

Dialog.Title: 1500 rubles.
Dialog.Text: No way! That ugly son of one... dirty bastard is totally screwed. That's not your fault. But I have only one thousand left. If you'll keep bringing that shit to me I'll pay you much, MUCH more. You have my word.

Dialog.Title: Here's your box.
Dialog.Text: Shhhhhh! Give it to me. Here's your cash. Right. Good. You can go now. Dismissed.

Dialog.Title: Here's your box.
Dialog.Text: Shhhhhh! Give it to me. Here's your cash. Right. Good. You can go now. Dismissed.

Dialog.Title: Слышал про Темного Сталкера?
Dialog.Text: Не только слышал, но и видел! Чуть в штаны не наделал. Дело было ночью. Напугал меня этот господин прохожий... Я направил его к Греку, как и всех. Внутри он пробыл недолго. Побежал мимо военных, в сторону ДК. Натерпелся я с него страху... Разумеется, это не "тот самый" Темный Сталкер, то все сказки да враки. Хотя кто знает... Все же страшный как черт. Весь в мусоре и, кажется, в крови запекшейся... Хорошо, что ушел.

Dialog.Title: Haven't you seen Temon?
Dialog.Text: I dunno. Ask the Greek. If Temon was here, there is a note about his visit.

Dialog.Title: Have you heard about The Dark Stalker?
Dialog.Text: I'VE SEEN HIM! I was shitting bricks when he passed by. It was very late in the night. I sent him to the Greek, as everyone. He was at the Greek's office shortly. Then he went to the Palace. All that rubbish and gore on his coat. Brrrr. Very scary. It's good that he has left.

Dialog.Title: Have you heard about The Dark Stalker?
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Who's there?

Dialog.Title: Hush. It's me.
Dialog.Text: I know such "mes", saw many of them already. Everytime a "me" come here, some of my stuff disappear surely.

Dialog.Title: What stuff? Nothing valuable here.
Dialog.Text: That's true. So what do you want?

Dialog.Title: Some temporary shelter.|| But it's already occupied.
Dialog.Text: It's not occupied... Frankly, I'm glad to see a guest. I've been sitting for a long time here.

Dialog.Title: Hiding from someone?
Dialog.Text: Hiding? No. On the contrary. I try to stay out of shadows and face my doubts alone. In other words, I try to understand.

Dialog.Title: To understand what?
Dialog.Text: It's not easy to put into words. Listen, if you really need to hear it... No problem, I'll tell you. But, you know, it's hard to make a good story on an empty stomach and a dry throat. You know what I mean.

Dialog.Title: I'm not a fool. What do you need?
Dialog.Text: Me? Well, I want a bottle of "Kianty" and a steak with the size of my head. But several cans of stew and something to drink will do too. And I wish this "something" could burn.

Dialog.Title: OK. Stew is possible.
Dialog.Text: Just remember, I need only fresh ones! I'm sick of the junk I eat every day...I know some guys who eat even mutant meat, but I can't stomach that! So, only the fresh ones will do. That's it. As for the alcohol, try to look for it in the "White's" village, that's in the north, search their hide-outs, there must be some. And there's no ruch. I'll wait.

Dialog.Title: It's me. Here's food.
Dialog.Text: What about drink?

Dialog.Title: Here it is.
Dialog.Text: ...Let's taste it.......... Goooood. That's what I need.

Dialog.Title: So what are you trying to understand?
Dialog.Text: Oh, my friend! Sit down. You heard about all those theories of how all this hell-stuff were appeared... about anomalies, mutants and all other unknown strange hell-knows-what?

Dialog.Title: I've heard, but was not interested.
Dialog.Text: That a sad thing you said. "Not interested"? It can't be that no one want to know why and for the what is all that here.

Dialog.Title: Now it is interesting.
Dialog.Text: I hope you didn't miss the Rainbow out of sight.

Dialog.Title: What Rainbow?
Dialog.Text: Oooooh. How could you not know about the Rainbow? I'll tell you in short. At 2012 some kind of strange object flew to our planet and blowed nearby. We saw a damn big rainbow for the 10 minutes in the sky. Everybody were joking, like, "They've warned us about the end of the world but the E.T. forces gave a bang with colors and music".

Dialog.Title: Oh, that. I remember, of course.
Dialog.Text: Don't interrupt me. In general, we all calmed down soon, started to live as we lived before. And then it all began. For example, a bus with tourists in Ukraine fall into the ditch on the flat spot. Some people died right there, some broke bones and hurt themselves. They told that it... jumped. The driver came to the place where his bus jumped and jumped himself. At twenty meters up. Letal accident. There were more... People started to disappear all over the world. It used to happen before, but not so often and so much. I mean disappearing, not peoples sudden "jumps". Damn a lot of such places appeared. They were isolated by the goverment. And you know the rest. We are right at this kind of place. Something changed after the day of those fireworks. It is believed that a piece of stone, with all kinds of trash fell onto the planet. And it spreaded. Not only biologically, but energetically. Dont make a pussy face. Even if you can not see something doesn't mean that it is not there. And you can see the consequences everywhere.

Dialog.Title: Something fell, that's for sure.
Dialog.Text: But the fact is that no one sure about anything. They say there are some "Guardians," which anciently guarded the biosphere of our planet. They say they are always invisible and come in shape of totally different people. And when there is some kind of cataclysm, they wake up and rush to the aid... like Chip and Dale. They say there are some installations, or artifacts, or buildings, which are hidden away better than the salary from a wife. And someone need to find them and then to perform some... sacred manipulations. I can not find another words. And I've lack necessary knowledge. The "Whites" can tell you more. But if they decide that you are standing in the way of "Guardians", they kill you.

Dialog.Title: Who are the "Whites"? And there are "Reds"?
Dialog.Text: Don't you make laugh out of them. The "Whites" are rather insane guys. Quite insane. The "Phon", as well as the Rainbow in particular, are subjects of study of many scientists, but there are little or no interest in the Guardians in official circles. So the "Whites" are your best shot. Consider yourself be warned. Keep in mind that the Army are watching anyone who shown an interest to these things. And as you know, the Army's interest have very bad effect on the object of interest. Also there is "Raven Wood" mercenary band. They, too, try to watch everyone. But I suspect their interest is purely mercantile.

Dialog.Title: The Raven Wood?
Dialog.Text: Sounds like a place from Wonderland, huh? Anyway, "Raven Wood" is a milutant group, its members are bandits, killers, thieves. You wouldn't like to mess with them believe me. However, working with them is a good idea. They have a good funding, so you may get your own profit staying in good terms with the Raven Wood.

Dialog.Title: You puzzled me.
Dialog.Text: Yeah, do be careful in the swamp. After all, we drank a bottle together.

Dialog.Title: I will. Goodbye.
Dialog.Text: Good luck.

Dialog.Title: So what are you trying to understand?
The Ravens remind about the debt.
Dialog.Text: Hey, easy... Man, don't push me... I'm just a poor philosopher. My pants and my jacket -- that's all I have. I'm happy that I'm not living in a tub.

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me where the stash?|So, we drank the bottle together, can you tell me how you con the Ravens?
Dialog.Text: Oh, this is a long story... Yes, kid, I see now what you want. I'm not a fool. I just thought... I'm good here, I have everything I need. These places opened my eyes. Do I need this money? No. Because there, behind the perimeter... there is a cursed dying world. The Zone is the place of our hope.

Dialog.Title: Well...
Dialog.Text: Find my hidden stash at square O12. I buried all Ravens money under the lop-sided tree. If that money weren't swallowed by the swamp, they are still there... I wish you to find your purpose. Long ago I was just like you -- young, naive, stupid... But my path helped me to find peace.

Dialog.Title: Liquor Master has the faith crisis.
Dialog.Text: He need his beverage to understand, not to forget. It should be drunk wisely. Tell him not to live in his past and to look through the future! We are at the beginning of something horrifying and awesome at the same time.

Dialog.Title: I thought, we are friends now.|| We drank the bottle together, can you tell me how you con the Ravens?
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: С тебя вороны долг просят
Dialog.Text: Парень... Так я ж тебе уже схрон указал! А больше нету у меня ничего!..

Dialog.Title: А остальные фракции?
Dialog.Text: Белые -- фанатики. На каплю больше фанатизма, и будет вообще секта. Зато среди них больше всего людей с пси-способностями. Не знаю, специально они их набирают или уже непосредственно с ними люди обретают такие особенности. Тоже повод для размышлений. Военные иногда не брезгуют сторонней помощью. Ученые... хм. Если ты безболезненно переносишь получасовые заумные лекции, то к ним тебе в первую очередь я бы советовал сходить. Ну, ты сам решишь. Ладно, друг. Было приятно пообщаться, но мне пора обратно в раздумья. Ты заходи, если что. Может у меня еще появится что рассказать.
Hello. Do you want to use the storage service?

Dialog.Title: What is it?
Dialog.Text: That's what I do in the Zone. I help stalkers keep their stuff safe. If you have just a few things you wanna keep here, I can keep my eye on 'em for free. I'm not the only person who does it. every storage is connected with the others and we provide special delivery service. You can leave your stuff in one storage and take it from another one. Ain't it convenient?

Dialog.Title: How does it work?
Dialog.Text: It's very simple. There're different fractions, such as the military, scientists, bandits. each fraction has storages where its members keep stuff. You leave your stuff in any of the storages. when you need it again, you can take it out from any other storage. Couriers are in charge of delivering your stuff between the storages. But there're certain rules you gotta follow. Firstly, we provide the service only for those who belong to our fraction.

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: So? Do you want to leave here anything?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello. Do you want to use the storage service?

Dialog.Title: What is it?
Dialog.Text: It's the service I give. The stalkers, who want their property to save, are turning to me. I look after their belongings. I can watch for free, if there is nothing of big value. Actually, I'm not the only one who is doing that. We have a whole network in the Zone. And our couriers run between the points. Therefore, any stalker can leave things at one point and take them back in another. Convenient?

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about your network.
Dialog.Text: It's simple. There are military, there are scientists, and there are street gangs, of which we will not speak aloud. All of them have a courier's network. You left things in one place, you can pick up anywhere else, we'll take care of delivery. But there are two important nuances. First, we try to stay out of political background, but the couriers are ordinary people, who belongs to some faction. So don't be surprised, if you can not access your vault in the scientist's camp, for example, before friendship with the scientists have been made. They will not even talk to you. So, if you want to have access to your items, watch for your reputation... Second, we can't risk sending people to their hostile. So don't expect military couriers in the bandits camps.

Dialog.Title: I've got it.
Dialog.Text: So? Want me to watch for your things?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello. Would you like to storage anything?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello. Do you want to use the storage service?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
You've been imprisoned for your crimes. If you try to break away, the guard will open fire immediately. Do something to deserve freedom.

Dialog.Title: Thanks. I get that.
Dialog.Text: Did you bring the voucher?

Dialog.Title: What can I do?
Dialog.Text: Prove that you see the error of your ways. Work for the public good.

Dialog.Title: What exactly do I have to do?
Dialog.Text: Go and find soldier Serov. He'll tell you what to do.

Dialog.Title: Will do.
Dialog.Text: Good for you.

Dialog.Title: Yes. here it is.
Dialog.Text: That's right. Now you're free to go, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Did I cleansed my name?
Dialog.Text: Yes! Well, to the freedom with a clear conscience?

Dialog.Title: Did I cleansed my name?
Dialog.Text: Not at all. Continue to work hard.

Dialog.Title: I still have things to do here.

Dialog.Text: What's up?

Dialog.Title: I wanna get out.
Dialog.Text: It costs 500000.

Dialog.Title: I brought the money.
Dialog.Text: Well done, you're on the right track.

Dialog.Title: Nothing. I was just passing by.
I need your advice
Dialog.Text: What kind of advice?

Dialog.Title: How to get in here again?
Dialog.Text: Whoops! Look at this! Everyone asks me about the way out not in. What's wrong with you? and as I see, killing is upon your conscience, huh?

Dialog.Title: That's right
Dialog.Text: Wow, man. And how do you manage to survive in the Zone?

Dialog.Title: It's very hard.
Dialog.Text: Hard? Listen, you gotta make peace with necessity to kill. Do it if you really wanna get back.

Dialog.Title: You're right.
Dialog.Text: What are you, pacifist?

Dialog.Title: No. It's called fear of blodd
Dialog.Text: Then go and slay some rats first. I'm not a doc to deal with your stupid phobias! Get the hell out!

Dialog.Title: It's just...I don't wanna live in sin.
Dialog.Text: Well I respect that. For an honest stalker it's not right to slay someone without case. But there's the thing...You must have heard about sergeant Kapustin, he's kinda famous in the Zone. He's hanging out in Liubech near the militia office. He's said to help guys deal with their issues for coupons. He might help you as well I assume.

Dialog.Title: Thanks man
Dialog.Text: Anytime, man. You're a nice fella.

Dialog.Title: The Hatter asked me to give you something.
Dialog.Text: Who? Give what?

Dialog.Title: Crutches are ordered.
Dialog.Text: What? Who do you think you're talking to?

Dialog.Title: The ordered crutches are ready.
Dialog.Text: What? Who do you think you're talking to?

Dialog.Title: The order on crutches are ready.
Dialog.Text: What? Who do you think you're talking to?

Dialog.Title: The order for crutches are ready.
Dialog.Text: What? Who do you think you're talking to?

Dialog.Title: Crutches are ready.
Dialog.Text: It seems like you did speak to the Hatter. Listen, haven't we met before? Your face looks familiar. Anyway, I've been waiting for his message.

Dialog.Title: What now?
Dialog.Text: You gotta be out of here as fast as you can. When you are, head for New land, find a pilot there and tell him word for word "The hospital is ready to accept med equipment." Got it? Word for word.

Dialog.Title: What about my reward?
Dialog.Text: The pilot will pay you off, don't worry. And remember, don't ask too many questions.

Dialog.Title: I need a gun.
Dialog.Text: Who doesn't? If you do, buy one, what's a big deal?

Dialog.Title: I need the "Scorpion".
Dialog.Text: Well it's rare! I did have it once. That's the stuff I must say! It's hard to find it in the Zone.

Dialog.Title: Do you know where I can get it?
Dialog.Text: If so, why should I tell you?

Dialog.Title: What do you want for that?
Dialog.Text: We're gonna have kinda party with guys but there's a problem with alkie. So get us some moonshine and I'll tell you more about the' Scorpion", deal?

Dialog.Title: I brought the moonshine.
Dialog.Text: Great, man! The gang will be just happy.

Dialog.Title: A favor for a favor, man.
Dialog.Text: Oh yes. You wanted to know where to get the 'Scorpion", right? I told the gang about you, they'll help. There's a dealer you'll find in a cave in square О3-4. Told him I sent you, he'll help.

Dialog.Title: So, I must turn to the Pusher for the scorpion, right?
Dialog.Text: That's right.

Dialog.Title: I met Mr. Big.
Dialog.Text: You??

Dialog.Title: That's right.
Dialog.Text: Yeah, right! Don't mess with me, stalker.

Dialog.Title: He's a big man, ain't he?
Dialog.Text: He's a very respected crook. If he accepts you, all he gang will too. So, don't jest with him.

So, this is it now. Welcome to the prison. If you are not lucky, then you are here for real and for long. You can escape, for sure, but I would recommend you to go to Bugor. He is in charge here and he can help you.

Dialog.Title: And where is Bugor?
Dialog.Text: He is in the baracks in front of me.

Dialog.Title: Do you know how to escape from here?
Dialog.Text: Hey, it is not a church here! You need to pay for the information. One hundred thousand, not less.

Dialog.Title: I am out of money.
Dialog.Text: Then run for some cigarettes. Find them in the baracks on the shelf. I need to "welcome" newbies here. And I horribly want to smoke.

Dialog.Title: Here is your money.
Dialog.Text: Excellent. And now listen. You can escape by following the railroad.

Dialog.Title: Here are your cigarettes.
Dialog.Text: Excellent. And now listen. You can escape by following the railroad.
So, what brought you here?

Dialog.Title: What can I do fo society?
Dialog.Text: Well, there are several options. I do need, for example, peat bog spider legs. Have you heard of such species? If you get me..let say, six legs I'll speak for you with my high-ranking friends. Unless, you wanna go the easiest way. You can always make a donation. Help your companions and I will speak for ya. Just don't come over every day, one good deed per a day.

Dialog.Title: Here's 75 000.
Dialog.Text: Good. is that all?

Dialog.Title: Here's 175 000.
Dialog.Text: Good, is that all?

Dialog.Title: Here is 290 000.
Dialog.Text: Good, is that all?

Dialog.Title: Here's 500 000.
Dialog.Text: Good, is that all?

Dialog.Title: I'll get you the legs.
Dialog.Text: Great. I need 'em badly, don't ask me what for. Get me six. Remember, six per one day.

Dialog.Title: I brought six legs.
Dialog.Text: Great! Give me those...I'll put 'em into the device right away.

Dialog.Title: Tatar sent you this...
Dialog.Text: Thank you, thank you. But.. where is Nicheporenko? Haven't seen him of late..

Dialog.Title: Will I get a recommendation after that?
Dialog.Text: Ha-ha...Don't be a fool! You're still too green, first you need to gain respect among stalkers. When you're known enough I'll write a decent recommendation for ya.

Dialog.Title: When will I get a recommendation?
Dialog.Text: You've been very helpful with stalkers as I see. Everyone who comes over speaks well of you. I think I will write the recommendation.

Dialog.Title: What can I do for stalkers?
Dialog.Text: Helping other stalkers is a fine gesture. I may well write a recommendation for you if you do a lot of such golden deeds. There's one lad, Corkscrew, he helps me get the trade going. Find him and ask what stuff we're going to need. Help us and I'll speak for you with our customers.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for Temon.
Dialog.Text: Temon? What for?

Dialog.Title: I think he killed someone.
Dialog.Text: There're lots of murderers in the Zone. You've traveled a long way to find one. How come?

Dialog.Title: He's wanted. If I find him I'll be rewarded.
Dialog.Text: You think it's worth it? I spoke to people. Noone is gonna search for him. Noone ever did. No matter who he killed. Every day someone is killed here.

Dialog.Title: He pretended to be Temon.
Dialog.Text: Wait a sec...I thought HE was Temon. Lousy liar! He used to help a lot, told he was sorry with what he did...And I didn't see what he had to be guilty of. Temon was a great lad! He did a lot for stalkers. Such a bastard one must be to kill him first and then pretended to be him.

Dialog.Title: Help me to find him.
Dialog.Text: I'd love to but I don't know where he is. You can get to New Land by air. You'll be lucky if find him here.

Dialog.Title: Every criminal must be punished.
Dialog.Text: Every? You came here to lecture him? Now there's a superman. I spoke to people. Noone is gonna search for him. Noone ever did. No matter who he killed. Every day someone is killed.

Dialog.Title: Eager to know why he killed Temon.
Helping my friend.
Dialog.Text: Personal motive.. I see. Strong motivation.

Dialog.Title: *Show the threatening letters*|Someone keeps sending me threatening letters. May I count on your help?
Dialog.Text: We're stalkers of the old stock, we help each other. Mind your reputation and we'll always be there. The man you're looking for was seen near Tukguska. I know people who can help. And they will help you but only if they know you're worth it. Are you sure you fit in here?

Dialog.Title: *Show the threatening letters*| Someone keeps sending me threatening letters. May I count on your help?
Dialog.Text: Sure! We don't leave our people in the lurch. I know those fearless freaks, who're mopping up the most critical areas of the Zone. Wherever your enemy is we'll find him soon ot later.

Dialog.Title: Tacklberry told me to stay away from you.
Dialog.Text: Damn, I haven't heard of him in a long time. Be careful, stalker, you'd better stay away from that man, he's completely insane. Why did you turn to him in teh first place?

Dialog.Title: He started the Wild Hunt.
Dialog.Text: Oh man! I thought I'd finally brought him into his senses. His idea of provoking a war is insane. We have to stop him, we can't let him finish what he started.

Dialog.Title: I have started the Wild Hunt.
Dialog.Text: Are you nuts? What did we all do to you? Listen, people have business here, they collect artifacts, earn money. Scientists do their researches. Everyone's in the pictutre. People die everyday, what's a big deal? So do they outside the Zone. If there's a war agaisnt the Zone, how many do you think will die in vain?

Dialog.Title: What do you suggest?
Dialog.Text: Tell Tacklberry if he doesn't stop, the entire Zone will learn what he's up to. I mean everyone, the white, the bandits, the military. Then he 'll face tough times.

Dialog.Title: But Tacklberry IS right!
Dialog.Text: You freak! You'd better pray your plan will work out or, I swear, you'll be dead long before the end of the world you're waiting for.

Dialog.Title: I will stop him.
Dialog.Text: There you go. Now you're being sensible! Just imagine what mess it would be if Tacklberry brought his idea into life.

Dialog.Title: I did what I had to. I'd better be going no. I have to talk to Tacklberry.
Dialog.Text: Take care, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: War can yield fruit if it's based on faith.
Dialog.Text: I thought you weren't one of the white...but you do sound like one. You're talking about war, huh? You know what, I've had enough and I've seen enough. War is not worth what people believe they fight for. It's always easier to break than to make, you know. But...the war is neverending, people have always been fighting, it's hard to imaging the world without it. I'm a dreamer, still hope there will be some miracle one day. But everyone has gold fever even here, stalkers kill each other for their own profit.

Dialog.Title: If you want peace you have to fight for it.
Dialog.Text: Maybe you're right. This is a place where you can become anybody you want. I have good friends in the right places...who knows, maybe I'll make good friends with military men and we'll sort all the things out and it won't be so frightening to live in the Zone anymore. I'm kind at heart, stalker, although I did make awful things. Anyway, I'm not gonna confess here, it'll take all day...

Dialog.Title: You didn't fall on your knees. Help others to get on their feet. (honor)
Dialog.Text: I think there're people among the military who will follow me. I'm not trying to show off, stalker, it's just I worked hard to deserve confidence and I still remember what I'm capable of. Probably, I should find real soldiers. Thank you, stalker, you opened my eyes. Who is your leader? Maybe I'll talk to him.

Dialog.Title: They'll crush you and bring you to your knees. (anger)
Dialog.Text: They can, I guess. But they'd better not. I am retired, but that doesn't mean I forgot how to fight. You know what I think, stalker? You are right. You are so right. It's ime to remember who I really am. I'll take care of everything myself, I have to fight. I will fight. Thank you, stalker, you opened my eyes. Tell me where I can learn more about things you preach.

Dialog.Title: Fedor the Prophet will tell you more. Go and find him.
Dialog.Text: Prophet, huh? Maybe he'll prophesy something for me.

Dialog.Title: How about something a little more interesting to do?
Dialog.Text: It's Tunguska, stalker, not an entertainment center. I do have a mission for you, which is about clearing the area off the mutants and collecting certain materials. There are ponds all around, so it makes this place perfect for such mutants as verliocks and jellies. I want you to get a shelled verliock leg and brutor bones. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: No problem. I'll get you verliock legs.
Dialog.Text: I like your attitude. Off you go, then, I'll be waiting for you here.

Dialog.Title: Всего-то?! Ну, готовь награду!
Dialog.Text: А ты не радуйся раньше времени. Сперва добейся, ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Here I am.
Dialog.Text: Well done! Here you go. Comу over tomorrow if you can, let's test you even more.

Dialog.Title: Hope there will be enough mutants to shoot.
Dialog.Text: You ain't a shy fella, huh? See you around.

Dialog.Title: I'll get you the bones.
Dialog.Text: Deal.

Dialog.Title: The bigger they are, the harder they fall!
Dialog.Text: You're back! I see you're pretty much alright. Give me what you brought. Here's your reward. Hey, you can get me more every day. The more the better.

Dialog.Title: Ok. I'll keep that in mind.
Dialog.Text: I wish you mice hunt, stalker.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a missing plane...
Dialog.Text: Good luck with that. Watch yourself.

Dialog.Title: I will try. Thank you for nothing.
Leonid Ceaser sent me.
Dialog.Text: What does he want this time?

Dialog.Title: Here're his papers.
Dialog.Text: Now I see...I just don't get why he's investigating the plane case over again.

Dialog.Title: What do you mean again?
Dialog.Text: You're not the first to question me about the plane. Military men were here, they were looking for the very same aircraft..they told me to keep my mouth shut about that, told it was top secret, do you understand?

Dialog.Title: Where did they go?
Dialog.Text: They didn't leave Tunguska, that's for sure. I think I can worm where exactly they are.

Dialog.Title: What do you know about Tacklberry?
Dialog.Text: We were together at the same flash point. He did well at first, but then..he went a little nuts.. and slaughtered all the locals. I heard he was taking some forbid stimulators...And now he happens to be here..

Dialog.Title: What's he up to?
Dialog.Text: I'm telling you, he wants people and mutants to have sort of a final battle. He's sure the Zone is our mutual enemy. Freak!

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for sale.
Someone excavated old mines...
Dialog.Text: Are you talking of the pits near the village? I thought they were abandoned long ago. Anyway, I don't care even if someone was looking for something in there. They're empry.

Dialog.Title: What are those pits?
Dialog.Text: Soviet geologists were extracting minerals there. It was a long time ago, long before the Zone appeared. If you want to know more about them, go and see there abandoned village in the east.

Dialog.Title: Someone tried to kill me!
Dialog.Text: Well...you were sniffing out. Hey, someome wants to talk to you. That man says his name's Woolf. He's waiting for you in a church. Listen to me, stalker, I've seen a lot here. But the way he looked at me made my blood turn to ice. So, if I were you, I'd hurry. Don't make him wait, stalker.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for the dig site.
Dialog.Text: I saw some holes to the east from the village not far from the entrance.

Dialog.Title: I need protection.
Dialog.Text: I'm sorry, but I'm not going to mess with Wolf. You wouldn't either if you knew who he's working for. Let you rest in peace, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Держи 25к
Dialog.Text: 7211 к проверке

Dialog.Title: Who are you?
Dialog.Text: People call me Retired Colonel. Hey, do you want to work for public goods?

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Sure! There're plenty of things that you can do. If you approve yourself I can get some stuff for you and even show you the "specific" goods.

Dialog.Title: I see.
Dialog.Text: So, what do you say?

Dialog.Title: Donation.
Dialog.Text: I think that job will cost me 175 000.

Dialog.Title: Donation.
Dialog.Text: I think that job will cost me 75 000.

Dialog.Title: Donation.
Dialog.Text: I think that job will cost me 500 000.

Dialog.Title: Donation.
Dialog.Text: I think that job will cost me 290 000.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals...Oh, who am I kidding? Of course I do! What's up?

Dialog.Title: We need to lose a tail.
Egor the Sniper sent me here.
Dialog.Text: Did he?

Dialog.Title: He wanted to remind you of "those two doggies".
Dialog.Text: I see...Is he so busy that he couldn't have showen up himself?

Dialog.Title: He wanted to know why you're so sad.
Dialog.Text: Am I? Was he looking at me through his sight?

Dialog.Title: He's doing well...
Dialog.Text: Nice to know that.

Dialog.Title: Kind of.
Dialog.Text: Alright, this is for you, then.

Dialog.Title: I met Lieutenant Still.
Dialog.Text: So what?

Dialog.Title: I'd like to know more about him...
Dialog.Text: And decied to ask me because I'm a "colonel", right?

Dialog.Title: Kind of.
Dialog.Text: Well, you came to the right place. That man is sneaky. If I were you I wouldn't believe any of his words. And I wouldn't reccomend to argue with him.Anyway, I warned you.

Dialog.Title: Have you ever crossed paths with him?
Dialog.Text: I see what you're doing stalker. Think twice before you ask.

Dialog.Title: Have you ever crossed paths with him?
Dialog.Text: I see what you're doing stalker. Think twice before you ask.

Dialog.Title: Have you ever crossed paths with him?
Dialog.Text: I see what you're doing stalker. Think twice before you ask.
Sup?

Dialog.Title: Hey. Could you tell me more about this place?
Dialog.Text: Dunno nothin'. Ask somebody else.

Dialog.Title: Why so tense, man?
Dialog.Text: My job is to keep an eye on the railways. Yours is to keep quiet. Come on, move your ass.

Dialog.Title: And where are bread, salt, shows?
Dialog.Text: Find Blacksmith and you will have it all. And if you keep joking, then you go back in a luggage wagon.

Dialog.Title: Got it. I'd better be going.
Where's all the fun?
Dialog.Text: Find Blacksmith, maybe he'll entertain you, funny boy. You'd better move on or I'll make you go back in a baggage car.

Dialog.Title: Want a cigarette?
Dialog.Text: Sure! Oh..that's.. so good. Haven't had one in a week! Thinking about giving up..but that seems impossible in the Zone..you know.

Dialog.Title: Well..You're right. Cigarettes ain't more dangerous than this place.
Dialog.Text: That's what I'm talking about! I would have been dead long ago or gone mad if it hadn't been for cigarettes...I'm going nuts here, the post Acid gave me is killing me! Hate the railroad! I Hate newcomers full of excitement.... they don't even know what they stepped into...Anyway, thanks for a cigarette, man.

Dialog.Title: Smoking kills, man.
Dialog.Text: What are you, a doctor? I would have been dead long ago or gone mad if it hadn't been for cigarettes...I'm going nuts here, the post Acid gave me is killing me! Hate the railroad! IHate newcomers full of excitement.... they don't even know what they stepped into...Anyway, thanks fo ra cigarette, man.

Dialog.Title: I have some question about the Zone.
Dialog.Text: So what? Keep your stupid qusetions to yourself. If you wanna go ahead, keep a still tongue in your head.

Dialog.Title: Are they lyrics of your new song?
Dialog.Text: Damn you!

Dialog.Title: I have some questions.
Dialog.Text: Hm...

Dialog.Title: Do you know where the rails lead to?
Dialog.Text: Of course I do. They lead to the eastwest. But further there're too many anomalies, so this station is the final stop. We offload the cars here and send 'em back to the check point. Then wait for more supplies.

Dialog.Title: Do you know anything about the accident on the bridge?
Dialog.Text: Of course! The train didn't arrive when it had to so I sent people to see what was going on. That's how I found out about an anomaly the train got stuck into and the wreck happened on the bridge.

Dialog.Title: How do I get out of the Zone?
Dialog.Text: I'm not the one who can help you with this. The train goes to the check point from this place. Without a special permission you won't be let anywhere...Listen, why don't you ask stalkers about that?

Dialog.Title: What if I had a permission?
Dialog.Text: You ain't likely to get one if you don't have the right connections outside the perimeter.

Dialog.Title: How did you get into the Zone?
Dialog.Text: I wish I could forget that time..so embarassing. I was green and stupid and came here seeking for wealth and fame. But..the things didn't work out the way I expected. I was lucky to meet Blacksmith though, he gave me a job...No what? I'm stuck here with no money and no courage. Ain't got nothing here and outside the perimeter...

Dialog.Title: I'd better be off.
Dialog.Text: Have fun!

Dialog.Title: Do you anything about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: Why are you interested anyway? All I know is that he had a quarrel with Pechkin over kinda toys or something...After the fight he even started looking for a gun for a better protection, strange, huh? You'd better ask Pechkin about that.

Dialog.Title: Why did you lie about Pechkin?
Dialog.Text: Wut?? I...I didn't..

Dialog.Title: No way! There's a huge anomaly on the way.
Dialog.Text: You think, you're smart, huh? Let see how long you're gonna hold out.

Dialog.Title: Do you know anyone with such connections?
Dialog.Text: Dunno who exactly but they must be top dogs, you know. Such as Blacksmith, Acid or Sergeant Dibenko. There's also a man among the white coats, named Simonov.

Dialog.Title: I'm ready to hear you out.
Dialog.Text: I've had the same weird dream in days. Every damn night. I'm standing on the railway and there's a train coming toward me at full speed, but I can't move so I just keep standing and watching the on-coming train. Then I notice a truck moving by my side, I try to draw driver's attentions but in vain. Then I see a guy hanging out of the truck. He smiled at me and says "Spit on the road to attract the luck." Then I wake up..

Dialog.Title: Nonsense...
Dialog.Text: It's just a dream.

Dialog.Title: Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Ха! Значит жив ещё чертяка! И своих друзей не забывает! Ну, если снова увидишь его, то поздравь от меня с Новым Годом! Спасибо тебе, сталкер! Прими и ты мои поздравления, и самые наилучшие пожелания в новом году! И вот тебе небольшой Новогодний подарочек.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Пожалуйста! Просить песенку спетья я не буду, не маленький ты уже! Ха-ха! Но, если отгадаешь загадку, то достанется тебе ещё небольшой подарочек. Слушай. Случился прошлой зимой со мной такой случай. Возвращался я с Каравана в Любеч и по дороге потерял очень редкий артефакт! Повздыхал и решил идти обратно, искать где артефакт обронил. Не оставлять же такую находку кому попало! Но идти уже другой дорогой, покороче. Ну и пошёл - лесом, полем, полем, лесом... И вдруг, река передо мной! Представляешь, я на карте её не заметил, когда путь прокладывал. А я же плавать-то совсем не умею! И лодки нигде нет. Но, в итоге я на другой берег переправился и артефакт свой нашёл. Вот и скажи мне, стелкер, как я на другой берег переправился?

Dialog.Title: Построил плот?
Dialog.Text: Эх, невниательный ты слушатель, сталкер! Дело было зимой! По льду я переправился! Ха-ха-ха! Ну, бывай!

Dialog.Title: Научился плавать?
Dialog.Text: Эх, невниательный ты слушатель, сталкер! Дело было зимой! По льду я переправился! Ха-ха-ха! Ну, бывай!

Dialog.Title: Нашёл брод
Dialog.Text: Эх, невниательный ты слушатель, сталкер! Дело было зимой! По льду я переправился! Ха-ха-ха! Ну, бывай!

Dialog.Title: Отрастил жабры?
Dialog.Text: Эх, невниательный ты слушатель, сталкер! Дело было зимой! По льду я переправился! Ха-ха-ха! Ну, бывай!

Dialog.Title: По льду?
Dialog.Text: Ну конечно! Молодец! Внимательно историю слушал! Держи приз! Ну, свидимся ещё! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Говорят, многие проблемы идут из детства...
Dialog.Text: Да иди ты! Наш-шелся тут мозгоправ еще один. Ничё в моем детстве не было такого...

Dialog.Title: А чего такой хмурый стал?
Dialog.Text: Чё ты прилип ко мне? В деревне я в детстве жил. При колхозе. В школу поселковую ходил за три... версты.

Dialog.Title: А с поездами было что-то связано?
Dialog.Text: Ты в голову ко мне залезть пытаешься? Ну... Не помню я. Но мать говорила, что я когда мелкий был, чуть под поезд не попал. Сильно напугался. Типа, потому я и з-заикаюсь. Но я не помню ни шиша. Так что все... иди по своим делам. К-кузнец с Кислым и так меня лечат-лечат, залечили уже к чертовой матери...
Hello.

Dialog.Title: I've heard you know a lot about the Zone.
Dialog.Text: Guess I do. Fell free to ask any question.

Dialog.Title: Questions?...
Dialog.Text: Come on. Pick up a question.

Dialog.Title: О зоне.
Dialog.Text: Ну зона, за перемитром наверно наслушался, так вот все это чес, понты зоны иследовано, остальное тайна, кто ходил далеко и выжел не колится, кто не вернулся уже не раскажет уж точно, правда постоянно чтото новое находят, пещеры, подземные тунели, говорят ктото дорогу на острова знает, ктото может через степь в тунгуску пройти, но кто и как эт пока на уровне слухов.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about places to visit.
Dialog.Text: There're lots of different places you can heard for. The most popular are two villages called Liubech and Ryabinushka.

Dialog.Title: Tall me about anomalies...
Dialog.Text: Anomalies are dangerous but useful in same cases. Things that can be pulled out of 'em can be sold at a very good price. By the way, I've heard from a colonel, a good friend of mine..if you see him, say hello from me. Where was I? Oh yes...he says there's a mountain in Ryabinushka which hides a very, VERY expensive artifact.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about monsters of the Zone...
Dialog.Text: You gotta talk to Misha the Hunter, he knows a lot about different sort of creatures. Did you know, by the way, that local people make souvenirs out of mutant parts and bones? Stalkers kill the monsters for 'em and make some cash on that.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about stalkers' equipment...
Dialog.Text: It's something that's worth spending money on. You can always buy the minimum set, but if you wanna have something special, you gotta get along with the right people who can help you.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about clans...
Dialog.Text: That's the way to maintain the law in the Zone. There're very powerful clans, which control large territories and whose members are powerful and respectful people here.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about local hucksters...
Dialog.Text: They all have a leader who tells 'em what they're "allowed to do", you know. All serious people work for him, even me.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about bandits...
Dialog.Text: I'm not sure I can tell you a lot. Some of 'em are real jerks, you know, but others are quite nice guys. But to know who is who, you gotta spend some time talking to local people, trading with 'em, fighting shoulder to shoulder.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about prison...
Dialog.Text: If you're to mess with the law, you might well be sent to prison. You're likely to be treat badly there, the guard men are usually tough. So you'd better try to stay away from that place. If your reputation leaves much to be desired, try to keep your head down. In that case you mat try talking to the former colonel, if you get along with him, you know.

Dialog.Title: I wanna know more about the Zone.
Dialog.Text: You must have already heard a lot about the Zone by now, I think. But I wouldn't recommend that you believe everything you hear. The Zone is full of great mysteries. I even heard there's a secret path to Tunguska through the prairie.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about stalkers...
Dialog.Text: Do you think I can tell you more than you already know? You're a stalker.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about trading...
Dialog.Text: You don't mind making some extra cash, do you?

Dialog.Title: Tell me about the law, bandits and raiders...
Dialog.Text: Do you know who set the rules? People that possess power and money. You may well be locked in jail, if your reputation is low, I wouldn't recommend you to try that.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about traders...
Dialog.Text: It's simple. There are places where stalkers are shuffled, trading with each other and some becoming professional traders. Also there are some "official" traders who trade supplies from "big earth" for rare goods. There are no big markets as you can see, because, to be honest, it's not fully legal.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about raiders...
Dialog.Text: Remember to stay sharp wherever you go.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about the Zone...
I'm gonna take off.
Dialog.Text: See ya.

Dialog.Title: Do you know why Prockhor is so angry?
Dialog.Text: If you were him you would be feeling tired too, believe me. I think he gotta smoke to let the steam off. i know he's trying to quit but it's been hard for him.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about recent events...
Dialog.Text: We've had lots of things going on.

Dialog.Title: We need drinks for the party.
Dialog.Text: Alcohol? Why do you think I have some? All that I have here, in front of you.

Dialog.Title: Ivy, be nice. Share some with me.
Dialog.Text: Alright, alright, don't look at me like this! I'll help you.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about rare weapon...
Dialog.Text: Oh I've seen an old man with a barrett recently. A barrett! Can you imagine?

Dialog.Title: Tell me about the wreck on the bridge...
Dialog.Text: I've heard bandits from a northern village ruined the bridge....then they "worked on" the railway and the train got stuck in the tunnel without a chance to move back or forth.

Dialog.Title: Where do the rails lead?
Dialog.Text: The leave nowhere! Haven't you heard me saying the bandits ruined the rails? The train can't go further the station.

Dialog.Title: Is there a way out of the Zone?
Dialog.Text: There're so called fractions, that unite people of the same "occupations", such as military, scientists, traders. Try to help 'em with anything they may need. When your reputation is pretty high, you get a chance to cross the boarder, do whatever you've planned to do. But think twice, my friend, it's not all that bad in here after all.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about visitors...
Dialog.Text: I remember one weird man, he was wearing a hooded jacket so that his face could be hardly seen. I think he was carrying very expensive loot in his backpack and was about to sell it somewhere by the perimeter.

Dialog.Title: How long did he stay here?
Dialog.Text: It didn't take him long. He headed for the village without even spending a night at the station. But I haven't seen him ever since..he must have been caught by mutants.

Dialog.Title: Do you know anything about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: It's very sad when such young men die here, you know. Temon was an ambitious guy and...stupidly risky.

Dialog.Title: Have you heard of the Dark Stalker?
Dialog.Text: Of course, it's an old legend of the Zone. According to it, there were two stalkers who had a fight over the loot and when one of 'em fell asleep, the other one shot him dead. Guess what happened next! The nest day he sold the loot and when he was sitting at a bar, his former companion, the Dark Stalker, came up to him and said "where's my half?" Then he took the bandages off his head and there was just half of his head left, the one which wasn't harm, you know. That must be a scene!

Dialog.Title: Tell me about the Dark Stalker...
What happened after that?
Dialog.Text: Well...actually there's just one bartender left who told that story. People say, the dark Stalker is still in the Zone, seeking for unfair stalkers to punish 'em.

Dialog.Title: Okay...
Dialog.Text: Here's my advice, stalker. Don't play with the law, be fair and kind to others if you don't wanna meet the Dark Stalker face to face.

Dialog.Title: И что потом?
Dialog.Text: В баре том все спиртягой отравились насмерть. Только бармен выжил, он и поведал историю людям. А Темный Сталкер, поговаривают, до сих пор бродит по Зоне. Ищет тех, у кого совесть не чиста. Я [те] так скажу, работ у него [дофига]. С чистой совестью тут туговато.

Dialog.Title: Понял...
Dialog.Text: Не нарушь закона, сталкер, живи праведно, не то Темный Сталкер придет за тобой, положит в землюшку да сверху присыплет.

Dialog.Title: I'm sure you know a riddle!
Dialog.Text: Why are you interested? Anyway, I do know several riddles. My friend, don't take me wrong, but I want you to do me a favor first.

Dialog.Title: I expected that. Spit it out.
Dialog.Text: I had a little problem with my gun. This Desert Eagle was almost new, can you believe it's broken? To make it work again, I gotta get a new bolt. Why don't get me one?

Dialog.Title: Deal. I'll get you that.
Dialog.Text: You're a good man, my friend!

Dialog.Title: I brought the bolt.
Dialog.Text: Thank you. Here's you reward and a riddle from me "Water gives it life, but what a trick! It fears water like a chick and always dies if soaked."

Dialog.Title: Thanks! See you later.
Dialog.Text: You take care, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hi there. What's up?

Dialog.Title: Got some cash?
Dialog.Text: I'll give you some if you get me couple of "Broken Screens".

Dialog.Title: I brought the broken screens.
Dialog.Text: Good news, man. They're always useful.

Dialog.Title: Gotcha. Wait for me here, I'll be back.
Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Ух, ты! Не забывает Артур своих друзей! Если его встретишь, то и от меня непременно поздравь с Новым Годом! Спасибо тебе за весточку от друга, сталкер! Прими и ты мои поздравления, и самые наилучшие пожелания в новом году! И как полагается небольшой Новогодний подарочек.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Пожалуйста! А хочешь ещё небольшой сюрнриз? Отгадай загадку. Идут два сталкера и разговаривают. - Когда послезавтра станет вчера, - говорит один из них, - то сегодня будет так же далеко от воскресенья, как и тот день который был сегодня, когда позавчера было завтра. В какой день сталкеры разговаривали?

Dialog.Title: Понедельник
Dialog.Text: Эх, не угадал! Воскресенье! Запутал я тебя! Ха-ха! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Вторник
Dialog.Text: Эх, не угадал! Воскресенье! Запутал я тебя! Ха-ха! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Среда
Dialog.Text: Эх, не угадал! Воскресенье! Запутал я тебя! Ха-ха! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Вторник
Dialog.Text: Эх, не угадал! Воскресенье! Запутал я тебя! Ха-ха! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Суббота
Dialog.Text: Эх, не угадал! Воскресенье! Запутал я тебя! Ха-ха! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Четверг
Dialog.Text: Эх, не угадал! Воскресенье! Запутал я тебя! Ха-ха! Бывай!

Dialog.Title: Воскресенье
Dialog.Text: Моолдец! Конечно воскресенье! Ну, держи приз! С Новым Годом!

Dialog.Title: Who buys the screens from you?
Dialog.Text: Why are you asking? I won't tell you anyway, I have no reason to...

Dialog.Title: How about cash?
Dialog.Text: Are you saying you'd like to make a contribution? If so, you'd better pay well. The more you give, the nicer I treat you, if you know what I mean.

Dialog.Title: What should I give you as contribution?
Dialog.Text: Screens. That's my trade. There're screens α and β. Get me 10 each.

Dialog.Title: And what comes next?
Dialog.Text: I'll tell the "big bosses" about you, they'll decide if they wanna cooperate with you or not. Actually, it's also up to them wether you live or die. I'm not the one who's working for them, man. There are lots of others. If they only knew how much those arts actually cost, you know, "outside the perimeter'...

Dialog.Title: I don't believe you, man. I'd better be going.
Dialog.Text: You gotta know how to tell the truth from a lie. It's kinda useful skill in the Zone.

Dialog.Title: Alright. This time I believe you. If you try to fool me, I'll kill you.
Dialog.Text: If not you, then somebody else will. The strongest motivation to run a fair business is a loaded gun held by a customer.

Dialog.Title: Here I am. Learned the alphabet by heart.
Dialog.Text: Wow, it was fast. Well, a deal is a deal. Artifacts for recommendations, as agreed. You can always find me here. There're lots of artifacts in the Zone and those who will eager to buy them.

Dialog.Title: I'm waiting for the results, remember?
Dialog.Text: Calm down, I'm not gonna mess with you. To be honest, I didn't expect you to be back,but since you're here, good news for you. The employers are ready to cooperate.

Dialog.Title: Good to know that. But don't you try to lie to me again.
Dialog.Text: Let's just leave all the little misunderstanding behind.

Dialog.Title: Okay, so how are we gonna work?
Dialog.Text: Everything is very simple. First, there's an employer, second, there's his partner in the Zone. I tell you want they offer and you choose who you wanna work for. You may choose to help all of 'em as well. So, what do you say?

Dialog.Title: I say I'm in.
Dialog.Text: Great. Just wait a minute, I'll show you want the offers are.

Dialog.Title: "Splendor" Company.
Dialog.Text: "Splendor" is a cosmetic company. We believe that beauty has universal value for all of us. Beauty is a language understood by everyone. We apply the best of the newest technologies to make our products.

Dialog.Title: The "Fabulous" museum.
Dialog.Text: Would you like to find yourself in the Land of Oz? Do you want to dive into the world of fantasy and magic? The "Fabulous" museum will lead you to the Land of unknown mysteries. The night at the museum will cost you about 40 000 euro.

Dialog.Title: "Terminus Ultima" Research Company.
Dialog.Text: Only high qualified professionals work for the "Terminus Ultima" Research Company. Our labs are well equipped and ready to serve for the public good. Welcome to the world of science. "Terminus Ultima" is your best choice.

Dialog.Title: Sounds nice. I'll take it.
Dialog.Text: Doctor Flayer will be a go-betweener. You'll find him on Vesuvius in the camp called "Aegis", he'll tell you all the details. Try to keep your head down and don't talk much about what you're up to.

Dialog.Title: I don't think I might be interested. Anything else?
Dialog.Text: It's up to you. Sure.

Dialog.Title: I don't think it's my thing.
Dialog.Text: As you say.

Dialog.Title: Cool! I'll take it.
Dialog.Text: Great. Find stalker named Corkscrew. He can be found on Vesuvius, ask him for more details.

Dialog.Title: Sounds ambitious. I'll take it.
Dialog.Text: Good choice. Money is said to be good as well. Find Vitek on Novaya Zemlya, he'll tell you more.

Dialog.Title: Crazy white coats? No thanks.
Dialog.Text: What if our future is on 'em?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hey, do you have heads for me? Puppy heads, I mean. I accept at least ten at a time.

Dialog.Title: What do you need heads for?|Ten? What for?
Dialog.Text: I'm a business man and I'll pay you well for them, that's all you need to know. I accept 10 puppy heads at a time.

Dialog.Title: I see. I'll get you some.
I see. Good luck with your business.
I brought the heads.
Dialog.Text: Give them to me, I'll see if the size is right.

Dialog.Title: I have some questions.
Dialog.Text: Ask quickly. Don't waist my time.

Dialog.Title: Have you heard about the truck wreck?
Dialog.Text: What trucks? Haven't heard anything.

Dialog.Title: Is it possible to get out of the Zone?
Dialog.Text: Why on the world would I want to get out? I'm nobody outside the Zone. The Zone gave me the shelter and the job.

Dialog.Title: How do you manage to trade with people outside the Zone, then?
Dialog.Text: I know the right people. Anyway, it's not your business.

Dialog.Title: How did you get into the Zone?
Dialog.Text: I "bought" the ticket. One stalker showed me the way. Not for free, of course.

Dialog.Title: Can you show me that way?...I wanna get out.
Dialog.Text: There's no way out. At least, with that route. There're anomalous places.

Dialog.Title: That's all I wanted to know. Thanks
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hey. What do you have for me today? Tails or meat?

Dialog.Title: What do you mean by 'tails'?
Dialog.Text: Are you a newbie here? We use rat tails to make souvenirs, it's a good way to make money. I accept at least 10 tails at a time.

Dialog.Title: Got it. I'll get you some.
I brought tails.
Dialog.Text: Give them to me, here is your reward.

Dialog.Title: Stick sent me. Do you have "the stuff" for me?
Dialog.Text: Stick sent you?? Prove it!

Dialog.Title: I know "the words".
Dialog.Text: OK...ahem..."Today the sky is clean ..."

Dialog.Title: ...but I'm duisturbed by someone's call..
Dialog.Text: Five hundred...

Dialog.Title: ...but I'm disturbed by someone's scream...
Dialog.Text: I don't know anybody by the name Stick. Get lost!

Dialog.Title: ...but I'm disturbed by someone's dream...
Dialog.Text: Don't know anybody by the name Stick. Get lost!

Dialog.Title: I don't have enough.
Dialog.Text: Why are you waisting my time then? Get money first, than come to me.

Dialog.Title: Five? How about three hundred?
Dialog.Text: Deal.

Dialog.Title: Take it.
Dialog.Text: Next time bring it on time or I'll give your order to somebody else. Anyway...the stuff for you will be left under a bench in the park.

Dialog.Title: Take it.
Dialog.Text: Next time bring it on time or I'll give your order to somebody else. Anyway...the stuff for you will be left under a bench in the park.

Dialog.Title: Ну и...?
Dialog.Text: Так. Залежалась ваша партия. Впредь деньги не задерживайте. А то мигом другие покупатели найдутся.

Dialog.Title: Не кипиши. Там проблемы с военными.
Dialog.Text: Пусть Палка свои проблемы решает и не светит меня кому попало. Короче... По этому делу ко мне больше не ходи. Товар оставят в парке, под скамейкой. И впредь посылки будут только там. Если вообще будут... А то с такой оплатой я еще подумаю.

Dialog.Title: What do you need meat for?
Dialog.Text: To eat it, of course! Don't like hunting myself, but I do like inspecting abandoned houses - a deal of useful stuff can be found inside. Recently I've come across a wonderful place, which location I'd like to keep in secret, that's full of 9x18 rounds. I'd keep them but I'm not a hunter...Anyway, I bet you need 'em more, so get me two slabs of raw meat and I'll share the rounds.

Dialog.Title: Deal. I'll get you the meat.
I brought the meat.
Dialog.Text: Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: Here
Dialog.Text: Well done. Here rounds for you. Come again if you need more.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: Sorry man, I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Deal. I'll get you the meat.
Here
Dialog.Text: Well done. Here rounds for you. Come again if you need more.

Dialog.Title: Here
Dialog.Text: Well done. Here rounds for you. Come again if you need more.

Dialog.Title: Here. More meat.
Dialog.Text: Ho! Daily delivery!

Dialog.Title: Need more meat?
Dialog.Text: Of course!

Dialog.Title: What do you need meat for?
Dialog.Text: To eat it, of course! Don't like hunting myself, but I do like inspecting abandoned houses - a deal of useful stuff can be found inside. Recently I've come across a wonderful place, which location I'd like to keep in secret, that's full of 9x18 rounds. I'd keep them but I'm not a hunter...Anyway, I bet you need 'em more, so get me two slabs of raw meat and I'll share the rounds.

Dialog.Title: I brought two slabs of meat.
Dialog.Text: Let's take a look...

Dialog.Title: Here!
Dialog.Text: Well done. Here rounds for you. Come again if you need more.
Do you have rat tails or puppy heads? I'll buy tails, heads. I'll take 10 pieces and give a good price.

Dialog.Title: Wait, I'll bring it.
Dialog.Text: Yes. Bring more. The more the better.

Dialog.Title: Why so cheap?
Dialog.Text: Cheap?! You'll not find better prices around and you have not need to walk far.

Dialog.Title: I brought you rat tails.
Dialog.Text: Let's have a look.

Dialog.Title: I brought you puppy heads.
Dialog.Text: Let's have a look.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
People call me Spit. I sell goods and exchange rounds for artifacts. What brought you here?

Dialog.Title: I have money. Show me the goods.
Арты принес. Давай меняться.
Dialog.Text: Ну показывай, что принес. Какие арты в Зоне накопал? Учти, каждый арт беру по две штуки, не меньше!

Dialog.Title: Экраны
Dialog.Text: Показывай! Беру по две штуки! Взамен могу дать патроны для дробовика. Отдаю по 10 пачек.

Dialog.Title: Подушки
Dialog.Text: Показывай! Беру по две штуки! Взамен могу дать патроны для винтовки. Отдаю по 10 пачек.

Dialog.Title: Стабы
Dialog.Text: Показывай! Беру по две штуки! Взамен могу дать патроны для автомата. Отдаю по 10 пачек.

Dialog.Title: Щиты
Dialog.Text: Показывай! Беру по две штуки! Взамен могу дать патроны для пистолета. Отдаю по 15 пачек. Или гранаты, 6 пачек.

Dialog.Title: Держи.
Dialog.Text: За хабар твой могу дать патроны для дробовика. Отдаю по 10 пачек. Выбирай.

Dialog.Title: Держи.
Dialog.Text: За хабар твой могу дать патроны для винтовки. Отдаю по 10 пачек. Выбирай.

Dialog.Title: Держи.
Dialog.Text: За хабар твой могу дать патроны для автомата. Отдаю по 10 пачек. Выбирай.

Dialog.Title: Держи.
Dialog.Text: За хабар твой могу дать патроны для пистолета. Отдаю по 15 пачек. Или гранаты, 6 пачек. Выбирай.

Dialog.Title: I don't have anything for exchange.
Acid sends you his greetings.|Are you Spit? Kolya Acid sends you his greetings. He asks how you are doing.
Dialog.Text: Ah! Acid! I remeber him! We have walked a lot together. Damn... He was the greatest anomaly lurker! Well... before the accident... We walked through places which are even scary to mention. Acid was brave like he had his head cut already, you know. But I am no hero myself. I was only bringing ammo to my mates. So I became a good trader. Tell him I am doing OK. I found a nice place for trading. I have a good business now. I'm gonna save some arts and cash and buy a little island.

Dialog.Title: He'll be happy to know you're doing well.
I want a repair kit.
Dialog.Text: I have one repair kit for rare equipment. I will sell it for 2 "Screens" and 80000. I can accept payment in parts: first money, then artefacts. But I dont lend anything. So you first bring me everything and then I give you the repair kit.

Dialog.Title: I haven't collected anything yet.
Dialog.Text: Well, then come back when you are done.

Dialog.Title: I brought everything.
Dialog.Text: Ah, yes... Take your repair kit. Pleasure to do business with you.

Dialog.Title: I've brought some arts. Let's trade.
I came for a riddle.
Dialog.Text: A riddle? What riddle?

Dialog.Title: Any, only if you know one.
Dialog.Text: You're weird, what do you need riddles for? Whatever...here's a riddle for you "Day and night it's between heaven and earth, you can never touch it so it's always way ahead you".

Dialog.Title: Thank you, you helped a lot.
Dialog.Text: You'd better find something to do.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Hey, are you fine? You look sick.
Dialog.Text: I know, I've caught a cold. It's just freezing in here, you know. About twenty people has hot sick recently and we're running out of medicine. By the way, stalker, I buy meds, so if you have anything like...aspirin, tansy or bronchial spasmolytics, come over.

Dialog.Title: I'll see what I can do.
Dialog.Text: I'm sure you'll cope with it easily.

Dialog.Title: I brought the meds.
Dialog.Text: Glad to know that.

Dialog.Title: These must be enough for now.
Dialog.Text: It would be nice if you get me more, let say, tomorrow.

Dialog.Title: I will try.
Dialog.Text: Take care, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Hey, man, do you need any help?
Dialog.Text: Help? We do need help in here. We need vitamins, the land is unfruitful, so we can barely grow anything. If you come back again. bring me different sort of berries, mushrooms and herbs. Here's the list. We always need some, so you can drop by every day.

Dialog.Title: Звучит нормально, договорились.
Dialog.Text: Хорошо, даже очень!

Dialog.Title: I brought you the strict-branch corals.
Dialog.Text: Great. Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: I brought the dog-rose.
Dialog.Text: Great. Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: I brought the cloudberry.
Dialog.Text: Cool. Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: Собрал зверобой.
Dialog.Text: Отлично, давай сюда.

Dialog.Title: I brought the Hypericum.
Dialog.Text: Good. Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: I brought the Fragrant Orchid.
Dialog.Text: Good. Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: These would be enough for now.
I'm from Acid. Everything's done.
Dialog.Text: That's you! I knew that would be you. Reservation, money...as intended.

Dialog.Title: Give me everything one by one.
Насчет трав, что ты просил...
Dialog.Text: Собрал?

Dialog.Title: Знаешь сталкера по кличке Шрам?
Dialog.Text: Предположим. Пересекался с ним пару раз. А к чему этот интерес?

Dialog.Title: Выходит так. Не то чтобы работать...
Dialog.Text: Да не кипеши. Все нормально, я вот тоже разные контакты поддерживаю - полезно для бизнеса. Так, говоришь, Шрам тебе нужен?

Dialog.Title: Да. Знаешь как его найти?
Dialog.Text: Ну, кое что сказать могу... Но я человек деловой, а информация имеет цену, как понимаешь. Давай мы одно дельце с тобой провернем - мне заказ один закрыть надо, а времени в обрез. Ты тоже в накладе не останешься. Как раз получится, что и тебе польза и мне достаток. Ты как? По рукам?

Dialog.Title: Что за заказ?
Dialog.Text: Да небольшой, но срочный - надо мне пяток Резин срочно достать. Ты мне резины - я тебе частично затраты возмещу, ну, и про Шрама расскажу, что знаю. По рукам?

Dialog.Title: Спасибо. У других поспрашиваю.
Dialog.Text: Как знаешь.

Dialog.Title: Ну, выбора особо не было...
Dialog.Text: Поймали тебя за жабры? Бывает.

Dialog.Title: Принес пять Резин...
Dialog.Text: Отлично. Вот обещанные комиссионные. та кчто ты там хотел узнать? Где найти Шрама?

Dialog.Title: Куда направлялся, он не сказал?
Dialog.Text: Я так понял, что он собрался лезть в ту аномалию... Ну, ты не мог ее не видеть - она тут как местная достопримечательность. На северное сияние похожа. Фиговина такая цветная в небо уходит... Это все, что я знаю.

Dialog.Title: Есть еще вопросы про Шрама...
Dialog.Text: Это какие?

Dialog.Title: А что это за байка о "Шепоте"?
Dialog.Text: О, друг!.. Эта история похлеще будет, чем про "Черного сталкера".

Dialog.Title: Расскажешь?
Dialog.Text: Я бы рассказал, да дел больно много... И то и се.

Dialog.Title: Даже за байки плату хочешь?
Dialog.Text: Ну, это же не просто байка. Сам же говоришь, что она с Шрамом связана. Кто тебя, кстати, надоумил спрашивать про Шепот?

Dialog.Title: Митька с Радиуса. Вы вроде знакомы...
Dialog.Text: А, так это Митяй! Да, знакомы. Мы долгое время вместе по Зоне скитались...

Dialog.Title: Так что ты хотел за историю?
Dialog.Text: История редкая, ну и на обмен надо что-то редкое... Мне как раз нужны "Стабилизатор Б" и "Подушка Б"...

Dialog.Title: Такой ты Плевок... барыга.
Dialog.Text: Я таким на свет появился. Я - торгую, а Митька, скажем, философствует. Наверное поэтому мы так долго вместе и ходили. Противоположности притягиваются.

Dialog.Title: Насчет артефактов β...
Dialog.Text: Нашел?

Dialog.Title: Ну что, рассказывай про Шёпота!
Dialog.Text: Предупреждаю: расказчик из меня не очень. Если тебя интересует литературно-фантастическая часть - обратись к Коле Кислому. Он любит байки травить перед новичками. Тебе же, наверное, больше интересно, как все это с Шрамом связано?

Dialog.Title: И это тоже...
Dialog.Text: В общем, если вкратце... Шёпот - это что-то типа сталкера-призрака. Он, говорят, появляется у особо сильных аномалий иногда. Выглядит как полупрозрачный мужик, который что-то бормочет без передыху - поэтому его и прозвали Шёпот. Я не слышал, чтобы кто-то хоть раз разобрал, что он пытается сказать. Вот с этого и начинается история про Шрама...

Dialog.Title: Слушаю внимательно.
Dialog.Text: Ага. Короче. Я сам этого Шёпота видел однажды. Дело было так. Тогда сталкерствовали мы втроем: я, Кислый и Шрам - не помню как он к нам прибился, он вечно лез везде, как затычка. Митька тогда где-то завис, отделился от нашей компании. Мы решили разведать аномалию, которую нынче называют "Проводник". И... Вляпались. Мы шли след в след. Первым - Кислый. Он хоть и опытный сталкер, но иногда слишком борзый - может на авось пойти. Вот и тут - ходу прибавил и... Смотрю я, Кислый замер, а потом как стало его колбасить! Стал он, знаешь, как белка скакать по поляне.

Dialog.Title: А ты?
Dialog.Text: А что я? Я не сразу врубился - пойди придумай, что в таком случае делать, как его ловить! Я попытался поймать его траекторию... И, короче, сам встрял - отвлекся, ступил не туда. В ушах зазвенело, и вырубило меня напрочь. Очнулся, стал отползать и тут вижу картину: стоит мужик в истрепанном бронике песочного цвета... Стоит, да как бы и не стоит одновременно - держит Кислого под руки и медленно так двигается из аномалии. При этом ноги у него не шевелятся и вообще, он как манекен, будто неживой. Я присмотрелся, а сквозь него камни просвечивают. Так, чутка. Вот я струхнул тогда! Думал все - крыша поехала.

Dialog.Title: Понятно. А куда Шрам делся?
Dialog.Text: Я не знаю, что Шрам делал, пока я был в отключке... Не исключено, что он меня вытащил и я ему жизнью обязан... А после...
