Я не сразу Шрама увидел - уж сильно я прифигел от того полупрозрачного мужика. Короче. Шрам какое-то время стоял как паралитик, а потом кинулся к Шёпоту и перехватил Кислого, дальше оттащил. А Шёпот - он даже и руками не двинул, так стал в другую сторону отъезжать. Скользит над землей и все губами шевелит.

Dialog.Title: Шрам рассказал, что услышал?
Dialog.Text: Я пытался после спрашивать. Но он как воды в рот набрал. И свалил от нас, кстати, на первом же привале. С того времени я Шрама встречал только пару раз, да и то так, чисто: "привет-привет".

Dialog.Title: Кислый сказал, что Шёпот телепортирует...
Dialog.Text: В смысле? А, ну да... Типа крутой сталкер, туда-сюда, взял Шёпота за руку и перенесся в какую-то пустыню... Да, помню такой вариант байки. Да только я тебе рассказываю то, что видел. И Кислый никуда не перенесся. Это ж байка! А потом, может у того сталкера вообще глюки начались... Кислый тогда в отрубе был. Может поэтому на него и не подействовало.

Dialog.Title: Да уж...
Dialog.Text: После того случая я и перстал окончательно в такие места лазить... Стал больше на подхвате...

Dialog.Title: Хм..
Dialog.Text: Так вот: слушай самое интересное. Шрам к нему подошел и стал что-то говорить, может благодарил - не знаю. И мне показалось, он разобрал, что Шёпот шепчет, потому что лицо у него стало ну очень странное.
Hey, what do you want?

Dialog.Title: У меня есть "Везувий".
Dialog.Text: Могу поменять на шлемы и штаны ШИЗ. Каждый предмет отдаю за 3 "Везувия".

Dialog.Title: Экраны
Dialog.Text: Вот что могу дать. Берешь?

Dialog.Title: Подушки.
Dialog.Text: Вот что могу дать. Берешь?

Dialog.Title: Стабы.
Dialog.Text: Вот что могу дать. Берешь?

Dialog.Title: Щиты.
Dialog.Text: Вот что могу дать. Берешь?

Dialog.Title: Резина.
Dialog.Text: Вот что могу дать. Берешь?

Dialog.Title: Антиграв.
Dialog.Text: Вот что могу дать. Берешь?

Dialog.Title: Нет у меня артов.||Обманул я тебя.
I got the papers from Krasnov.
Dialog.Text: You're not kidding, right?

Dialog.Title: Do you happen to know where I can get a barrett?
Dialog.Text: Not yet. I've been lookin' for it myself.

Dialog.Title: Too bad.
Dialog.Text: If I find it first, I'll surely sell it to you, brother.

Dialog.Title: Why not fo free? I did help Krasnov.
Dialog.Text: Where did you see such stuff for free? Don't be rediculous! You should thank Krasnov that you're able to buy such good stuff.

Dialog.Title: Let me see what you have for exchange.
Покажи штаны.
Dialog.Text: Штаны как штаны. ШИЗ. Броня, надежная, без дураков.

Dialog.Title: Беру шлем ШИЗ "Очкарик".
Dialog.Text: Один шлем ШИЗ "Очкарик". Три "Везувия"!

Dialog.Title: Беру шлем ШИЗ "Прорезь".
Dialog.Text: Шлем ШИЗ "Прорезь". Три "Везувия"!

Dialog.Title: Вот твой "Везувий".
Dialog.Text: Благодарствую.

Dialog.Title: Что в замен предлагаешь?
Dialog.Text: Шлем, штаны, бронь ШИЗ в обмен на "Везувий" и рекомендации.

Dialog.Title: What reccomendations?
Dialog.Text: Don't you know? I sell stuff only to Krasnov's people. That's the rule. And don't ask me where to find him. I'm not an information desk.

Dialog.Title: What are you ready to give me in return?
Dialog.Text: SHIZ helmets and pants. They're yours if you get me the "Vesuvius" and Krasnov's reccomendations.

Dialog.Title: Беру!
Dialog.Text: Три "Везувия"!

Dialog.Title: Давай броню.
Dialog.Text: Краснову привет. Пусть не хворает.

Dialog.Title: All kidding aside. Have a look.
Dialog.Text: I see you met Krasnov, now you're one of us, man. Now I'll sell you SHIZ body armor, I've been keeping it for a man like you.

Dialog.Title: Who are you?
Dialog.Text: Are you here to interview me? You're just wasting your time, then. I'm just a regular man. You'd better talk to the Colonel, he knows a lot.

Dialog.Title: Do you know a lot about him?
Dialog.Text: He's a real hero, man. He's not young anymore, that's true, but he's well known and respectable in the Zone. He has seen a lot, believe me. Now we're having business on our own. We're making meds via special device and we're always in need for ingredients, such as Marevo artifact and spirit.

Dialog.Title: I can get you the "Mirage" and alcohol.
Dialog.Text: Really? Bring it! Scientists will be lucky to have the "Mirage".

Dialog.Title: I brought what you needed.
Dialog.Text: Really?

Dialog.Title: Do you need more "Marevo" arts?
Dialog.Text: Sure.

Dialog.Title: Do you need more spirit?
Dialog.Text: Sure.

Dialog.Title: I brought the "Marevo" art.
Dialog.Text: Appreciate that.

Dialog.Title: I brought the spirit.
Dialog.Text: Great.

Dialog.Title: I can get you the "Mirage" and alcohol.
Dialog.Text: Really? Bring it! Scientists will be lucky to have the "Mirage".

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Ready to do something bigger than just searching for artifacts? I do have an order from one man, who's waiting for mutant body parts. What do you say? Are you in?

Dialog.Title: Tell me what I should do.
Dialog.Text: Monsieur Garrel wants to have some exotic items in his collection.

Dialog.Title: Yes.
Dialog.Text: Here's a list od what we need. First of all, a bear head, second of all, six slow fiend paws, four shelled verliock legs and a dozen polar dog jaws. And for dessert, smart blyak claws. I guaranty you'll get a fair reward.

Dialog.Title: Ok, I'll do that.
Dialog.Text: Deal. Be careful, I'll be waiting for you here.

Dialog.Title: That's too much. I may be back later.
Hey! I brought everything needed.
Dialog.Text: Let me see what you got here.

Dialog.Title: I brought everything you told me.
Dialog.Text: Great. Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Why else do people stop by?
Dialog.Text: They have their own reasons. Recently one man offered me to hunt for jellies. I said no. Those creatures are just disgusting. But the man was right, their number nust be eliminated

Dialog.Title: Do you know a lot about jellies?
Dialog.Text: Hell yeah. Although I ain't a scientist, I can tell they're dangerous. We gotta eliminate as many as we can.

Dialog.Title: I can hunt for them.
Dialog.Text: That's great! I'll be waiting for you here.

Dialog.Title: I killed the jellies.
Dialog.Text: How did you you manage to? They're so disgusting.

Dialog.Title: Thank you.
Dialog.Text: Thank YOU. Good luck and take care.

Dialog.Title: I heard you're hunting sages.
Dialog.Text: Well, not exactly. There's a man who's studying so-called "Sage's phenomenon", their nature, abilities and so on. He believes that the Stonehenge anomaly is a kind of power source for those creatures. They always gather next to it. That scientist needs sages' medallions for his researches. That's what I'm hunting for.

Dialog.Title: I suppose I can help.
Dialog.Text: That's just wonderful, man. I'll be waiting for you right here, get back soon and try not to be killed.

Dialog.Title: I will try.
Dialog.Text: I wish you the best of luck.

Dialog.Title: Talking of the sages...
Dialog.Text: Did you bring their medallions?

Dialog.Title: I gor the medallions.
Dialog.Text: Good. That's enough for now, but I'm gonna need more soon.

Dialog.Title: I'm lookin' for a missing plane.
Dialog.Text: I remember. I used to get wasted a lot. Those were the days! we had so much moonshine...Now it's not what it used to be. Do you see where I'm going?

Dialog.Title: How mush moonshine do you want?
Dialog.Text: Don't think I'm a drunk, I just wanna help you. Do me a favor, man. My birthday is within days, so get me at least ten botles.

Dialog.Title: Whatf I just pay you?
Dialog.Text: No way. If I take money from you, that will be bribery. But a birthday present from you is another thing.

Dialog.Title: Bribery? Wehat are you, police officer?
Dialog.Text: Quiet, man. I was told...to keep my mouth shut about that plane...So let's not talk about that until you get me the present.

Dialog.Title: Here's your booze.
Dialog.Text: Not mine, but ours. Booze is like public property, you know. Where were we? Oh yeah.. .you should look for the plane in the swampland, square Д5 or Г5 I think.

Dialog.Title: Talking of the moonshine and the plane...
Dialog.Text: Did you bring the booze?

Dialog.Title: I've found out all I needed.
Dialog.Text: Whatever.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for sale.
Что за студни? Расскажи...
Dialog.Text: Противные твари! Выползают на берег, ловят неосторожного сталкера и тянут в студеную воду, на дно. Человек захлебывается, разбухает... А студень перерабатывает его в кашицу, поглощает и отправляется на поиск новой жертвы. Многие думают, что студень -- что-то типа неразумной стихии, ну, типа воды или огня. Не верь. Это хищник, хитрый, коварный, вечно голодный, готовый жрать что угодно и когда угодно. Другое дело -- отверженные. Тупые зомби. Вот их убивать -- одно удовольствие.
What's wrong with you, people?

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: I was on my way to the base carrying a very valuable artifact when I bumped into that...crook, dammit! He distracted me with his stupid talk and bang! All went dark. He smacked me upside my head and that was that. I bet he's running towards the boarder with my artifact now, there're lots of dealers wishing to buy it. Hey, help me out, hunt that bastard down and kill him. I wish I could do that myself, but I still feel a bit dizzy. I'll pay you well for that!

Dialog.Title: No problem. Wait here, I'll get you the art back.
I have no time for this.
Dialog.Text: Too bad...

Dialog.Title: I'm gonna keep the artifact.| I shot him down, but the artifact is now mine. C'est la vie. No offence, mon ami.
Dialog.Text: I saw that coming. well, anyway the bastard didn't sneak away unpunished.

Dialog.Title: I brought you the artifact back.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, man! I started to think you were gonna keep it, but now I know you're an honest guy. Here's your money.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for the White.
Dialog.Text: Do you mean scientists?

Dialog.Title: Not exactly.
Dialog.Text: Well, I saw some scientists passing by this place, there were lots of them and they were led by a guide with a barrett...as far as I know they were going to go round the volcano and camp down in the south...Anyway, you seem to be talking of some other guys. Ask Zelenkin, he might have seen more than me, hardly ever leaves his tent.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Is everything okay this time?
Dialog.Text: Yep, thank you for helping me out. You never know who you'll run into tomorrow.

Dialog.Title: So, what's up?
Dialog.Text: Hey, did you hear a tale about love of artifacts?

Dialog.Title: I'm not in the mood for tales. Take care.
You meant "love for artifacts", right?
Dialog.Text: No, I made no mistakes, love of arts! Some people say there're some special places where artifacts literally jump into nice people's hands.

Dialog.Title: Ha-ha, very funny.
Dialog.Text: Believe it or not, but it's happened to me once. I was in the wood when suddenly I got knocked down, thay started to shake and sweat...I thought that was the end cause I'd gotten into an anomaly...When I came to my senses I realized there was no anomaly nearby. So, as soon as I came back to the encampment, I found an artifact inside my backpack! I dodn't pick it up myself! It just appeared there...

Dialog.Title: No way!
Dialog.Text: You may not believe it. But that really happened.

Dialog.Title: I'm gonna go now. Take care.

Dialog.Text: Prof. Simonov, at your service.

Dialog.Title: What is this place and who are you?
Dialog.Text: Welcome to the scientific camp of team "Aegis", my friend. We are exploring local flora and fauna and we have a great chance to make several big scientific discoveries. Most of us are qualified specialists and the we are working all time.

Dialog.Title: I won't bother you...
Dialog.Text: No, no, wait...

Dialog.Title: I don't see any active work.|| Everyone are gloomy and tired like in a queue to the old man Charon.
Dialog.Text: Well, you understood it really fast.

Dialog.Title: I am listening.
Dialog.Text: I guess, I embellished the situation a bit. You see, we have weapons but we don't have militaries -- only low-skilled mercenaries. We managed to create a camp here and start working, thanks to the resources from the abandoned military base nearby. One stalker showed us this place. We haven't seen him for a while and I'm afraid he vanished in these dead lands while doing an important job for us.

Dialog.Title: I don't have time for this.|I guess you don't need another dead stalker, right? So I go away.
Dialog.Text: Maybe you are right. Good luck to you then! Good luck to all of us...

Dialog.Title: I can finish his work.
Dialog.Text: No doubt, my friend! I hope you don't mind if I not give you such difficult and secret assignments yet. In the end, your colleague looked more reliable than you, but he disappeared like he never existed. Ask my coworkers, they have tasks important enough, which can't be completed without skilled and lucky stalker.

Dialog.Title: Tell me what is the problem.| Lets get to business, tell me what is the problem.
Dialog.Text: We are surrounded by mutants: demons, blyaks, chillers, boars... Here every day is not a work but survival. Walk through the camp and ask other scientists. They surely have work for you. Come back to me after completing all tasks.

Dialog.Title: Got it. I'll talk with other scientists.
I've helped your colleagues.
Dialog.Text: Yes, I see that now our work is going better. You know what... You need to be rewarded. We have many weapons, including military samples. But hired guards couldn't use it all, so we had to trade a part of it for supplies. There is one speculator, named Sly. If you give him these recommendations, he'll give you a good assault rifle Sig Sauer 751. You can find Sly around Lubech, but I don't know where exactly, as I last met him long before the expedition. Then one stalker guided us to the Vezuvius and disappeared. Probably died.

Dialog.Title: What can you tell me about your guide?|Tell me about the man who led you here.
Dialog.Text: He was a true professional, an old and wise man. He was taking Barret with him everywhere, but it seems that the rifle didn't save him, because he disappeared without a trace. We have sent him with a task, about which I can't talk. Don't even ask. He moved to north-west. I can't imagine what could kill such a skilled stalker.

Dialog.Title: I see.|Thanks for the paper. Now I'll try to find this Sly.
Dialog.Text: Good luck.

Dialog.Title: Помогаю твоим коллегам...
Dialog.Text: Слышал, слышал. Продолжай в том же духе, сталкер!

Dialog.Title: I found Sly, but he wants arts.|I found Sly, but he didn't give me the rifle. He said you owe him a lot of artefacts.
Dialog.Text: Too bad... We don't have any free artefacts, sorry. I apologize, but I can do nothing about it.

Dialog.Title: I'm helping your colleagues...
Dialog.Text: I heard of it. They told me. That's good. I would be glad to give you the reward when you will deserve it. Keep pushing the science forward to reach a high level of respect.

Dialog.Title: For how long should I push the science?
Dialog.Text: If the reputation might be measured, then it would be around 27 000 points.

Dialog.Title: Can we do it earlier?|So I can hit the wall with my head but you won't share your secrets?
Dialog.Text: Try to understand. We don't know you at all, and there are plenty of unfair dealers here, who can trick us to gain a rare weapon.

Dialog.Title: I saw a cage nearby with a scientist in it.
Dialog.Text: It's our colleague, Patisson. It seems like he doesn't suffer from his situation. The winter is coming soon, we has plenty of work to do and he has to get out, but he doesn't. And he is feeding mutants. Crazy old man. He was carrying the cage with him and constructed it here. With his own hands. He is not a human but a phenomenon.

Dialog.Title: You think mutants won't eat him?
Dialog.Text: I think his cage is quite reliable. He is alive after all. We gave him guards, but he just send them back. He says they shoot mutants, and shooting mutants is forbidden. He surely going crazy after the accident.

Dialog.Title: What accident?
Dialog.Text: He had an assistant, a student from the university, who wasn't lucky with his supervisor... In general, first days he was sitting with Patisson in the cage and then he got out for some reason. Right in the time of another attack of the mutants. Of course they ate him. Patisson doesn't take weapons with him, only supplies. So his assistant became a mutant's meal.

Dialog.Title: Is there anyone who care about Patisson?
Dialog.Text: If he would be a valuable employee... but he is not. If you manage to convince him to leave the cage and to return to the camp, then I'll give a bonus to your salary... Wait... You're not working here... Still, I'll give you a good reward.

Dialog.Title: I don't have time for him either.
He'll be back soon.
Dialog.Text: I guess he won't. Patisson is famous for his... character.

Dialog.Title: Is there anyone who care about Patisson?
The scientist is still in the cage.
Dialog.Text: What is holding him there?

Dialog.Title: His crazy theory...||He believes that mutants assimilate victim's DNA and that's exactly what they've done with his assistant.
Dialog.Text: Hm...That explains a lot. So, he discovered his assistant's genes in mutant's blood and now he believes that...I don't even know how to put it...that those mutants are in some way his assistant. That's rather interesting... We shall keep an eye on his research, it might be helpful for the science... However, I can't give you the reward, as you didn't complete the task, but this medkit may be more useful for you than money.

Dialog.Title: I don't want even to think about it.
Maybe you tell me about it? I can help.
Dialog.Text: You're good man. I have to ask you something. My collegues don't know that we have a huge debt for the artefacts. Don't tell them. I need a rare "Antigrav α". Get one for me and I'll tell you about your predecessor.

Dialog.Title: I've found your "Antigrav α".
Dialog.Text: Let me see it...

Dialog.Title: Yeah.
Dialog.Text: Yup. That's what I need. So. Do you want to repeat your predecessor's great deed?

Dialog.Title: So let's do this!
Dialog.Text: You can disappear like him. But we can't wait longer!

Dialog.Title: Tell me about the stalker who brought you here.
I'm listening.
Dialog.Text: I have one theory aabout how do other people manages to get here from the outer Zone. But I need more information. I sent a stalker to make all the samples. I gave him my analisator. Special gear. Constructed with the inner Zone materials. Our Dr. Aibolit was right about these gear.

Dialog.Title: Aaaaaaaaaand.....
Dialog.Text: I've sent a stalker in the K2, A1, A10 and K10 areas. It needs to be very close to the Vesuvius to make the right indications. But he sent me just the K2 information. Now he must be at this way: A1 - A10 - then K10 and come back here.

Dialog.Title: Did he return?
Dialog.Text: You need to repeat his way. You can visit all these areas in your way. But i recommend you to go at K2 and K3 at first. You can find this stalker there.

Dialog.Title: I've visited all the areas.
Dialog.Text: I have first results...not good...

Dialog.Title: What?
Dialog.Text: Do you know about the "Phon" energy? It is averywhere. And it manages to spread wider. And it's getting....hm....more solid if we can say like that. Soon we'll be cut off the other world. We need to do something to find the exit.

Dialog.Title: How bad is that?
Dialog.Text: There are a lot of men here on the factory. Hundreds of good stalkers. And thousands of "natives". Just imagine that there is no exit from here. It will be like a huge freaking blast when everybody finds out about the situation.

Dialog.Title: I found this journal. Your stalker had failed your job. He was working for Chereshnikov.
Dialog.Text: Chereshnikov? He's a good specialist but that's too much! Please, remind him about where we are now. Somebody could die because of his pathetic theories!

Dialog.Title: I've found some strange "rocks".
Dialog.Text: That's not funny.....wait a second....these things are full of Phon! Where did you get that?

Dialog.Title: On the couriers' bodies.
Dialog.Text: I see...I see....These artefacts are poisoned. But I think that you're already know that. I don't have right equipment here.... but we have special safe boxes for stuff like that.

Dialog.Title: Take it from me!
Dialog.Text: Ofcourse! And burn down the corpses. That will be good for everyone.

Dialog.Title: I have some new toys!
Dialog.Text: Let me see... no. That's just party toys. Nothing strange about them.

Dialog.Title: Why?
Dialog.Text: Because the dead ones attracts the living ones. They scavanging, got irradiated by the Phon, go back and infect others.

Dialog.Title: But this is good. We can deal with Marauders like that.
Dialog.Text: Have you eve heard the word like "Humanity"?

Dialog.Title: I've already burned the bodies.
Dialog.Text: You did the right thing,

Dialog.Title: I've got a message from Patisson...
Dialog.Text: hmmm. Let him work. He could completely change our knowledge about the mutated.

Dialog.Title: What did he find out?
Dialog.Text: Well..He's been studying 'em closely. The thing is that when he was examining mutants he found traces of his ex-assistant's genes in them. Now he believes that the mutated ARE his ex-assistant, I mean, he's a part of them.

Dialog.Title: Will you help him with his research?
Dialog.Text: Sure! He'll get anything he needs.

Dialog.Title: I didn't manage to free the scientist.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: I met Litovski..
Dialog.Text: In the Zone? Great news! Now it all will work out for us. My people always talk him up. He's known for giving the best protection in the toughest scientific expeditions. Haven't he told you what he's up to? Is he going to side with us? He may be escorting our colleagues at the moment...

Dialog.Title: He didn't tell me anything about his plans.
Dialog.Text: Let's just hope he'll come over to our small camp.

Dialog.Title: Litovski wants me to get the reports...
Dialog.Text: I know, everything's ready. His tasks are indeed unusual, it's good for my brain.

Dialog.Title: huh?
Dialog.Text: We're scientists as you could've noticed...
Stalker? Brought the legs?

Dialog.Title: I think I'm gonna take off.
What legs are you talking about?
Dialog.Text: ...Wasn't that you who promised me to kill the Big Spider? No? God, sorry, you stalkers are all alike. Alright, I'll say it again. My colleagues claim they saw an enormous and terrifying spider near Liubech, in square M2. So, I want to have its legs so that I could carry on my experiments. I would go there myself, but Simonov wants me to join him in his expedition...So, I'm looking for volunteers. I pay well.

Dialog.Title: One Big Spider leg. Got it.
Dialog.Text: Take your time. The problem is - nobody knows, whether the beast actually exists. So first you should find its lair and make sure it is real. You must wonder why my colleagues habe been searching for it for so long? They are real cowards and their eyes are not sharp. So your task is actually dual: kill it or dispel these gossips.

Dialog.Title: I can't take the job.|| I don't like spiders.
Dialog.Text: You don't know how to cook them either, right?

Dialog.Title: You can put it this way.
I did. Here, big spider leg. Take it.
Dialog.Text: Great Scott! The Big Spider leg! Who could have thought... Here is your reward. Bring some more! But not now, we have enough of them. Tomorrow maybe...

Dialog.Title: I'll go there and scout the area.
8 лап за козырные шмотки? Интересно.
Dialog.Text: А, заинтригован?

Dialog.Title: Why do you need so many legs anyway? They're really heavy.
Dialog.Text: I test different sorts of weapon and chemicals on them in order to find more effective ways fighting mutants. we're trying to do our best to help you stalkers. Listen, you helped us a lot. Now I know how to reward you for that. Get me 8 lega at a time, I'll give you a permission to get experimental equipment. So? What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Bring 8 legs at a time? I'll do it.|Heh, what kind of "thank you" is it anyway? OK, I'll see what I can do.
Dialog.Text: Remember, 8 legs at a time. No less. Or there will be no recommendation for you.

Dialog.Title: Are you kidding? It's too many.
Dialog.Text: It is just a test. A test to check if you're worth my recommendations or not.

Dialog.Title: I did. Brought you 8 legs.
Dialog.Text: Well done, stalker! Good job. Here are your recommendations...Listen, you shouldn't bring that many next time, we can't cope with that number at a time. Show the papers to our official supplier, I heard he'd mover to Tunguska. Don't know where exactly he's now, but when you do find him, he won't reject you.

Dialog.Title: *Tell about the scientist inside a cage.* |I saw a cage not far from here...there was a man inside.
Dialog.Text: Oh, that was Patisson. He's an odd fish, I know. Said he was going to watch mutants, their behavior in, so to speak, natural habitat. So, he built that cage over a month ago ans is still there. We bring him food. We don't mind and let him do what he wants. However, if he doesn't finish his experiments until winter comes, we'll have to leave him alone. He won't come with us for sure.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: We need to honor the memory of the fallen soldiers.
Dialog.Text: And you must be from Dibenko, right? Very well. The military protect usfrom the hazards of teh Zone, so we decided to thank them. If you kill the saged at the local cemetery and pluck some daisies, we'll take care of the graves.

Dialog.Title: Я принес медальоны ведунов и цветы.
Dialog.Text: Ты молодец, сталкер. Чтишь память героев. Знаешь, если творишь добро, оно потом к тебе обязательно возвращается... В данном случае оно к тебе вернется в виде кое-каких лекарств. Как знать, может они спасут тебе жизнь. И не придется твоим близким в праздничный день ложить цветы на могилку...

Dialog.Title: I'll be back with sages' medallions and the flowers.
Can you read this?
Dialog.Text: What a stupid question? Of course I can...wait, what it it? It doesn't make any sense! Is it a joke or something?

Dialog.Title: I found these notes on a dead body.
Dialog.Text: That's creepy. Anyway, I....Wait a minute! I have a friend who studies sort of odd languages. He may translate it...if it can be translated at all.

Dialog.Title: Where can I find your friend?
Dialog.Text: The problem is he's in England. However, you can try to digitize the text, send it with a courier to the nearest city to the Zone outside the perimeter and email my friend. But you've got to fix my scan first.

Dialog.Title: No problem.
Dialog.Text: Get me some electronic parts, then. I'll fix it myself. I'll keep the notes till you came back.

Dialog.Title: I brought the parts for the scanner.
Dialog.Text: Well done! Now we can scan the text and save it on the PDA. And there's just one thing left to do, then - to find a courier who will deliver the PDA outside the Zone, send the information to my friend, wait for his aswer and get back. However, I have no idea who'll agree on that.

Dialog.Title: I know who will.
Dialog.Text: Well, good luck to him, then.
Hello. Do you want to use the storage service?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello. Do you want to use the storage service?

Dialog.Title: Hey, are you Victor Borovikov?
Dialog.Text: It depends who's asking.

Dialog.Title: I wanna talk about the guy named Stupka. What can I do to set him free?
Dialog.Text: Do you expect me to let him go just for free? What's the point? Unless...if you got me something in exchange, I wouldn't that mind and tell you where he is. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: I agree. Say what you need.
Dialog.Text: Here's the list, 5 screens α and 5 pillows α. That would be enough.

Dialog.Title: I brought what you asked for.
Dialog.Text: A bargain is a bargain. You'll find the guy in Caravan. He's in a shed nor far from a pond. Do whatever you want when you find him. Now he's yours, ha-ha.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Right on the contrary. I came for the loot.
Dialog.Text: Fair enough. Here's your share. Have fun.

Dialog.Title: Cool. Take care.
Dialog.Text: See you later, stalker.
You wanna to head for Novaya Ssemlya, right? Ssorry, man. I'm not on dutty now, I took ssome time offf.

Dialog.Title: How much should I pay you?
Dialog.Text: 10 000. Shall we go?

Dialog.Title: No. I'll find it myself.
Dialog.Text: You may try... But you'll not find...

Dialog.Title: Here's the money. Lead the way!
Why are you talking like this?
Dialog.Text: Ssomething happened here...

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: Let'ss ssay..I had argumentss with competitorss..Sssomebody must've sstarted a rumor..

Dialog.Title: What rumor?
Dialog.Text: Sssomeone ffound out my service I offer cheaper service than others.

Dialog.Title: I see. Get better.
Dialog.Text: Thanksss.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I can guide you to the abandoned base. I know the way.

Dialog.Title: I'll find the way myself.
Dialog.Text: You may try...
You may try...

Dialog.Title: How much should I pay you?
Dialog.Text: 5 000 only! Shall we go?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I can guide you to the mine. I know the way to the mine. It's near the crazy-house.

Dialog.Title: I'll find the way myself.
Dialog.Text: You may try...

Dialog.Title: How much should I pay you?
Dialog.Text: 5 000 only! Shall we go?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Sorry, man. I don't guide for a while. I took a break.

Dialog.Title: I will find it on my own.
Dialog.Text: No, you won't...

Dialog.Title: How much do you want?
Dialog.Text: 500 rubles! Shall we go?

Dialog.Title: Take the money. Now let's go.
Веди.
Dialog.Text: Эй! Ты же вне закона! Я тебя не поведу!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Sorry, man. I don't guide. I took a break, need to have rest.

Dialog.Title: I will find it on my own.
Dialog.Text: No, you won't...

Dialog.Title: How much?
Dialog.Text: 1000 rubles! Shall we go?

Dialog.Title: Guide me to the Scientists' Camp.
Guide me to the Bandits Cave.
I see.
Dialog.Text: Listen, would you help me out?

Dialog.Title: What do you need?
Dialog.Text: Well, I have a friend who people call Leshich. He's a very skilled hunter, you know. He can trace creatures without being noticed at all.

Dialog.Title: How does he manage to?
Dialog.Text: He made kinda special suit for that. Animals just don't sense him when he wears it.

Dialog.Title: So what do you want from me?
Dialog.Text: The thing is...I lost him while hunting. We used to hunt together, you know, and nothing like that had ever happened before! Dunno how I could've lost him. I wasn't all that worried at first, you know, I thought he'd show up one day....but now it's been a week since I last saw him. And I'm getting really worried..

Dialog.Title: Why don't you look for him yourself?
Dialog.Text: I'd love to, believe me! But I'm waiting for a man here, can't leave this place.

Dialog.Title: Ok. So where were you hunting that day?
Dialog.Text: I'll never forgive myself that I left him there! Find him, stalker, I'm almost bagging you.

Dialog.Title: Alright, alright. I'll try to find that friend of yours.
Dialog.Text: Great. It happened in the Caravan, Leshich had heard there was a mutant called Impenetrable, so we were trying to trace it there.

Dialog.Title: Sorry but I gotta be going.
Dialog.Text: I see. I wish you'd help.

Dialog.Title: I figured out where Leshich is.
Dialog.Text: How is he doing? Is he alright? Did you find him?

Dialog.Title: I did.
Dialog.Text: How is he?

Dialog.Title: Well now he's fine.
Dialog.Text: Now?

Dialog.Title: He was sick when I found him. But I fixed him up.
Dialog.Text: Man, I'm so grateful! Thanks, bro. Tell me where he's now.

Dialog.Title: He's still in Caravan, getting better.
Dialog.Text: I'm so happy he's alive! I'm gonna take off to visit him right now. Let me reward you.

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: Visit him anytime as well, as I assume it'll take time for him to recover.

Dialog.Title: А самогон тебе зачем?
Dialog.Text: Ну а сам-то как думаешь? Тут холод адский, даже наглухо утепленная экипировка не спасает. Аж по самым костям этим ветром скребет! Ну а самогон - это ж первая помощь в такой ситуации. Хоть и глотку дерет, да согревает, собака! Так вот, для этого, исключительно, интересуюсь.

Dialog.Title: Вот самогон!
Dialog.Text: Ну-ка, братец, давай сюда скорей! Да, и награду, вот, получи-распишись.

Dialog.Title: Do you need any science workers?
Dialog.Text: Hey, noone's aksed me for a 'serious' job in a long time! Do you know what organisation offers the job?

Dialog.Title: More or less. I'm a man of business.
Dialog.Text: Very well, ignorance is blessing isn't it? Let me quickly bring you up to date. Those guys are serious and demanding people.They're collecting arts. But not simple arts, those that're much more valuable. They pay well and are ready to giveweapon as a reward. Are you in?

Dialog.Title: Sure, I'm not scared of hard tasks.
Dialog.Text: So, let's carry on, then. Here's the list: screens, vesuvious, stabilizers, antigravs. I don't care where you're gonna get 'em. Bring 'em all and you'll be well paid. Ready?

Dialog.Title: Sure.
Dialog.Text: I'll be waiting for you, stalker. Good luck.

Dialog.Title: I need more time to get prepared.
Dialog.Text: Well, you know how to find me.

Dialog.Title: I brought some arts.
Dialog.Text: You did deserve a reward for that!

Dialog.Title: That's all. Don't get cold.
Dialog.Text: Good luck, stalker!

Dialog.Title: No problem. Hey, do you know any riddles?
Dialog.Text: I've been in the Zone for a long time, but you managed to surprise me, man. Riddles! Are you ready to do something for a riddle or two?

Dialog.Title: Sure. Just tell me what to do.
Dialog.Text: Shoot about twenty polar dogs. This place is teeming with 'em.

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: Be back soon, riddle lover.

Dialog.Title: They have huge teeth, man!
Dialog.Text: Sure they do. They're mutants, remember? They can tear you apart in two seconds. Anyway, thanks for your help. As I promised, here's a riddle for you "Until I am measured I am not known, Yet how you miss me When I have flown." See you later, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Good bye.
Dialog.Text: Good luck.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: What do you need rest from?
Dialog.Text: Hey, if I don't guide people now, it doesn't mean I have nothing to do here in the Zone!

Dialog.Title: The Zone is just a tail of a comet called "New World".
Dialog.Text: What are you talking about, man? Where do you have those thoughts from? To tell you the truth, some scientists say the same things. I hope the person who put that thought into your head does know about the Door.

Dialog.Title: If you join us, you'll witness the New World and find yourself a better person.
Dialog.Text: Hey, I'm ok with myself. You're wasting my time, stalker.

Dialog.Title: What door are you talking about?
Dialog.Text: Don't you know what "door" is? I meant...just a door, the one that opens and closes. okey, stalker, I think it's time for you to leave.

Dialog.Title: I'm leaving. But remember, we trust you!
Dialog.Text: Thank you, man. But the only person I trust is myself. No offence.

Dialog.Title: I can get you more atrs if you still need them...
Dialog.Text: Sure I do, get me the following ones: vesuviuses, β-shields, Stabilizers and antigravs. Are you sure you can get me those?
Do you want, I'll spend you to the abandoned base? I know the way to the abandoned base.

Dialog.Title: How much should I pay you?
Dialog.Text: 5 000 only! Shall we go?

Dialog.Title: I'll find the way myself.
Dialog.Text: You may try...

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I guide to the Airport trough the tunnels. What do you want?

Dialog.Title: How much do you take?
Dialog.Text: I don't know you. I won't take you anywhere.

Dialog.Title: Even for cash?
Dialog.Text: Not for cash, not for arts, not for rags. What if I agrre and you stab with a knife? That way I don't need you money anymore. No way. I won't take you anywhere.

Dialog.Title: How much do you take?
Dialog.Text: For you..it'll be 5000. Can take you to the Airport.

Dialog.Title: Mokrukh sent me. I need a generator.
Dialog.Text: I see. Yeah, I got one. It'll cost you 20 000.

Dialog.Title: 20 000. Here you go.
Dialog.Text: Good job. Come up to the trader. The thing is that we sell everything that got in our hands. I didn't know the generator was intended for you anyway, so I gave it to the trader. Luckily, we haven't sold it yet.

Dialog.Title: Maybe there're some other ways...?
Dialog.Text: Oh yeah...Think faster till I raise the price.

Dialog.Title: I already paid Mokrukh.
Dialog.Text: You haven't paid me though.

Dialog.Title: That trader knocked me down...|and I woke up on Novaya Zemlya...
Dialog.Text: He must've got everything wrong. Noone told him to do so. You just look like one jerk that owes Philin money. No offense. man.
Hello. Do you want to use the storage service?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hey! Can fix any of your stuff. That's easier than nicking someone else's, plus there's no risk. I accept even useless at first glance stuff, bring me anything, we'll work out how to use that.

Dialog.Title: Fix it all.
Dialog.Text: I can fix all your stuff for %COMPLEX_COST% rubles. Deal?

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for sale.
I'm looking for a set of tools.
Dialog.Text: That'll cost you no less than a hundred.

Dialog.Title: What stuff can you assemble for me?

Dialog.Text: Leave me alone! Don't you see I'm busy?

Dialog.Title: I'd better be going. Take care.
Do you know this place well?
Dialog.Text: Do I know...? Ough! Listen to me, boy, I'd got here when you still wetted your pants...I'm too sober for this time of a day...

Dialog.Title: Let me fill your glass. My treat.
Dialog.Text: That's a different story!

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me about the Zone?
Dialog.Text: The Zone is like an old wife..grumpy, never satisfied. Although you still love her, you can barely stand her...

Dialog.Title: You must know "her" like the back of your hand..
Dialog.Text: Ain't listening to me at all? You can't know the Zone! You must love this place and really care about it so that all the routes will reveal themselves. Suddenly you may even find yourself in an absolutely unknown place without knowing how to find the way back. In such case you'll need a skilled guide who'll lead you. Not for free, of course.

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me about artifacts?
Dialog.Text: So-called arts or artifacts are gifts the Zone give us. They're hidden inside anomalies but not many of 'em are all that useful. Every art is unique. Some of 'em can even save your ass, some of 'em are just bright stones without any useful properties. Artifacts are basic stuff that's in trade here. You'll be very well paid if you find a proper buyer for the art you were lucky enough to find.

Dialog.Title: Where can a guide lead me?
Dialog.Text: There're many destinations...Vesuvius, Tunguska, for example. The Zone is big outside Liubech.

Dialog.Title: Do you know why Prokhor is so angry?
Dialog.Text: Do you mean Prochor theTrackman? He's always angry.

Dialog.Title: Have your heard about the accident with the trucks?
Dialog.Text: What trucks? I haven't seen trucks here in a long time.

Dialog.Title: How do I get out?
Dialog.Text: There's no way out.

Dialog.Title: I don't believe it.
Dialog.Text: You're green and naive.

Dialog.Title: How did you get into the Zone?
Dialog.Text: Well...I used to be a convict. Got away for one "zone" and got to another one. Almost everyone here has murky past and noone ever ask about it..well, except for you. If I were you I'd think better what questions to ask.

Dialog.Title: I have some questions.
Dialog.Text: Ask away.

Dialog.Title: Do you know anything about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: It was the Dark Stalker who killed him!

Dialog.Title: Who?
Dialog.Text: I was out having a smoke.. when I saw that guy..he was getting rid of a body wrapped in canvas. He put it in a dumpster like a trash...I'm telling you. it was the Dark Stalker.

Dialog.Title: You should drink less...
Dialog.Text: Don't belive me, right? But I ain't nuts.

Dialog.Title: Who?
Dialog.Text: I was out having a smoke.. when I saw that guy..he was getting rid of a body wrapped in canvas. He put it in a dumpster like a trash...I'm telling you. it was the Dark Stalker.

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me about mutants?
Dialog.Text: Rats, pups... are they real mutants? We used to scare them away with sticks and rocks. Child's play! Only once have I seen a real mutant. It was long ago and it appeared in Ryabinushka...we lost many people there..Those who survived left the village as soon as the had a chance to.

Dialog.Title: Did you use to live in Ryabinushka?
Dialog.Text: Sure! Liubech wasn't an interesting place to stay in and people used to head for Ryabinushka right after they got into the Zone.

Dialog.Title: I found a peculiar book...|| I think it sais something about Ryabinushka
Dialog.Text: Give me that! Very interesting...hum...But the author is such a liar.

Dialog.Title: Why liar?
Dialog.Text: The mutant he mentioned in the book used to help people...you know, "incognito". Once it was seen ...fixing a roof of an old shed. Well, of course nobody got what its intentions were, people rushed to grab guns, pitchforks, shovels....It was the last time I saw that mutant.

Dialog.Title: Do you know what's become of it?
Dialog.Text: We chased it away. I tried to convince the others it was enough.. but they didn't listen. They wanted to kill the monster so they traced him down. All I know is that their bodies were found somewhere on Vesuvius..Noone ever came back.

Dialog.Title: Where is Basilisk now?
Dialog.Text: Don't think it's still alive...Anyway I wasn't among those who tried to kiil the mutant. I left Ryabinuska as soon as I ever could...Damn you, boy! I sobered up...while talking to you. Leave me along!

Dialog.Title: I found a peculiar book...|| I think it sais something about Ryabinushka
Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Ух, ты! Помнит Артур своих друзей! Молодец! Уважаю! Ему от меня поздравление обязательно передавай! Спасибо, сталкер, порадовал! И тебе самые наилучшие пожелания в новом году! А ещё небольшой Новогодний подарочек держи.

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Слушай, мне тут загадку загадали, так я её не отгадал! Представляешь! А, когда ответ узнал правильный, так вообще стыдно стало за себя! Ха-ха! А ты сможешь разгадать? Вот скажи мне, сколько кусков жареного мяса войдёт в твой пустой желудок?

Dialog.Title: Десять!
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты. В пустой желудок только один кусок войти может! Потом он уже не пустой! Ха-ха! Бывай, сталкер. С Новым годом тебя!

Dialog.Title: Пять!
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты. В пустой желудок только один кусок войти может! Потом он уже не пустой! Ха-ха! Бывай, сталкер. С Новым годом тебя!

Dialog.Title: Много!
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты. В пустой желудок только один кусок войти может! Потом он уже не пустой! Ха-ха! Бывай, сталкер. С Новым годом тебя!

Dialog.Title: Сколько предложат!
Dialog.Text: Эх, ты. В пустой желудок только один кусок войти может! Потом он уже не пустой! Ха-ха! Бывай, сталкер. С Новым годом тебя!

Dialog.Title: Один!
Dialog.Text: Хм... А ты и правда смышлёный! Конечно только один! Потом желудок уже не пустой! Ха-ха! Ну, держи презент! Заслужил! И счастливого Нового Года тебе!

Dialog.Title: You know a lot about the war, don't you?
Dialog.Text: Do I know a lot about thу war? I don't even know how to to tell you...Are there a lot of grains in sugar? Or drops in the Black Sea? Yes, I do know a lot, even more than I want..I'd prefer to forget some things. What about you? How mush do you know?

Dialog.Title: Well, I've read books.
Dialog.Text: Books? Do you think that's enough? Look at him, he has read books! Amswer my questions, let see what you know. If you're indeed well informed, I'll give you fireworks. The Victory Day is soon anyway.

Dialog.Title: Fireworks? That's too much...
Dialog.Text: I'm serious! Even here, in the Zone, we must remember about those who died so that we could live. Nothing can stop us from honoring the memory of the soldiers who shed blood in the war.

Dialog.Title: You're so right. Ask your questions.
Dialog.Text: In for a penny, in for a pound. I'll ask you one question, for more you should see other veterans. Just congratulate them.

Dialog.Title: Let's do it!
Dialog.Text: Get ready.

Dialog.Title: Always up for a challenge.
Dialog.Text: There was a tank called NI-1 used in the battles during the siege of Odessa. What does "NI" stand for?

Dialog.Title: "Net Imperalismy" ("Say no to imperialism")!
Dialog.Text: Say no to wrong answers! Did you not sleep well last night? Here, take this. I'll help you think better.

Dialog.Title: "Nash Iosiph" (Our Joseph)! Named after Stalin.
Dialog.Text: You must be kidding me!

Dialog.Title: "Na Ispug" ("Bluff into retreat")! Sirens, night atacks!
Dialog.Text: Well done, stalker! You're not just a twaddler. No you should see Sanek the Old Coon, he'll test you with another question. Good luck!

Dialog.Title: I'm stubborn. I won't give in!
Dialog.Text: It's just the beginning.

Dialog.Title: Я упрямый. До конца пойду!
Dialog.Text: А ты молодец! Оправдываешь ожидания! Так держать, путь только начинается!

Dialog.Title: I answered all the questions.
Dialog.Text: Exellent! I knew you'd nail it, stalker. Well done, well done. You honor the memory of the fallen in the war. As I promised, this is for you. Celebrate the Victory Day properly.

Dialog.Title: That's exactly what I'm gonna do.
Dialog.Text: By the way, you can help the Hatter, if you want to. He's planning to produce some sort of a play about the war.

Dialog.Title: Ask me more questions.
Dialog.Text: Give yourself a break. Read a good book, take a walk and come again tomorrow, then we will talk.

Dialog.Title: I need to refresh a bit.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hey! Ain't you had enough here?

Dialog.Title: I'm trying to stay away from troubles.
Dialog.Text: There's no way you can stay away from troubles in the Zone. You'll have to fight against mutants one way or another.

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me about mutants?
Dialog.Text: Everything you can see around is the result of anomalous impact. I'm talking about mutations, new agressive and vicious forms of life, whose only desire is to kill everything they meet on the way. The only possible way to fight eith 'em is to eliminate 'em. So we gotta kill 'em before they get to us.

Dialog.Title: Are there mutants of many types?
Dialog.Text: You bet! Some of 'em remotely remind human beings and "white coats" say they used to be people. Some of 'em are mutanted animals, such as rats, dogs or boars that used to be harmless creatures but ain't any more. And also there're the most dangerous and agressive ones...noone knows where they came from. You wouldn't like to come across one, believe me.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about mutated human beings...
Dialog.Text: Well..we don't know if they did use to be real people..but it doesn't matter cause now they ain't alike us at all. I herad rumors that silvans would "communicate" with poeople, but I think it's bullshit. Other creatures, sages, remotely remind people but there's nothing we could have in common.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about mutated animals...
Dialog.Text: There're lots of 'em...mutated dogs, rats, spiders, bears or even boars, you can come across them anywhere. Stalkers hunt for 'em every day.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about the most dangerous and vicious mutants...
Dialog.Text: As I said.. noone knows where they came from or what they are. "White Coats" are ready to pay for their parts and that's all I need to know, my friend. They even named those monsters, so now you can come across sach aliens as blyaks, verliocks or even fiends.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about silvans...
Dialog.Text: "White coats" say they have ultra high metabolism and capacity for regeneration. They're ugly, bloodthirsty and ALWAYS hungry. One stalker told me that his friend told him that he saw how stalkers were actually talking to a silvan..and that..they can help people pull artifacts out of anomalies. Can you believe this? I didn't believe a word.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about saged...
Dialog.Text: They're real psychos. They use psi energy to attack, making zombies out of their victims.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about mutated rats...
Dialog.Text: Rats are rats, you know. Sone of 'em are so huge that they can bite your head off. They carry infectious disease and breed like rabbits.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about mutated dogs...
Dialog.Text: A dog is said to be a man's best friends..but not anymore. Those are worst than The Hound of the Baskervilles. If you see a god, kill it. You'd better be quick.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about mutated spiders...
Dialog.Text: Ain't you afraid of spiders? They're huge and very agressive. So if you come across this mutant, shoot on sight. By the way, "white coats" buy spider legs. In case, if you need some cash..

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about mutated boars...
Dialog.Text: They look like common bears, but things are not always what they semm, you know. They're huge and have very thick skin. The good news is if you're a skilled hunter, you'll a mutant boar hands down.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more about mutated bears...
Dialog.Text: Oh, that one is the king of mutants. It's extremely strong so don't hunt for it until you find a proper armor and a gun.

Dialog.Title: Blyaks...?
Dialog.Text: They like hiding in dark and damp places.. such as cellars, swamps, caves..They suck blood out of their victims.

Dialog.Title: Verliocks...?
Dialog.Text: We don't know a lot about 'em cause just a few survived after they came across this monster. The minute a verliock sees you, iy lashes out at you immediately.

Dialog.Title: Fiends...?
Dialog.Text: So-called "brainsuckers". They're said to eat human brains...If they get close to you and attack, that's the end. They'll make a vegetable out of you and then.. suck your life out.

Dialog.Title: That's all I wanted to know, thank you.
Dialog.Text: Most people think that arts are the most valuable findings in the Zone, but I don't agree. Mutants are the reason why this place is so attractive. In fact, artifacts are rare..as for mutants.. they're everywhere. If you're broke or dying for something to eat, just kill some.. The formula is simple. It's risky, though, I know. But everything is risky here, no matter what you're gonna do.

Dialog.Title: Tell me more.
Dialog.Text: What do you wanna know?

Dialog.Title: And are there any other mutants?
Tell me more about mutated animals...
Tell me more about the others.
Do you know why Prokhor is so angry?
Dialog.Text: I think he's just very scared. He'd love to leave this place but he has nowhere to go.

Dialog.Title: *Tell him about Pope's problem.* |A pope had a dog. The dog ate some mutant meat and became a vicious mutant leader.
Dialog.Text: Talk to a man named Scar, he's a skilled hunter. I think he's at the bar.

Dialog.Title: I have some questions about the Zone.
Dialog.Text: Ask away!

Dialog.Title: Have you heard about the accident on the bridge?
Dialog.Text: I have. There was a consoy going from outside the perimeter. I don't know what exactly had happened but the trucks never got here.

Dialog.Title: Do you think mutants caused the accident?
Dialog.Text: Of course! It had never happened before and mutants are getting more agressive, they're getting closer to the perimeter.

Dialog.Title: I see...
Dialog.Text: There're rumors, you know, that people were inside the trucks. Sergeant Dibenko behaved strangely the day before...in fact, the military constracted a kind of landing point.

Dialog.Title: Landing point? What for?
Dialog.Text: For copters. I know what I'm talking about, believe me. I was hunting neraby and I saw everything myself. I guess they were getting ready to trasport somebody... let's say people from the trucks...But everything went wrong, mutants attacked the base, the tracks crashed and the copters didn't arrive..

Dialog.Title: Ain't it too dangerous to fly over the Zone?
Dialog.Text: Everybody does know that it's very dangerous! Dibenko must have been sure his pilots would manage it since he went for it.

Dialog.Title: I must be off now. take care!
How did you get into the Zone?
Dialog.Text: I came here cause it's a perfect place for hunting. Kill as many mutants as you want and get bonuses for that! Ain't it a paradise for a stalker? Keep trophies as you want, sell mutant pasrts if you need money and you'll be alright!

Dialog.Title: I see...
Dialog.Text: There're rumors, you know, that people were inside the trucks. Sergeant Dibenko behaved strangely the day before...in fact, the military constracted a kind of landing point.

Dialog.Title: Do you know anything about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: I heard about a guy by that name and I know he's dead. Sorry, man, I don't think I can be of any help. I barely knew the guy.

Dialog.Title: Артур поздравляет с Новым Годом
Dialog.Text: Не забыл значит Артур о Мише Охотнике! Спасибо тебе, сталкер! Артуру передавай мои поздравления и крепкого здоровья в новом году! Прими и ты мои поздравления и небольшой подарочек!

Dialog.Title: Спасибо!
Dialog.Text: Слушай, сталкер, а отгадай загадку! Если отгадаешь, я тебе ещё один маленький новогодний подарочек сделаю. Вот скажи, что такое -- чем больше их поймаешь, тем меньше у тебя, а чем меньше их поймаешь, тем больше у тебя?

Dialog.Title: Деньги?
Dialog.Text: Не... Блохи! Ха-ха-ха! Ладно, бывай. С Новым Годом!

Dialog.Title: Радиация?
Dialog.Text: Не... Блохи! Ха-ха-ха! Ладно, бывай. С Новым Годом!

Dialog.Title: Крысы?
Dialog.Text: Не... Блохи! Ха-ха-ха! Ладно, бывай. С Новым Годом!

Dialog.Title: Артефакты?
Dialog.Text: Не... Блохи! Ха-ха-ха! Ладно, бывай. С Новым Годом!

Dialog.Title: Блохи?
Dialog.Text: Точно! Они! Сразу видно, что ты старый охотник! Ха-ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: I'm ready to answer your questions.
Dialog.Text: You talked to Blacksmith, didn't you? Well if so.. I'll test your knowledge. Sure you're ready?

Dialog.Title: Of course.
Dialog.Text: There's a miniseries called "Seventeen Moments of Spring" based on the novel of the same title. There was a scene where Stierlitz hit Fritz with a bottle...So the question is - what was in the bottle?

Dialog.Title: Champagne.
Dialog.Text: Do you think they were celebrating something? Try again.

Dialog.Title: Cognac.
Dialog.Text: That's right! Well done, stalker. Now go to Old Stalker. He'll reward you.

Dialog.Title: Beer.
Dialog.Text: Beer? Do you think they were sitting in a local pub? Try again.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hey, stalker!

Dialog.Title: I don't have time for this.
What do you want?
Dialog.Text: I want you to do a favor for me. Hand this 15 rubles from me toTyomich. He's at the other entrance of the station.

Dialog.Title: Why can't you do it yourself?
Dialog.Text: It's a long story...I just can't.

Dialog.Title: I don't have time for games.
Dialog.Text: Games? it's vital, how can you not undertand? It's a matter of life and death.

Dialog.Title: Alright. I'll do it.
Dialog.Text: Thanks! Take the money. Tell him the Owl says hello...

Dialog.Title: That's all. He didn't give me anything in return.
Dialog.Text: You're kidding, right? How come he didn't give you anything? Whatam I suppose to do now?

And that's all? Damn... Listen, stalker. That guy, whom you gave that coin, owes Owl a lot. And these money are nothing. Owl will be upset. It is not even a half. If I won't deliver Tyomich's debt, I will be the first who get "hurt". Tyomich is deep in the Zone now and he is hard to reach. And I have a wife and a little kid. Owl will take them as hostages. What we gonna do?

That's all? Damn... Listen, stalker. That guy, whom you gave that coin, owes Owl a lot. And these money are nothing. Owl will be upset. It is not even a half. If I won't deliver Tyomich's debt, I will be the first who get "hurt". Tyomich is deep in the Zone now and he is hard to reach. And I have a wife and a little kid. Owl will take them as hostages. What we gonna do?

Dialog.Title: Not my problem.
Dialog.Text: Damn it...I'm dead.

Dialog.Title: I can take care of Owl.
Dialog.Text: No, bro. Thanks, but I don't think you can handle Owl. This bird is too high for you.

Dialog.Title: I can visit Tyomich again.
Dialog.Text: That's great. Ask him to pay back at least a half of the debt. If not The Owl will think we're making fun of him, he'll kill us both for that.

That sounds better. But damn... I need to return it all. I just... need. And Tyomich has money. He is lying. Ivy saw him with good valuable artefacts recently. Tyomich sold them for a good price. Now his pockets are so full of money that he can barely walk in his pants. Tyomich is no trader or pusher, he doesn't need so much. He is walking just for fun. Ask him again, he must return everything. He must. Or I'll go there myself and beg him for it.

Dialog.Title: He said he don't have money.
Dialog.Text: He is lying. Ivy saw him with good valuable artefacts recently. Tyomich sold them for a good price. Now his pockets are so full of money that he can barely walk in his pants. Tyomich is no trader or pusher, he doesn't need so much. He is walking just for fun. Ask him again, he must return everything. He must. Or I'll go there myself and beg him for it.

Dialog.Title: I will talk to Tyomich again. But this is the last time.
Tyomich says you don't have a family.
Dialog.Text: You got me...I confess that I lied. But I do have my own life! I can't explore the Zone like he does...I wanna stay alive. I wanted you to sympathise me, that's all. Forgive me, stalker. The truth is that I an in trouble. I must take Tyomich's debt or I'm a dead man.

Dialog.Title: He doesn't have any money left.|| He says the arts were empty.
Dialog.Text: Now I'm dead.

And this is looking like a payment now. Ok, thank you. I hope Owl won't kill me... Listen... There is one problem. I owe Owl too. That is why I'm working for him. If I could bring a part of my debt too, that would be awesome. Can you lend me a couple of hundreds?

Dialog.Title: Take 200 rubles||, I'm kind today.
Dialog.Text: Thanks buddy! You saved my life!

Dialog.Title: Are you kidding me?!
Dialog.Text: Sorry, sorry... My fault.

Dialog.Title: How are you doing?
Dialog.Text: How do you think I'm doing? I owe The Owl myself. Can you lend me some?

Dialog.Title: Do you know why Prochor is so angry?
Dialog.Text: No and I don't care.

Dialog.Title: Who was I suppose to deliver the cash?
Dialog.Text: Ain't you done with it? Holy cra...Did you just steal from me for crying out loud? I told you it was life-or-death.

Dialog.Title: Sorry...goldfish memory.
Dialog.Text: Hand it to Tyomich, he's near the entrance to the station. Tell him it's from the Owl. Come on! Don't stand like a stock.

Dialog.Title: Do you know anything about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: I would have killed that idiot myself but somebody was ahead me! I gave him a mission to deliver money and he just pocketed all the cash, little bastard.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Stalker, go your way. I do not bother you and you don't bother me.

Dialog.Title: Owl sends his regards.
Dialog.Text: Really? And what else?
He makes fun of me? I'll catch this rat and will tear him into shreds. I tired of his threats already.

Dialog.Title: Easy. I know nothing about it.|| Some guy asked me, on the other side of the station.
Dialog.Text: That's Owl's signature, he use people. Can you imagine, I lent his money at interest once, and he still can't buzz off. It's his joke -- to send a coin, and then you receive a knife in the ribs and become food for mutants. He's a slippery type. And the guy who sent you, this Powell... I don't know why Blacksmith and Kisliy are still keep him here. He's running errands for Owl, and everyone knows it. Okay, take this. And tell him, I'll not give them any more.

Dialog.Title: Okay, I'll take it to him.
Need more money.
Dialog.Text: Go away! Go to Zone! I said, no more money.

Dialog.Title: We must save Powell's family.|Powell says Owl will take his family hostage, if he does not bring your debt. We must save the kid.
Dialog.Text: What family? And you believe him? He has no family. Quirky extortionist. Now he'll tell you about his wife, children, mom, dad, grandma sick... Damn, now you dragged into all this... Here, take a hundred, let this freak know, no more coins from me. I'm not going to pay any more. And if he tries to attack me, I'll strangle him with my bare hands.

Dialog.Title: I'll take it to him. Thanks.
Powell says, you have the money||, recently you've sold good artefacts.
Dialog.Text: Stalker, turn on your brains. Some guy, who never was further than the station, says that I've sold good artefacts. Did he saw at least one good artefact in his life? The last raid I returned with bad and cheap artefacts. All empty. I sold them for a penny, because it's hard to carry them around. The penny I gave you long time ago. Hey, aren't you in conspiracy with them? Maybe you too work for Owl? What's your catch? Get out of here.

Dialog.Title: I'm afraid, they'll kill him.
Dialog.Text: Damn ... Rrrr... GOOD. HERE. TAKE IT. But that's all. No more coins.

Dialog.Title: Do you know why Prochor is so angry?
Dialog.Text: Prochor? No, I don't know... He can't live quietly.

Dialog.Title: You know about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: Never heard about him.

Dialog.Title: We must save Powell's family.|Powell says Owl will take his family hostage, if he does not bring your debt. We must save the kid.
Dialog.Text: What family? And you believe him? He has no family. Quirky extortionist. Now he'll tell you about his wife, children, mom, dad, grandma sick... Damn, now you dragged into all this... I already gave you a hundred, let this freak know, no more coins from me. I'm not going to pay any more. And if he tries to attack me, I'll strangle him with my bare hands.

Dialog.Title: I'll take it to him. Thanks.
I'm afraid, they'll kill him.
Dialog.Text: No more coins.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Shh...Quiet.

Dialog.Title: Who?
Dialog.Text: They will tell you more.

Dialog.Title: Are you Mitka?
Dialog.Text: Well yeah.

Dialog.Title: Acid send his regards.|Are you Mitya? Kolya Acid sent his regards.
Dialog.Text: Acid? Never heard of him.

Dialog.Title: Who do you hunt?
Dialog.Text: С какими военными?

Dialog.Title: He is your friend.|| He asked how you're doing.
Dialog.Text: I have no time, do not bother me.

Dialog.Title: Have you seen a man with a barrett?
Dialog.Text: I remember one old man came for the gun oil. There was a sheathed rifle behind his back, that might have been a barrett.

Dialog.Title: Where did he go?
Dialog.Text: He never left.

Dialog.Title: And where is he?
Dialog.Text: I'm not sure I remember...I think the "Conductor" and "Heat" artifacts will refresh my memory.

Dialog.Title: I brought the artifacts.
Dialog.Text: Really?

Dialog.Title: Yes. I've already given them 'all to you.
Dialog.Text: Oh yes, you're right. But the man has left...maybe that's for the best.

Dialog.Title: Left? Where did he go?
Dialog.Text: I don't know.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for sale.
I need to repair some stuff.
I need to fix all.
Dialog.Text: I will fix all that you're wearing for %COMPLEX_COST% rubles. Deal?

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a missing plane.
Dialog.Text: Why?

Dialog.Title: Something valuable might be undamaged.
Dialog.Text: I think It'll be fair if you pay me for the information. Let say, 10 000 rubles.

Dialog.Title: I wanna find the sirvivors.
Dialog.Text: I doubt someone has survived. I saw how the plane crahsed and fell down on the south-west. If anyone did survive ... they do need your help.

Dialog.Title: Leonid Ceasar asked me to help.
Dialog.Text: He pays you for the job, right? I think it'll be fair if you share with me. 10 000 will be enough.

Dialog.Title: Here's your money.
Dialog.Text: I saw how the plane fell downon the south-west. It must have crashed in square Д5 or Г5.

Dialog.Title: I don't have that much.
Dialog.Text: Well, come over when you do.

Dialog.Title: I can pay you for any useful information.
Dialog.Text: Sorry man. Not this time. It's better for me to hold my tongue.

Dialog.Title: Something valuable might be undamaged.
Dialog.Text: I think It'll be fair if you pay me for the information. Let say, 10 000 rubles.

Dialog.Title: Leonid Ceasar asked to help.
Dialog.Text: He pays you for the job, right? I think it'll be fair if you share with me. 10 000 will be enough.

Dialog.Title: Hey, talking of the price of the information...
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: I've found out all I needed.
Dialog.Text: Whatever.

Dialog.Title: Sounds fair.
Dialog.Text: So?

Dialog.Title: Sounds fair.
Dialog.Text: So?

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for exchange.
What do you know about the diggings?
Dialog.Text: What diggings? You'd better ask Former Colonel about that. He's in charge here.

Dialog.Title: Do you remember Acid now?
Dialog.Text: Why do you care anyway? Hey, I bet you can't cross the Caravan and survive the journey.

Dialog.Title: Are you trying to dare me?
Dialog.Text: I am.

Dialog.Title: What's at stake?
Dialog.Text: A "Vesuvius".

Dialog.Title: Why so generous?
Dialog.Text: It's expensive I know. It's just that you're not the first guy I dared to that...noone has returned.

Dialog.Title: Why are you doung this?
Dialog.Text: I'm not doing anything. They all did it voluntarily so will you. I see your eyes are already sparkling...

Dialog.Title: Why do you need it anyway?
Dialog.Text: I have my own reasons. If you do get back, I'll be sure you can be trusted. There's no use telling anything to a man that will die in the very first anomaly he ever comes across. Is that clear?

Dialog.Title: No, thanks. Maybe some other time.
Ok. I accept the challenge.
Dialog.Text: Here's the deal.You don't expect me to believe on your bare word, do you? I want you to write a couple of notes and leave them to people who you meet there. There ain't any settlements on the Caravan but people do live there. So, take some toilet paper along. Will be useful anyway. One more thing, in case if you don't know how to get to the Caravan, find a man called Kolya Badger.Tell him I sent you and he'll give you a discount. Vesuvius 's waiting for you, get back...alive.

Dialog.Title: You didn't really expect me to terurn, do you?
Dialog.Text: You're right. But I hoped.

Dialog.Title: Here's my gift to you. A roll of toilet paper.
Dialog.Text: You're a tough guy. No you can relax. Here, take this Vesuvius away.

Dialog.Title: So, what's next?
Dialog.Text: Next? Try to stay alive, heh. Come over any time.

Dialog.Title: Do you not want to make sure I'm not lying?
Dialog.Text: Rumors are flying you know...I believe you.

Dialog.Title: Do you know a man named Scar?
Dialog.Text: I do.

Dialog.Title: Where can I find him?
Dialog.Text: Why do you care?

Dialog.Title: Его ищут. Говорят, он военных пострелял...
Dialog.Text: Ну и пусть дальше ищут. Мне-то что с того?

Dialog.Title: Могут быть последствия для всех... || Военные грозятся, что устроят зачистку, если Шрама не найдут.
Dialog.Text: Если бы ты знал, чем занимается Шрам, ты бы не спешил верить военным.

Dialog.Title: As far as I know he sells some rarities...
Dialog.Text: Listen, what he does is not the point. Believe me on that.

Dialog.Title: What do you mean?
Dialog.Text: Nevermind.

Dialog.Title: Where can I find him?
Dialog.Text: You will find him when the time comes. You've survived the test...you came back, so I can give you a hint. Go to a couple of our friends and ask them to tell you " A tale about the Whisper".

Dialog.Title: Will you tell me anything about Scar?
Dialog.Text: There's nothing to tell. The time hasn't come yet.

Dialog.Title: Why is he so importnat anyway?
Dialog.Text: There's time for everything.

Dialog.Title: Ok, I got it. Take care.
We need to talk.
Dialog.Text: What's up?

Dialog.Title: Do you know where I can find him?
Dialog.Text: Listen, I'd tell you something if I was sure I can trust you. I heard you got in with the military, so I don't feel it's safe for me to talk to you.

Dialog.Title: Come on! I'm ready for this.
Dialog.Text: You seem to be a tough guy. The problem is that I know you got in with the military which means it's better for me to keep my mouth shut.

Dialog.Title: Не похож ты на простого барыгу...
Dialog.Text: Хех. А то!

Dialog.Title: Что за "Шепот"?
Dialog.Text: У них спроси.

Dialog.Title: Ты обещал наводку на Шрама.
Dialog.Text: Придет время, и ты обязательно его найдешь. Я тебе отвечаю. Ты прошел мою... "нашу" проверку... Не замарал туалетной бумаги и вернулся живой, хе-хе... Но пока рано, извиняй, брат. Могу дать тебе кое-какую наводку, чтобы ты проникся, так сказать. У нас с тобой есть пара общих знакомых, которых ты можешь пораспросить. Тема распросов будет такая: "Расскажи-ка мне, друг, байку о Шепоте".

Dialog.Title: Так что там за наводка на Шрама?
Dialog.Text: Хм... Ладно. Ты и правда производишь впечатление крутого чувака. Могу дать тебе кое-какую наводку, чтобы ты проникся, так сказать. У нас с тобой есть пара общих знакомых, которых ты можешь пораспросить. Тема распросов будет такая: "Расскажи-ка мне, друг, байку о Шепоте".

Dialog.Title: Что еще за "Шепот"?
Dialog.Text: У них спроси.
Looking for something?

Dialog.Title: What are you doing here?
Dialog.Text: Listen, just get out. I don't have time for talking.

Dialog.Title: As you say.
Dialog.Text: Wait... Are you going from Lubech's railway station? There was a bar desk, where you could buy some cigarettes. Do you have a box of it?

Dialog.Title: Yes. Sure.
Dialog.Text: O! Thanks, friend.

Dialog.Title: Will you answer my questions now?
Dialog.Text: Why not? Ask me something.

Dialog.Title: I don't.
Dialog.Text: Aaaah...so get lost.

Dialog.Title: What's so special about Ivy's cigarettes?
Dialog.Text: It is hard to explain. I don't know and don't want to know how he makes it, but you won't find anything like that anywhere.

Dialog.Title: What are you doing here?
Dialog.Text: I'm selling some special tools. Do you need one? Only 2 Screens and 80 000. You can fix even a rare stuff with them, if your hands are good enough.

Dialog.Title: I will come back later.
Dialog.Text: Mmm... OK... Ah, the motherf....sorry. But this tobacco is SOOOOO delicious.

Dialog.Title: Do you know about mutants in the new district?
Dialog.Text: Get lost.

Dialog.Title: I gave you everything you need.|| Where are the tools?
Dialog.Text: Sorry, pal. Here you go.

Dialog.Title: Do you know about mutants in the new district?| I have been in one place. There are dead bodies of mutants laid in some kind of ritual circle.
Dialog.Text: You should talk to Stepan about it. He is somewhere in this building.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I've been robbed!

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: One bandit stole all my equipment and killed my friend! I'm gonna find this asshole. I don't need my stuff. Only this bastard's head! I can pay you.

Dialog.Title: I can bring you your equipment.
Bastard is dead. ||But I didn't find anything with him.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, stalker. I think he stashed my stuff. I'll find it by myself.

Dialog.Title: About robbery...
Dialog.Text: What?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Who are you? Go away.

Dialog.Title: We need to talk.
Dialog.Text: Well, you probably need to talk. I don't. Go away.

Dialog.Title: It's me. We need to talk.
Dialog.Text: Herad about you. Even a journeyman told me about you. Since he's so impressed, I can show you want we got for sale or repair something.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for sale.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Sup?

Dialog.Title: Здоров.
Dialog.Text: Слушай, хочешь поговорить с Мастером? Он тут, рядом. Чинит и продает вещи. Но он с незнакомыми не разговаривает. Старый параноик.

Dialog.Title: Нет, не хочу.
Dialog.Text: Ну, как хочешь. Но он -- Мастер, это я тебе заявляю!

Dialog.Title: И как же мне с ним поговорить?
Dialog.Text: Я могу замолвить за тебя словечко. Ну, знаешь, представить тебя как очень важную персону, знаменитость. Не бесплатно, конечно. 1000 рублей хватит. Просто я тут куртку одну испортил, так пока Мастер не спалил, надо срочно купить точно такую же.

Dialog.Title: Хорошо, вот 1000. Поговори с Мастером.
Dialog.Text: Отлично. Когда в следующий раз к нему подойдешь, он уже будет думать, что ты -- чертовски важный клиент.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello. I don't have much goods, but the price is fair for all. Come, choose.

Dialog.Title: Why not much?
Dialog.Text: Well... Some nimble thieves are to blame. These rats are stealing my goods. Today, I open a shop in the morning, and didn't find the bag of goods. And where only guards watching. Probably, the bastard that I am robbed, ran close to, but here is hidden behind the houses. Someone would have killed him. I do not feel sorry for your bag, But if the thief is gone, will continue me steal.

Dialog.Title: Well,I'm going to kill the thief, for a bag of goods.
As your business?
Dialog.Text: Oh, hard. Thieves can not get enough. That's just the morning, cleaned out again, the bastards.

Dialog.Title: I understand necessary find the thief.
You cannot strengthen the protection,or put locks better?
Dialog.Text: I thought, of course, but the protection is worth the money, and I was robbed on a regular basis. I could barely make ends meet. Well, you and the other bounty hunters, at my request, the local thieves shoot, should they ever end ...

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
You know how it feels, right? Can't spend a day without killing someone.

Dialog.Title: Neither can I.
Dialog.Text: Then listen, here's a tip. One wiseguy decided he might offend our boss Owl and steal from him, without paying. He hide in places with anomalies. He think we will not find him there. Prove that he was wrong. Shoot him, understand? Let the others ponder. You can keep all that you'll find on him. For us, it's not a matter of money, it's a matter of respect.

Dialog.Title: You're insane.
Dialog.Text: Oh YEAH? You'd better run away then. Run fast.

Dialog.Title: Говорят, вы курьера ограбили...
Dialog.Text: Эй, полегче с такими заявами. Чего тебе?

Dialog.Title: При нем был задающий генератор.
Dialog.Text: Понял. Сколько за него отвалишь?

Dialog.Title: 100 рублей.
Dialog.Text: Не смеши мои бутсы. Такие деньги в кармане-то носить стыдно. 20 штук эта железка стоит, я же вижу.

Dialog.Title: 10 000 рублей.
Dialog.Text: Хм... Раз ты свой, я так скажу, отдам за 15.

Dialog.Title: 12 000 и по рукам.
Dialog.Text: Хорошо, убедил.

Dialog.Title: Where's the generator?
Dialog.Text: Go find a guide called Sashka. He's got what you need.

Dialog.Title: Свинца отвалю. На всю голову.
Dialog.Text: Шутник. Не отвалишь. Мы сейчас в безопаске. Я тебе так скажу. 50 штук приноси, ни копейкой меньше. Тогда подумаю, отдавать или нет. А будешь дальше шутить, я ребят снизу созову, и они славно над тобой поработают. Да так поработают, что ты с радостью поползешь обниматься с бляком. Ты меня понял, дурка?

Dialog.Title: Успокойся. Вот твои 50 000.
Dialog.Text: Хе-хе-хе...

Dialog.Title: Свинца отвалю. На всю голову.
Dialog.Text: Не шуми. Думал, ты свой. Чего злой такой? Отдам я его. За 5 штук.

Dialog.Title: Alright. Take 5 000.
Dialog.Text: Nice.

Dialog.Title: Wait here. I'll be back with money.
Хорошо. Вот твои 20 000.
Dialog.Text: Хе-хе-хе...

Dialog.Title: Проводник требует денег.
Dialog.Text: Ну, что я могу. Я ему не указ. Видишь, у нас эта... как ее... демократия. У всех равные права. Я свое согласие дал. Генератор твой. Но раз сейчас он у других, решай с ними сам.

Dialog.Title: Генератор у вашего торговца...|| а торговец требует денег.
Your trader knocked me down...|and I woke up on Novaya Zemlya...
Dialog.Text: Don't be mad at him. It was no more than a mistake. He mistook you for another stalker. Now he will give you what you need for sure.

Dialog.Title: He did...
Dialog.Text: You see, he's a serious man.

Dialog.Title: I can. What I can't live without is riddles.
Dialog.Text: You're a funny man, huh? What if I tell you a riddle? What will I get for that?

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: Not much I need three AKMS guns.Will you get me them?

Dialog.Title: No problem.
Dialog.Text: That's how you do it!

Dialog.Title: I got you the guns. Count them.
Dialog.Text: No need in that, I trust you.Here's your reward. As for the riddle. how about this one:" Four ears, two bellies. What's that?" Peace, man.

Dialog.Title: Yeah, peace.
Dialog.Text: Be safe, stalker.

Dialog.Title: I'm here to talk. Shtaket's bail for me.
Dialog.Text: Are you the one that's looking for the truth? What did you bring along?

Dialog.Title: Got some goodies for the folks.
Dialog.Text: Thank you so much, stalker! You care about people.Shtaket was right about you. You're a fair man. We don't like sabotage here.

Dialog.Title: That's the thing. Two of the deserters are alive.
Dialog.Text: How do you know that?

Dialog.Title: The military lost their men and one truck.
Dialog.Text: I hope you have no reason to hook me. But still, I'm gonna check if that's true. So, it means, those two set us up?

Dialog.Title: Exactly.
Dialog.Text: That's good. That's damn good! This way we don't have to start a war and sacrifice our people..well but for those two of course. So, the war dogs are lookin' for the truck too. If you see any of them, tell them that they're unlucky if we're the first who find it. The deserters are dead in that case and two thirds of the cargo is ours. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: I'm not the one to take the decision. But I'll hand them your message.
Dialog.Text: Very well. So, that's it, then. You've got a coming from me for your job. Here's only a half. Come later to get the rest. And if we find the cargo, you're in.

Dialog.Title: Shtaket says hello.
Dialog.Text: It's good you came. Let's get straight to business. We're gonna give it hot for the war dogs. Do you know how? With you help!

Dialog.Title: What mess are you getting me in?
Dialog.Text: Calm down! We're fair folks. We need help from a man that's not often seen. I don't ask you to kill anyone. But I do want you to do something for me...

Dialog.Title: Ну, излагай.
Dialog.Text: Да там дел-то на два плевка, сталкер! Короче, так, идешь на КПП и у них там на каждом рация есть. Вот тебе лампы для них. Думаешь, небось, как мы вояк офоршмачим? А вот так. Лампы наш умелец обработал. В них, в патроне, пилюля с царской водкой. Когда завинчивать будешь, пилюля треснет, петришь? Рации из строя выйдут, да так, что просто лампочку не сменить будет. Связи вообще никакой.

Dialog.Title: Хитро! Не знал, что у вас такое есть.
