Dialog.Text: Ха, сталкер, это ж Зона! Только в отличие от крытой, здесь свобода кругом! Смышленому человеку тут такие дела светят! Ну ты, думаю, понял. Когда с рациями разберешься, иди на склад. Вот тебе еще пилюльки. Найди там на складах ящики с боеприпасами. На каждый по одной хватит. Вояки заметят саботаж, да метаться начнут, проверять, все ли годится. Ну а пока суть да дело, мы уже все провернем. А конкретно, все их патрули в Окрестностях прижмем. Мочканем кое-кого, остальных поучим.

Dialog.Title: Понятно. Ну, тогда я пошел?
Dialog.Text: Скорее уж, лети, авиатор! Смотри только, с пилюлями поосторожней. А то тебя потом так укоцанного найдут, что не опознают.

Dialog.Title: Я в деле. Увидимся после. (ложь)
Dialog.Text: Осторожней с пилюльками, сталкер, не раствори там себе чего не надо!

Dialog.Title: It's all being kept dark. You can start.
Dialog.Text: Nice job, stalker! Some day you'll join us.

Dialog.Title: You never can tell.
Dialog.Text: Guess so. Here's your reward! Hope that's more than enough. Now you'd better to heep your head down, go to the Spirits Plant, have a drink or two.

Dialog.Title: I got some tobacco for the folks.
Shtaket sent me.
Dialog.Text: I see...Let's talk business, then. We're gonna make it hard for the military..and guess what? You're gonna help us.

Dialog.Title: I didn't sign up for any of this!
Dialog.Text: Hey, calm down. We just need your help as from the guy who'll stay undetected. I don't ask you to kill anyone.

Dialog.Title: So, what am I supposed to do, then?
Dialog.Text: I want you to damage the walkie-talkies inside the checkpoint. I'll give you radio tubes for them you need to put instead the old ones. There's chloronitric acid in each lamp socket, so the connection will be lost immediately.

Dialog.Title: Хитро! Не знал, что у вас такое есть.
Dialog.Text: Ха, сталкер, это ж Зона! Только в отличие от крытой, здесь свобода кругом! Смышленому человеку тут такие дела светят! Ну ты, думаю, понял. Когда с рациями разберешься, иди на склад. Вот тебе еще пилюльки. Найди там на складах ящики с боеприпасами. На каждый по одной хватит. Вояки заметят саботаж, да метаться начнут, проверять, все ли годится. Ну а пока суть да дело, мы уже все провернем. А конкретно, все их патрули в Окрестностях прижмем. Мочканем кое-кого, остальных поучим.

Dialog.Title: Я в деле. Увидимся после. (ложь)
Dialog.Text: Осторожней с пилюльками, сталкер, не раствори там себе чего не надо!

Dialog.Title: Понятно. Ну, тогда я пошел?
Dialog.Text: Скорее уж, лети, авиатор! Смотри только, с пилюлями поосторожней. А то тебя потом так укоцанного найдут, что не опознают.

Dialog.Title: Look. I'm gonna do a magic trick!
Dialog.Text: What are you talking about? Have you gone nuts?

Dialog.Title: Look at my hands I said!
Dialog.Text: Get the hell out of here till I shoot you down!

Dialog.Title: I met Mr. Big...
Dialog.Text: Why are you telling me this?

Dialog.Title: I wanna more about him.
Dialog.Text: He's an old gangster. I ain't gonna tell you more than that.

Dialog.Title: I'm at one with you...
Dialog.Text: Listen, if the gang respects him, so do I.
Stalker! Need your help urgently!

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: All because of this anomaly... When we found it, we did something, somehow awakened it. You see, it has an amazing feature - produce clones of all who in the range. My colleagues do not understand what a disaster we are facing. Dozens, hundreds, thousands of shells, copies of unwary travelers, husks mindlessly wandering forward.

Dialog.Title: You found an anomaly, which clones people?|Wait a minute. You tell me you found an anomaly, which clones people?
Dialog.Text: Not really. These husks are not people. We can't make a contact with them. They seem to be stuck in their own reality. They are real enough and even capable of primitive reactions. We observed their fear and aggression. But no sign of intelligence or self-aware. I believe that they only mimic the actions they have seen in the past and the emotions of real people who had come into the anomaly.

Dialog.Title: What do you want from me?
Dialog.Text: How to delicately put it... The clones respond with aggression to any of our actions. Those are dangerous objects, stalker, and after showing up, they begin to go further and further from the anomalies, into the residential areas, into the bases and even outside of the Zone. You understand how dangerous it is? The anomaly makes these... These zombies, at least one per day. Someone has to hold them until we'll understand why this happens and how to stop it.

Dialog.Title: You want me to kill them?
Dialog.Text: Yes, you could say that... But do not think of it as a murder. We had a man who... eliminated these... beings. But he had disappeared, and the anomaly has released today yet another clone. Go by a dirt trail to the north-east, there you'll see the clump of anomalies which the clone was passing by. Now, in theory, he is moving along the broad road to the north.

Dialog.Title: No, too risky.|A murder is a murder. And what if a real person would be in those places? I will not take that kind of responsibility.
Dialog.Text: I understand, it is difficult. Thank you for having listened.

Dialog.Title: Clones again?
Dialog.Text: Yes. Another one was seen today...

Dialog.Title: Gotcha. I'll get rid of him.
I'm not gonna kill anybody else.
I know about Orlov.
Dialog.Text: What do you mean?

Dialog.Title: You canceled the task Simonov gave him.
Dialog.Text: He did it himself! I only said there were options. Simonov thinks he knows everything about the Zone. But he's wrong. I told Orlov where to make measurements. He's a wise man if he did what I told him. I feel sorry he got lost. Believe me, I have nothing to do with it.

Dialog.Title: You're under suspect from now on.
*Tell about Temon*| One stalker says he killed his own clone.
Dialog.Text: That proves they're among us! I'd love to examine him. How is he?

Dialog.Title: He went absolutely nuts...
Dialog.Text: I bet he did! That must have been tough to meet his own clone.

Dialog.Title: Is there a chance to fix him up?
Dialog.Text: I'm a scientist, not a doctor. He needs to be taken care of. I'm sure local doctors know how to heal the guy.

Dialog.Title: Talking of Temon...
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: I'll try to find a proper doctor.
What if he IS the clone?
Dialog.Text: No way. They aren't humans. They can't think or feel, they're just mindless copies of people who were unfortunate enough to wander around an anomaly.

Dialog.Title: All the people I know could be described that way...
Dialog.Text: They're just empty shells that receive energy from the Phon. Don't mix 'em up with real human beings.

Dialog.Title: What mission did you offer to Orlov?
Dialog.Text: The task is pretty the same that Simonov's, but it's necessary to visit six points on Vesuvius, including the northermost, the southernmost, the easternmost, the westernmost, the highest and the lowest points. I don't know where exactly those points and that even complicates the issue. Maybe that was why Orlov didn't manage to complete the task.

Dialog.Title: I cheked all points.
Dialog.Text: Yea, I'm analyzing data....Bad news, stalker.... very bad.

Dialog.Title: Why?
Dialog.Text: Concentration of the Phon around this area is going up. Which means that transmission of anomal energy slows down, but its solidness is growing. Only God knows why.

Dialog.Title: So what's gonna happen?
Dialog.Text: There'll be even more mutants, illusions, anomalies...Don't know which objects exactly the Phone reflects, but I know for sure it can reflect people. One of that anomalies is just near here, not far from the volcano. Besides, we're not sure about the exact effect of that energy on people. I'm assuming. that if the worst comes to the worst it'll tear us up from inside.

Dialog.Title: Pardon me?
Dialog.Text: The faster this energy spreads, the more enegry accumulate within the Zone. Did you know that the Phone not only circle the Zone but also go through it? Just like the air we breath. And we're breathing the Phone in right now. That's why the military consider the Zone infected. They're right at a point. It causes another serious problem.

Dialog.Title: Which problem?
Dialog.Text: When you're in the Zone, you're a part of the Phone. And the Phone is a part of you. Do ask me what happenes to people who leave the Zone. That's interesting.

Dialog.Title: What are you driving at?
Dialog.Text: Я считаю, что все частицы Фона связаны. Как молекулы единого организма. Они тянутся друг к другу... И погибают, оказавшись оторванными от "тела". Так человек, покинув Зону, начинает чахнуть. В конце концов он умирает. Или возвращается сюда и продолжает жить. По последним данным, весь научный персонал, активно посещавший Зону в прошлом, прошедший дезинфекцию и все проверки, но оставшийся по тем или иным причинам вне периметра, скончался по невыясненным, необъяснимым причинам. А ведь среди них были совсем юные дарования... И, напротив, люди оставшиеся в Зоне, включая стариков, так называемых "первопроходцев", живы до сих пор. Исключая тех, кто погиб в результате разбоя и атак мутантов, разумеется.

Dialog.Title: What are you driving at?
Dialog.Text: Люди Зоны зависят от нее гораздо сильнее, чем им кажется. Но вот дилемма. Все, кто не желает остаться здесь навсегда и неминуемо погибнуть, поймав бандитскую пулю, попав в аномалию, наткнувшись на мутантов или будучи раздавленным энергией Фона, уже должны собрать вещи и направиться к выходу. И тем не менее, покинув Зону, эти люди все равно умрут раньше своего срока.

Dialog.Title: Thta's...not very
Dialog.Text: Well..I hope we'll prove me wrong. But now I have no doubts in my theories.

Dialog.Title: That sounds like what Simonov told me.
Dialog.Text: Here's one thing I agree with Simonov on. Soon it's gonna be hard to leave the Zone. Simonov thinks that there're lots of such zones all around the world and there's a chance to travel between 'em, using them like kinda teleport.

Dialog.Title: Do you think so too?
Dialog.Text: No. Things are not what they look like in the Zone.

Dialog.Title: And I need yours, professor.
Dialog.Text: How can I possibly help a stalker? I'm a scientist, not a hunter or a pathfinder.

Dialog.Title: There's a signal effecting people's minds.
Dialog.Text: Oh, I see. Can't say I'm surprised. It's quite possible...taking into account the psionic abilities of some mutants. And what is it exactly? Just noises, phrases, screams...?

Dialog.Title: The Voice. The Voice is talking to us.
Dialog.Text: What?! A rational interaction? How is that possible? What is it saying? Did you hear it yourself?

Dialog.Title: Morse did. It's driving him crazy.
Dialog.Text: Oh God! Can you imagine what repercussion are gonna be like if someone gets their mind and thoughts transmitted? That would be a real disaster! We've got to take measures right now! Morse may well become a sort of retransmitter for those purposes. Morse is the one from the radio tower, right? That means the tower may become a booster. We can't let it happen, the Voice seems to be an agressive essence, which obviously aims to get in contact with human minds. we must do something before it happens.

Dialog.Title: You're right. But how can we...
Dialog.Text: I think the best idea is to damage the tower...I mean not blow it up, just knock out of service. We can reload it, for example. Thus, we'll have time to think everything over. We also have to take care of Morse. Find a loner by the name Timokha, ask him to give you a psychotropic drug called "Badluck". It'll neutralize the Voice...When you're done, get back here, we'll decide what to do next.

Dialog.Title: OK. I'm gonna see Timokha.
Dialog.Text: Hurry up!

Dialog.Title: I got the "Badluck".
Dialog.Text: Great! There're some things left to do. Look, I assembled a kind of magneto-electric grenade, this stuff will creat a powerful EMI-impulse. So, here's what you're going to do: first, you need to inject Morse with the "Badluck", then activate the grenade. I'm sure it'll put an end on all that Voice thing.

Dialog.Title: What if it won't?
Dialog.Text: Then, I'm afraid a lot of blood will be shed...Be prepared for whatever comes...

Dialog.Title: Always prepared!
Dialog.Text: Good luck to you. Hope you'll make it.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Ivan Hell needs your help.
Dialog.Text: What an aweful nickname! I wish I'd never had the "pleasure" to meet that man. What does he want from me?

Dialog.Title: He offers beneficial co-operation.
Dialog.Text: And what do I get?

Dialog.Title: What do you want?
Dialog.Text: Oh, not much. There're no more than a hundred items on the list, mainly samples of local fauna. Some of them are exceptionally rare! Is it you who'll get me those?

Dialog.Title: I brought the samples of local fauna.
Dialog.Text: Tell Ivan he can count on me.

Dialog.Title: What gives?
Dialog.Text: Hello-o-o!

Dialog.Title: Чего?
Dialog.Text: Пиздюлей

Dialog.Title: Hey. What is there to give?
Dialog.Text: Depends on what you're looking for.

Dialog.Title: What is this place?
Dialog.Text: You are so curios, Your nose is not itchy? I do not know who you are, and you already ask me "What is this place?". Maybe you will also ask me about is my sign of zodiac?

Dialog.Title: I am looking for work. That's asking.
Dialog.Text: From this it was necessary to start, my friend! We have a lot of work. What can you do?

Dialog.Title: I can dig and cannot dig.
Dialog.Text: Jester, eh? This is good. Humor is useful. Laugh a minute - is possible to think that you ate sour cream. Listen here. We have a different tasks, but they to be solved. Just our hands and feet do not reach. Do you understand?

Dialog.Title: Goodbye!
Dialog.Text: Goodbye!

Dialog.Title: Yes, I understand you.
Dialog.Text: Excellent. In general. If you love to kill various monsters, then you've come to the right place. We will always find you a job. Fortunately, there are many different monsters. Just remember that there are monsters whose head is not so good. Do you understand?

Dialog.Title: Yes, they everything here is incredibly evil!
Dialog.Text: Вот! Я как раз не об этом. Вернее об этом... но не совсем. Хорош меня путать! В общей массе зверье тут -- сволочуги дикие. Но, бывало, я лично натыкался на совсем не агрессивных особей. Да что уж там, на Икаре у меня животина ручная есть. Хотел с собой взять, да тут придурков толпы с ружьями наперевес туда - сюда галопом носятся и стреляют во все, что движется.

Dialog.Title: Икар?
Dialog.Text: Гм. Я это вслух сказал? Забей. Тебе еще рано об этом.

Dialog.Title: Как знаешь. Что там с работой?
Dialog.Text: Тут есть четыре типчика. Камиль, Ольг, Крокодил и Боно. Рекомендую сначала с Крокодилом поговорить. Он у нас таксидермист знатный. Причем слегка двинутый. Он делает чучела-гибриды. Нос от верлиоки, хвост от медведя, жопа от кабана и так далее. Они, блин, по отдельности-то страшные. А егонные уродцы вообще неподготовленного человека дурачком на всю жизнь сделать могут. Пытались запретить ему эту ересь ваять. Так он без дела вообще такую хрень творить начинает, что небу жарко.

Dialog.Title: А Камиль что исполняет?
Dialog.Text: Да ничего. Он спокойный. Слишком даже. Достал меня уже. Если ты его из себя выведешь, то я тебе пузырь поставлю. А то взрывы, ошметки плоти, кишки -- ниче его не берет. То ли папа у него ручник от Белаза, то ли лоботомию ему в детстве сделали. Дважды, причем.

Dialog.Title: Боно?
Dialog.Text: Ага. Увидишь -- сразу поймешь. Вообще вылитый. И музыку хорошую любит.

Dialog.Title: Олег?
Dialog.Text: Не. ОЛЬГ. Родители у него приколисты знатные. Не шути над его именем только. Чаще всего ему пофигу. Но иногда может и полоснуть.

Dialog.Title: Пойду перетру с ними.
Dialog.Text: С Богом, дружище.

Dialog.Title: Пойду перетру с ними.
Dialog.Text: Вперед!

Dialog.Title: Пойду перетру с ними.
Dialog.Text: Удачи.

Dialog.Title: Вопрос есть.
Dialog.Text: М?

Dialog.Title: Вопрос есть.
Dialog.Text: М?

Dialog.Title: Вопрос есть.
Dialog.Text: М?

Dialog.Title: Все понял.
Dialog.Text: Молодец. Иди с миром. Алюминь!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Хэллоу. Я вижу, ты от Зуя.

Dialog.Title: Именно.
Dialog.Text: Поди, работу ищешь?

Dialog.Title: В точку.
Dialog.Text: Ну так вот. Надеюсь, у тебя нет никаких уболбешенных принципов насчет "не укради"?

Dialog.Title: Вообще-то есть. Но...
Dialog.Text: Но?

Dialog.Title: Но эта мораль относительна.
Dialog.Text: Ах, друг мой. Нет в мире большей и худшей кучи дерьма, чем относительность морали... но...

Dialog.Title: Но?
Dialog.Text: Но в нашем с тобой случае это офигенно нам на руку.

Dialog.Title: И каким же образом?
Dialog.Text: Есть нехорошие люди, у них есть хорошие вещи. Это негармонично. Это не Инь-Янь. Это не Танго и Кэш...ты понял. Мы с тобой -- хорошие люди. И эти хорошие вещи должны быть у нас. Вернее одна штука у меня, все остальное -- у тебя.

Dialog.Title: Какая штука?
Dialog.Text: Я и сам толком не знаю. Флешка, микрочип, наладонник, диск, дискета, тетрадь. Кусок туалетной бумаги, наконец, с написанной на нем нужной мне инфой.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Ты что-то хотел?

Dialog.Title: Ага. Есть работа?
Dialog.Text: Есть немного. Ходить пешком любишь?

Dialog.Title: Да не особо.
Dialog.Text: А придется. Сам собирался. А раз уж ты тут такой трудолюбивый, то грех не воспользоваться таким твоим ценным качеством.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Tynts-tydynts-tydynts, ta-ta-da-dam! Sing along with me!

Dialog.Title: I do not know the words.
Dialog.Text: So do I. But these are details. You know, like here is not enough good music?

Dialog.Title: I can imagine.
Dialog.Text: I've got everything here. Headphones, the player ... And the music, does not. Generally, anyone who will be here to trade drives - get rich as a sheikh. Uncle promised me a gift. And is silent about where he took it. And we did not meet with him. My nerves are crunched. Another evening with a guitar strumming Camille and I told him to break his guitar about his head!

Dialog.Title: Maybe I can a bring to you?
Dialog.Text: Well, here I have just one more brother appeared. If you bring me music, I'll give you and money, and talk to Zuiem, that he said to you, something more interesting.

Dialog.Title: No, me a bear on his head, arrived.
Dialog.Text: As you wish ...

Dialog.Title: Here is the music.
Dialog.Text: What is this? Oh, he ... Well, I asked for, or on a flash drive or disk. Where I'll put this chip? Here's a deer. You, will still thank you.

Dialog.Title: Not that.
Dialog.Text: If even a help is ready, then went up to Samodelkina. It is in this area, microchip, he understands. Maybe that he advise.

Dialog.Title: I'm going. Only you, give me a listen.
Dialog.Text: No problem!

Dialog.Title: Not. Be tired with running about already.
Do not figured out the chip?
Dialog.Text: No. I have never seen such a thing.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Good day.

Dialog.Title: Hello. I'm looking for a job.
Dialog.Text: Right. Do you have any weapon?

Dialog.Title: That's very silly question.
Dialog.Text: Ok. I need a big mountain of mutant body parts. I'm kind of....

Dialog.Title: A taxidermist?
Dialog.Text: Right! I need a wing of that scary jumping monster for a start.

Dialog.Title: A Verliock's wing?
Dialog.Text: Yeeaaah! Verliock's. Will you bring that?

Dialog.Title: Definitely.
Dialog.Text: Cool. So I can throw away my old one. My friend brought it to me. He killed Verliock with a machine gun. I don't need the minced wing. Be accurate.

Dialog.Title: Hello. Just passing by.
Dialog.Text: Good luck.

Dialog.Title: Here's your wing.
Dialog.Text: Wow. Nice wing. Thanks.

Dialog.Title: Any reward?
Dialog.Text: Take it. Come again.

Dialog.Title: I need some work.
Dialog.Text: That's good. Now I need a good strong leather. You can kill a Sylvan.

Dialog.Title: Got it. I hate Sylvans.
Dialog.Text: Kill it. And bring me it's SKIN!

Dialog.Title: Need some skin?
Dialog.Text: Nice material! You're my best friend now, friend! Take your reward.

Dialog.Title: Need some Sylvan's skin jacket?
Dialog.Text: Nice material! You're my best friend now, friend! Take your reward.

Dialog.Title: My pleasure!
Dialog.Text: Nice skin! That's my Ripper!

Dialog.Title: Can I kill another beast?
Dialog.Text: Yup. Go and kill the Fiend. It has nice arms. I will attach them to another mutant's butt!

Dialog.Title: Cool idea. I'll return soon.
Dialog.Text: May the force be with you.

Dialog.Title: No. I won't do this.
Dialog.Text: Come back if you'll change your mind.

Dialog.Title: Here's the Fiend's arms.
Dialog.Text: The real ice cold ripper! In da house! It's pleasure doing business with you.

Dialog.Title: I think so.
Dialog.Text: I have another job for you.

Dialog.Title: What's next?
Dialog.Text: I need a big mutated head. Scary one.

Dialog.Title: I will regret this...
Dialog.Text: What?

Dialog.Title: Maybe... BIG BEAR HEAD?|Maybe you need the BIG FREAKY BEAR HEAD?
Dialog.Text: THE RIPPER! YES! MAAAAN! If you'll kill that mo*****, I'll speak with Zuy for you. We need psychoes like you!

Dialog.Title: Hell yeah!
Dialog.Text: Kill the Bear. Bring the Head.

Dialog.Title: I need some time to get ready.
Dialog.Text: But don't think too long. I need to finish my dummy.

Dialog.Title: Your bear head.
Dialog.Text: YEAAAAH! MY MAAAAN! THE RIPPER! THE BIG F***G HEAD!!!!!!!

Dialog.Title: I appreciate that.
Dialog.Text: Good luck, Ripper!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Stalker!

Dialog.Title: How are you?
Dialog.Text: Do not complain. Accompany a group of scientists and they are well pay for protection. There are a lot of mutants. Nerdy fond of them. They always want to take a closer look, and even better - hands touch. But here is only one rule if you pull your hands where is not safe than you will die. So we kill mutants for them it is better for them to touch dead creaturesl. They are scientists but totally crazy.

Dialog.Title: And what about you?
Dialog.Text: Did you hear about "Ravenwood"? We are from it.

Dialog.Title: Mercenaries?
Dialog.Text: You are hurting my feelings, stalker. What is this dismissive "mercenaries"? We - multifunction paramilitary organization, we solve complex problems, helping to explore the Zone. You and I, we are stalkers and have much in common, but we do not walk alone. Damn only crazy man can go alone ... here. No offense.

Dialog.Title: How many of you here?
Dialog.Text: Well, in our party - four specialists, we are defensing that scientists. I am Captain Sperling. Those gloomy fellows who look like twins - Kich and Butch. And that complete psycho who are in the corner is Telkberri. He became deaf after verlioka spat in his ear when he was dreaming.

Dialog.Title: I see...
Dialog.Text: Listen ... You look like a smart kid who is not afraid of a couple of simple instructions.Talk with the guys may be they have some job for you. We are doing different things - contacts with locals, killing mutants ... Sometimes scientists need to bring something, sometimes - drive away the homeless. Well, you know ... We can pay you good money

Dialog.Title: Helping your guys.|I am helping your guys...
Dialog.Text: Not blind. Noticed. So you... I find a good reward for you. Keep up the good work.

Dialog.Title: Helping your guys.|I am helping your guys...
Dialog.Text: Yes, I've heard about your exploits. In short ... There is one trader, we defense him, and he sell us different things with discount. He will not even speak with you but I'll give you a special paper, which will untie his tongue instantly. Look at his stuff, choose and do not hesitate.

Dialog.Title: I uderstood, thanks
Dialog.Text: One problem - we have not seen him for a long time. Previously he lived in cave tunnels with the bandits but where he lives now ... God knows. Good luck.

Dialog.Title: *Show the threatening letters*|Someone has been sending me threatening letters. Can I hire your guys for protection?
Dialog.Text: We already have employers, but I'd let you take one or two of my guys if I knew you better. no offence, man. There're lots of maniacs and freaks in the Zone. first, they pay you and then blow out your brains.

Dialog.Title: *Show threatening letters*|Someone keeps sending me these threatening letters.
Dialog.Text: Don't worry. I'll tell my people, they're gonna find that man, not for free of course. Have you got 100 000?

Dialog.Title: That's too much.
Dialog.Text: Sorry, man. That's all I can offer.

Dialog.Title: I have.
Dialog.Text: Excellent. You can have my word, he'll leave you alone.

Dialog.Title: Мы договорились?
Dialog.Text: Даю слово, больше этот дед не будет тебя доставать.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Ivan Hell says hi!
Dialog.Text: Yeah, I remember him. What is it about?

Dialog.Title: How about being partners?
Dialog.Text: Listen, I'm on duty here and can't take any decisions on my own. Only if you could prove cooperating with you is worth it...

Dialog.Title: How can I prove that?
Dialog.Text: I want you to take this thing to Vesuvius. One man "lost" it and I want you to put it right where it used to be until he notices anything. Put it into a box inside a tent. Any questions?

Dialog.Title: Ivan Hell told me to come by...
Dialog.Text: You're fast. Here you go.

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me more about him?
Dialog.Text: You say it the way you meet one or another "Litovski" every day. He's a legend! You can't tell when you meet him..but he takes the most challengeable tasks. I once worked with him, he's tough. Be proud you met him...It's a bit strange, though, he showed up now. I think something is going on here...

Dialog.Title: Litovski sent me to get the reports.
Dialog.Text: Say the password, then.

Dialog.Title: He didn't tell me the password..
Dialog.Text: Just kidding. Here're the records. Hope, you remember the rules.

Dialog.Title: I won't stick my nose into that...
Dialog.Text: Good for you. Good luck.

Dialog.Title: I met Litovski...
Dialog.Text: I know that. He's a good mercenary.

Dialog.Title: Говорят, вы состязание затеяли?
Dialog.Text: Ты про "Сезон охоты" что ли? Да, есть такое дело.

Dialog.Title: На кого охотимся?
Dialog.Text: Нынче - на бруторов. Нужно притащить двадцать их брутальных мускулов. И не иначе! А потом еще двадцать... и еще... Ну, ты понял. И так, пока мы не насобираем нужное количество. Берешься?

Dialog.Title: А какая награда?
Dialog.Text: Ну, награда стандартная. Однако, тем сталкерам и охотникам, кто натаскает больше всех - полагается дополнительная премия. Только учти - в соревновании участвует еще и Ловчий - он клыки кабанов собирает. Наши заказы равнозначны и считаться будут вместе. А значит победит тот, кто натаскает больше всех ему и мне суммарно. Берешься?

Dialog.Title: Вот мускулы брутора!
Dialog.Text: Хм. Да ты брутален! Мы их обработаем... Можешь через 4 часа с новой порцией приходить.

Dialog.Title: А где результаты посмотреть?
Dialog.Text: Их Ловчий вывешивает. Прямо около себя на заборе.
You damn creature! No, not you, stalker.

Dialog.Title: What's your problem?
Dialog.Text: My..my.. name's Butch and something baa-aa-ad happened here. That damn bear went at at at me when I got distracted a bit...and ..and..cracked my he-ad. Now I'm struggling with stam-mer.

Dialog.Title: That's...a pity. Can I do anything to help?
Dialog.Text: Yeah....Kill at at at least one of 'em. Be-ars, I me-an. And and..get me some...something as trophy. I'll give that to to...to Eisenstein. He he agreed to help me with my..my issue.

Dialog.Title: No problem, Butch. I'll be back with trophies.
Dialog.Text: But re..remember, I...I don't need guts...bring me-e-e bear claw...claws.

Dialog.Title: So you want me to get bear claws, right?
Dialog.Text: R-r-right! You get me...I..I...give 'em to Eisenstein....

Dialog.Title: I brought bear claws.
Dialog.Text: That's how you.. you.. do that! One mo-re hairy monster is dead! Hot D-og!

Dialog.Title: Here, take 'em,
Dialog.Text: Hey! If...if...you're around some...sometimes la-ter....get me-e more claw....claws.

Dialog.Title: So you want me to get you bear claws, right?
Dialog.Text: No..no...not me...Bring 'em to Dr. Eisenstein....Ke-e-ep your pro-promises.

Dialog.Title: So you want me to get you bear claws, right?
Dialog.Text: No..no...not me...Bring 'em to Dr. Eisenstein....Ke-e-ep your pro-promises.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I ...I...I...don't talk to criminals.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Do you have work for me?
Dialog.Text: I have a job for you. One madman lives here in the swamps. We call him Swampman. Well, he isn't always lived in the swamp. This bastard had run away from us, and didn't pay. I myself have never set a foot to the swamp, that's why I look for a stalker. A stalker will be able to find a way, right? Take ten thousand rubles from him, and bring the money to me. I'll give you five thousand in return.

Dialog.Title: Here your ten thousand rubles.
Dialog.Text: Wait, I'll check the money.

Dialog.Title: Everything is fine?
Dialog.Text: Yes. Well, here is your honestly earned three thousand.

Dialog.Title: Thank you.
Dialog.Text: Now piss off and don't bother me anymore.

Dialog.Title: Wait a minute...|| You promised five thousand.
Dialog.Text: You're smart. Take your five. And don't come to me anymore.

Dialog.Title: Do you have work for me?
Dialog.Text: I told you never bother me again... But wait, stop you, man! Listen, there is one meanie named Priest. Maybe he is a true priest, I do not know. He's one of those... local residents, consider, almost mutant. But do not worry, he is ok... Or was... last time I saw him. This Priest has a debt of 12 thousands and is hiding somewhere in the villages right now. I can't find him myself, but you can. And if you suddenly find him, take the money from him and go back to me. Bring all twelve thousands, and the six thousands will be yours.

Dialog.Title: Here your twelve thousand.
Dialog.Text: Wait, I'll check the money.

Dialog.Title: Happy now?
Dialog.Text: Yes. Well, here is your honestly earned three thousand.

Dialog.Title: Thank you.
Dialog.Text: Well done. Come again.

Dialog.Title: Wait a minute...|| You promised six thousand rubles.
Dialog.Text: Smart eye. Well done. Come again.

Dialog.Title: Do you have work for me?
Dialog.Text: Somewhere on the outskirts of Lubech lives a pervert named Gourmet. Why he was given such a nickname? This moron likes to cook different dishes of the mutants. Can you imagine, eating mutants. I, as the official representative of the "Ravens Wood", can't leave this behavior just like that. In short, take some money from him. Shake him like a tree. This wise guy sells its culinary specialties, so he has lots of money. You have to pick up from him at least 50 thousands. Once you take them and bring them me, I'll give you 25 thousand. Yes, I'm in a generous mood today.

Dialog.Title: Here are your 50 000 rubles.
Dialog.Text: Wait, I'll check the money.

Dialog.Title: Happy now?
Dialog.Text: Yes. Well, here is your honestly earned ten thousand.

Dialog.Title: Wait a minute... ||You promised me twenty-five thousand rubles.
Dialog.Text: Am I? Are you calling me a liar? Think again... Ha-ha-ha... Just kidding. Here's your money.

Dialog.Title: Do you have work for me?
Dialog.Text: Not yet. Come back later.

Dialog.Title: My mistake. I don't have the money.
Dialog.Text: Yes, I see you didn't collect enough.

Dialog.Title: My mistake. I don't have the money.
Dialog.Text: Yes, I see you didn't collect enough.

Dialog.Title: My mistake. I don't have the money.
Dialog.Text: Yes, I see you didn't collect enough.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Работа есть. Наградой не обидят.
Dialog.Text: Что еще за работа? Я тут тоже не просто так. Вон, яйцеголовых сторожу. Да ладно, шуткую я! Уже на стенку лезу от тоски. Долги выбиваю из местных, как уличный бандит, а руки чешутся по драке. Вон, Тэклберри не теряется, хоть и псих. Уже какую-то войну затеял. А я что-то никак не соберусь. Ну да, ладно, отвлекся. Так что у тебя?

Dialog.Title: Надо уменьшить криминальную прослойку.
Dialog.Text: Насколько? И кто заказчик? Если ты, то задаток будет нужен. Если нет, тогда давай, подтверди, что не воздух трясешь.

Dialog.Title: Верхнего предела нет. А вот бумаги.
Dialog.Text: Хм. Военные. Неплохо. Условия устраивают, в принципе. Возьмусь, пожалуй, но только через несколько часов. Должники еще остались. Ну а потом, я понимаю, к этому Драчуку надо обращаться?

Dialog.Title: Да, все верно.
Dialog.Text: Хорошо. Тогда я в деле.
Well?

Dialog.Title: Do you sell something?
Dialog.Text: Who said that? No. I do not sell anything. I do not give a loan. Do not repair. I do not send on errands. Get the hell out!

Dialog.Title: I have a recommendation from Shperling.
Dialog.Text: Give it to me.

Dialog.Title: Take it.
Dialog.Text: Wow. I can't believe it. He let me go! I don't know what you've done for him...and I don't want to know. But I'm free now!... Look, I don't have new stuff right now, but I hid a good piece. I'll give you a huge discount for all of this. So, what do you say?

Dialog.Title: Why should I pay?|Shperling said that I can choose what I want for free.
Dialog.Text: Shperling can kiss my ass now. This paper is nothing. You can buy or you can piss off.

Dialog.Title: Helm "Viking" for 12100.
Dialog.Text: Excellent choice! Total 12100. Deal?

Dialog.Title: I'll take Glock-18 for 17550.
Dialog.Text: Total -- 17550

Dialog.Title: Backpack for 5300...
Dialog.Text: Great backpack! 5300!

Dialog.Title: Хочу посмотреть броню "Вороний Лес".
Dialog.Text: Броня -- загляденье. Бери, пока есть.

Dialog.Title: Why so nervous?
Dialog.Text: Have you heard about the "Ravenwood"? They have one captain, mercenary named Shperling. He is such a beast that I can't even stick my nose outside. So do not even ask. I don't have any products. All sell to military.

Dialog.Title: Show me the repair kit.
Dialog.Text: Repair kit for rare items. I will take two "Screens" and 80 000 rubles for it.

Dialog.Title: I gave everything you asked.
Dialog.Text: Aw, yeah. Repair kit is your's now.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hold on! What do you want?

Dialog.Title: What are you doing?
Dialog.Text: Nothing. Pay no attention to the screams. It's the Master watching a movie. He gave us few assignments. Want to help?

Dialog.Title: I guess I could help.
Dialog.Text: Anyway... I must stay here, but the Master need several tools for his work: a blowtorch, a duct tape, a gasoline lighter and a steel scalpel. Can you bring all that?

Dialog.Title: No. ||I will not help to torture people.
Dialog.Text: What do you mean? You're paranoiac.

Dialog.Title: I brought what you need.
Dialog.Text: Great job. Bring it here.

Dialog.Title: It's not for a... torture, I hope?
Dialog.Text: What makes you think such things? The Master does not hurt anyone. He is working. And while working, he is listening to the TV. Watching these... as they call it... Thrillers. Yes, thrillers. It's a movie show. You don't believe me or what?

Dialog.Title: Do you need something else?
Dialog.Text: It's you again... Well done, you brought right tools last time. And we just received a new order. The Master asked for: one copper wire, steel beads (five sets), a short pipe (required with carvings), a set of repair tools... and two rolls of duct tape.

Dialog.Title: Do you need something else?
Dialog.Text: This time the Master came up with a delicate job. He need a surgical scalpel. Also drag a canvas, a hydrogen peroxide, and a flask of spider's venom here. And we need a silk thread.

Dialog.Title: I brought everything you need.
Dialog.Text: The beads... The carved short pipe...

Dialog.Title: Yes, everything is here.
Dialog.Text: Excellent. The Master will be pleased. Here's your share.

Dialog.Title: I brought everything you asked for.
Dialog.Text: Good. Give me that.

Dialog.Title: Don't forget about the money.
Dialog.Text: Of course. Here is the payment for your work.

Dialog.Title: What are you doing here?
Dialog.Text: Nothing special. Don't pay attention on those noise...Foreman's watching a movie. by the way, he gave us couple of missions. Wanna help?

Dialog.Title: I can't find a surgical scalpel.
Dialog.Text: I know a man you can buy it from. He's known as Doc. Dolittle and he lives in Ryabinushka, in square A5.

Dialog.Title: I can't find a scalpel.
Dialog.Text: I know a man you can buy it from. He's known as Doc. Dolittle and he lives in Ryabinushka, in square A5.

Dialog.Title: I must have forgotten something...
Dialog.Text: You too?

Dialog.Title: I got a package from Senya.
Dialog.Text: Give me that and take this. Don't get busted!

Dialog.Title: What's in there?
Dialog.Text: Nothing special... Just deliver that.

Dialog.Title: I'm here to grab the stuff for Senya.
Dialog.Text: Take it. Don't get busted.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: How is it going on?
Dialog.Text: Thanks for asking. One colleague of mine told me a very interesting story about medieval Spain...that story really inspired me, it's important to grow and perfect yourself, if you know what I mean. So, I drew a sketch of a new machine. Now the only problem is that to assemblt the machine I'm gonna need whole lot of stuff. I know you get get me all I need...What do you say? Will you help me? Not for free, of course. I'll give you the gun one client gifted me as a reward for you job.

Dialog.Title: I don't have time for that, sorry.
I got you the stuff you need...
Dialog.Text: Show me everything!

Dialog.Title: You promised me a gun for the job.
Dialog.Text: Sure, here you go. Come over again.

Dialog.Title: I met Mr. Big...
Dialog.Text: eh, I see...

Dialog.Title: Do you know who that man is?
Dialog.Text: I do.

Dialog.Title: So, what can you tell about him?
Dialog.Text: I can't tell you anything for the Foreman will tell me off for that. But I'm sure he won't mind if we chat a little if you do us a favor.

Dialog.Title: What have you heard of him?
Dialog.Text: I heard he's a smart man with a good sense of humor. Having a sense of humor is necessary in our job, you know. Being smart is helpful too. Sometimes you say something polite and hilarious at the same time and people start to treat you differently. If you know what I mean.
Do you have a coin for an old stalker?

Dialog.Title: I don't.
Dialog.Text: Not even a penny? Don't know why but I don't believe you...

Dialog.Title: Here, 10 rubles for you.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, my friend. I'm starving...I used to search for food in abandoned houses, but now it's getting more and more dangerous. Have you heard of the bogies? Those ugly bastards slip in the houses and turn 'em upside down. I bet they eat the food they found there. Listen, could you do me a favor, man? Kill some bogies nearby and also try to find out what they eat.

Dialog.Title: I did shoot the bogies.
Dialog.Text: Did you find out what they eat?

Dialog.Title: They seem to eat rats. |They seem to eat rats.I found some rat tails as an evidence.
Dialog.Text: Hmm ... That's what they're looking for in the houses...So they turn out to be harmless, right?

Dialog.Title: Be careful anyway.|| Don't think so. They will kill you if they need.
Dialog.Text: Got it.

Dialog.Title: They seem to eat people.|They're bloodthirsty and visious creatures. They eat people.
Dialog.Text: Shoot! They could have eaten me! Thanks God I escaped.

Dialog.Title: Just kidding, man. They eat rats. |Just kidding, man. They seem to eat rats.
They seem to eat canned food.|Since I didn't find any provision inside, they seem to eat canned food.
Dialog.Text: I see...Shoot! That's what they're scrounging for in the houses. Thanks for your help.

Dialog.Title: Take 10 rubles.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, bro. Listen...You did well with the bogies, but they're back again. Since they eat rats, they must carry diseases themselves, which is disgusting. Will you seek through the houses one more time?

Dialog.Title: I don't.
Dialog.Text: Not even a penny? Welcome to the club, then. Here's my advice to you...Try checking dumpsters, you'll be surprised how much useful stuff can be found in 'em.

Dialog.Title: I'm gonna check 'em myself.
Dialog.Text: There you go!

Dialog.Title: I'm not that broke to root through a dumpster.
Dialog.Text: It's up to you man, anyway. I haven't been always this poor myself. I remember coming to Liubech for the first time. I was full of enegry and desire to find adventures, treasures and artifacts as you are now. You never know, stalker. The only thing I am looking for now is food. You never know...

Dialog.Title: Have checked the dumpsters...|| I found some empty bottles.
Dialog.Text: What did I tell you? It's always worth it. Keep the bottles, they'll come useful. By the way. there're other places you may find vital to inspect. See those carriages? They serve to transport the remains of those who wasn't as lucky as we are to survive in the Zone. So there're also carriages with the weapon that belonged to them. I don't think a train will ever come to take 'em away, so feel free to grab anything you'll find there.

Dialog.Title: Did you find anything interesting?
Dialog.Text: No, haven't checked the dumpsters yet. Do you wanna check 'em yourself?

Dialog.Title: Do you know anything about Temon's death?
Dialog.Text: Well...I came across a body in a dumpster the other day. It smelled like shit and was wrapped in canvas. I told Acid and Balcksmith what I'd found. They took the body away and burnt it somewhere. People say it was Temon's body.

Dialog.Title: What is in the dumpsters?
Dialog.Text: Have you heard of anomalous corroison effect? Sooner or later most of the stuff turn to dust in the Zone. So it's not a good idea to throw trash right and left. The trash is put to the dumpsters, where it doesn't dissolve so quickly.

Dialog.Title: Does the corrosion affect all the stuff equally?
Dialog.Text: Nope. Although it does affect artifacts, lots of everyday objects, that had been here before we started to call this place the Zone, remain the same. Newbies like to look for different sort of old garbage and take it along with 'em. Sooner or later all the stuff go to the dumpsters. So, as you can see, they're quite worth checking.

Dialog.Title: Ain't it dangerous?
Dialog.Text: Relax, the corrosion won't affect you. Science people say that's because of human magnetic field...So it also won't affect the stuff you're touching. As long as you carry a weapon, it'll remain the same, but once you drop it, it'll fall apart litterally. This is quite a show.

Dialog.Title: What do you need meat for?
Dialog.Text: To eat it, of course! I don't like hunting myself, besides, I'm quite shy at the sight of blood. But I do like inspecting abandoned places to see what's inside. Recently, I came across a wonderful place, which location I'd like to keep in secret.. that place is full of PM rounds, new and untouched. I don't need them myself, but I bet you do. I'm ready to share with you some if you get me five slabs of raw meat. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Deal. I''l bring you some meat.
Dialog.Text: Agreed. I'm waiting for ya.

Dialog.Title: I brought you some meat.
Dialog.Text: Give me that!

Dialog.Title: Here.
Dialog.Text: At last I can eat! Here are the rounds for you. Come again when you need more.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: Sorry, man. I don't talk to criminals.
Hello.

Dialog.Title: Show me your stuff.
Dialog.Text: If you don't have Simonov's recommendation you can't see my goods. Only for special customers. And Simonov with his men are special customers now for me. No offence.

Dialog.Title: Maybe we can make a deal?
Dialog.Text: Nope. I don't screwing my REAL deals. And this stuff isn't mine. I'm just a broker here. They count their goods very narrowly. I've got here nice Sig 751. But they can broke my legs if I sell that shit to someone else.

Dialog.Title: I have Simonov's recommendation.
Dialog.Text: No way!

Dialog.Title: I don't have so much stuff right now.
Look.
Dialog.Text: Let me see it. Hmmm... looks like real. Ok then. I've got very good gun. Sig Sauer 751. Eggheads won't use it. But I can't give you this gun. You can take it if you'll bring me some arts and Spiderkhan's legs. Simonov didn't bring me any arts, so I'm loosing a lot of money right now. But these legs can change my situation. Bring them to me, and then I'll think about selling you my Sig.

Dialog.Title: I'd like to exchange arts and legs for the gun.
Вроде все отдал...
Dialog.Text: Хм... Ты смотри-ка... Не ожидал так быстро. Ну что же, вот теперь я могу продать тебе Sig 715. Отдам, считай, со скидкой, так как иначе я бы продал его гораздо дороже. Так что 200 000 рублей -- и автомат твой.

Dialog.Title: Nice gun. Got another one?
Dialog.Text: Yup. But I won't give it to you. One recommendation -- one Sig. You can bring me another paper, plus arts and legs, and then I'll give you another Sig.

Dialog.Title: У меня есть рекомендации Симонова.
Dialog.Text: Не может быть!

Dialog.Title: Сам смотри.
Dialog.Text: Давай сюда. Хм... Вроде не поддельные. Где взял? Не мог же Симонов сам лично дать. Ладно, раз так... Как договаривались... Вот только... Если я тебя ни разу не видел, то и арты ты мне не приносил, верно? Хе-хе... Поэтому отдать я тебе его не могу. Симонов обещал вернуться с артами, вот список моей доли... Четыре "Щита", два "Стабилизатора", три "Антиграва" и две "Резины". Еще нужны лапы Паукана. Четыре штуки. Если ты принесешь мне все это -- тогда посмотрим.

Dialog.Title: А как же 200 тысяч?
Dialog.Text: И 200 тысяч. Молодец, что напомнил.

Dialog.Title: У меня есть нужные арты.
Dialog.Text: Сейчас посмотрим...

Dialog.Title: По поводу Sig 751...
Dialog.Text: Слушаю?

Dialog.Title: Вроде все уже принес.
Dialog.Text: Точно. Чуть со счета не сбился. Хе-хе... Да не бойся, у меня все записано. Вот. Получи свой автомат.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Listening carefully.

Dialog.Title: Can I help you with anything?
Dialog.Text: You can. I wanna study local mutants...but there's a problem...

Dialog.Title: They may well eat you before you get a chance to study them.
Dialog.Text: That's why I'll need your help. I gotta get some rare stuff to examine.

Dialog.Title: What stuff?
Dialog.Text: First of all, I'm gonna need at least five hog tusks and five hog legs, then blyak tongues and claws and finally fast fiend paws.

Dialog.Title: Wait for me here. I'll be back.
I brought hog body parts.
Dialog.Text: Which ones?

Dialog.Title: I brought blyak body parts.
Dialog.Text: Which ones?

Dialog.Title: I brought fiend paws.
Dialog.Text: Good. Give 'em to me.

Dialog.Title: Do you need more hog claws and tusks?
Dialog.Text: Sure. I'll be happy if you get me more.

Dialog.Title: I will. Wait for me here.
Do you need more blyak claws and tongues?
Dialog.Text: Sure. I'll be happy if you get me more.

Dialog.Title: I will. Wait for me here.
Do you need more fiend paws?
Dialog.Text: Sure. I'll be happy if you get me more.

Dialog.Title: I will. Wait for me here.
I saw a cage with a scientist. |I saw a cage nearby with a scientist in it.
Dialog.Text: It's Patisson. He's a brave man but foolish and stubborn as a mule. He studies alive mutants. I see no point in that! We're trying to find effective ways to kill not domesticate them!

Dialog.Title: Is there any ways to get him out?
Dialog.Text: I'm conсerned about that to. If anything happens to him...we're to answer. Moreover, we keep losing people and those who got killed by mutants cost us a pretty penny. We barely get the the financing. We need to het Patisson back to the camp. If he loves being encaged, OK. We can make it, but it's time to get him away from mutants.

Dialog.Title: Any suggestions?
Dialog.Text: There's one thing. Patisson is obsessed with watching alive beasts. If they're dead, there's nothing to watch, then.

Dialog.Title: Understood.
Dialog.Text: Do it. The old man gets so mad when any mutant gets killed nearby. That'll break him.

Dialog.Title: We need to free Patisson. Suggestions?|Any suggestions how to get Patisson out of the cage?
The scientist stayed in the cage.|Killing mutants makes Patisson furious, but he didn't go out from the cage.
Dialog.Text: What an old donkey. Nothing does work for him... Come back later, I have to think this through.

Dialog.Title: The scientist is still in the cage.|| Any other ideas?
Dialog.Text: This time we have to take drastic measures! Since he doesn't get the hint, we're to stop supplying him with food. Officially, we haven't been supplying him for a while so far, but my colleagues still feed him using such stalkers as you. The irony of the situation is that he feed mutants with is own provision He's starving, but still carrys on his stupid experiments. As for my colleagues, I will press the case. We will see what he's going to do in a day or two. We will break his will sooner or later.

Dialog.Title: Hunger does not affect the scientist.|Does not seem that hunger affected the scientist.
Dialog.Text: He's still holding out...

Dialog.Title: The scientist is still in the cage.|| Any other ideas?
Dialog.Text: He must be thinking we can't leave him with no water. Way off the mark! He will get no water, no more water from us! I know it's going to be tough, but I'll be able to convince Simonov this is the only way...You go and tell Whatman to hold water for a while. Do not bring anything to that stubborn donkey yourself! I bet he won't hold out more than a day!

Dialog.Title: Ain't it too cruel?
Dialog.Text: I'm not asking you to do anything criminal. If you don't want to go and talk to Whatman, that's fine, I'll find another way to informhim about our plan.

Dialog.Title: I don't want to be any part of this.
Dialog.Text: No problem. We'll take care of everything ourselves.

Dialog.Title: Your scientist stands his ground.
Dialog.Text: Yes, I admit, Patisson won this round. We do not need his death on our conscience. Get him some water and stew.

Dialog.Title: That's enough. I'm not a delivery boy.
Dialog.Text: Do you not want to save an old man? I thought I was the cruel one here...

Dialog.Title: Your scientist stands his ground.
Dialog.Text: It's all because someone continued to bring him water. But I again warned and threatened everybody... Let's see if Patisson hold on another day...

Dialog.Title: Is there any ways to take him out?
Dialog.Text: Talk to Simonov. If he agrees it's the time to get Patisson out, get back here. I have an idea.

Dialog.Title: Just let me know when you come up with another plan.
I got Patisson's work.
Dialog.Text: Where did you get it?! Well, well...he turns out to be much more reasonable than I expected...not a complete freak after all...I treated him badly thinking he was no more than an old looney...It turned out that I almost killed the genius! Blimey!

Dialog.Title: No thanks. I think I'm gonna give the papers to Simonov.
Dialog.Text: What?! Are you together with him?

Dialog.Title: What will I get for that?
Dialog.Text: Can't do a thing for free, huh? I think I could get a "Screen" α for ya, how do you like that? A Screen for papers, I thinks that's a fair deal.

Dialog.Title: Hey, haven't you lost your beauty bag?
Dialog.Text: Hey! Not so loud...how do you know about this job?

Dialog.Title: Sisyphus told me. I'm in.
Dialog.Text: I bet you wonder what kind of business I do with that organization. Their work bounds up with the pharmaceuticals undustry, so I help them and they help me on my researches outside the perimeter in return. A real symbiosis, huh?

Dialog.Title: That's right! They give you lipstick for mutants' body parts.
Dialog.Text: Hey! Pack it up! If you're on business here, let's talk business, then. If you're not, get the hell out!

Dialog.Title: Or what? You're gonna kiss me?!
Dialog.Text: I haaaaaate you! I hope a spider will eat you soon!

Dialog.Title: Okay, okay! Please don't hit me with your beaty bag!
Dialog.Text: Listen you, jackass! What do you want from me? I'm just trying to make some money, okay?

Dialog.Title: Calm down, I was just kidding.
Dialog.Text: Alright. All kidding aside, it's a serious job. You'll need to collect legs of different spiders, they have some sort of special glands on their legs, that's what you'll be looking for.

Dialog.Title: Alright.
Dialog.Text: In one word, legs are needed. Here's the list: 15 Royal Spider legs, 7 Peat Bog Spider legs, 2 Big Spider legs, plus some Stupid Blyak claws. I know, the task is hard, but you're gonna make a fortune on it!

Dialog.Title: Don't you cry, little girl!
Dialog.Text: I wish I had a gun, I'd kill you right away!

Dialog.Title: С таким сопрано уж в кабаре ждут!
Dialog.Text: Арррррргхххх!!!! Нанял бы убийцу, останься деньги на такое дело!! Да только ты, ничтожество, даже пули не заслуживаешь!!! На кол тебя! Четвертовать и блякам скормить!! Уйди, противный!!! Довел!!!

Dialog.Title: Ухожу! Букет и конфеты по почте пришлю!
Dialog.Text: РРРРРРРРР!!!!!!

Dialog.Title: Those are ingredients for the cosmetics they make? Man!
Dialog.Text: Beaty has its price, you know.

Dialog.Title: I brought mutant body parts.
Dialog.Text: Great. I'm glad you survived. Here's your reward as it was promised.

Dialog.Title: What else do they use for production?
Dialog.Text: You don't wanna know, believe me. Don't store your mind with trivial!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Here're Horrendous Spider legs.
Dialog.Text: Nice job, stalker!

Dialog.Title: Here're Spider legs.
Dialog.Text: Wow. Great.

Dialog.Title: Blyak tongues.
Dialog.Text: That's gross, but we need them. You did well.

Dialog.Title: Do you still need a sage?
Dialog.Text: That's right! I've been waiting too long. Where is it?

Dialog.Title: I need an injection to quiet sages.
Dialog.Text: I've given it to Tavr already! What's going on? Actually, It's very hard to make it!

Dialog.Title: Okay...if you don't need a sage anymore...
Dialog.Text: Alright. alright! Here, take this injection, it'll quite them for a while.

Dialog.Title: I need a key to the cage.
Dialog.Text: Did you lose the key? Oh, you're such a ....alright, here's it.

Dialog.Title: Все принес.
Dialog.Text: Ну, тогда держи оплату и подарок от ученой братии!..

Dialog.Title: I'm ready to work for ladys' sake...
Dialog.Text: Excellent! Spider legs are needed. Here's the list: 15 Royal Spider legs, 7 Bog Spider legs, 2 Big Spider legs, plus some Stupid Blyak claws. I know the task is hard, but you're gonna make a fortune on it.
Rare mutants seen?

Dialog.Title: What kind of mutants?
Dialog.Text: Rare. We are here investigating a specific mutants and catch them on the dispute. It's simple: a description of the mutant was found, killed, cut off a piece of it, brought to me, received the award. It seems the game. There are two conditions. First: you have to stay within the allotted time. Second, while the job is not completed, do not kill more than two mutants of the same species.

Dialog.Title: I can not kill other mutants?
Dialog.Text: Are you listening? You can kill other mutants, except for mutants of the same species. I gave you the task of finding a rare rat. Beginners go to habitat for rats and kill everyone there. And then understand what the rat was also a rare. Improvise. Looked after. If you shoot and realized that not a rare mutant -- not kill. I do not care who you shoot the before and after the job. But at the time -- no, no.

Dialog.Title: Time on task is limited?
Dialog.Text: Yes. Eternally waiting for you, no one will. Agreed to catch, so go catch rather than go for a walk streets. Need to be clear about what you can, and that -- no. Not ready -- do not touch. And then there were cases. A stalker, boasted that he could kill the Swamp Goblin. He left and died. All right, we decided he ate it with a goblin mushrooms. But no. Stalker returned. A year later. And Goblin head with it brought. Repent, they say, is not calculated, was injured, was treated and then prepared, push-ups, was looking for equipment. So, we are here, the kindergarten is no longer needed.

Dialog.Title: I want to kill a rare mutant.
Dialog.Text: It is commendable, but do not hurry. Area is full of mutants. New specimens of various species caught almost every week either. Go slowly, from simple to complex.

Dialog.Title: Not aggressive mutant-animals.
Dialog.Text: On whom will you hunt?

Dialog.Title: Rat....
Dialog.Text: A right choice for a newbie. We have one guy in Lubech. Name Dudochkin. Maybe you heard about him. So, this Dudochkin was sent to the hell-knows-where by his commanders to look after some ruins. I dont know what he did wrong... It would be OK, if Dudochkin didnt send complaints because of plenly of rats near his outpost. And if he sends them, then he is alive. And if he is alive, then there is nothing to worry about, as our militaries think. But we are looking through their mail and it is interesting to us, what kind of rats Dudochkin saw. He writes, that this a new specie. Quote: "I saw rats again today. It seems like they have a leader now... Disguisting, fat beast. A true rat king. It is acting like a general before the battle... I feel like my death is near..." Dudochkin, as usually, panicked and streches the truth., but we should check it. Find and kill this "rat king". And bring me his tail.

Dialog.Title: Everything is clear.
Dialog.Text: Questions?

Dialog.Title: I killed the rat king.
Dialog.Text: And did you bring the tail?

Dialog.Title: Of course.
Dialog.Text: It is hard to fail such an easy mission.

Dialog.Title: Tell about Pop's troubles. |We have a problem here. Pop had a dog.. ate some mutated meat and became an alfa-dog, now it is commanding other dogs and terrorizing the village.
Dialog.Text: What kind of village, stalker? There are only ruins with mutants in them.

Dialog.Title: Now -- yes... ||But, maybe, these ruins are some kind of memory for him.
Dialog.Text: OK, listen up. Dogs-mutants love brutor's bones. Dont laugh. If you want to attract that alfa-dog, try to come to the village and lure him with the not weak brutor's bones.

Dialog.Title: Why not weak?
Dialog.Text: You are attracting the leader. So the bone should be big. But bone is not enough. You need a brutors's smell. So make an ambush, place the bone, treat the house with the smell. And then the dog will come to you.

Dialog.Title: Where can I get the brutor's smell. |Where the hell can I find brutor's smell?
Dialog.Text: Heh, youngsters... Take toilet paper, find place, where brutors live, put toilet paper into this place and here you go. You can spread it all over the village. Dont forget to do teh same procidure with the bone.

Dialog.Title: Emm... Sounds disguisting.
Dialog.Text: Yes, life is not easy. But still I helped you with what I could. Now it is your turn.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Terminal for doors control.

Dialog.Title: Open the door and enter the lab.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Terminal for doors control.

Dialog.Title: Open the door and leave the lab.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Bloody mutants...

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: Rats...Bloody rats caught us with pants down! Tolyan and I were watching the military last night. Silently, cautiously... Then rats came out of nowhere and gave us away. Bloody soldiers opened fire...Tolyan was shot dead...I'm here

Dialog.Title: I'm sorry.
Dialog.Text: I want those bloody bastards to be dead as well! Rats, I mean...

Dialog.Title: What about the militaries?
Dialog.Text:
They're gone for now. But surely they'll be back again to see about the accident. We don't have much time left.
So what? Will you stick to my plan?

Dialog.Title: I killed the rats...
Dialog.Text: Thanks... As soon as I get better, I'll bury Tolyan myself before I leave. You found his pistol? Take it, you deserve it. I have nothing to pay you for your help anyway. But you know... You can sell the rat tails. The local trader is paying a good price for them. The young rats tails doesn't interest him, but someone saw the large beasts to the north-east of here. Their tails would be just right size.

Dialog.Title: Do you also want to get rid of the rats?
Dialog.Text: Sure. They didn't use to attack so close to the safe zone! Now there are everywhere.

Dialog.Title: I can shoot more. It's easy for me.
Dialog.Text: Thanks again... I remember when I came to this station the first time, some strange dude was here. A skilled stalker ex facte. But when I asked him for help, he ignored me. And you helped me without hesitation. I'm glad that there are still good people in our world.

Dialog.Title: Ok thanks, I'll check it out…
Dialog.Text: If you are bitten by rats, don't forget to talk to the doctor. You can always buy additional ammo from the trader over there. And here is the last tip: even the most reliable equipment deteriorates over time. If you need repairs, and you haven't the repair skills, talk to the repairman.

Dialog.Title: I'll see what I can do.
What happened?
Dialog.Text: Shooting happened. But I won't bother you. We must protect the station first. Talk to the station sentry. He gave us shelter, so we all owe him. I too would help, but I still haven't recovered from the wound. Come back later if your still alive.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: I'm armed.
Dialog.Text: Shoot these bastards! Rats, of course, not the militaries. I don't have much to repay you... But!

Dialog.Title: Where do I fing him?
Dialog.Text: Near the fence, on the south of here, I think Tolyan's corpse are still there.

Dialog.Title: But?
Dialog.Text: If you will find a Tolyan's backpack, you can take everything you need. He was carring some suplies.

Dialog.Title: I may help you, but I'm not armed.
Dialog.Text: If you say so... I think I have a plan, how do you help me to kill these bastards and at the same time, I'll help you with a gun, what do you say?

Dialog.Title: Whats the plan?
Dialog.Text: We had a stash here, you'll go fing him, take the gun and ammo, find the body of Tolyan and show these disgusting creatures where they place is!

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text:
Well, then, stash is located in the drainage under the embankment. Once you'll fint him - come back, I'll tell you where and how to find Tolyan's corpse. Tolyan have a backpack with proision and loot, if you can find him and revenge him - you can pick up everything you'll find.
So, I hope you understand that to run with a pistol from the stash - slightly stupid... You will stay without loot and screw up your reputation doing such an actions.

Dialog.Title: What about the militaries?
Dialog.Text: They're gone for now. But surely they'll be back again to see about the accident. We don't have much time left.

Dialog.Title: I found the stash.
Dialog.Text: Well, now you can go to the south of the station, you'll find Tolyan's corpse near the fence, backpack should be located nearby. Just be careful there...
Backpack torn into shreds.

Dialog.Title: Есть минутка?
Dialog.Text: Извини, с уголовниками не общаюсь

Dialog.Title: Search the backpack..
Dialog.Text: There was a pistole and some ammo with supplies in the backpack.

Dialog.Title: Search the backpack...
Dialog.Text: There was some ammo and supplies in the backpack.

Dialog.Title: Search the backpack.
Dialog.Text: I've took everything already. Nothing left inside.
I just can't take it anymore... I... I can't...

Dialog.Title: What's happened?
Dialog.Text: All these animals... All these poor little animals... Spiders, pigs, puppies... Yesterday they brought me an infant rat. They made me cut it....But.. how could have I? They needed mutant parts....We shouldn't be so vicious.

Dialog.Title: They're right, you must cut mutants.
Dialog.Text: You'd better be going...

Dialog.Title: I'm sorry.
Dialog.Text: Really? Didn't expect... Here, in the Zone, mutants are supposed to be killed, not saved and guarded like endangered species. We have body structure analyzers, we don't need to cut these creatures to study them. But still... It's much more simple to kill a mutant before analyse it...You look like a reseanobale man...why don't you serve the science without hurting local species?

Dialog.Title: Muddy said you had scalpels.
Dialog.Text: I do. Here, take 'em all. I wish I'd never used any of them.

Dialog.Title: Do you have a scalpel?
Dialog.Text: Don't remind me...I hurt so many innocent animals with that scalpel....Here, you take it.

Dialog.Title: Let me see what you have for sale.
How?
Dialog.Text: I'll give you the analyzer and point the mutant spawn location. You'll go there, analyze their changes and return back without killing any of the mutants.

Dialog.Title: Right into the horde of mutants?|Doc, you're asking me to go into the horde of mutants and wait till they start to eat me, without killing any of them? Can I buy them some flowers and a champagne?
Dialog.Text: Not again... They are endangered species! And we are civilized people, we have to take responsibility. If you don't kill anyone, I will share some bandages with you. Can you promise not to kill anyone? If you kill I will find out through the analyzer.

Dialog.Title: No.||The bandages will not help to a dead man.
Dialog.Text: As you wish.

Dialog.Title: All right, doc. Give me your analyzer.
Dialog.Text: Let's start with rats, they are harmless. Go to square A6, you'll find military installations and the rats there. The tool will collect data. Do not leave the area till 10 minutes at least. Come back after that. But remember, no rat should be injured.

Dialog.Title: Do not panic, doc. Your rats will be ok.
I've done the job.
Dialog.Text: Really? What about the rats?

Dialog.Title: None of the rats was hurt.
Dialog.Text: Thank you! Here, take the bandages. If you need more meds, I'll make 'em for you, but I'll need some ingredients. Come over if you're ready to get me some.

Dialog.Title: *Tell about Patisson's work*.|There's a man on the other side of the Vesuvius, he's also studying rat mutation and he also believes rats shouldn't be hurt. So... Could I borrow your analyzer for him?
Dialog.Text: That means I'm not the one who's doing it, right? Great news. Of course, you can borrow it...but with the term that you'll share the research results. Deal?

Dialog.Title: Agreed!
Dialog.Text: Agreed. I give you teh analizer, you bring the results. One more thing - please don't kill rats while doing researches, I ask you as a friend. Please don't. Now go back to Patisson.

Dialog.Title: I'm back with the results.
Dialog.Text: How are the rats?

Dialog.Title: They all are alive.
Dialog.Text: Thank you! Just wait a minute...I'll take the data off the analyzer and copy on your PDA. Hand it to the scientist you told me about.

Dialog.Title: Your analyzer broke down.
Dialog.Text: What? WHAT THE HELL? What have you done?

Dialog.Title: Sorry. I didn't mean it...
Dialog.Text: Get out of my sight!

Dialog.Title: Here, take 2000 to repair it.
Dialog.Text: Repair? How do you expect me to repair it? It's entirely hand made! Oh.....whatever...give me that

Dialog.Title: I'm sorry, man...
Dialog.Text: Ah. No problem. Things happen.

Dialog.Title: Did you find the way to make money?
Dialog.Text: More or less....Listen, you're a stalker, right? Help me get some rare arts, I'll give it backб шт cash. There's an art called Vesuvius, one huckster set a good price for it. I'll share with you, I promise, I don't need a lot. I've no idea how that Vesuvius thing looks like, I guess it must be somewhere in a volcano.

Dialog.Title: Нет, это слишком редкий арт.
Dialog.Text: Понимаю, вопрос доверия. Ну что же...

Dialog.Title: Сколько денег тебе нужно?
Dialog.Text: Здесь вопрос не только денег... Если бы я доказал, что могу поставлять редкости, хотя бы иногда, барыги согласились бы меня поддерживать какое-то время. Не по доброте душевной, конечно, но за товар похуже, скажем, какой я могу найти на помойках и близ поселений. А это уже работа. Как понимаешь, я не собираюсь всю жизнь у мусорных куч отираться.

Dialog.Title: Ты никогда не видел "Везувий"?
Dialog.Text: Я слышал про ценный артефакт, похожий на прямоугольную металлическую пластину с абсолютной гладкой поверхностью... Но это все, что я знаю.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about this place.
Dialog.Text: Welcome to Vesuvius, my friend. All my colleagues went to the east to study the place thoroughly and its phenomena. And I'm left here studying local fauna...To tell the truth...it's not really my thing...

Dialog.Title: What phenomena?
Dialog.Text: The volcano, of course. A real volcano...isn't it amazing, huh? The temperature here is very high, so almost all the equipment broke down, including all the communication tools. But a local repairman helped me assemble an analyzer so we're having a pretty good connection here. What is more phenomenal...is that only the equipment that you assemble near the volcano is actually working here.

Dialog.Title: I got the ingredients for the meds.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I have no intention to talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me about the war?
Dialog.Text: War is bad. Not only for people. Animals did also make a contribution to the Vicroty. Everyone knows how horses were important during the war, but few people know in what way dogs assisted soldiers. Do you know that they "served" as mine pickers, signalers, nurses, diversionests and snoopers? They were more than fifty thousands of them!
This ditch Brutors use for direct and not direct purposes. The smell is such that the horse will fall down. And hamster -- break into pieces.

Dialog.Title: Throw into a ditch roll of paper.
Throw in a ditch Brutors bone.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Хорошее место для приманки.

Dialog.Title: Положить кость брутора.
Dialog.Text: Кости брутора мало. Как пес узнает, что она здесь лежит?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Good place for bait.

Dialog.Title: Place the paper roll.
Dialog.Text: Dog-mutant need an extra trace to come here.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Tea time! Tea time! Have another cup of tea!

Dialog.Title: Please fill my cup.
Dialog.Text: I'm run out of tea, unfortunately. Will you get some?

Dialog.Title: Do you have tea glass holders?
Dialog.Text: I do. Take as many as you need, all glases are broken anyway.

Dialog.Title: Could you give me three?
Dialog.Text: No problem. You get me three packs of tea, I give you three glass holders, deal?

Dialog.Title: Here is your tea.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, bro! You know.. I used to be a boozer before I got into the Zone...I've seen so much stuff here...different sort of stuff, if you see what I mean..Now I'm sober, man. The only thing I'm addicted to is tea...Hey! Here's your reward, pick a hat.

Dialog.Title: What hat?
Dialog.Text: Any you like..panama hat or a cap..

Dialog.Title: No, thanks. I don't need a hat.
Dialog.Text: Are you sure?

Dialog.Title: I am. Let say the tea was my gift.
Dialog.Text: Oh man! Thanks, bro..it's...it's so kind of you.

Dialog.Title: I brought the tea. You promised to give me the glass holders.
Dialog.Text: Here you are.

Dialog.Title: Leshich sent me.
Dialog.Text: Oh really? I know that Leshich puts 45 tea bags into his cup. How many do you put?
You have a bad taste for tea...too bad, too bad...
What?? Are you mad?
You have a very bad taste for tea, man...too bad, too bad..
You have a good taste for tea. I adrmire that!

Dialog.Title: Can we talk business now?
Dialog.Text: Yea, now we can talk business...Tell me, stalker, have you been in jail? Don't think I'm interested if you've been imprisonned and what you were accused of. It's just, if you wanna make some extra cash, you gotta go to the Jail. If you go for it, there's no way back. So, what do you say? Will you take the risk?

Dialog.Title: Sure. I ain't scared.
Dialog.Text: I'm not trying to scare you, it's just the way it is...dangerous. Oh yes. I think you're gonna find the way to get into the Jail yourself. When you're there, find a guy named Bugor and tell him the following "The order for crutches is ready". Learn it by heart and tell him word to word.

Dialog.Title: Да
Dialog.Text: Это хорошо. В смысле значит, знаешь, что там да как. И, что там совсем не курорт. Но, если хочешь в деле поучаствовать и заработать, придётся ещё разок там побывать. Как туда попасть я тебя учить не буду. Это уже твоя забота. Ну, что не передумал ещё хорошо подзаработать? Берешься за дело?

Dialog.Title: Берусь
Dialog.Text: Вот и хорошо. Но смотри, дело серьёзное. Я тебя предупредил. Если решишь в последний момент соскочить с темы, не позавидую.

Dialog.Title: I'll think about it.
Dialog.Text: Take your time.

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: Great. That's all.You'd better move.

Dialog.Title: And...it's time for a riddle! Right?
Dialog.Text: Tea ceremony needs special attention...But! You have what I need, I have what you need...let's help one another!

Dialog.Title: And what do you need?
Dialog.Text: Some hypericum, it's the best natural anti depressant..all you have to do is just add it to your tea..and then..

Dialog.Title: ...I don't have it. But I will get you some!
Dialog.Text: So you'd better move then! As long as I remember who you are...

Dialog.Title: I brought the hypericum.
Dialog.Text: Well done! Here's a riddle for you - "He can't run, he only walks. He can't sing, he only talks. He has arms but ain't got shoulders, he has face, but ain't got eyes so he doesn't wear folders. Is he real or just lies? ." Riddle me that!

Dialog.Title: Thank you! I must be off now.
Dialog.Text: See you around, my friend!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I think one of us is a criminal...guess who it is, if not me. Go away!

Dialog.Title: I'd better get you a daisy.
Hey, a daisy for you!
Dialog.Text: Great! Excellent! And a riddle for you! "Who runs but doesn't walk? Who sings but doesn't speak? Who has face but has no eyes?"

Dialog.Title: Thanks!
Dialog.Text: Daisy for you! Daisy for me! Come over any day!

Dialog.Title: I heard you wanted to produce a play.
Dialog.Text: That's right. It's going to be a play about The Great Patriotic War, I want to show that we never forgot what happened. Old Stalker's quiz hit me upon this idea by the way... I thought what if certain people can't answer many questions because they simply don't know their own history? We must educate them!

Dialog.Title: Nice idea. Do you need any help?
Dialog.Text: Well...I'll be honest, you're not a born actor. I don't think you'll be eager to sweep the stage...But you could help me find actors. What do you think of that?

Dialog.Title: Are you sure you can handle a play?
Dialog.Text: Are you worried bacause of my...hum, eccentric ways and love for hats and tea? Oh, believe me, my talents lie far beyond hats and tea! Or do you know anyone who'd handle it better than me?

Dialog.Title: Where and when will it take place?
Dialog.Text: Hard to say....but definitely not any time soon. First, we have to reherse a lot, moreover I'm planning to go on tour far away from here...You know how hard it's to "travel" across the Zone, right? So, it makes things even more vague.

Dialog.Title: I don't think I can handle this.
Dialog.Text: Let's have a cup of tea, shall we?

Dialog.Title: I'd love to help!
Dialog.Text: Very well. Here's a list of people that I think are talented enough to be good actors. Find 'em. And don't forget to take notice what hats they wear.

Dialog.Title: I found the actors for your play.
Dialog.Text: Excellent! Great! That's a perfect reason to drink a special China tea....But not everything is that perfect.

Dialog.Title: What's wrong?
Dialog.Text: I'm running of ideas for the play! I need to learn interesting facts about the war. Could you ask certain people to tell you some stories?

Dialog.Title: I've collected stories about the War.
Dialog.Text: I'm all ears! Whose story do you wanna tell me?

Dialog.Title: Shepelev's.
Dialog.Text: Well well well...What aircraft are you saying Shepelev's father was piloting?

Dialog.Title: Bomber.
Dialog.Text: What a story! So, what did they happen to destroy by accident?

Dialog.Title: Warehouse.
Dialog.Text: And all German supplies went off! Wow, that's incredible! Were our men awarded?

Dialog.Title: No. They didn't confess they destroyed it.
Dialog.Text: That was a great story! Let's carry on! Shall we?

Dialog.Title: Salnikov's.
Dialog.Text: That's a real spy fiction! Where did that man do service?

Dialog.Title: SMERSH.
Dialog.Text: Wow...that's quite a title. So, what gave away the spy?

Dialog.Title: His passport.
Dialog.Text: What was wrong with his passport?

Dialog.Title: Paper clips didn't rust.
Dialog.Text: We can film an action movie based on this story! Tell me one more!

Dialog.Title: The photo wasn't black and white.
Jean Bratovski's.
Dialog.Text: Oh, this was an international story! So, how did the fighter squadron where Jean's grandfarther did service named?

Dialog.Title: Normandie-Nieman.
Dialog.Text: Yeah, that was a legendary squadron. Tell me how hard it was for Jean's farther during the last battle.

Dialog.Title: He was waiting for assistance in a cold water.
Dialog.Text: He was lucky to survive! You mantioned the sword gifted by the king of Great Britain. Who was the sword adressed to?

Dialog.Title: He spent several days wandering in the woods.
To Stalin, as firm as steel.
To Red Army soldiers. as brave as knites.
To the citiszens of Stalingrad, as firm as steel.
Dialog.Text: That sword is a real masterpiece.

Dialog.Title: Tacklberry's.
Dialog.Text: Oh, I know he has many horryfing stories to tell. But isn't any war horryfing? So, what was Tacklberry doing at the front?

Dialog.Title: Delivering supplies.
Dialog.Text: And that was when the German overtook him...I mean, he overtook them, right? What weapon did he use?

Dialog.Title: Axe and grenades.
Dialog.Text: This is how the war really looks like...when you kill your enemy with teeth and nails...And how many did he manage to kill?

Dialog.Title: A couple of dozens.
Dialog.Text: More or less...

Dialog.Title: Doctor Dolittle's
Dialog.Text: I feel it's gonna be interesting! What is the story about?

Dialog.Title: About dogs.
Dialog.Text: I didn't know they played such an important role...What "professions" exactly did they have?

Dialog.Title: Signaller, mine pickers, nurses.
Dialog.Text: Ok, that's clear.

Dialog.Title: I told you all the stories.
Dialog.Text: Thanks to the likes of you, the memory about The Great Patriotic War will be forever in our hearts. Thank you so much, stalker! I'm gonna write the play now...
Hey... Hey, stalker! Come here.

Dialog.Title: What?
Dialog.Text: Do you have some unused or good conditioned stuff? You can exchange it here. Also I have the rare repair kit. And some armor. Rare. I can give it to you for the arts and Spiderkhan's legs. But keep your hands out of my stuff till we make a deal. I have a gun. Seriously.

Dialog.Title: Why do you need these arts and legs?
Dialog.Text: Why so curious? The eggheads needs them. That's all I can tell.

Dialog.Title: Возьму бронь "Железная крыса".
Dialog.Text: 4 экрана, 2 подушки, 1 стаб, 2 лапы Паукана. Все принес?

Dialog.Title: Возьму бронь "Ниндзя".
Dialog.Text: 2 экрана, 1 стаб, 1 лапа Паукана и 50 000 рублей. Выкладывай, считать будем.

Dialog.Title: Я не все собрал.
