Dialog.Text: Плохо. Пока все не собрал, не подходи. Я принимаю только сразу наборами. Так считать удобнее...

Dialog.Title: Все отдал. Давай бронь.
Dialog.Text: Да, хорошо. Вот твоя бронь... Ты меня не видел и разговора этого не было, понял?

Dialog.Title: Все отдал уже. Давай бронь.
Dialog.Text: Да, вижу, отлично. Забирай... Ты меня не видел и разговора этого не было, понял?

Dialog.Title: Возьму ремнабор для редких вещей.
Dialog.Text: 2 экрана и 80 000 рублей. При тебе?

Dialog.Title: I have some things to sell.
И деньги.
Dialog.Text: Отлично. Забирай ремнабор. Как говорится, целее будешь, хе-хе-хе...

Dialog.Title: А денег пока нет. Много просишь.
Dialog.Text: Без денег не отдам. Неси деньги.

Dialog.Title: И экраны.
Dialog.Text: Отлично. Забирай ремнабор. Как говорится, целее будешь, хе-хе-хе...

Dialog.Title: Я не все собрал.
Dialog.Text: Плохо. Так уж и быть, могу взять частями, отдельно экраны, отдельно деньги. Я тебя запомнил, не боись. Но лучше приноси все сразу.

Dialog.Title: Вроде все отдал.
Dialog.Text: Да. Отлично. Забирай ремнабор. Как говорится, целее будешь, хе-хе-хе...

Dialog.Title: Вот деньги.
Dialog.Text: Деньги -- это хорошо, учту. Ты, главное, арты неси.

Dialog.Title: Ты упомянул автомат...
Dialog.Text: А... Это АК107. Нужен? У него особая цена. Приноси шесть артефактов "Резина", десять самодельных шашек и модернизированный бронежилет "Железная Крыса". Доплачивай 250 000. И автомат будет твой. За такой автомат цена грошовая.

Dialog.Title: Все отдал. Давай автомат...
Dialog.Text: А, ну да, точно... Эх, от сердца отрываю. Ладно, забирай. Забирай, пока я не передумал... К слову, у меня еще есть, если что...

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for padded jacket.
Dialog.Text: There is an excellent jacket. Don't look that all in dirt and in patches. I will trade it for five hundred.

Dialog.Title: Here is 500. Give me the jacket.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hey stalker! If you have meat or cash, feel free to share with Chestnut.

Dialog.Title: Here, take ten rubles.
Dialog.Text: Oh thanks. Now I can buy some food on it. Listen, I heard that puppy heads are very delicious if cooked right. I'm not a hunter myself, but you are. How about you getting me ten heads and we share the meal?

Dialog.Title: I brought the heads.
Dialog.Text: They smell like...Alright, at least we won't die of hunger today. Thanks, man. Here's you portion.

Dialog.Title: What do you need meat for?
Dialog.Text: What for? To eat it, of course. Ain't you hungry, be the way? If you get me meat, I'll cook it for ya. If you get me, let say, five slabs of meat, we'd share meal with everyone.

Dialog.Title: Мне бы фейерверки
Dialog.Text: Добро! Неси мясо и буде тебе фейерверк!

Dialog.Title: I brought you the meat.
Dialog.Text: Great. And this is for you.

Dialog.Title: Я мясо приёс. Гони фейерверк.
Dialog.Text: Отлично! Давай его сюда.

Dialog.Title: So fast?
Dialog.Text: See how many people are in Liubech? They all wanna eat, you know.

Dialog.Title: Фейерверк
Dialog.Text: Держи! Но смотри аккуратней с ним! Очень близко не стой рядом, когда запускать будешь. Ну, бывай, сталкер! Веселись!

Dialog.Title: Что-то песня не ахти как...
Dialog.Text:
Сам ты... Уже немного осталось, дослушаешь и мясо будет готово!
Надо выдать преступнику печень, Но сойдет для него требуха. Мне роскошный обед обеспечен, А ему все равно ха-ха-ха! Умеют повара проворачивать дела, Что плохо лежит, не зевай-вай-вай, Только повара, только повара, Только поворачиваться успевай!
Всё! Готово! Держи свою долю!

Dialog.Title: Спасибо
Dialog.Text: На здоровье! Ну, ты заглядывай! С мясом желательно! Ха-ха-ха!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello!

Dialog.Title: How is it going?
Dialog.Text: Not very well, it's damn freezing in this place.The gale force wind is killing. Well, you stalkers ain't bothered with such stuff, you don't even notice what's going on around you. All hat you do is running about..My life's different. I have to sit here and wait.

Dialog.Title: Why aren't you at the station?
Dialog.Text: That place's not for me. It's occupied by more successful dealers. They're stronger and richer than me. They know who to suck up to in order to stay safe. We're not safe here. We sleep by turns, you alway have to be alert. I remember on guy...Senya was his name. He was unfortunate to fall asleep when on duty. He didn't even wake up when rats ate his legs to the knees.

Dialog.Title: I can get you some spirit. It'll help you get warm.
Dialog.Text: No way. I have to be alert, don't want to suffer the same fate as Senya. I saterted to knit a sweater, but I need a decent material for that. My fellas suggested spider net would do. Hey, I have an idea. What if you shoot several spiders for me? Take out their glands and bring to me?

Dialog.Title: I brought spider glands.
Dialog.Text: Excellent.

Dialog.Title: How is your sweater?
Dialog.Text: Knitting it..slowly. My grandma used to be very good at knitting. Well, she didn't use spider net for that though. Listen, can you get me more net?

Dialog.Title: Hey! Listen, do you know any riddles?
Dialog.Text: Well, let me think first. I guess I can come up with one. Ready to exchange it for three energy drinks?

Dialog.Title: I will try to help.
Dialog.Text: That would be just great.

Dialog.Title: Hey, don't get cold man, look what I brought you.
Dialog.Text: Thank you, stalker. Here's a riddle for you "I live in the oceans, the rivers and seas, when I'm cold I float, when I'm hot, I'm free."

Dialog.Title: See you later, Fedya!
Dialog.Text: You take care, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Hi! Listen, do you know any riddles?
Dialog.Text: You did help me, stalker. Here's a riddle for you for free -"It always tirelessly roars and swallows something all the time. It solts its meal and drinks a lot of water. What is it?"
What?

Dialog.Title: What are you doing in a cage?
Dialog.Text: Can't you see? I feed mutants. And before you will ask one more silly question... It is important scientific experiment. It is necessary to watch changes in their behavior and behind action after some components which I add into food.

Dialog.Title: How long you sit here?
Dialog.Text: Now every day in two shifts. Previously, I had an assistant. But he went away from the cage so they ate him. Therefore, I will not open the cage even if you'll be attacked. You're a stalker and you have weapons. And... Can't you just walk away? Because you scare my mutants.

Dialog.Title: Can I help you?
Dialog.Text: You? Help me? Ha! Stalker, get out of here. How many people do you know who sympathize with mutants? And how many scientists among them? Do not stand there because mutants will attack and you will kill them even from the defense or just for fun. You better not interfere.

Dialog.Title: Here is the data about mutants. ||You can take them from my PDA.
Dialog.Text: Where did you get them?

Dialog.Title: One scientist has helped. ||I think it is useful to you.
Dialog.Text: Hmm... Well... Thank you. Now you're waiting, that I'll get out of here and go back to the camp, right?

Dialog.Title: You have the data. Why to sit here?
Dialog.Text: Why? WHY? This data is only the first step! It did not give me anything, no answers. Only more questions. I will not move from this spot until I check everything!

Dialog.Title: Actually, I'm waiting for the money.
Dialog.Text: Ah... I just thought... Does not matter. Yes, of course, here you go.

Dialog.Title: Doc...?
Dialog.Text: What the...! What are you doing? You are parasite! You're bastard! You're killing them!

Dialog.Title: I keep killing till you open the cage.
Dialog.Text: I will not get out of the cage! Until I finish the job! How dare you! Interfere with my work! Get out! OUT!

Dialog.Title: Sorry, Doc. Did not know that it's your mutants.
Dialog.Text: Don't shoot nearby mutants. You're destroying the research.

Dialog.Title: ...Doc?
Dialog.Text: What the...! What are you doing? You are parasite! You're bastard! You're killing them!

Dialog.Title: Sorry, Doc. Didn't know that it's your mutants.
Dialog.Text: Don't shoot nearby mutants. You're destroying the research.

Dialog.Title: I keep killing till you open the cage.
Dialog.Text: I will not get out of the cage! Until I finish the job! How dare you! Interfere with my work! Get out! OUT!

Dialog.Title: Can I help you?
Dialog.Text: No! But wait... ...Colleagues are skeptical toward my work. Recently they stoped supplying food. They say that they don't have enough, but I know... They think that hunger and thirst will force me out of here. Ha!

Dialog.Title: How are you?
Dialog.Text: Fine... Who cares?

Dialog.Title: I brought cans.
Dialog.Text: Hm... Thanks.

Dialog.Title: Open the cage.
Dialog.Text: N...o...n...o...not... going.... anywhere....please...water...

Dialog.Title: I brought food.
Dialog.Text: ....Thanks...

Dialog.Title: Here is food and water.
Dialog.Text: I... ...Thank you... I'm sorry, stalker. I know how it looks. But the boy... my assistant... I should not take him with me. Mutants ate him. And I could not do anything. Did not open the cage... You know what I have found... in the mutant...? No remains of... No remains in their stomachs to dig. These creatures absorbed the very structure of their victim. The genes themselves. Do you understand? We always thought that animals were subjected to mutation under the Phon radiation. But what if we were wrong? What if it is a mutation itself, a certain essence, absorbs a rat and becomes rat-alike? And that boy... what was his name...? His DNA is there, in these mutants. He lives in them, he can be found there... I have to find him...

Dialog.Title: You're tired, Doc. Take a rest.
Your stubborn will kill you.|| Open the cage!
Open the cage.
Dialog.Text: ...Go away...

Dialog.Title: Here is the data about mutants. ||You can take them from my PDA.
Dialog.Text: You are a murderer! Murderer! I... I do not trust you... Keep your data away from me...

Dialog.Title: How are we doing?
Dialog.Text: I...screwed up, stalker...that lab guy...I shouldn't have taken him along...They tore him apart, ate him alive. I couldn't help him. Know what I ound out about the mutants? They won't just eat you, they'll literally suck the life out of you. They, so to speak, soak the genic material out of their victims. Do you understand? We used to think those animals got affected by the Phone, but what if it's not true? What if the mutation is something that eats a rat and becomes one? And that lad..what was his name? His DNA is there now, inside the mutants that ate him. He's living inside'em..I gotta find him.

Dialog.Title: Can I help with anything?
Dialog.Text: No. You can't help.

Dialog.Title: Is there any proofs of the theory?
Dialog.Text: No. Only ideas and guesses. I'm making notes...

Dialog.Title: You should show Simonov your notes!
Dialog.Text: But...

Dialog.Title: If your theory is not just ideas and guesses Simonov will support you! He will talk to Doc Frayer and press the case so that you'll have enough time, food and stuff...
Dialog.Text: You're right. Simonov can help. Here's my work. Go and show it to him.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hey!

Dialog.Title: Hey.
Dialog.Text: Do you fancy killing mutants today?

Dialog.Title: No thanks. I've had enough.
Dialog.Text: But they keep coming every day...nothing stops 'em.

Dialog.Title: Sure.
Dialog.Text: Great. There's a hole in the wall, see? They're slipping in through it.

Dialog.Title: Those dogs were damn crazy...
Dialog.Text: You bet. I know this kind of work must be rewarded, but I'm stuck here, so I have nothing to offer you. Unless...If you keep helping us, I'll speak for you with the Sergeant.

Dialog.Title: Blacksmith told me to get some rounds from you.
Dialog.Text: Still don't have time to do away with those monsters myself...Listen, let me keep the ammunition, I really need it and I'll tell you where to get some more.

Dialog.Title: No thanks, give me the rounds now.
Well... Alright.|| I hope there's more than one pack!
Dialog.Text: Inside the warehouse Blacksmith has sent you to...He keeps telling everyone there's nothing left, but that's not true.

Dialog.Title: You were right, I found the ammo.
Dialog.Text: We both won, then. Listen, there's a job that must be done quickly...I was asked to kill a couple of dogs and hand their parts to local scientists. Saw some proper mutants in the yard, to the left from here. Hand their parts to Doctor Zinoviev. So, what do you say?

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Sure. Zinoviev keeps talking you up for the samples you got him. I want you to kill a couple of big dogs again, but this time you bring their ears to me and I'll hand them to Zinoviev miself, deal? I'll give you 150 for each.

Dialog.Title: I do all the crap job and you take credit for that?! No way!
Dialog.Text: Whatever. I was going to pay you well, though.

Dialog.Title: I brought dog ears.
Dialog.Text: Excellent! Give them to me.

Dialog.Title: Here you go.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, buddy. Here is your money.

Dialog.Title: I offended you last time. Take these rounds from me.
Dialog.Text: Thanks, man, didn't expect that. So, listen up, I'm gonna tell you a secret. Inside the warehouse Blacksmith sent you to there're lots of ammunitions. Blacksmith keeps telling everyone there's nothing left there, but that is not true.

Dialog.Title: Good morning.
Dialog.Text: What do you want?

Dialog.Title: I need your help.
Dialog.Text: What kind of help?

Dialog.Title: Help me get into the Prison.
Dialog.Text: Prioson?! Why on earth do you want to get there?

Dialog.Title: Got some business there.
Dialog.Text: Business? Only bad men have business there. Get the hell out! Or I'll kick your ass!

Dialog.Title: I need to deliver some stuff there.
Dialog.Text: Are you a goon the delivery boy? Get the hell out of here until I kick your ass!

Dialog.Title: None of your business.
Dialog.Text: Fair enough. Ask no questions and get money quickly. I'm gonna help you but with two cinditions only. First - you keep your mouth shut about my part in this. Second - it'll cost you 10 tickets. Pay in advance.

Dialog.Title: Tickets? What do you need them for?
Dialog.Text: None of YOUR business. Got it?

Dialog.Title: Gotcha.
Dialog.Text: So, what do you say?

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: Give me the tickets now, then!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: I'm one of you. Ask Dibenko, he'll confirm.
Dialog.Text: How do you happen to know about that?

Dialog.Title: Does it matter? I need to sort something out here.
Dialog.Text: I knew stalkers would send someone here. Listen, that accident concerns my personal interests. Someone among the locals wanted to get easy money, you know. But I've no idea who that was, the guardsman or the stockman...it could have been anybody, warehouses are everywhere. You can steal without being noticed, if you have the nerve to.

Dialog.Title: Are you saying you didn't know about stealing? I don't believe it.
Dialog.Text: Not at such scale! We closed our eyes on small accidents, you know. But this time that grabby bastard stole a truck, full of supplies! Know what's the most shocking? No one has stopped him, that means he had a permission to pass, wherever he took it from. And now everybody suspects each other. Moreover, I've found out that our smart ass decided to sell all the stuff to bandits.

Dialog.Title: You're talking about one man, but what about the others?
Dialog.Text: I have no idea. Maybe our hero owed someone money.

Dialog.Title: Why do you think they opened fire?
Dialog.Text: Maybe someone just didn't want to do what was agreed to or it was just an accident. The most important it that the truck is gone which means somebody survived and took all the loot.

Dialog.Title: Who's investigating this?
Dialog.Text: Talk to Drachuk, he might tell you more.

Dialog.Title: Thank you for the information.
Dialog.Text: listen, I don't know what you're up to, but be careful.

Dialog.Title: Have you heard anything about firing in the wood?
Dialog.Text: Maybe. But why on earth should I tell you anything? It's none of you business. Talk to seargeants, Dibenko and Drachuk. If they show you their respect, we'll talk.

Dialog.Title: I met Lieutenant Still...
Dialog.Text: Oh, man. God damn it!
You spoiled my day, stalker! Go away.

Dialog.Title: Ты говорил про склад, где патроны...
Dialog.Text: На складе, на который тебя Кузнец послал, военные одно время кантовались. Оставили там припасов кучу. Это Кузнец всем сказки рассказывает, что нет там ничего. Сам-то он оттуда добра много продал.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: The Greek told me to come to you.
Dialog.Text: OK. So listen. I can't confiscate your weapon, you know, but it is forbidden to shoot inside the building. You're free to shoot mutants outside though. Have you seen our prison? If there is any misunderstanding between us, you can always think about it there.

Dialog.Title: Who is in charge here? || Greek, you, the military or Shtaket?
Dialog.Text: If I were you I wouldn't talk about Shtaket so loud. That devil's always up to something but we have to bear with his deeds. He's the one who cotrols the hucksters, and we need food and arms, you know. The military would be happy to send us all out of here, they call it "evacuate". But they don't have enough people for that, becides, they need our arms, our people and connections.

Dialog.Title: So you all depend on each other?
Dialog.Text: Yes, and we don't complain much. We all are in one boat, stalker. If you rock it, I will drown you first. So you just enter, buy, sell, rest and go away. Don't delay.

Dialog.Title: So you all are in one boat.
Dialog.Text: Yes, and we don't complain. If you start trouble, then I will be the first one who will drown you. So you just come, buy, sell, rest and move along. Don't stay here for too long.

Dialog.Title: Got some work?
Dialog.Text: Maybe... but listen to me for a while.

Dialog.Title: I don't have time for stories.
Dialog.Text: As you wish. I won't give you any work then. As we say it, first the theory, then the practice.

Dialog.Title: OK...
Dialog.Text: This old building was used by us as a police department. The Greek, our comendant, is a former lieutenant, who was working on behind the border. Then the life brought him to the Zone, he settled in Lubech and bacame our boss. And I became his right hand. When the mutants started to appear. Many people ran to the railway station or to the well defended Palace of Culture... Anywhere, just as far as possible. But the Greek stayed. He and me were actually the only ones who stayed by own will. We took cover for several days. But mutants kept pushing. And then I offered him to free the prisoners. The Greek agreed. That is how Stick, Shtaket and their helpers became free. We defeated those mutants, but, of course, we couldn't even think of returning them all back to cells.

Dialog.Title: Where did the militaries came from?
Dialog.Text: Don't interrupt me... For good or bad, Shtaket didn't want to get out of here. Of course, where could he go with such a great quantity of mutants around... But he understood, that he could use this building as a new place for his illegal operations. He has sent the couriers, made some connections... First goods appeared. We made profit from that too... The Greek loves to play a role of good policeman and to shut his eyes on many things, but the fact is that we all are dirty now. So dirty that we may share the same cell with Shtaket some day.

Dialog.Title: Let's get closer to business.
Dialog.Text: Patience. The trouble is that the Greek won't leave this place. As so as I won't. We can't put Shtaket back to prison. And we can't stop his business, as it is our business too. Shtaket, as I suppose, is thinking right now. From one side, we don't stay on his way. From the other side, he don't need us. So, as you see, the situation may lose control soon. While we have mutants -- we are united. While we don't have them, we are starting to think of killing each other.

Dialog.Title: But you still didn't.
Dialog.Text: No. Thanks to sergeant. Sergeants Drachuk and Dibenko with their squads are taking part in killing-mutants operations. This building attracts them because of its "defence capabilities". Now it is a military post here... Their priority is to hold position while the main forces are clearing the city. But they have problems with supplies and people. So they need our resources.

Dialog.Title: You mean Shtaket's connections...
Dialog.Text: That doesn't matter. The militaries are important factor of balance, which is made here. We all have our own roles, our own places. It is easy this way, without paranoid... I want to keep this balance. So, you wanted to find a job? Ask people around. If our suppliers think, that you can be trusted, then you will help them with goods. Militaries need informants, scouts and good warriors. But I want you to look, listen, watch and then come to me and tell me about it. I want to make sure, that our fragile union will not become the catastrophe. You will have money from me for important information. And rewards from employers, of course.

Dialog.Title: You made me confused. OK, we will see...
Dialog.Text: If you think of trying quarreling us and have profit from that, then think again. Criminal leaders, army and former cops are dangerous targets for joking. You'd better walk away, if you are not ready for this assignment.

Dialog.Title: I understand.|| I will come to you with information or won't come to all.
Dialog.Text: Good.

Dialog.Title: I understand.|| I will come to you with information or wont come to all.
Dialog.Text: Good.

Dialog.Title: About the assignment...
Dialog.Text: I am listening.

Dialog.Title: The report will be ready later.|I'm collecting the information. The report will be ready later.
Shtaket sells arts on to some hucksters. He buys up all kinds of nicked stuff and mutant parts. He also wants Kolya Acid dead.
Dialog.Text: Acid? Who is that guy? Is he still alive?

Dialog.Title: Not yet...
Dialog.Text: Don't worry man. I don't think Acid is in any kind of danger! Shtaket just wants us to believe he's a tough guy. Isn't Shtaket up to a rebellion or anything?

Dialog.Title: No, he is pleased with everything.
Dialog.Text: Great.

Dialog.Title: Militaries are not in hurry. ||They are trying to contact with their commanders and hold mutant's expantion.
Dialog.Text: Good... Yes... Very good...

Dialog.Title: Stick is planning something. ||He is trying to create his own network apart from Shtaket. Found his own traders and asks me to go for goods.
Dialog.Text: Damn it! So. We are lucky that Stick hired you. So we do it this way. Bring the goods to me. I will contact someone and we will make a fake package. And you give this package to Stick. Got it?

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: I hope Stick shall cure from his ambitions soon. If Shtaket find out, he will cut his head. Greek will try to stop him, militaries will try to "keep situation under control" and everything will be ruined. So, please, take it serious and do what I ask you to.

Dialog.Title: Take the package.
Dialog.Text: OK. Walk around for 10 minutes and then come back.

Dialog.Title: Is it ready?
Dialog.Text: Yes. Take it. And bring to Stick.

Dialog.Title: Do you want to know anything else?
Dialog.Text: Well, yes. Our union is now out of danger. And Stick will come down soon... Here are your reward and my personal thanks.

Dialog.Title: I will keep you up to date.
Have you any Morozov's stuff?
Dialog.Text: Yup. But I won't give it to you. Because it's a main evidence in the Twisted's case

Dialog.Title: What case?
Dialog.Text: I won't tell anything to you. I don't trust you. Good luck.

Dialog.Title: What case?
Dialog.Text: Twisted is Morozov's ex partner. We think that they were making serious mess here before the mutants' attack and radio problems.

Dialog.Title: What did they do?
Dialog.Text: They were selling arts to the Main Land. Then somebody killed Twisted.

Dialog.Title: Morozov said that Twisted is dead.
Dialog.Text: Here are the money for Morozov's "good job". We can't get him right now. So I can't give you this box.

Dialog.Title: Got a mission for me?
Dialog.Text: Yep. But first you gotta go to Greek and register. Then come back and I'll give you some job.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Я от Ивана Ада.
Dialog.Text: Слушаю.

Dialog.Title: Он предлагает тебе сотрудничать.
Dialog.Text: Нет. Я понимаю его цели, но методы... Они неприемлемы.

Dialog.Title: Есть способ переубедить тебя?
Dialog.Text: Нет. И я думаю, лучше нам больше никогда не затрагивать эту тему.

Dialog.Title: Знаешь про Батю?
Dialog.Text: Какого Батю? Ты о чем вообще, сталкер?

Dialog.Title: Он, вроде как, авторитеный уголовник...
Dialog.Text: А, вот ты к чему клонишь: что я мент бывший. Понятно. Но про твоего Батю я первый раз слышу.

Dialog.Title: А Грек знает, но почему-то молчит.
Dialog.Text: Послушай. Во-первых, если Грек молчит - это его дело. А во-вторых, нас, конечно, многие считают наемниками - и в чем-то они правы... Но, видишь ли, мент не бывает бывшим. Нормальный мент. Если бы ты поменьше общался с уголовниками и за тебя поручились бы уважаемые сталкеры - Грек бы все тебе рассказал. Я уверен.

Dialog.Title: Знаешь про Батю?
Dialog.Text: Какого Батю? Ты о чем вообще, сталкер?
Hello. Do you want to use the storage service?

Do you wantto go to New Land? I can lead you a way to the lighthouse or to the swamp. You mustn't go alone, you'll get lost. If you follow me, I'll take you right to a hut on the swamps. You know where it is, right?
Провести тебя на Новую Землю? Я знаю путь на Новую Землю, к маяку. Или может провести на болота? На болота один не ходи -- заблудишься. А я сразу к дому выведу. Знаешь такой дом, на болоте?

Dialog.Title: No thanks. I'll find the way myself.
Dialog.Text: Oh really? Good luck with THAT.

Dialog.Title: Lead me to the lighthouse on New Land.
Dialog.Text: It costs 500 000.

Dialog.Title: Lead me to the swamp.
Dialog.Text: It costs 300 000.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hello, bro. Where you wanna go?

Dialog.Title: I'm not gonna anywhere.
Dialog.Text: Don't ya trust me?

Dialog.Title: Where can you conduct me?
Dialog.Text: I can conduct you in the cellar under the House of Culture. Go to the anomalous field, where you can get hold many of good artifacts, there still is a lake and a house ... In the cave of the bandits, around psychiatric hospitals. Go to the cave in the mountains, in a square K4. I can conduct you on the Vesuvius ...

Dialog.Title: To the basement of Palace of Culture.
Dialog.Text: 5000 rubles. You must pay in advance.

Dialog.Title: To the lake near the anomalous field.
Dialog.Text: 21 000 rubles. You must pay in advance.

Dialog.Title: To the Bandits Cave, near the clinic.
Dialog.Text: 10 000 rubles. You must pay in advance.

Dialog.Title: To the mountains, in a square K4.
Dialog.Text: 9000 rubles. You must pay in advance.

Dialog.Title: At Vesuvius? Where is it?
Dialog.Text: To a tent near the radio tower. Or in the camp of scientists.

Dialog.Title: To the radio tower.
Dialog.Text: 12 000 rubles. You must pay in advance.

Dialog.Title: To the Scientists Camp.
Dialog.Text: 30 000 rubles. You must pay in advance.

Dialog.Title: Remind me where you to spend in Ljubech.
Too expensive.
Dialog.Text: I do not lead the poor.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I sell rounds, grenades. Even the best weapon is useless without ammo. Do you need anything?

Dialog.Title: Let me see what you have for sale.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Where are my paws?

Dialog.Title: What kind of paws?
Dialog.Text: Have you seen one-eyed green creatures in the swamps? That's verliokas. Kill these monsters, cut their paws and bring them to me. I'll trade some ammo for them. It's simple. You can also find some spiders. Their paws are good too. But much more cheaper. And don't bring me less than 17 paws. Verlioka's. And I won't buy spider parts, unless you bring me 35 pieces.

Dialog.Title: I brought some Verlioka's paws.
Dialog.Text: Good for you. What I've promised you? 35 000 rubles?

Dialog.Title: I've brought you spider legs.
Dialog.Text: Good for you. Take your ammo.

Dialog.Title: No. ||I have nothing for you.
Dialog.Text: So why are you here? Where are my paws?

Dialog.Title: 35 000 and some ammo.
Dialog.Text: Ah... Well, yes, of course... I almost forgot... heh heh...

Dialog.Title: Ammo and money. Come on!
Dialog.Text: Ah, yes... exactly... I almost forgot... heh heh...

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Hey there. I can fix any of your stuff. Noone has yet complained. You're gonna probably say it's easier to buy new stuff than to fix the old one, but that would be much expensive as they say your own shirt is closer to the body. So, what do you say?

Dialog.Title: There's actually something I need to fix.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I'm working, stalker. Be quick.

Dialog.Title: What do I do if got bitten?
Dialog.Text: I wish I could help you for free, stalker. But I won't. If I was that generous I would have been broke myself long ago. So...until you're at the point of death, noone's gonna save your life for free. Be ready to pay for being fixed up.

Dialog.Title: I get that.
Dialog.Text: Wait...all right, all right...Take this med kit. I don't want you to die here. But this is for the first and the only time!

Dialog.Title: I'm not a stalker.
Dialog.Text: Sorry, my mistake. The thing is, people who got here illegally are of two types, stalkers and dead bodies. Obviously, you're not dead, so you must be a stalker then.

Dialog.Title: Thank you, Doc! I won't forget it.
Can you fix me up?
Dialog.Text: I don't examine but for your money I can do any injection you need, for example general tonic or anti radiation.

Dialog.Title: You don't admire stalkers, huh?
Dialog.Text: Stalkers like babbling too much. In my mind, they're all just bandits and vagabonds. Their presence in the Zone is illegal. The authorities say there's no such "profession" at all and those who, so to speak, employ them, do it on the quiet.

Dialog.Title: If that's true, why do they employ stalkers at all?
Dialog.Text: Although their "business" is illegal, it may be useful. They're ready to risk their own lives and do what normal people wouldn't ever sign for. They explore the Zone, they know it from A to Z and as long as there're unexplored parts of the Zone, they will be needed.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I sell rounds, grenades. Even the best weapon is useless without rounds. Do you need anything?

Dialog.Title: Let me see what you have for sale.
How is your business?
Dialog.Text: Not bad, man. I always have customers.

Dialog.Title: Got a license?
Dialog.Text: Certainly not. But it's OK here, in the Zone. How about you? Ain't you afraid of being searched by the military? They won't leave such a strange accident behind.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Do you need new armor? Here's a wide choice for you. What will protect you from bullets and mutant teeth? That's right, decent armor.

Dialog.Title: Let me see what you have for sale.
How is your business?
Dialog.Text: Fine. Listen, take this jacket, it's your size, it'll fit you perfectly well. I gotta sell at least half of the goods.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
The remains of a careless stalker.

Dialog.Title: Inspect the corpse.
Dialog.Text: The skull and spine shattered by bullets. Legs are melted. The hand bones gnawed by rats. Judging by traces, the man crept from the lake side almost on a lap and was seriously wounded already before he met his death here.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Let me to the city.
Dialog.Text: Stalker? You may pass. Hurry.

Dialog.Title: Let me to the city.
Dialog.Text: I can't let you pass, stalker. Dibenko's orders. I'm sorry.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Let me to the city.
Dialog.Text: Stalker? You may pass. Hurry.

Dialog.Title: Let me to the city.
Dialog.Text: I can't let you pass, stalker. Dibenko's orders. I'm sorry.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Let me to the city.
Dialog.Text: Stalker? You may pass. Hurry.

Dialog.Title: Let me to the city.
Dialog.Text: I can't let you pass, stalker. Dibenko's orders. I'm sorry.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Do you have interest in rare goods? I can put camo on weapons, armors... It's a best remedy, when you need to feel comfort in the Zone.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Guiding to the Lubech surroundings. For free. Do you know Gurman? We can travel to him. We can go to swamps and bandits as well.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hey, who's there?

Dialog.Title: Are you living here on your own?
Dialog.Text: I am. And that fits me.

Dialog.Title: How did you get here in the first place?
Dialog.Text: Why so curious? It was a long time ago.

Dialog.Title: Did you sail here?
Dialog.Text: Are you nuts? Do I look like an experienced captain?

Dialog.Title: Well you never know... || I have heard there is an anomaly in which all aging faster. And you could be a passenger.
Dialog.Text: The theory is great. But you are wrong. I came here by myself. Previously found this place for myself. After all, the noticeable barge is here. Dragged the supplies and built up, settled down... Don't trample here. If you have a business just say so. If not... then move to the south where people are friendlier.

Dialog.Title: What business?
Dialog.Text: I thought everyone already knows. But no... still there are stray travelers. Ugh! In short, I need herbs for infusions. You do not clap your eyes and listen. I'm making tinctures. But good plant is almost gone nearby. And it is dangerous to go far. Therefore willing to pay more for the work of others. You stalkers should be able to understand the herbs. You go to the swamps and forests in the mountains... Looking for herbs and bring them to me. If the grass is good I will pay you money. By the way, if you have interest in tinctures, can succeed. But with your ingredients and alcohol... As you know, rare ingredients are in short supply. And I take ammo as the payment for my work. Mutants like to pester. Especially at night. And from crooks like you right ammo will always help.

Dialog.Title: Show me what you have for exchange.
I see you have a stronghold here.
Dialog.Text: Pretty good, eh? I built it myself. Almost died here... But now I have a whole second floor with private arsenal. I can kill almost everything from there.

Dialog.Title: I see. I'm gonna go.
Dialog.Text: Wait. I thought you came here to do business?

Dialog.Title: Did you walk here?
Dialog.Text: Of course I did. I was looking for a deserted place to live in...all this fuss about anomalies and experiments, never a moment's peace.

Dialog.Title: I brought empty bottles.
Dialog.Text: I hope they ain't broken. Here's your money.

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: Yeah, whatever.

Dialog.Title: I brought empty bottles.
Dialog.Text: Ain't they broken? Listen, I didn't expect you to be this quick, so I can't pay you now. Come over later.

Dialog.Title: Do not try to cheat...
Dialog.Text: Yeah, yeah. I'm scared. So... I'm saving money for some furniture for my house. As soon as I have extra money I will give them to you.

Dialog.Title: It's me. Where is the money?
Dialog.Text: Oh, it's you... So be it, take your pennies. I still have not bought the furniture, but your dime will not help anyway.

Dialog.Title: Where are my percents?
Dialog.Text: What percents?

Dialog.Title: For the delay.
Dialog.Text: I do not understand you stalker. Take the money and go.

Dialog.Title: Should I start break your furniture? |If I break your old furniture it will be easier to understand?
Dialog.Text: Wait, wait...! Take your percents.

Dialog.Title: I brought empty bottles.
Dialog.Text: They're not broken, I hope? Don't forget the money.

Dialog.Title: I brought empty bottles.
Dialog.Text: Hey, a little bird told me Dumpster didn't get any money from me. What will you say on that?

Dialog.Title: Dumpster and I made a deal...
Dialog.Text: I see...It's not my business anyway, but I'll send money with another courier. I care about my reputation. And don't you dare threaten me.

Dialog.Title: I brought empty bottles.
Dialog.Text: Give them to me. I will send money with a courier. You should wait.

Dialog.Title: And how long should I wait?
Dialog.Text: As needed. If there is a problem, solve it with Dumpster.

Dialog.Title: Hey. I got some questions to you.
Dialog.Text: Seriously?

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me about this place?
Dialog.Text: Do I look like a tour guide? Go to Novikovo or Ryabinushka villages, ask people there. You may try asking white coats, they must be somewhere in the south east slope of the volcano, they may well have something interesting to tell.

Dialog.Title: How do I get to Ryabinushka?
Dialog.Text: Ryabinushka is an abandoned place. People left it when the volcano started to awake, they just grabbed all their stuff and head for Liubech. Now stalkers use the village as a camp. One man called Fin even runs a store there, he doesn't seem to be afraid of the volcano.

Dialog.Title: What volcano?
Dialog.Text: There's a volcano nearby. Haven't you seen it yet?

Dialog.Title: How do I get to Novikovo?
Dialog.Text: Go to the east past an old base, when you get to a crossroad, you're almost there. However, I'd recommend that you go to the south after the crossroad, there're traders who buy up different stuff found in Novikovo.

Dialog.Title: Что за ученые?
Dialog.Text: Откуда я знаю? Я же не ученый! Большая группа... с транспортом... это вдоль болот-то! Прошли мимо Новиково и двинули на юго-восток. Судя по уровню подготовки, они собрались разбить полноценный лагерь где-то за вулканом. Развернут свои антенны, выставят охрану и будут пялиться в мониторы, время от времени загружая в аппараты новую грязь. Ее вокруг и под вулканом как... как грязи.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for the white.
Dialog.Text: Haven't seen 'em here in a long time. Why don't ya look for them somewhere else?

Dialog.Title: Some say they've seen you having some sort of business with the white people.
Dialog.Text: Now what? Are you gonna kill me? We will see on that. Alright, I admit I sold 'em a bottle of balsam in exchange of information about some herbs. People try to stay away from the white, you know, so it wasn't easy to come up to them. However the man I was talking to turned out to be quite reasonable and then I had that idea...to ferret out as many of their secrets as I could. So...I figured out they were gonna "clean up their souls" in the throat of the volcano. In other words, they're gonna burn themselves. Freaks.

Dialog.Title: Wasn't there a pilot with 'em?
Dialog.Text: Don't think so. Why should they take a prisoner along? But since you're looking for him, I think you have the right to know...The man I was talking to left a note for their mentor...

Dialog.Title: Where is it?
Dialog.Text: I don't have it, didn't even read it. I digged a hole to make a fire on my way back and was just about to burn the note down when boars scared me away. I think it's still somewhere there, in square Д2...

Dialog.Title: Where's the note from the white?
I want to try that "famous" "Badluck" potion.
Dialog.Text: Hey, do you think I called it "badluck" for nothing? I was going to sell it, but they guys that tried it literally lost their minds...all they wanted was just to relax, but they got lost in the Wanderland instead. People after lobotomy look more alive and sensible than they did. So, I don't make it anymore...moreover, those armed guys were very convincing, asking me to wrap it up.

Dialog.Title: Listen, this potion can save someone's life!
Dialog.Text: Bullshit! Okay, I'm not gonna question you. You want the 'badluck', no problem! I will make it but with a condition that you collect all the ingredients yourself. I'll write it all down for you.

Dialog.Title: Fair enough, deal.
Dialog.Text: Here's the list. Get back when you collect all.

Dialog.Title: I'll be right back.
Dialog.Text: Try not to get stuck in mud.

Dialog.Title: It's me, I brought you the ingredients you asked for.
Dialog.Text: Experience doesn't teach you anything! You stalkers are all the same. Here, take the 'badluk". Just want you to know, drink it up, quickly and at a gulp. Good luck to you, psychonaut.

Dialog.Title: Понял, благодарствую!
Dialog.Text: Да за отраву не благодари, сталкер. Не надо.

Dialog.Title: Hey! Do you know any riddles?
Dialog.Text: A riddle? Is that really what brought you here? You're full of surprises, man. I do have a riddle for ya, but so something for me first.

Dialog.Title: Whatever you need.
Dialog.Text: Here's a list if ingredients I need: 5 tansy flowers and 10 bracket funguses. I'm about to make a nice decoction.

Dialog.Title: Just wait for me here.
Dialog.Text: Good luck.

Dialog.Title: I brought the ingredients.
Dialog.Text: Appreciate your help, stalker. Here's some cash for ya and this is a riddle: "While I don't walk, swim or fly. Before I fade I still wander. I shed tears even if I don't cry, But what am I? That I wonder."

Dialog.Title: Thanks, Timoha.
Dialog.Text: You're welcome.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
...What? ...Who? ...Where?

Dialog.Title: How's it going?
Dialog.Text: How?...hic...All I need is a one teeny tiny drop of water of life..hic..Oh man...

Dialog.Title: How long have you been here?
Dialog.Text: What? Where? Oh... My head... I want to dine. I see we have guests today... What a crowd! But we have no food... I eat only swill here... And it burns me from inside... Burns me to ashes... m... um...

Dialog.Title: I brought something to eat.
Dialog.Text: Food! Wonder... ful... What are you drinkin'?

Dialog.Title: How are you doing here?
Dialog.Text: Can't be bet..ter. Like in Paradise. Had a drink in the morning...great all day long. They won't take me alive! DO YOU HEAR ME, huh?..Hey, do you wanna a bet?

Dialog.Title: What bet?
Dialog.Text: This morning...I shot 20 freaking monstrous dogs. I bet you can't beat my record.

Dialog.Title: I don't wanna compete with a drunk.
Dialog.Text: Why so rude...man? I'm not ...hick..drunk.

Dialog.Title: Twenty one.
Dialog.Text: Wow...That's fast! I've just filled the glasses..Pick one..

Dialog.Title: How many did you shoot today?
Dialog.Text: Whew...22! and I cut off each one's head. Ani't it imressive? I could do even better ...hick...drunk. I bet you can't beat my record.

Dialog.Title: Wait. I'll be back with the heads.
Dialog.Text: Are you telling me you'll kill 23? You have to cut off 23 heads, then! I will count 'em myself.

Dialog.Title: This is impossible.|You have removed every dead dog's head intact? It's impossible.
Dialog.Text: Ha! It's a two-drinks case to me.

Dialog.Title: How will you understand which are mine?
Dialog.Text: That's easy. I remember how your steps and shots sound like.

Dialog.Title: Twenty three.
Dialog.Text: Hmm... You're kidding me, right?..You must be a pro too.

Dialog.Title: It seems so.
Dialog.Text: Stop pulling my leg!

Dialog.Title: It's me.
Dialog.Text: Oh, that's you. Hey, I'm..so to speak..into engineering, so if you need anything to get fixed, come over, I'll see what I can do.

Dialog.Title: Fix the current equipment.
Dialog.Text: No problem! I'll fix it for %COMPLEX_COST%.

Dialog.Title: That's too much.
Dialog.Text: Come on! Do you think you're gonna find cheaper service?

Dialog.Title: What's up?
Dialog.Text: Damn it!There's nobody to drink with!

Dialog.Title: Maybe it's time to quit drinking?
Dialog.Text: Maybe you're right...but again...I think I can't do that alone.

Dialog.Title: Valera has stashed drinking too.
Dialog.Text: Well..I don't know...

Dialog.Title: We'll see...
Dialog.Text: Yup...

Dialog.Title: Bljdad has stashed drinking.
Dialog.Text: Wow. I think I need to get sober too. Bljdad...who could have known!

Dialog.Title: Changed your mind?
Dialog.Text: Nope! Ahhahahahaha!

Dialog.Title: What did you decide?
Dialog.Text: One sober thought has just crossed my mind...I think I'm gonna sign off drinking too.

Dialog.Title: Great.
Dialog.Text: Thank you...I don't have any money, but here's my jacket, take it. It served me well.

Dialog.Title: Hang-over, huh?
Dialog.Text: I'm tryin' to hang in. Man, my head's just killin' me....I'm thinkin' about getting back home, I left my son there. The problem is I don't know how to get out..

Dialog.Title: Cheer up!
Dialog.Text: I screwed up, stalker. I thought my son was..dead. I was almost lost with all that drinking, you know. I was delusioned. But my son is just alright, he's at home. And I got stuck here...damn Zone.

Dialog.Title: I'm kinda busy right now. We'll talk later.
How did you end up here?
Dialog.Text: I started working at the station long before the Zone appeared. When the perimeter was decided to be build up, people were evacuated...it was such a mess, so I just lost my son in the crowd. When I found myself outside the perimeter, the gates were already closed and I thought my son was left inside.

Dialog.Title: But everything happened to be well, right?
Dialog.Text: Well...I prayed to God to bring my son back to me.The very next day my son did come back. It turned out he'd managed to leave the Zone like I did, but he was taken to the control point and came right back to me the next morning. It was when I realized our God is no more than a crook.

Dialog.Title: Why?
Dialog.Text: I have faith, stalker. But I know the return of my son wasn't a miracle or something. When I was thinking he was locked inside the Zone.. I prayed a lot, asking God to get him back. I became really devotional...Even when I knew my son had been alright, those thoughts just kept possessing my mind.

Dialog.Title: So what did you do then?
Dialog.Text: I decided to stay in the Zone. I came here on my own and got back to the station. I wanted to see if I could help people who were trying to handle their lives here.

Dialog.Title: I know a person that can help you.
Dialog.Text: Who's that?

Dialog.Title: The Priest still believes, he doesn't lose faith.
Dialog.Text: I just realized...God led my way here so that I could become a real protector. Now I know. I'm gonna fix the station, I'm gonna chase the mutants away...this place is my new home, these people are my new family.

Dialog.Title: The Swampman advices you to relax and go with the flow.
Dialog.Text: yea...I think he's right. That's the Zone, for God's sake! And I'll find the way outof here...it's just a matter of time. I'll get back home..to my son. But firts I'm gonna find something really unique, my own miracle...if you know what I mean.

Dialog.Title: The White want us to be as one with the Zone.
Dialog.Text: Are you nuts? I am sober now and I know the white people are just crazy freaks! They eat mutant flesh and burn people alive! I thought you could help me out, man, but you're just one of those insane "missionaries". No offense, man, but I'm not gonna buy that, so you'd better get the hell out of here.

Dialog.Title: The Prophet says we're all gonna die.
Dialog.Text: Are you sure that Prophet guy is not stoned? There're lots of ways, you know, booze, shrooms, weed....With all my respect, man...Why did you help me sober up if you're wasting my time now? I want to do something really significant and I have no time talking to you about stupid prophecies and stuff.

Dialog.Title: How are you?
Dialog.Text: Well..you know, it scares the hell out of me to fight the mutants being all that sober...I don't get how you do that. I used to be very lucky, that's the only reason they never got me....I don't have neither good armor nor a weapon..I wish I still had my TOZ-34, there're still some rounds left and I'd be very happy to get the Screen α art, it'll be just what is needed.

Dialog.Title: Sorry, but can't help you with anything.
I will help you get the shotgun and the artifact.
About the stuff you were looking for...
Dialog.Text: Did you find anything?

Dialog.Title: I brought everything you asked for.
Dialog.Text: Is it all for me? Really? Didn't expect...Sorry...It just so touchy...Listen, I saved some bottles...for a rainy day, you know. Take 'em all. You can sell 'em to someone. Know what? you reminded me one guy...he was quite a sniper, could shoor a fly with his barrett. To ne honest, at first, I thought you were him, but now I recall he must be way older than you.

Dialog.Title: Hey! Do you know any riddles?
Dialog.Text: Right out of the gate! Riddles, huh? Even if I know, I'd like to get something in return.

Dialog.Title: Spit it out.
Dialog.Text: I need something to maintain the station. So that would be...5 repair kits and 5 bottles of acetone. Get me all this and I'll pose you a riddle.

Dialog.Title: Deal. Just wait for me here.
Dialog.Text: Good deal.

Dialog.Title: I brought everything you needed.
Dialog.Text: Well done. Here's your riddle as a reward "What brings us letters from the sky?". That's an easy one, I think. Ok, I'm gonna get back to work.

Dialog.Title: Thanks. Good bye.
Dialog.Text: Take care.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: There's a part for you in a stage play!
Dialog.Text: Wait, what? In the theater? Why?

Dialog.Title: To commemorate the Victory Day.
Dialog.Text: You should have begun with this! In the interest of the cause I'll go on stage. I used to play in the school...But I can't go up there in this state...I'm gonna scare people away.

Dialog.Title: Energy drink will key you up!
I brought the drink.
Dialog.Text: Let me drink it down.

Dialog.Title: What's up? How is it like to lead a healthy life?
Dialog.Text: Hey, this ain't funny, stalker. I bet you make laugh at me behind my back!

Dialog.Title: I don't. I worry about you.
Dialog.Text: Well, healthy life is a good thing...but I can't help feeling there's something that I'm missing...Anyway, there's something I want you to do.

Dialog.Title: I'll be glad to be helpful.
Dialog.Text: Во-во. Это хорошо, это ладно. Тогда будь другом: сгоняй к моим бывшим.. э-э.. "товарищам по несчастью", ты знаешь о ком я. Короче, мы как-то давно уговаривались в картишки при случае перекинуться. Скажешь им: мол, так и так - Мастер просил пожаловать в ближайшую пятницу на дружескую партию в карты на нейтральной территории. Они поймут. Лады?

Dialog.Title: I invited friends to the game.
Dialog.Text: Thank you stalker. Now I'm going to have fun..finally. That's not really amusing to shoot dogs when you're sober.

Dialog.Title: They wanted to know if it's gonna be bridge or poker.
Dialog.Text: Oh man, I blew my own memory on booze...

Dialog.Title: Is anything wrong?
Dialog.Text: Well, the name of the game is a code word...for the place where they have to go. By the way, what day is today?

Dialog.Title: ...I don't really know.
Dialog.Text: I screwed that! I am one big fat fool...Anyway, take this, you deserved.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
You can change your stuff for mine. This is barter, bro. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Senya Spagetti sent me.
Dialog.Text: He has a new delivery boy, huh? Show me what you got there.

Dialog.Title: Here you go.
Dialog.Text: That's the stuff. Here, take this for Senya and this pack of cigarettes is for you, my treat. You can exchange 'em on something else if you want to, Senya loves these cigarettes.

Dialog.Title: I saw Bugor and he said to say hi.
Dialog.Text: So that was Bugor who sent you...If so, you're worth helping, I guess. He asked you to get the "Scorpion", I should let you know it's very rare and expensive.

Dialog.Title: I understand that. How much do you want for that?
Dialog.Text: It's not just about money, you know. Freedom is what my people are seeking for. Now it's possible only in return for vouchers. But where are we gonna get those?

Dialog.Title: What can I do to help?
Dialog.Text: You get me 200 vouchers, I get you teh Scorpion. But I gotta warn you, the Scorpion is extremely rare, so it might take me a while to find it. If I don't manage to get it soon, I'll pay you with 7.62х54 rounds. So what do you say?

Dialog.Title: I've got to think about it.
I brought the vouchers.
Dialog.Text: Great. Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: Here you are.
Dialog.Text: Listen..could you get more vouchers?

Dialog.Title: OK. I'll get you more.
Dialog.Text: That's the deal.

Dialog.Title: I don't think so.
Dialog.Text: Up to you. Good bye, then.
I can stash your stuff for a while. I think you have some cool things to stash. Don't be afraid, it will be safe.
Look at you, man! You alright?

Dialog.Title: Where am I? What happened?
Dialog.Text: You're alive, man. That's the most important. Others weren't that lucky. Do you remember anything? Where were the trucks heading for?

Dialog.Title: Do you know a cause of the truck wreck?
Dialog.Text: ...Uh... Good question... And a good food for thought. I told you, it was "bang!" Maybe a sabotage? I think, something hit the bridge... Listen, if you're all right, can you ask the people if anyone needs help?

Dialog.Title: What about you?
Dialog.Text: Me? No I'm good thanks. I'm not from your truck, I would just scare them. I see a soldier who was riding on your truck, he may arrest me for nothing... The station is nearby. At the station, there is a repairmen and a doctor... If something happens, you can call them. They probably already know about the crash. The entire region must know... The "bang" was loud enough.

Dialog.Title: I need to go now...
Dialog.Text: That's right! The perimeter security probably already know about the train wreck. Very soon there will be more soldiers than trees in the forest turning up here!

Dialog.Title: Thanks man.
Dialog.Text: Not at all. Oh, yea, almost forgot. If you're hungry, buy something at the station. Go! I'll wait stay here.

Dialog.Title: To Liubech.
Dialog.Text: I see... The military go there almost every day. You're not one of them, am I right? You look more like a tourist. Listen, there is one more survived, a soldier sitting over the fire. Talk to him carefully, he doesn't seem very friendly. Then get to the station. It's not far from here. The sentry will help you.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Stay away!

Dialog.Title: What happened?
Dialog.Text: You were on that truck too, right? Listen, man...It's not my fault, OK? I didn't ask what was on the truck, you never ask questions when you're given orders. Only when the accident happened I realize our cargo was people. Don't ask me why we had to deliver people to the Zone. I've no idea! I..I wish I could just forget all that shit.

Dialog.Title: Where are other soldiers?
Dialog.Text: Don't know! When I came round nobody was alive. All I know that my people would have never left me here. I'll wait for them...They'll come back I'm sure...

Dialog.Title: But WHAT happened to the truck?
Dialog.Text: I said I don't know! What else do you want me to say? Piss off, man! Listen, I'm sure you need a weapon, right? So take one from the box behind me and shut up!

Dialog.Title: Where were you taking those people?
I'm leaving...
Dialog.Text: Get away!

Dialog.Title: I got a weapon.
Dialog.Text: Don't come near me!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Are you a station watchman?
Dialog.Text: Yes, that's me if you call this place "station". We've had too many problems recently. Trains here are more uncommon, that troubles... First, something happened to the convoy, then a train got stuck in an anomaly. And now mutants are all over this place!

Dialog.Title: Mutants?
Dialog.Text: Mutant rats. As big as cats. Fear of nothing and even attacks people. I need someone to help me to mess with them.

Dialog.Title: I got questions about the accident.
Dialog.Text: Speak up, man. Do it quickly, have no time for small talks.

Dialog.Title: What happened to the convoy?
Dialog.Text: I saw a bright flash then heard a terrible rumble. When I went out I saw a real mess. Fire, smoke, people screaming and bustling.

Dialog.Title: Where were people going?
Dialog.Text: There's only one road and it leads to Lyubech, don't ya know? Tracks deliver food, equipment and medications there almost every day. But what really surprises me is that the track was transporting civilians. That's weird.

Dialog.Title: Did anyone survive?
Dialog.Text: Sure...but most of people died. Not everybody are that lucky.

Dialog.Title: I'm wounded, need help.
Dialog.Text: The doctor near here. Can you walk to him by yourself? You certainly look like you can. Don't bother me with your scratches! You're not the only one who is wounded...

Dialog.Title: I killed the rats.
Dialog.Text: You did? Appreciate that. To be honest, I didn't expect that you'd cope with it. No offence. Thanks again, here take it, I think it will help you.

Dialog.Title: I have some questions about the Zone.
Dialog.Text: Ask away.

Dialog.Title: Why should I go to Liubech?
Dialog.Text: Because all roads lead to Liubech. If you wanna make a fortune or get a job, If you need food, weapon or artifacts, if you wanna get out of here. Just go to Liubech.

Dialog.Title: What is the Zone?
Dialog.Text: Don't you know yourself? Well... It's not easy to answer that. If in short, the Zone is both amazing and dangerous. It's an odd and mysterious place you wouldn't like to mess with. If you wanna learn more specific information, ask stalkers. You'll meet lots of 'em in Liubech.

Dialog.Title: How do I get out of the Zone?
Dialog.Text: The sounth tunnel is blocked so you can't take a train, it bumpted into an anomaly and got stuck. You may try walking through the wood, but I woudn't recommend that you do it alone. Anyway, you need a guide who'll show you the safest route. The best choice now is to head for Liubech.

Dialog.Title: May I stay here?
Dialog.Text: Do you really think it's a good idea? The accident created kind of a scandal. The military will soon be here. It's a bad sign, man. Do you wanna be questioned? That's not very likely. I don't wanna have troubles eitther.

Dialog.Title: But I did no wrong...
Dialog.Text: Nobody cares, man. How did you get here? Do you have a permission to be here? No? I knew it. It's illegal so the military will either arrest you or just get rid of you, believe me.

Dialog.Title: Where I can find Charon?
Dialog.Text: Charon is living in the hut, near the north tunnel. Find the marsh. You won't miss it. Do not step into the water. Some years ago we wouldn't go to the hut and call him from the shore -- Charon used to come out himself. But he is cloth-eared now, therefore the shout is useless.

Dialog.Title: Charon is dead.
Dialog.Text: Dead? You got to be kidding me, man! Are you sure? Such a nice fella he was... Okay, look ... Find Mischa at the northern tunnel, tell him what happened to the owner of the draizine and ask him to take you to Ljubech. Do not linger here any longer than necessary. When you reach the place, find Blacksmith and Kolya Acid. They'll help you with everything.

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: Not at all. By the way, talk to local people here before leaving. They may give your a job or may be someone needs help, and people can help you in return.

Dialog.Title: I'll go talk with him.
Dialog.Text: Good luck!

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: Listen ... Find old Charon. His shack in the swamp is not far from the northern tunnel. He will help you reach Liubech, forest-walking to there are dangerous, and he had a draizine

Dialog.Title: Remind, who can help me?
Dialog.Text: Charon the gaffer. He will help you get to Lubech on a handcar. It was possible to reach the city on foot, but now, with all these mutants and anomalies, I would not recommend to walk alone. Of course, you can stay here. But someone will come for this truck. Believe me, you don't want to meet the military.

Dialog.Title: I have questions...
Dialog.Text: No time to twaddle. Rat mutants are near. We need to banish beasts until they became even more...

Dialog.Title: Thanks...
Dialog.Text: Пожалуйста! Обращайся, если будут вопросы.

Dialog.Title: My pleasure...
Dialog.Text: Listen my advice, find Charon the gaffer. He will help you get to Lubech on a handcar. It was possible to reach the city on foot, but now, with all these mutants and anomalies, I would not recommend to walk alone. Of course, you can stay here. But someone will come for this truck. Believe me, you don't want to meet the military.

Dialog.Title: Where I can find Charon?
Dialog.Text: Charon is living in the hut, near the north tunnel. Find the marsh. You won't miss it. Do not step into the water. Some years ago we wouldn't go to the hut and call him from the shore -- Charon used to come out himself. But he is cloth-eared now, therefore the shout is useless.

Dialog.Title: I visited him already. He's dead.
Dialog.Text: Dead? You got to be kidding me, man! Are you sure? Such a nice fella he was... Okay, look ... Find Mischa at the northern tunnel, tell him what happened to the owner of the draizine and ask him to take you to Ljubech. Do not linger here any longer than necessary. When you reach the place, find Blacksmith and Kolya Acid. They'll help you with everything.

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: It's not for your sake, it's for me and my men. You've brought big problems here. And I try to minimize all collateral damage.

Dialog.Title: You said someting about a train...
Dialog.Text: The military used the train to deliver supplies to Liubech. Usual routine had it been until recently. See that flame in front of the train? That's an anomaly, appeared from nowhere and damaged our roadway. You'd better stay away from it!

Dialog.Title: Where I can find some food?
Dialog.Text: You can always buy food for money, if you have money, at other cases - hunting is our everything!

Dialog.Title: Hunting?
Dialog.Text: From the bodies of dead animals can get meat, but I'll suggest you to cook it before eating.

Dialog.Title: It's interesting.
Dialog.Text: Of course! By the way, people said that in the Б2-3 square mutant-dogs have found. Gnawed a hole in the fence somewhere and passing through it now. If you'll shoot some of them - come back to me, I'll help you with the supplies.

Dialog.Title: Я подумаю
Dialog.Text: Ну, подумай.

Dialog.Title: OK. I''ll bring some
Dialog.Text: Still waiting for meat!

Dialog.Title: I brought you the meat.
Dialog.Text: Wow, I didn't expect you'd be so good at hunting. Thanks, man! Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: Thank you.
Dialog.Text: You're welcome.

Dialog.Title: Я принесу мясо
Dialog.Text: Отлично! Только ты помни, что здесь не какие-то дворовые шавки, а мутанты! Чуть зазеваешься и порвут, как Тузик грелку! Аккуратней там!

Dialog.Title: OK. I'll get you some meat.
Dialog.Text: Deal! Remember, they're mutants, vicious creatures! Take your eye off them and you're dead! Stay sharp!

Dialog.Title: How do I collect artifacts?
Dialog.Text: I see you haven't been wasting your time here. You're a newbie but ready to search for artifacts, incredible! Soon you're gonna be a skilled stalker. Artifacts are spawned in anomalies and can be found inside them. Remember to be very careful! Try to approach an anomaly, but not too close, look closely right at its center. If you see an object in the very middle, that'll be an artifact. For you to know, not all anomalies are visible. To spot one, throw something in front of you. An invisible anomaly will immediately react and reveal itself.

Dialog.Title: How to pull an artifact out of an anomaly?
Dialog.Text: That's the hardest challenge! You need to run through an anomaly as fast as you can and manage to grab an atrifact. Don't hesitate! Don't forget to stock up with meds before you even try to approach an anomaly. And there's one more thing. It's not enough just to get an artifact, it's also crucial to keep it right. The thing is, artifacts out of anomalies tend to lose their properties. An artifact will soon turn to a stone without the proper upkeep.

Dialog.Title: So what should I do?
Dialog.Text: Use special containers to transport arts. They were made by scientists and now are widely used among stalkers as they learned to craft such containers themselves.To craft one, you'll need to learn the recipe. Also, a container cannot be used without a special stabilizer. as long as a stabilizer is inside, a container can be used.

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: Almost forgot...You'll be able to craft a container only for keeping one artifact. To craft a bigger one, you'll need special tools that only scientists have access to. If you know right people, you can get a big container.

Dialog.Title: Anything else?
Dialog.Text: I can help you, If you wanna try to get an artifact right now.There're anomalies not far from this place, in square A2-2. I can give you an empty container. But a favor for a favor! I'm giving you a container and you bring me an artifact you'll find in return. Practice for you, artifact for me. Deal?

Dialog.Title: Согласен
Dialog.Text: Отлично. Держи контейнер.

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: Here's a container. And take this med kit, I'm sure you'll need. Remember, you're looking for anomalies to the right of the train! They look like green mist.

Dialog.Title: I found an artifact.
Dialog.Text: Well done! Keep the container as a gift from me.

Dialog.Title: Any news?
Dialog.Text: News? Every minute something new happens here. Observe the Notice board, you'll find the latest news there.

Dialog.Title: What Notice board?
Dialog.Text: Smart stalkers placed notice boards at all strategic points of the Zone. They're quite useful, I use 'em myself all the time. There's information about trading and earning money and also you can place an ad yourself. For example, offering an award on someone's head.

Dialog.Title: Whose head?
Dialog.Text: Just imagine...let's say, someone shot you and injured, what would you do? Returning the "favor" is a way to bad reputation. So what to do, then? Go to a Notice Board and place an ad with a name of the "bad guy" and the price for his head. Then, I'm telling you, he'll be punished for what he's done. You'll find such ads in "Hunting" section. By the way, you may try to "hunt" yourself, it's a good way to make money.

Dialog.Title: I'll keep that in mind.
Dialog.Text: There're also other sections.. If you need to buy or sell anything, just check "Trade" section. Find an item you wanna buy, pay for it and then just go to the Storage where the item is located and get it from there. Storages are places where stalkers keep their stuff. If you wanna sell an item, just offer it for sale in one of the Storages. Information about it will automatically appear on Notice Boards. When the item is sold, you take money from the same Storage you put the item in.

Dialog.Title: Convenient.
Dialog.Text: You bet! In fact, stalkers also placed a map of the Zone on each Notice Board. So take your time studing the one that's here, on the platform.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I have no intention to talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Where I can get some water?
Dialog.Text: The easiest way - to buy bottled water from the traders. Experienced stalkers often use sets of flasks and bowler that allow to draw water and boil, and if you're lucky - you'll find something like that. In the meantime, here you go.

Dialog.Title: What do you said about Charon?
Dialog.Text: Find old Charon. He will help you reach Liubech on the draizine. Previously, you could safely walk on foot by your own, but with the emergence of mutants and anomalies in the area, I would not recommend walking, especially alone.

Dialog.Title: Что ты говорил про Харона?
Dialog.Text: Найди старика Харона. Его хибара на болоте находится, недалеко от северного тоннеля. Он поможет тебе добраться до Любеча на дрезине. Раньше можно было спокойно дойти своим ходом, но с учетом появления мутантов и аномалий в окрестностях, я бы не рекомендовал ходить пешком, тем более в одиночку.

Dialog.Title: Что ты говорил про Харона?
Dialog.Text: Найди старика Харона. Его хибара на болоте находится, недалеко от северного тоннеля. Он поможет тебе добраться до Любеча на дрезине. Раньше можно было спокойно дойти своим ходом, но с учетом появления мутантов и аномалий в окрестностях, я бы не рекомендовал ходить пешком, тем более в одиночку.

Dialog.Title: Что ты говорил про Харона?
Dialog.Text: Найди старика Харона. Его хибара на болоте находится, недалеко от северного тоннеля. Он поможет тебе добраться до Любеча на дрезине. Раньше можно было спокойно дойти своим ходом, но с учетом появления мутантов и аномалий в окрестностях, я бы не рекомендовал ходить пешком, тем более в одиночку.

Dialog.Title: А где живет Харон?
Dialog.Text: Его хибара на болоте находится, недалеко от северного тоннеля.

Dialog.Title: How do I cook the meat?
Dialog.Text: It is the most affordable way to make a fireplace and fry the meat on it as it should.

Dialog.Title: Make a fireplace?
Dialog.Text: Yes of course. You will need wood, it is not hard to find here, and matches. They are sold by traders or found as loot. (Press the "P", to show the Crafting window) (Select the desired item from the drop-down list at the top of the window. Drag the needed for assemble items to the cell on the right, OR check the "Autofill" box, then re-select a recipe from the drop-down list and it automatically find needed items. If you have the necessary amount of resources, after clicking the "Apply" the object will be crafted)

Dialog.Title: Where do I find them?
Dialog.Text:
On the southwest from the station, in the center of the squares А2-2 and Б1-3. (Map of the area can be opened by pressing the "M")
Write down this coordinates, if you may forget them somehow. (All tasks and their progress are displayed in the Quest Journal, you can open it by pressing "J")

Dialog.Title: Sorry, can't help you with that.
Remind me, where do I find mutant-rats?
I'm armed.
Dialog.Text: Excellent! Help me, I will not stay in debt.

Dialog.Title: Who do I need to find, and where?
Dialog.Text:
Just give me a break, better to write down it somewhere... Again, you need to find Misha Kochegarova at the northern tunnel, walk along the railway under the bridge, and you will find the northern tunnel.
Write down this, if you may forget that somehow. (All tasks and their progress are displayed in the Quest Journal, you can open it by pressing "J")

Dialog.Title: I would have help you, but I have no gun.
Dialog.Text: Hmm ... Well, you can ask peoples at the station, may be they help you with that, also, stalker Seriy recently lost his friend somewhere and curses the mutants, you speak to him or may look for the his friend's corpe, probably a stalker was in possession of some weapon.
Heavy military crate, fell out from the truck.

Dialog.Title: Search the crate again.
Dialog.Text: The crate is empty.

Dialog.Title: Search the crate...
Dialog.Text: There was a gun with an ammi in the crate.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Leave the crate.
Dialog.Text: There was a gun in the crate.

Dialog.Title: (ящик осмотрен не был)
Dialog.Text: Тяжелый военный ящик, выпавший из грузовика.

Dialog.Title: (ящик уже был осмотрен)
Dialog.Text: Ящик пуст.

Dialog.Title: Search the crate.
Dialog.Text: There was an ammo in the crate.
Dead body turned stiff.

Dialog.Title: Inspect.
Dialog.Text: It must be Charon's body. But what happened to the poor man? There're no signs of violent death...even if they'd been, they must have been destroyed. Charon was an old man...he might have had a strike or something like that. I have to tell Sation Watchman what I found.

Dialog.Title: Inspect the corpse.
Dialog.Text: There are visible traces on the neck... Looks like long and thin fingers. The man died in his sleep from asphyxiation. And then the body were pulled down from the sofa to the floor, where it was gobbled by the rats...

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
What do you need?

Dialog.Title: You're buying rat tails?
Dialog.Text: Maybe. You have some?

Dialog.Title: No.
Dialog.Text: So why you ask? Do you know what happens with stalkers, who ask stupid questions?

Dialog.Title: I have some.
Dialog.Text: Let me see... It looks fine to me.

Dialog.Title: Need more tails?
Dialog.Text: Yes. But if I was you, I would run as far away as I could. Give me the tail and naff off.

Dialog.Title: Why do you buy tails?
Dialog.Text: I eat them Kidding... Newbie?

Dialog.Title: How did you know?
Dialog.Text: You ask stupid questions. If you arrived on the truck, which burns nearby, I don't envy you. You've got out of the frying pan, but right into the f... I mean "into the fire". Not a good time to jump over perimeter fence.

Dialog.Title: Why?
Dialog.Text: Mutants almost reached the perimeter. And on the other hand -- there is always someone who sneaks into the Zone. The military is getting nervous. It will all end badly. Here is a good piece of advice: don't stay here more than you need.

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: Don't thank me. The soldiers will interrogate the locals, scour tunnels and spoil my trade. I could hand you over to them, for a fee, but we don't screw newbies. On the other hand...

Dialog.Title: You need it?
Dialog.Text: Yes, I'll buy.

Dialog.Title: What?
Dialog.Text: ...Some dude came here yesterday. He didn't barter with me, but talk to my neighbor about some ammunition. I saw his backpack. There was an art-safe, a container for safely storing artefact. He probably was a courier or a transporter and was going to ferry some goods across the border... I will hand him over for sure.

Dialog.Title: I'm leaving now.
Dialog.Text: Wait. I saw you go to the hut, in the swamp.

Dialog.Title: So what?
Dialog.Text: You saw bald rats or brownies there? Let me put it straight. Do you have a rat tail? Bald rat tail? I can buy it.

Dialog.Title: I haven't, but I can get it.
I found the tail.
Dialog.Text: Let me see... It looks fine to me.

Dialog.Title: No and I don't have time.
Take it.
Dialog.Text: Good. Here is your money.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Is it your draisine?
Dialog.Text: Nope. It's Charon's. He lives in a small hut on the swamps. I'm just covering him while he's busy. I can't give you a ride without station watchman's permission. Talk to him first.

Dialog.Title: Who is Charon?
Dialog.Text: Local hermit. Talk to the station sentry. He and Charon are some kind of buddies. Often divide profits together.

Dialog.Title: Charon is dead.
Dialog.Text: Damn... Mutants gobbled him too? Damn these shit-rats... Listen, if you need the handcar, you should talk to the station sentry. If he allows you to rent it, I won't mind.

Dialog.Title: The station watchman said I could use the draisine.
Dialog.Text: Hmmm...It would be just fine if stalkers hadn't come across an anomaly right behind the tunnel. You wouldn't want to get into it, believe me. I see you're armed, so there's another way to Liubech, through the woods.

Dialog.Title: Yes. Let's get going!
Dialog.Text: I warned you anyway.

Dialog.Title: Charon is dead.
Dialog.Text: Dead!? Oh... what a losss...poor fellow...couldn't protect himself...we're all doomed, I'm telling you. Listen, if what you need is a draisine, talk to the station watchman. If he allows you too use it, I won''t mind.

Dialog.Title: Through the woods?
Dialog.Text: Well, yeah. There're more than just one road to Liubech. I would lead you there, but in that case I'm gonna need your favor.

Dialog.Title: What favor?
Dialog.Text: I want you to get my knife back. The thing is I gambled it to Charon a long time ago...yeah, I know it was stupid, but I thought I'd win...Anyway, go to Charon's, search the place I think the knife might be in his stash ... he doesn't need it anymore anyway.You get me the knife and I'll take you to Liubech for free.

Dialog.Title: Here is your knife.
Dialog.Text: Wow! Thanks, man! If you've found anything else - just keep it for yourself. So, what way did you choose, through the woods or on the draisine?

Dialog.Title: Anytime.
Dialog.Text: Now I'm ready to show you the way. Do you still wanna go to Liubech?

Dialog.Title: Not now.
Dialog.Text: Got it. Let me know when you're ready.

Dialog.Title: Lets go through the woods.
Dialog.Text: Are you ready?

Dialog.Title: Charon is dead.
Dialog.Text: Dead?! What a loss...Our days are numbered, I'm telling you. Pour fellow...Listen, you need the draisine, right? Ask the watchman at the station. If he allows you to use it, I'll give you a ride.

Dialog.Title: May we talk?
Dialog.Text: Sorry, man. I don't talk to strangers.

Dialog.Title: Let's go to Luibech on railway.
Let's use the draisine.
Dialog.Text: I did warn you. Are you sure you want it?

Dialog.Title: No. I need time to think.
Поехали на дрезине!
Dialog.Text: Ух, врешь ты, по лицу вижу. Придал бы тебе ускорение, да дрезину жалко - кто-то обратно на ней ехать должен... Поедешь уже? Без ножа я тебя лесом не поведу.

Dialog.Title: Э-э.. Ты меня обманул что ли?
Dialog.Text: Ну, не то чтобы обманул... Но видишь ли, это такая развалюха... А на путях аномалии. Нет, я не рискну на ней ехать и тебя не повезу - еще и тебя подставлять. Это не по мне. Извини.

Dialog.Title: Ну, что делать... Пошли через лес.
А нож?
Dialog.Text: Уж лучше идти по лесу без ножа, чем в аномалию прыгать...
I can buy stuff only from the base owners.

Dialog.Title: Why?
Dialog.Text: I've made a good deal. I trade only with locals and they give me some funds.

Dialog.Title: Who gives you the funds?
Dialog.Text: I don't know. And don't want to.

Dialog.Title: I'm local. I want to sell you something.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
You with us? I can watch your valuables if you need.

Dialog.Title: I need to store some items.

Dialog.Text: Вожу по Зоне безопасными тропами. Своих. За деньги. Куда пойдем?

Dialog.Title: Никуда...
Dialog.Text: Чужой или денег нет? Или передумал? Не важно... Не стой, тут не очередь.

Dialog.Title: Почему не бесплатно?
Dialog.Text: Кушать хочется. Скажи "спасибо", что чужих не вожу.

Dialog.Title: Любеч...
Dialog.Text: Могу провести к ДК, к Гурману или на болото. Расценки смотри. Цены честные. Идем?

Dialog.Title: Vesuvius and New Land.
Dialog.Text: I can guide you to scientists' camp or radio tower on Vesuvius and to the lighthouse on New Land. Have a look at prices. Everything's fair. So, let's go?

Dialog.Title: To the lighthouse on New Land, 400 000...
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Вожу по Зоне безопасными тропами. Своих. За еду и за деньги. Куда пойдем?

Dialog.Title: Никуда...
Dialog.Text: Чужой, без денег, без еды или передумал идти? Не важно... Не стой, не распугивай клиентов.

Dialog.Title: Почему не бесплатно?
