Dialog.Text: Well..it's up to you. But don't turn to me for help.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Are you not scared to sit here almost all alone?
Dialog.Text: I am and there's nothing surprising in that. Do you know that there's a huge mutated bear right in the next square B4-1? And it's not only the bear, there're also lots of that damn dogs. As for us..we can't afford a decent guard, unless...you help clear the area of those mutated creatures. Dogs, rats will be more than enough, I don't dare asking you to kill the bear. If you agree to do that for us, could you also get here some of their parts? Such as tails, jaws..

Dialog.Title: Alright, I'll take care of that.
Dialog.Text: Thank you a lot. That's more than enough.

Dialog.Title: That's right.
Dialog.Text: Let me see what you've got there.

Dialog.Title: I brought you the trophies.
Dialog.Text: You're quick.

Dialog.Title: I scared the mutants away.
Dialog.Text: Here's your rewar, then. Come over again, there's always some job for you.

Dialog.Title: We'll see.
Dialog.Text: Take care.

Dialog.Title: You still here?
Dialog.Text: Listen, let's forget about that. Just pretend nothing has happened. Anyway, can I count on your help?

Dialog.Title: Say what help you need from me.
Dialog.Text: I want you to steal one thing from the "Aegis" camp on the Vesuvius.

Dialog.Title: Alright, but only if you pay me for that.
Dialog.Text: Don't worry, I'll pay you well. I know where the scientists keep all the samples, but I think you'll figure it out yourself. So, you'll be looking for an ampulle with ashes. There will be a sticker on it saying "Mark 17".

Dialog.Title: I found "Mark 17".
Dialog.Text: Hey, not so loud! You did help me out and this is your reward. Now you must forget everything that we talked about.

Sherstnov's notes: "... Examinee №1031 - mind damaged. Heavy psycological issues. Status: Dead. Reason: smashed his head with the armed glass..........Examinee №1032. He took the medicine M good. But the medicine N caused a lethal allergical reaction. Status: dead. Cause: lacerated heart.......Examinee №1033 - heavy muscle acitvity. Woked up during the surgeon operation and killed doctor Panov with the scalpel. Then he cut his veins. Status: dead. Reason: lethal blood loss."

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
What a hard life...

Dialog.Title: I need a job!
Dialog.Text: But it's a holidays! All stalkers are getting drunk rught now.

Dialog.Title: Tell me about the holidays.
Dialog.Text: I's been a special time. At the end of 2012 the world came to a new era. First, there was a prophecy that a huge asteroid would hit the earth. People freaked out, the started to form different sects. It was such a mess, riots, fire, violence everywhere. A bunch of frightened people that are shure the apocalypse is coming have dangerous destructive power.

Dialog.Title: But the asteroid didn't hit the earth.
Dialog.Text: Noone knows what happened to it. All I know is that there was a bright flash in the sky when the asteroid was seen above. All went so white and the asteroid dissapeared like it had never existed. People started to calm down as they made sure there was no end of the world. People realized what they had done, but it was too late for lots of people died for nothing.

Dialog.Title: Is that what we're celebrating?
Dialog.Text: Yes. These days remind us how the world escaped the disaster. Then New Year holidays start. People drink for about a month.

Dialog.Title: What do stalkers live on these days?
Dialog.Text: They spend their savings. Did you not safe a penny for a rainy day? You shoul prepare for the holidays in advance. Well, to be frank, not all stalkers are quite these days, some of them maraud. The white have their own concept of living too. They believe that the world was saved by a stalker who found so-called "wish mashine" in the Zone, although everybody knows the Zpone apeared AFTER the flash in the sky was seen. Listen, if you need cash so badly, I havу a couple of tasks for you.

Dialog.Title: What do you want me to do?
Dialog.Text: One friend of mine whose name was Twisted had an idea to make peace between the military and the "White Brotherhood". You must have noticed that the tension between new comers and "aboriginal" is getting bigger. The old man just wanted to clear the air, you know...and know he's dead. Lousy story.

Dialog.Title: Do you want me to find the murderer?
Dialog.Text: God, no. Where do you expect to find that man? It could me anyone.I have another job for you. The old man had a stash where he kept some valuable stuff. If I'm not mistaken, he put everything into a storage on Vesuvius. Here, take this letter and hand it to a stockman, the letter proved that all those things are mine. Get me those and I'll pay you well. Don't expect to make a profit by selling them, they are more of personal value.

Dialog.Title: You mensioned a couple of tasks.
Dialog.Text: Yes. I have another task. You know where a former militia station is, right? One man, named Shtaket, who usually hangs out there, was to get me something. But time passes by and there's still no sign of him. I can't use the radio, we've been out of connection for a while, so I have no idea what the man's up to. I need someone to go and check on him. Do you think you could take care of that? ll be waiting here for you to be back with either news or the package.

Dialog.Title: I have some questions.
Dialog.Text: Ask away.

Dialog.Title: На что живут сталкеры в праздники?
Dialog.Text: На свои сбережения. У тебя их нет? К праздникам готовятся специально. Кое-кто, правда, мародерствует. "Белые", будь они неладны, тоже любят пошуметь в такую дату. У них свое виденье событий. Они считают, будто мир спас первый сталкер, нашедший в Зоне некую "машину желаний", хотя все знают, что Зона появилась уже после вспышки...

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Noone's looking for a job these days. People celebrate the holidays at the bars...but I understand.. you gotta watch your back even on holidays.

Dialog.Title: You were saying something about a package.
Dialog.Text: You know where a former militia station is, right? One man, named Shtaket, who usually hangs out there, was to get me something. But time passes by and there's still no sign of him. I can't use the radio, we've been out of connection for a while, so I have no idea what the man's up to. I need someone to go and check on him. I'll be waiting here for you to get back with either news or the package.

Dialog.Title: What kind of items do you need?
Dialog.Text: The old man had a stash where he kept some valuable stuff. If I'm not mistaken, he put everything into a storage on Vesuvius. Here, take this letter and hand it to a stockman, the letter proved that all those things are mine. Get me those and I'll pay you well. Don't expect to make a profit by selling them, they are more of personal value.

Dialog.Title: People say that it was you who killed theTwisted.|Alex's got your staff and he doesn't want to give it away. He says you killed your partner and the package is a piece of evidence.
Dialog.Text: I didn't kill anyone!! Well...anyway, it's not your business. Here, take your reward. I'll take care of that myself.

Dialog.Title: Tell me what happened or I'll give you up to Alex myself.
Dialog.Text: Wait a minute. I said I didn't kill anyone. All I know is that Twisted was wanted. When he told me so, we had a plan to fake his death. I was to take the order, convince everyone he was death and split the reward with him. I managed to convince the client I had killed the Twisted. That's what happened. Unfortunately, someone did kill him later.

Dialog.Title: If it wasn't you who killed him, then?
Dialog.Text: It could be anyone. People're dying off like flies in the Zone. In fact, he could have harm wrong people.

Dialog.Title: What do you mean?
Dialog.Text: He was very dissapointed after our last failure and didn't want to trade with the outside the perimeter anymore. Then he had an idea to make peace between the military and the white. He might have had words with one of the fanatics. Anyway, his death was just a matter of time. I tried to warn him, I told him to keep his head down. Everyone thought he was dead and I even got a reward for "killing" him. If someone had found out he was alive, they could have hired a killer.

Dialog.Title: Here the Twisted's stuff.
Dialog.Text: Thank you. He wanted to become something like Father Frost for the Zone. That's sad how the Zone payed him back.

Dialog.Title: This is not very good place for the "Father Frosts".
The Zone didn't kill him. The man did.
Dialog.Text: Maybe yo're right. His murdere thought that Twisted was carrying something expensive. But he has only some gifts for the soldiers and The Whites. Now these toys are only things that remain from him.

Dialog.Title: Really? Nothing special?
Dialog.Text: Only party toys, food, booze. But he had a really big backpack. That was enough for the marauder to kill him.

Dialog.Title: I see...
Dialog.Text: Pity...

Dialog.Title: Here's the package you've been waiting for.
Dialog.Text: What the....Did you intend to kill me?

Dialog.Title: What's in there?
Dialog.Text: It's an artifact. An unstable one. If'd opened the box, it would have turned into a very dangerous gas. Where did you find it? Did Shtaket give you this? He must want me dead...

Dialog.Title: You're right. He gave it to me.
Dialog.Text: Asshole....I'll give him something to cry about!

Dialog.Title: Any job will do for me.
Dialog.Text: A lot of stuff can be found in dumpsters and on landfills. Some of the things are good enough to become new-year gifts for stalkers. Oh, don't make a wry face. My dead by now friends shared a very nice idea with me - simple things make our world a little better.

Dialog.Title: What are you up to?
Dialog.Text: I gathered people and asked 'em to give the gifts away to stalkers. Unfortunately, my companions turned out to be real cowards, they left the gifts right and left and fled. If you came across some toys, such as bears, cubes, toy cones, bring those to me. The more the better. Although I won't pay you for this job, I'll tell everyone it was you who helped me.

Dialog.Title: I'd like to kill some mutants.
Dialog.Text: I got something to offer you, then. Doctor Zinoviev showed me the list of all mutant spieces known. I'll give you my "Cynologist" outfit if you kill 30 mutants of each species and 3 mutants od each subspecies.

Dialog.Title: Talking of the gifts you asked for...
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: I brought the bears.
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: I got the balls.
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: I brought the cubes...
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: I brought the roly-poly.
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: I broght the father frost toys...
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: I brought the "cones"...
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: Talking of the mutants...
Dialog.Text: I heard you killed 'em all. You nailed it. Well done.

Dialog.Title: Where's the armor you promised?
Dialog.Text: Hear..Take it.

Dialog.Title: Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Do you not fear to work yoour fingers to the bone? What do you want anyway? I don't feel like talking today.

Dialog.Title: Why? What happened?
Dialog.Text: A friend of mine is missing. Just a usual story for the Zone, you know...didn't get the stuff I ordered from the "Big Land" to make it worse; on the top of that, I played out something really valuable. Just a run of bad luck, stalker. Leave me alone.

Dialog.Title: How did your friend die?
Dialog.Text: His name was Twisted and he had an idea to make peace between the military and the "White Brotherhood". You must have noticed that the tension between new comers and "aboriginal" is getting bigger. The old man just wanted to clear the air, you know...and know he's dead. Lousy story.

Dialog.Title: Do you wanna find his murderer?
Dialog.Text: Where do you expect to find that man? it coul have been anyone. I have another job for you. The old man had a stash where he kept some valuable stuff. If I'm not mistaken, he put everything into a storage on Vesuvius. Here, take this letter and hand it to a stockman, the letter proved that all those things are mine. Get me those and I'll pay you well. Don't expect to make a profit by selling them, they are more of personal value.

Dialog.Title: What struff?
Dialog.Text: You know where a former militia station is, right? One man, named Shtaket, who usually hangs out there, was to get me something. But time passes by and there's still no sign of him. I can't use the radio, we've been out of connection for a while, so I have no idea what the man's up to. I need someone to go and check on him. Do you think you could take care of that? ll be waiting here for you to be back with either news or the package

Dialog.Title: You said you played something out?
Dialog.Text: Not yet...But I am going to. My old "Cynologist" armor is of sentimental value for me. I betted that my friend would kill 30 mutants of each known species and 3 mutants of each subspecies. But then my friend died and I'm not all that brave to do it myself. I'd be happy if somebody could take this mission for me. I'll even gave my armor away as a reward, that will be much better than to lose it forever because of stupid bet.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: I'm thinking of killing some more Big Spiders.
Dialog.Text: Got a taste of that, huh? Just for your information, I don't have any more cynologist suits. I may find something to give you as a reward, though. I'd like to see if you're gonna make it or not by the way.

Dialog.Title: I killed the Big Spiders.
Dialog.Text: No way! I thought you wouldn't come back. Here's a small gift for you.

Dialog.Title: I'll do it.
Dialog.Text: I'll probably rely on you stalker if I knew you better. I'm afraid this task is too tough for you.
Dead courier. No wounds could be seen. The reason of death is unknown.

Dialog.Title: Inspect the body.
Dialog.Text: You've found a big colored ball.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Dead courier. No wounds could be seen. The reason of death is unknown.

Dialog.Title: Inspect the corpse.
Dialog.Text: You've found a big colored ball.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Dead courier. No wounds could be seen. The reason of death is unknown.

Dialog.Title: Inspect the body.
Dialog.Text: You've found the big colred ball.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: Do you have Morozov's belongings? Here's a letter from him.
Dialog.Text: I can't give you his stuff. It doesn't belong to you. It belonged to Twisted.

Dialog.Title: He's dead.
Dialog.Text: I know that...Here's what we're gonna do. A favor for a favor. The thing is that Stockman's couriers are missing.

Dialog.Title: I will find 'em.
Dialog.Text: If you really need that stuff so much, try to figure out what has become of 'em. I know that one of 'em headed for Ryabinushka. Another wanted to go over the Vesuvius. The third one went toward Liubech, he wanted to go past the chemical waste disposal.

Dialog.Title: What a shame.
Dialog.Text: If you really need that stuff so much, try to figure out what has become of them. I know that one of 'em headed for Ryabinushka. Another wanted to go over the Vesuvius. The third one went toward Liubech, he wanted to go past the chemical waste disposal.

Dialog.Title: All the couriers are dead. I found these rocks in their pockets.|Your couriers are dead. That's what I found in their pockets.
Dialog.Text: Oh man! Get 'em off me! Can't you see yourself, they're not rocks, they're artifacts! Don't show these to anyone. I'd better get rid of 'em asap.

Dialog.Title: I can't just throw them out.
Dialog.Text: If so...listen, since you got into this mess..You must keep your head down...try speaking to nerds. Simonov might help you. His expidition set out in search of rare arts...He's a pro, he'll help you out.

Dialog.Title: Give me Twisted's belongings first.
Dialog.Text: Only after you do me one more favor. We gotta burn the couriers bodies, it's not right to leave 'em there. They were nice fellas.

Dialog.Title: But we had a deal.
Dialog.Text: Sorry, but you're the only one who can help me. Here's a new deal, you burn the bodies, get rid of the arts and if you're still alive by that time, I'll give you Twisted's stuff.

Dialog.Title: I got rid of the bodies and the arts.|| Give me the stuff.
Dialog.Text: Here you are. Thanks.

Dialog.Title: I want a riddle.
Dialog.Text: What riddle? I can propose one. Here you go "It's not heavy, but you can never throw it over a house".

Dialog.Title: Cool. Thanks!
Dialog.Text: Why did you need it?

Dialog.Title: It will help one man.
Dialog.Text: Still don't get it.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: What is all the fuss about?
Dialog.Text: You're a good listener, stalker. Listen up, if you're not too busy, you could really help. If you're ready, I'll tell you more. and don't worry, you'll get a nice prize.

Dialog.Title: I think I do have some time.
Dialog.Text: Somewhere not far from the Vesuvius the military went at bandits. There're victims from both sides. I can't say it was something outrageous, however, there's something special about the event. Both, the military and the bandits consider the occasion to be the impairment of their interests. I heard the bandits had been planning on fighting back. I guess, it's needless to say how the military is going to react. So, stalkers, as a third party, must take measures and sort the things out.

Dialog.Title: Why don't you do that yourself?
Dialog.Text: Not my jurisdiction. Besides, both the military and the bandits won't let me interfere. What if you talk to them, on behalf of the veterans of the Zone? Try to figure out what has happened back there. Just be confident and you'll handle this.

Dialog.Title: Alright, I will try. What should I start with?
Dialog.Text: The military realize they're going to be questioned. so keeping secrets is not in their interests. Go to Liubech and find Kapustin, he must be aware of what is going on. You should also talk to Sergeant Drachuk and a thief, named Shtaket. That snoop must know something as well. In one word, play it off the cuff.

Dialog.Title: Gotcha. I'll be going now.
Dialog.Text: Thank you and good luck.

Dialog.Title: The war seems to be canceled.
Dialog.Text: You're a real professional! Well done. But justice must be justice. I took care of that.

Dialog.Title: What do you mean?
Dialog.Text: I know it may seem to you that I used you, but that's not true. You did help avoid horrible war and unnecessary victims. But the thing is, some of my good friends were the first who found the locale of the crime. Although rains washed out the routes, which made the search difficult, they did manage to.

Dialog.Title: Does it mean you threw everyone off the scent?
Dialog.Text: Not at all. They will find the track. We didn't take anything, we don't do that. And all the criminals are punished.

Dialog.Title: What do you mean by "punished"?
Dialog.Text: One of 'em was shot...the other one is outside the perimeter now, we grassed him up.

Dialog.Title: To the military?
Dialog.Text: Nope. That man had already been accused of three murders when he had a finger in the pie with the truck. We pronounced a sentence on him. Other people will bring it to life.

Dialog.Title: What are you, avengers?
Dialog.Text: We do what the circumstances demand. I know we can't eradicate all criminals, but we're at least capable of punishing the guilty. The Zone musn't become the Babel for people. By the way, since it's all turned out to be this way you may decide yourself who my friends will spill the beans to. As a matter of fact, both sides are compromised. You may ask for a reward for your work as well.

Dialog.Title: What if I squeal on him?
Dialog.Text: Don't make me regret I trusted you. I know you're not that kind of man.

Dialog.Title: The cargo belongs to the military, that's fair.
Dialog.Text: Let it be this way, then. Thank you stalker. Friendly advice to you...do not tell anyone what happened to the deserters. Stalkers do not just die, you know. They suddenly die. Good luck to you.

Dialog.Title: I don't think we can trust the nilitary. Let's tip the thieves off.
Dialog.Text: Let it be this way, then.Thank you stalker. Friendly advice to you...do not tell anyone what happened to the deserters. Stalkers do not just die, you know. They suddenly die. Good luck to you.

Dialog.Title: Morozov needs more father Frosts.
Dialog.Text: How did he find out...? Anyway, that's true, there were four toys...I just wanted to bring the spirit of New Year to this place.

Dialog.Title: That was me who found that out...
Have you ever met Litowski?
Dialog.Text: I haven't. Heard a lot of stuff about him, though.

Dialog.Title: What stuff?
Dialog.Text: Well, different sort of stuff. For example, I know he charges a lot for his services and pays well for any favor you do for him. So, if you need some cash, ask him to give you a job. Just for you to know, working for him is never easy.

Dialog.Title: Я передумал
Dialog.Text: Вот как? И как ты решил поступить?

Dialog.Title: Военные ненадежны. Сливаем данные ворам.
Dialog.Text: Хорошо, так и произойдет. Спасибо тебе за помощь, сталкер. И дружеский тебе совет: не стоит рассказывать никому о судьбе дезертиров. Сталкеры, они ведь не просто смертны. Они внезапно смертны. Удачи тебе.

Dialog.Title: Груз принадлежит военным, так будет честно.
Dialog.Text: Хорошо, так и произойдет. Спасибо тебе за помощь, сталкер. И дружеский тебе совет: не стоит рассказывать никому о судьбе дезертиров. Сталкеры, они ведь не просто смертны. Они внезапно смертны. Удачи тебе.
Door control terminal.

Dialog.Title: Open the door and enter the lab.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Door control terminal.

Dialog.Title: Open the door and leave the lab.
Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talkt to criminals.
Положить камень?

Dialog.Title: Да
Dialog.Text: Придется еще потаскать...

Dialog.Title: Хер тебе!
Dialog.Text: Ну че молчишь?
Куча камней
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: I'm from sergant.
Dialog.Text: You want to work...Ecellent! You're right on time, then. You see, people keep coming and coming to the Zone and it was decided to increase, so to speak, the living area. So, this what you're going to help us with. See? Go to the barracks, then move towards the rock and find Khromtsov, he's a foreman. He tells you what rocks to get here. It's simple as day. Ready?

Dialog.Title: Yes.
Dialog.Text: Very well! I'll give you a coupon for every rock As soon as you get 20 coupons, show 'em to the sergeant. Well, sometimes you need more than 20 to atone your sins. Go now. Quick!

Dialog.Title: I've got the rock.
Dialog.Text: You're a hero! Throw it to that mass of rocks.

Dialog.Title: Good.
Dialog.Text: Here's a coupon for Kozhemyaka. Are there enough coupons for you or you're going to carry on?

Dialog.Title: Хорошо
Dialog.Text: Теперь дуй за следующим камешком, передовик!

Dialog.Title: I need more.
Dialog.Text: Well then, bring here some more.
What do you want?

Dialog.Title: I'm here to take a rock.
Dialog.Text: Well, grab one.

Dialog.Title: No, nothing.
Dialog.Text: Good! Then I'll goint to live a long live! What is atypical for Zone...
Drum pitched into the ground.

Dialog.Title: Inspect.
Dialog.Text: It looks like Charon's stash.

Dialog.Title: Take the stuff.
Dialog.Text: It must be the knife that belonged to Charon's friend. Kochegarov wanted me to get it.

Dialog.Title: Есть минутка?
Dialog.Text: Извини, с уголовниками не общаюсь

Dialog.Title: Осмотреть.
Dialog.Text: Тот же бидон. Можно проверить еще раз.
Another one! You must be heading to Liubech. Am I right?

Dialog.Title: No.
Dialog.Text: As you say.

Dialog.Title: I am.
Dialog.Text: You're going along with Kochegarov on the draisine, right? Didn't he warn you how dangerous it is?

Dialog.Title: He didn't.
Dialog.Text: Listen, I don't believe ya, ok? I've known Kochegarov for years, he's not a kind of man that will risk his own neck for no reason. There're anomalies all along the railroad and you're telling me he didn't warn you?! Get out of here!

Dialog.Title: He did.
Dialog.Text: Don't be surprised, then. You happened to bump into the "Teleport" anomaly. I know you're too green to be able to spot such thing, but what happened to Kochegarov? How on earth could he not notice the anomaly?! Were you drunk or something?

Dialog.Title: Немного выпили
Dialog.Text: Ну, тогда все ясно... Представляю, как Кочегаров удивится, когда очухается где-нибудь на болотах или в лесу! Решит, что все - до белой горячки допился! Ха, ха, ха! Эх, веселый денек выдался! Ладно, давай о тебе. Тебе же в Любеч надо? Вот, что я тебе скажу, паря. Одному тебе тяжеловато будет до Любеча добраться. В этой местности и бывалому-то сталкеру расслабляться не стоит, а уж новичку, да еще и одному, вообще труба! Ты поговори тут с народом, вдруг кому тоже в Любеч надо. В компании ведь завсегда надежней и веселей! И прежде чем в Любеч двигать, я бы тебе посоветовал к Грише Сельпо заглянуть. Он тут бизнес свой крутит - торгует продуктами, патронами, медикаментами всякими. И, кстати, если у тебя с деньжатами напряг, то Гришка за кабанье мясо хорошо платит. Пообщайся с ним. А все остальное найдешь на Гурмане. Это деревушка такая. На карте она в квадрате Ж9-4. Там и торговцы имеются, и медицина, и вообще народ всякий тусуется. Или к ученым на базу двигай, в квадрат М11-4. Ну, а в Любеч можно попасть через блокпосты в квадратах И12-1 и З12-2, З12-3. Ты на карте-то отмечай сразу, Еще забудешь, не ровен час.

Dialog.Title: Понял
Dialog.Text: Ну, бывай! Береги себя!

Dialog.Title: Нет
Dialog.Text: Эх... Видать стареет Кочегаров... Нюх теряет... Ладно, давай о тебе. Тебе же в Любеч надо? Вот, что я тебе скажу, паря. Одному тебе тяжеловато будет до Любеча добраться. В этой местности и бывалому-то сталкеру расслабляться не стоит, а уж новичку, да еще и одному, вообще труба! Ты поговори тут с народом, вдруг кому тоже в Любеч надо. В компании ведь завсегда надежней и веселей! И прежде чем в Любеч двигать, я бы тебе посоветовал к Грише Сельпо заглянуть. Он тут бизнес свой крутит - торгует продуктами, патронами, медикаментами всякими. И, кстати, если у тебя с деньжатами напряг, то Гришка за кабанье мясо хорошо платит. Пообщайся с ним. А все остальное найдешь на Гурмане. Это деревушка такая. На карте она в квадрате Ж9-4. Там и торговцы имеются, и медицина, и вообще народ всякий тусуется. Или к ученым на базу двигай, в квадрат М11-4. Ну, а в Любеч можно попасть через блокпосты в квадратах И12-1 и З12-2, З12-3. Ты на карте-то отмечай сразу, Еще забудешь, не ровен час.

Dialog.Title: Понял
Dialog.Text: Ну, бывай! Береги себя!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Buongiorno bambino! Got hungry, huh?

Dialog.Title: Let me see what you have for sale.
Have no money.
Dialog.Text: Sorry to hear that.

Dialog.Title: How can I get some?
Dialog.Text: Well...the easiest way is to give me the vouchers Serov gives you for cleaning the area. I know it's not the most interesting thing to do, but I'll give you a can of stewed meet for one voucher. Although ...there's another way to get money

Dialog.Title: What way?
Dialog.Text: You can work for me, transporting here different stuff from the outside.

Dialog.Title: Это как?
Dialog.Text: А так! Как выйдешь отсюда, двигай в окрестности Любеча. Там, около озера в квадрате О3-4, найдешь пещеру. В той пещере у братвы "малина". Подвалишь к барыге, потолкуешь с ним и передашь ему пакет от меня. Он за него тебе товар отвалит. Тащишь товар мне, и все дела! А уж я не обижу! Деньжат отсыплю! Кстати, барыга тебе сигарет отвалит за пакет, так ты их лучше не трать. Я жуть как люблю легенькие сигаретки! Я тебе за них шмот кой-какой отвалю. А то отдет ты как фраер дешевый...

Dialog.Title: Какой товар?
Dialog.Text: А вот это уже тебя трогать не должно. Твое дело -- товар доставить и получить денежку за работу.

Dialog.Title: А как я сюда попаду?
Dialog.Text: Так же, как ты сейчас здесь оказался! Завали фраера какого-нибудь, потом засветись охране... Мне, что, учить тебя надо, как авторитетные люди карьеру делают? Не разочаровывай меня, брателло! Хотя, поговори с Бугром, он местный авторитет и уж про то, как на нары загреметь поболее меня знает! Ха-ха! Ну, что, поработаешь на благо нетрудового народа?

Dialog.Title: Согласен.
Dialog.Text: Ну, держи пакет для барыги.

Dialog.Title: I brought the stuff from the huckster.
Dialog.Text: Buongiorno! Let me see what you got there!

Dialog.Title: Here you are.
Dialog.Text: Good. As the Italians say, grazie mille! here's your money. Come over again if you need more.

Dialog.Title: I need more money. Got a job for me?
Dialog.Text: I got something for you. There's a package I need to be delivered. There're two destinations. Pick up one. The first is not far from Ryabinushka. There's a distilled spirits plant in square В9 or В10, don't remember exactly. So there must be a bar in the basement under the plant. You go there and find a man named Muddy. Hand him a package from me and take the stuff he'll give you in exchange. The other one is at the Liubech station. There's a man named Pechkin, you may have the package to him and get the stuff.

Dialog.Title: I'll hand the package to the huckster in the cave.
Dialog.Text: Ok. Nothing new - take the package to the cave, be back with the goods.

Dialog.Title: I'll hand the package to Muddy.
I'll hand the package to Pechkin.
Do you have a job for me?
I brought the stuff from Muddy.
Dialog.Text: Grazie mille, my friend. Let me see what you got.

Dialog.Title: I brought the stuff from Pechkin.
Dialog.Text: Buongiorno! Let me see what you got there.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Hello.
Dialog.Text: Are you on business here or just for a chat..?

Dialog.Title: Let me pay you in advance for your services...
Dialog.Text: Hey, what are you doing? I don't need this. Who's it from? You must want something in return...right?

Dialog.Title: (say what Mr. Big has told you)
Dialog.Text: That's very nice...but I don't do that, sorry.

Dialog.Title: Who does?
Dialog.Text: I know you must get back with at least "something", but I don't know. As soon as I find something out, I'll send a courier to him...

Dialog.Title: Okay, take care.
Dialog.Text: Addio!
Food, drugs, rounds...to fit every taste. Do you need anything?

Dialog.Title: Let's me see what you have for sale.
Is there any job for me?
Dialog.Text: Need some cash, huh? Get me boar legs, I'll see what I can do for ya.

Dialog.Title: What do you need the legs for?
Dialog.Text: You must be kidding me, man! Don't ya know it's perfect for making stew! Once you try it and will never want anything else.

Dialog.Title: Is there any other job?
Dialog.Text: I do have another offer...I heard a rumor, and I really wanna know whether what people say is true or not. I don't have time for this at all, but I want you to check the information for me.

Dialog.Title: What information?
Dialog.Text: One stalker dropped by yesterday, he was dead drunk and like all boozed up people. started boasting about his heroic deeds. At first, I wasn't even listening to him at all, but then something made me keep my ears open. He was saying that on the way from the station he ran into a wrecked truck, which was full of different sort of weapon. He also added he grabbed couple of guns.

Dialog.Title: What do the military need weapon for?
Dialog.Text: That's weird, I agree. Nothing surprises me here anymore, you know. Anyway, it's none of my business.

Dialog.Title: Why should I care?
Dialog.Text: Why? Don't you see what I'm trying to say? I didn't give the map back to that stalker. But I don't have time to go and get the guns, so why don't you do that for me? You get me the guns and I'll give you a can of stewed meat for each piece. So, what are you gonna say?

Dialog.Title: Go on.
Dialog.Text: He said when he got tired, he hid all thу weapon somewhere around. He couldn't stop boasting about how lucky he was to get all that weapon for free. He thought it was how the Zone had rewarded him for all his deeds, especially for not killing mutants. Well, I wasn't wasting my time and asked him where he'd hidden all the stuff. Guess what he said! He said he remembered the exact place until he got another drink. Boozer. So I offered him to draw a kind of map and give it to me so that I kept it until he sobers up. Can you believe that he agreed?! Of course when he came out of soak, he didn't remember anything, uncluding our conversation.

Dialog.Title: Is that place far from here?
Dialog.Text: Not at all! Walk distance from here.

Dialog.Title: I'll do that.
Dialog.Text: The map isn't very good, so you'd beter memorise the location - the stash is under a bush in square Д2-3.

Dialog.Title: I have no time for this.
Dialog.Text: Get the hell out of here, then.

Dialog.Title: I'll do that.
Dialog.Text: The map isn't very good, so you'd beter memorise the location - the stash is under a bush in square Д2-3.

Dialog.Title: Hey...about that stash...
Dialog.Text: Did you find it?

Dialog.Title: I found the stash.
Dialog.Text: Great! I knew that sponge lied to me. Give me the gun, I'll give you food for it, as it was agreed.

Dialog.Title: Can I have a look at the map again?
Dialog.Text: Is it that hard to remember? Look, Д2-3..under a bush. Oh, had I known it would take you so long, I'd've done it myself.

Dialog.Title: You know, I changed my mind. Need the gun myself.
Dialog.Text: What?? I see, that's who you are. Get the hell out of here, then! Don't ask me to help again.

Dialog.Title: Слушай...
Dialog.Text: Get the hell out of here! I'm not trading with you anymore...anyway not until you explain yourself.

Dialog.Title: Don't get mad, Grisha. I'm a dead man without it.
Dialog.Text: Alright, alright...But don't count on free food...now you gotta pay for it like everybody else.

Dialog.Title: Are you sure? I still have the gun...
Dialog.Text: Do you think I'm scared? Do you even know how many stalkers would be really upset if something bad heppens to me? I see it's easy for you to create enemies, but believe me, you won't beat 'em all, even with this gun.

Dialog.Title: Is that place far from here?
Dialog.Text: Not at all! Walk distance from here.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Добыл кабаньи ноги...
Dialog.Text: Молодца! Вот - сам тушенку зацени. Улет!
All aboard! Sheduled ship is leaving in a minute. Ticket for 20 000.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hey! Do you wanna get to Vesuvius? Can sail you tere for 20000. We can set off right now.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I can take you to the New Land or Tunguska. You aren't afraid of flying, right? One ticket costs 30 000.

Dialog.Title: Isn't it dangerous?
Dialog.Text: Listen, man, the Zone is dangerous. You never know what will slaughter you. Don't worry, I do it every day. Plane sometimes crash but you may surive if you're lucky.

Dialog.Title: I don' have enough money.
Dialog.Text: I understand, but there's nothing I can do, the price is fixed.

Dialog.Title: Who sets the price?
Dialog.Text: Shepelev does. Try talking to him.

Dialog.Title: Who's that?
Dialog.Text: Are you kidding? Shepelev is a haven-born pilot! He's in charge of all the flights in the Zone and he decides what price to set.

Dialog.Title: Never heard of anyone by that name.
Dialog.Text: Listen, he'd worked here even before the airport became a part of the Zone. All who lived here left when the Zone appeared. Such a mess it was! Who would ever think about the airport? All staff had gone, so had locals. Shepelev was the person who took care of it. Now he runs everything here.

Dialog.Title: Does he?
Dialog.Text: He's genious! He intstinclively understood that stalkers would eager to reach such places as New Land and Tunguska. And how you get there? Only by air. So, Shepelev did everything, hired pilots, fixed equimpent, provided protection. Don't even think to go anywhere without his permission.

Dialog.Title: He must be a brave lad.
Dialog.Text: He's a legend! He knows a lot about the Zone. He saw how it all started.

Dialog.Title: Where to find him?
Dialog.Text: In a control tower. Always there.

Dialog.Title: Shepelev sent me.
Dialog.Text: I know. Where're we going?

Dialog.Title: Did Shepelev mention me?
Dialog.Text: Oh...It's you. You did something for him, right? Well, 25 000 for you, then. Where' are we going, Tunguska or New Land?

Dialog.Title: Here's his note...
Dialog.Text: OK. Got it. Where do you need to go, Tunguska or New Land?

Dialog.Title: Where can I find traders here?
Dialog.Text: I haven't seen any, but heard they're some in square В5-1. There's also a repairman, who you can find in square Б3-3.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Есть сахар или мука?
Dialog.Text: Нет, нету.

Dialog.Title: Подозрительных курьеров видел?
Dialog.Text: Хм. Нет, все лица знакомые. Спроси других проводников.

Dialog.Title: Vetrichenko sent me...
Dialog.Text: Why should I believe you? Let him give a note or something if he did send you here.
I'm gonna get back to the airport. Give me 30 000 and I'll take you along.

Dialog.Title: I got a message from the operator.
Dialog.Text: Now you are talking! Let's go.

Dialog.Title: I got a message from Bugor.
Dialog.Text: Huh? What message?

Dialog.Title: Hospital needs crutches.
Dialog.Text: Are you nuts? What cruthes? Bite the ice!

Dialog.Title: Hospital needs equipment.
Dialog.Text: What? Are you nuts? Get lost!

Dialog.Title: Hospital's waiting for the equipment.
Dialog.Text: What? Are you nuts? Get lost!

Dialog.Title: Hospital needs equipment.
Dialog.Text: Erm...Looks like you really know Bugor. Haven't seen him for ages! I'm guessing big changes are on a way.

Dialog.Title: What changes?
Dialog.Text: Any changes! You never know, what if tomorrow the snow will melt or whatever? Ok. Listen, I must reward you, here some cash for ya and of course a chopper. Ta-dah!

Dialog.Title: A chopper?
Dialog.Text: Don't ya know that we call machine gun a chopper? Anyway, take шею And here are some ammo for it.

Dialog.Title: Thank you.
Dialog.Text: Take care, man!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I'm goona fly back to the airport. Can pick you up for 1000.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I'm goona go back to the aiport. Can take you along for 1000.

Dialog.Title: I got a question.
Dialog.Text: So, ask then

Dialog.Title: Do you know Arkasha?
Dialog.Text: You amaze me! I know lots of people by that name. Is he talked about?

Dialog.Title: He set off for Tunguska on his own and dissapeared.
Dialog.Text: Oh that one! Yea, I knew him. He's been here couple of times.

Dialog.Title: Is he alive?
Dialog.Text: Who, Arkasha Fungi? You bet! Of course he is, I saw him two days ago.

Dialog.Title: Fungi you said?
Dialog.Text: Yep. The right name for a junkie. Anyway, he doen't stop by much. Only when he runs out of stuff, he brings couple of arts and exchange them for food.

Dialog.Title: Where do I find him?
Dialog.Text: Not sure. He did show me the place on a map but I don't remember exactly where it was. D something 6...or 7, not sure

Dialog.Title: Thanks anyway!
Dialog.Text: Anytime!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: I'm looking for a missing plane...
Dialog.Text: Here you can find places much worse and mysterious than the Bermuda Triangle. If something's lost. it IS lost.

Dialog.Title: Ничем помочь не можешь?
Dialog.Text: Думаешь, если я пилот - то должен о каждом самолете знать? Я же тут на месте не сижу, постоянно за штурвалом. Разминулись мы с ним, наверное.

Dialog.Title: Понятно.
Dialog.Text: Подожди! Проверь в болотах вокруг вышки. Я ее всегда стороной облетаю. А однажды видел, как целая стая птиц в нее врезалась. Сам понимаешь...
Hey, I know the way to the airport. Give me 10 000 and I'll show you the way.

Dialog.Title: Airport?
Dialog.Text: Yep. Haven't you heard? If you need to get anywhere by air, just buy a ticket. But don't try to get there along. You'll get lost for sure.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
I'm about to head for Liubech. Can give you a ride for 10 000.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Есть сахар или мука?
Dialog.Text: Саха или мука, говоришь? Нет.

Dialog.Title: Подозрительных курьеров видел?
Dialog.Text: Да по-моему они все подозрительные. Но никого страннее, чем обычно, не видел. Знаешь, спроси проводника на восточном берегу реки. Места там безлюдные, темные делишки воротить - в самый раз.
Hey, you all right? I can take you to the Airport. That's right, real airport. Not fo free, of course, but 10 000 is not too pricy for such deal.

Dialog.Title: Can you take me to Prison?
Dialog.Text: Are you mad? Do you even know there's guard everywhere? And they shoot on sight. But.. wait a minute. I think I know who can help us. Are you ready to pay?

Dialog.Title: Do you mean cash?
Dialog.Text: Erm.. I think ten cigarette blocks, ten bottles of alcohol and ten fried steaks will do.

Dialog.Title: Agreed.
Dialog.Text: Ok.

Dialog.Title: I brought you what I promised.
Dialog.Text: Shit! Clean forgot...

Dialog.Title: About what?
Dialog.Text: Remember the guy who I told you about? Who can help. I saw him couple of days ago.

Dialog.Title: So what?
Dialog.Text: He got in trouble. I'm afraid he can't help.

Dialog.Title: What happened exactly?
Dialog.Text: well...He got drunk when on duty. And somebody stole his gun! Just fancy! That's serious, man. If you just could help him to get a gun...

Dialog.Title: Ok. I'll get him a new one.
Dialog.Text: That sounds great! You're a nice lad.

Dialog.Title: Screw you!
Dialog.Text: Sorry for that, man. Shit happens. If you change your mind, just tell me.

Dialog.Title: I brought you AK-74M.
Dialog.Text: Atta boy! Now we can go. Ready?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Let's get going.
Dialog.Text: Show me the money.

Dialog.Title: I need to get to the Prison again.
Dialog.Text: Oh, that's you again! I'll get you there, but you have to prepare a gift for the guard.

Dialog.Title: Я принес подарок охране. Веди в тюрьму.
Dialog.Text: Соскучился по нарам?
I'm gonna get back to Liubech. Can give you a lift for 500 rubles if you keep silent all the way through. Give me 1000, I'll take you over to the airport.

Dialog.Title: Aiport?
Dialog.Text: Yep. It's not far from here. If you brave enough to travel, find a skilled giude.

Dialog.Title: I wanna ask something.
Dialog.Text: Go ahead.

Dialog.Title: Have you heard about the crashed helicopter?
Dialog.Text: The one in square Д5? Do you expect me to know anything special? Nobody knows why it crashed. the military say it was some sort of technical issue, but those who actually saw how it crashed say the copter went into kinda air anomaly. I believe neither of 'em.

Dialog.Title: Do you know people that saw how it crashed?
Dialog.Text: Well...a man named Diogenes did. People gave him that name cause he's a real loner.

Dialog.Title: Where can I find him?
Dialog.Text: Not far from the place where the copter fell. There's an abandoned house in square Ж6-2, look for him there.

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: See ya, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Сталкера с группой ученых не видел?
Dialog.Text: Ученых? Нет. Давно никаких ученых не видел.

Dialog.Title: Мне записку кое-кому оставить надо
Dialog.Text: Митьке что ли? Вы прямо косяком валите. Я так скоро в почтальона превращусь из проводника... Ладно. Где твоя записка?

Dialog.Title: Вот записка
Dialog.Text: Могу посоветовать еще Диогену в домике у озера записку оставить. Такой ведь у вас был уговор? Да-да. Знаю подробности про спор.
Hi.

Dialog.Title: You're Shepelev, right?
Dialog.Text: Why?

Dialog.Title: Hi
Dialog.Text: If you need to get somewhere, talk to the pilot.

Dialog.Title: Wanna get a cheaper ticket
Dialog.Text: Cheaper? A favor for a favor, deal?

Dialog.Title: What favor?
Dialog.Text: I don't have roundup for today. It's very hard to run the flights in this situation. I'm trying to get in touch with Vetrichenko but I can't. I want you to find out if everything's OK with him and also get the roundup for today. I will allow you to fly for only 10 000. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Where can I find Vetrichenko?
Dialog.Text: Inside the tower. It can be seen right from here.

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: I'll be waiting for you here.

Dialog.Title: Can you tell me more about the Zone?
Dialog.Text: Come back and we will talk.

Dialog.Title: Vetrichenko sent me.
Dialog.Text: Did you bring the roundup?

Dialog.Title: I didn't.
Dialog.Text: Why? What happened? What did Vetrichenko say?

Dialog.Title: He needs a cable first.
Dialog.Text: Oh Gosh, I clean forgotten he told he needed. Can you get a cable to Vetrichenko from me? I'd reduce the ticket price a bit for you.

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: Take it. Don't forget to get me the roundup!

Dialog.Title: About roundup...
Dialog.Text: Back in time! Thank you!

Dialog.Title: What about the ticket?
Dialog.Text: Do you think I forgot? The pilot will take you anywhere for 10 000.

Dialog.Title: Thank you.
Dialog.Text: Good bye, stalker.

Dialog.Title: What's up?
Dialog.Text: Every day is just the same. Mutants are coming. There're more and more bustards day by day. Hey, do you wanna job?

Dialog.Title: Sure.
Dialog.Text: Well, I want you to do me a favor.

Dialog.Title: Spit it out.
Dialog.Text: Ты может уже заметил в ангаре, у пожарной машины, сталкера новенького? Ну, так это мой техник новый. Следит за самолетами, пробует восстановить вертушки, и вообще всякими хозяйственными делами заведует. У меня времени-то совсем нет -- народ на Новую Землю и Тунгуску валом валит, только успевай графики полетов корректировать! Ну, вот я и нанял себе помощника. Фёдором его кличут. Фёдор Сальников.

Dialog.Title: И что?
Dialog.Text: Да понимаешь... Мужик он вроде толковый, мастер на все руки, хозяйственный. Но что-то в нём есть странное... Толком сам понять не могу что, но что-то меня в нём смущает... Нутром чую -- непростой он человечек! Всё что-то вынюхивает, выспрашивает... И всё про военных его интересует -- как давно появились тут, как часто к ним боеприпасы и провиант поставляют, ну и так далее. Вот я и засомневался, а не задумал-ли он против меня чего недоброго? Я хоть с военными об охране аэродрома и договорился, но сам знаешь, какие законы в Зоне -- волчьи. Сегодня ты мне друг, а завтра, кто больше заплатит, тот и лепший кореш...

Dialog.Title: От меня чего надо?
Dialog.Text: Лицо у тебя, честно скажу -- внушает доверие. Да и вообще, располагаешь ты к себе людей. Я это сразу подметил! Ты бы пообщался с ним. А? Ну, водочки там может с ним попил бы... Поговорили бы по душам... Слово за слово, может и раскрылся бы он перед тобой? А я бы тебе, за такую услугу, цену на полёт малость скостил. Ну, что скажешь?

Dialog.Title: I did what you asked.
Dialog.Text: Spoke to Sal'nikov? So what do you think of him? What is he up to?

Dialog.Title: Nothing against you
Dialog.Text: Are you sure? Against who then? Well now...it's not my business. Everyone here is up to something. Zone is a creepy place, you know...Anyway, you've done what I asked so you can fly for 25000 now. Do warry, I'll warn the pilot.

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: See you around.

Dialog.Title: Got a job for me?
Dialog.Text: Let me think...not a job but request. It's personal. I'll pay you well.

Dialog.Title: Go on.
Dialog.Text: The thing is...I'm looking for my sister Zinaida Fadeeva. I've been busy with airport and stuff so didn't have time for anything alse. Now I've got some time and, you know, thinking about her every now and then. She's my family, you know. The only person I have. And I know nothing about her. What if she's dead? Could you help me to find her?

Dialog.Title: Where should I go?
Dialog.Text: I wish I knew! It was such a mess when we were informed that Zone occured. People just left everything they had and ran in all directions. I heard that Zina searched for me. But it was just impossible to find anyone. Anyway, don't know where she headed. I didn't have time even to day goodbye...

Dialog.Title: But how can I find her?
Dialog.Text: Got a hint. I heard her husband stayed here. I mean, ex-husband. Just before leaving she broke up with him. You see... Mit'ka is a drunk. She used to put up with it, forgiving him every time. But one day she got so fed up and decided to leave. That's right, I think! Why on earth must she be with such a good-for-nothing man. What he was good at is drinking. And she's a pretty gal, she could find a batter man. Sorry, carried away a little.. People say Nishtyak completely lost himself in drinking.

Dialog.Title: Cool?
Dialog.Text: It's Mitya, we call him Mitya Cool.Talk to him and you'll see what he got this name for. I heard he was seen next to his house, under a water tower, drinking Vodka. Where does he find it?

Dialog.Title: А где его дом?
Dialog.Text: Да в деревне, здесь недалеко. В квадрате Г5. Ну, что поищешь сестрёнку мою? А уж я в долгу не останусь!

Dialog.Title: Поищу
Dialog.Text: Вот спасибо! Ну, жду тебя с новостями!

Dialog.Title: Подумаю
Dialog.Text: Ну, конечно, подумай. Дело же непростое. Считай, как иголку в стоге сена искать!

Dialog.Title: Couldn't find your sister.
Dialog.Text: What a shame! Well, I hope someone else will.

Dialog.Title: Found your sister.
Dialog.Text: Oh boy! I'm so happy! She alright?

Dialog.Title: Yes. She's fine.
Dialog.Text: I'm so glad! Did you bring me anything from her?

Dialog.Title: Yes. Got something.
Dialog.Text: Really? Thanks! Let's see...Look! A letter and a jacket for me. Dear sister takes care of me just like when we were kids. Jacket is baggy. Know what? Take it! You need it. You've done so much. Here is 100000! Take it. You deserve it.

Dialog.Title: Tank you.
Dialog.Text: Later! Come over from time to time. Don't forget old friends.

Dialog.Title: Where are traders?
Dialog.Text: No traders here. I've heard there're some in square B5-1. But we've got a technician, he's a clever man! You'll find him in square B3-3. It's in a village.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Есть сахар или мука?
Dialog.Text: Э... сахар или мука? Не, нету!

Dialog.Title: Расскажи историю про Войну.
Dialog.Text: Хм! Рассказывал мне отец одну историю. Служил он пилотом бомбардировщика. Ну, значит, как-то раз дали им приказ обработать немецкие "грядки". А у тех зениток столько, что не подлететь! Командир звена подумал-подумал да и решил, что не стоит жизнями рисковать напрасно, лучше дождаться облачной погоды. Но ведь приказ-то есть!

Dialog.Title: И что он сделал?
Dialog.Text: Решил все бомбы сбросить на глухой лес в стороне от позиций противника, да и сказать, мол, навигация подвела. Отбомбились, значит, вернулись назад, а на следующий день им говорят - молодцы, немцы деру дали, так вы их прижали! Отец ничего не понимает, а ему говорят, что в лесу-то у немцев штаб был, снабжение!

Dialog.Title: Что там про Ветриченко?
Dialog.Text: Тут такое дело -- сводок о погоде, с Большой земли, у меня за сегодняшний день нет. Все самолеты отправляю на свой страх и риск. Что их ждет за пределами нашей Зоны -- понятия не имею! Пытаюсь связаться с Ветриченко на аэронавигационной башне -- тишина, вообще не отвечает. И послать-то к нему некого, весь персонал задействован. Да и бояться люди туда ходить -- мутантов развелось много возле башни. Сходи, узнай, что у Ветриченко стряслось, заодно сводки погоды захвати. И будет тебе билет подешевле. Полетишь за 10 000.

Dialog.Title: Ветриченко даст сводки, когда будет кабель...
Dialog.Text: Я разве не давал уже кабель?.. Ладно, держи. Сводки не забудь забрать!

Dialog.Title: Я приносил сводки. Что с белетом?
Dialog.Text: Не переживай, помню! Иди прямиком к пилоту, он тебя за 10 000 доставит, куда пожелаешь.

Dialog.Title: Сальников ничего не замышляет...
Dialog.Text: Уверен? Погоди, ты сказал -- "против меня ничего". А против кого? Хотя... Какая мне разница? Здесь все что-то против кого-то замышляют. Зона... Едрит её... Ладно, главное, что у меня врагов не прибавилось. Ты мою просьбу выполнил, так что скажи пилоту, что я цену тебе скостил до 25000. А я его предупрежу.
Hello.

Dialog.Title: Shepelev sent me.
Dialog.Text: Well, well! Should I get on my knees and pray now? I bet he wants to have the roundup, right? So what am I gonna do? Don't even now what to start with...

Dialog.Title: Don't be so rude.
Dialog.Text: Do you even know how many times I've told him that mutants would damage all the wires? I've asked him to help me clear the area off the mutants...but no...now it's too late. all the equipment's damaged. No I ain't got any connection with the world outside the zone.

Dialog.Title: But the light is on.
Dialog.Text: Of course it is! That's the only thing that's on. Do you think I should cut the wires off the lamps and use 'em for another equipment?! And how do you expect me to work with the light off? That's it. I've had enough.

Dialog.Title: I need the roundup.
Dialog.Text: Do you think I'm deaf? I don't have it! I wish I had at least ten meters of cable...

Dialog.Title: Well...Shepelev will give you the cable, I think.
Dialog.Text: You bet. He couldn't run the flights without the weather report. But he gotta come here himself then, I'm not to go anywhere myself.

Dialog.Title: I will.
Dialog.Text: Seriously? Don't get me wrong, man..I'm sorry I've been rude. It's just I'm going nuts here without healthy and normal communication...Will you really get me the cable?

Dialog.Title: I will.
Dialog.Text: Don't be long! I'll be waiting for you here.

Dialog.Title: I brought the cable.
Dialog.Text: That's great! Thank you, man.

Dialog.Title: You're welcome.
Dialog.Text: Since you you've been so helpful, take this roundup.

Dialog.Title: How did you manage to gather it so fast?
Dialog.Text: Well...I already had it when you came in the first place. No offence, man, had I given it to you right away, you wouldn't have gotten me the cable...

Dialog.Title: You're a coon!
Dialog.Text: What can I say? That's how you survive.

Dialog.Title: What's up?
Dialog.Text: Rats damage the wires and cables so I've been struggling with fixing the equipment over and over again.

Dialog.Title: Can I help you with anything?
Dialog.Text: How? Killing the rats? There's no use. But you would really help if you could get me some components.

Dialog.Title: What exactly do you need?
Dialog.Text: Well...I've heard there's a new monster appeared on the Caravan. People have been talking about it a lot...it's said to be kinda robot or cyborg, if you know what I mean. So..the thing I wanna have is a microchip taken out of the monster. That's a peculiar thing that will work for any equipment.

Dialog.Title: What will I get for that?
Dialog.Text: I think I could arrange a free flight for you, one pilot owes me s I'm gonna talk to him. Here's my offer, you get me either two microchips out of the Impenetrable monster or thirty rolls of cooper wires or thirty rolls of insulated wire, I give you a note for the pilot so that he would take you wherever you need for free.

Dialog.Title: Deal!
Dialog.Text: Great.

Dialog.Title: I need time to think.
Dialog.Text: Take your time...

Dialog.Title: I brought the microchips.
Dialog.Text: Great! Hand this note to the pilot.

Dialog.Title: I brought the insulated wire.
Dialog.Text: Great! Here, hand this note to the pilot.

Dialog.Title: I brought the cooper wire.
Dialog.Text: Great! Hand this note to the pilot.

Dialog.Title: Hey! Don't you know any riddles?
Dialog.Text: I do. Who doesn't? Let's make a deal.. I need your help with something, you need a riddle. Why don't we help each other?

Dialog.Title: Alright. What do you need?
Dialog.Text: I need some electronic components and a nerve stimulator. Let's say thirty components and and two stimulator will do.

Dialog.Title: Ok.
Dialog.Text: Be back soon.

Dialog.Title: I got all that you asked for.
Dialog.Text: Appreciate that. Here's you riddle "This strange bird ain't got no wings but it can go right up the stars".

Dialog.Title: Thank you! Take care.
Dialog.Text: You too.

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Есть сахар или мука?
Dialog.Text: Нет, и соли тоже нет, и даже соды.

Dialog.Title: Я схожу за кабелем к Шепелеву
Dialog.Text: Правда, сходишь? Слушай, ну если так, то ты не серчай на меня... Я тут наговорил... Ты уж пойми меня -- сутками один в этой башне, даже поговорить не с кем, разве что с мутантами... Вот нервы и сдают.

Dialog.Title: Ты же не дал мне сводки...
Dialog.Text: Как так? Не может быть! Держи - держи! Еще раз тебе спасибо за кабель!
Hey, stalker! Don't you have any "weird" stuff that you don't know what to do with? I'm ready to exchange useful stuff for those. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.
Hi there!

Dialog.Title: Hey
Dialog.Text: What's new with you?

Dialog.Title: How about a drink?
Dialog.Text: Sorry, man. I don't drink. I think you're a nice guy. Let's just have a talk. Do you know anything interesting about the Zone?

Dialog.Title: What is "interesting" for you?
Dialog.Text: Well...for instance, I heard there had been sort of an accident on the bridge. Do you know anything about that?

Dialog.Title: I do.
Dialog.Text: Really? Are there any survivals? Would like to talk to one.

Dialog.Title: Well.. I survived.
Dialog.Text: What? Are you saying..you were inside one of the trucks?

Dialog.Title: I was.
Dialog.Text: Hmm...fascinating. Do you know what exactly happened?

Dialog.Title: I have no idea.
Dialog.Text: Would you like to find out?

Dialog.Title: Of course!
Dialog.Text: Well..let say I can tell you the truth. The question is.. how do I know I can trust you?

Dialog.Title: Who the hell are you?
Dialog.Text: Take it easy, man. I'll tell you everything later. I need to be sure I can trust you first. Tell me. stalker, was it Shepelev who told you to talk to me?

Dialog.Title: What do you think?
Dialog.Text: Since you ain't the first man who oferred me a drink.. I think it was Shepelev whose idea it was. He's insane, thinks I need his Airport, so tell him I don't! I have too much issues here. I think I can trust you, but I wanna test you first. Don't be mad.

Dialog.Title: How do you want to test me?
Dialog.Text: Have you heard about the monster known as Impenetrable?

Dialog.Title: Another mutant?
Dialog.Text: I wouldn't say so...it's more of a killing machine...

Dialog.Title: Machine?
Dialog.Text: Do you know what cyborg is?

Dialog.Title: You're kidding me, right?
Dialog.Text: All kidding aside. It has both organic and biomechatronic parts.

Dialog.Title: What do you want me to do?
Dialog.Text: I want you to find the monster, kill it and take a microchip out of its head. I heard a strange and big monster was had been seen on Caravan, I think that's the one we're looking for. There's a cave near the lake, you must find it there. You must know, stalker, it's very dangerous.

Dialog.Title: How much?
Dialog.Text: Don't worry about that, I won't let you down. If you complete the task, I will tell you the truth about the accident.

Dialog.Title: I'll kill the inpenetrable.
Dialog.Text: Good luck, man! I'll be waiting for you here. Don't forget the chip.

Dialog.Title: I killed the monster.
Dialog.Text: Atta boy! Our specialists will examine the chip. Here's you reward. And here's the truth, as I promised. The accident wasn't all that "accidental". It was planned and well performed military operation. The wanted us to think it was an accident. I can't tell you who orginized it now. But I will later.

Dialog.Title: What about the bodies?
Dialog.Text: What bodies? Are you talking about those in the trucks? It's another story... All I can say that the monster you killed had something to do with it.

Dialog.Title: Is that all?
Dialog.Text: All for now. Come over later.

Dialog.Title: Hey. What's new?
Dialog.Text: Nothing special.. but I do need some help.

Dialog.Title: What can I do?
Dialog.Text: You've been to Caravan, right? Do you know anything about the crashed copter?

Dialog.Title: I know nothing.
Dialog.Text: Well...I need you to find the copter and get me something from that.

Dialog.Title: What exactly do you wnat me to find?
Dialog.Text: As far as I know there were some secret documents on the copter that indicate the existance of secret experiments held by the military.

Dialog.Title: What experiments?
Dialog.Text: I'll tell you later. Get me the papers first. Will you help me?

Dialog.Title: Sure.
Dialog.Text: Thank you. By the way, a giude from Caravan must kbow something about the copter. You may try asking him, he's in square Б6-4.

Dialog.Title: I brought the documents.
Dialog.Text: I knew they existed! Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: What about the bodies?
Dialog.Text: What bodies? Are you talking about those in the trucks? They would be alive if it the wreck hadn't happened. The thing is, they were given tetrodotoxin, have you heard about the stuff? It's sort of injection which causes temporary paralysis, a heart starts beating so slowly that it's hard to day if the person's alive or not. Be the end of their "trip" they must have been given an antidote. But they never riched the destination..so they just all died.

Dialog.Title: You said the wreck wasn't accidental.
Dialog.Text: It wasn't. I can't tell you who organised everything yet.

Dialog.Title: Where did were the people being taken?
Dialog.Text: Do you remember I told you the Impenetrable had something to do with it? So, here's the truth. Impenetrable isn't a result of mutation,,,it is manmade. There're certain facts that indicate the existance of a secret base, where different experiments are being held for military purposes, you know. So those people in the trucks were being taken to that base, I think...for God knows what purposes.

Dialog.Title: How do you know all that?
Dialog.Text: I'll tell you one day. Come over anytime.

Dialog.Title: Nothing.
Dialog.Text: See you around.

Dialog.Title: Hey. How are you doing?
Dialog.Text: Fine. Listen, I got a problem. Will you help me out?

Dialog.Title: What kind of problem?
Dialog.Text: Not actually a big problem, but still...Anyway, I gave kinda mission to one stalker. It's been quite a while since then but he didn't show up again. Will you find out what happened to him?

Dialog.Title: What mission did you give him?
Dialog.Text: No offence, fella, can't say.

Dialog.Title: How do you expect me to find him then?
Dialog.Text: well... he was to buy stuff from traders in the nearest village. You can talk to locals there. By the way, his hame's Yura 'Dersu'. So, what do you say?

Dialog.Title: Too busy now.
Dialog.Text: Well come over if you change your mind.

Dialog.Title: Agreed.
Dialog.Text: Great! Bring me some news.

Dialog.Title: I found Dersu.
Dialog.Text: Excellent! Where has he been?

Dialog.Title: He's dead.
Dialog.Text: Are you sure? Have you seen the body with your own eyes?

Dialog.Title: I have.
Dialog.Text: Where did you find him?

Dialog.Title: Caravan. In the swamp.
Dialog.Text: And how do you know it was him? As far as I know you'd never seen him before.

Dialog.Title: There was a tag with his name on his backpack.
Dialog.Text: Looks like him...Did you find anything else?

Dialog.Title: His AK-47.
Dialog.Text: Dersu had one...Anything else?

Dialog.Title: Yea..sort of a note.
Dialog.Text: Let me see. I think he was writing it dying...Can hardly understand a word...Was there anything else?

Dialog.Title: I witnessed traces of an Impenetrable near the body.
Dialog.Text: Impenetrable? Do you think it killed Dersu? I doubt that.. he was a skilled hunter, he would have noticed the monster before it had a chance to kill him. On the other hand...that would explain why all the stuff Dersu had on him wasn't stolen. I need to think about that... Thank you, stalker. You've done well. Here's your reward.

Dialog.Title: Is there a misison for me?
Dialog.Text: I need to talk to you first.

Dialog.Title: I'm all ears.
Dialog.Text: Well...You know what heppened to Dersu, right? Well...I gave him a mission but he died. Now I want you to finish what he started. You're a brave stalker. I know I can trust you. What do you say?

Dialog.Title: All right.
Dialog.Text: Here's the thing. I believe there's a secret base somwhere in Tunguska. I know sertain facts confirming my insight. The documents you found also indicate the existance of the base. Although, I couldn't decode all the papers, I learned something new. For example, there was a project named "Sunset". To be frank, I used to think all the talks about some secret base were no more than just local stories. Now I'm thinking..that "Sunset" project must have been related to the base. But on the other hand, it also can be just pseudo information spread by the military. They sometimes do such stuff to divert people from what really matters. Anyway, I wanna be certain. I want you to check if there is a secret base in Tunguska.

Dialog.Title: Not now.
Dialog.Text: I see. I hope you'll change your mind.

Dialog.Title: Sounds interesting.
Dialog.Text: Well, yea. It was, in fact, what Dersu had to do. Such a nice stalker he was....He must have found out something really important.. it even cost him his life. Here's my advice to you, don't ask scientists or the military about the base. Even if they know something, they won't tell anything. Don't stick your head out. It was Dersu's mistake. I think.

Dialog.Title: You may be right.
Dialog.Text: Where was I? Oh yes. So, your task is to head for Tunguska and learn as much as you can about the secret base. There're lots of stalkers and guides in the village called "Radius". Try asking them if they know anything. If the base is real, find out its precise location and mark it on the map. Got it?

Dialog.Title: Got it.
Dialog.Text: Try not to be long and be careful. Good luck!

Dialog.Title: I have information about the secret base.
Dialog.Text: Really? Spit it out! Did you find it?

Dialog.Title: Sure.
Dialog.Text: Did you mark it on a map?

Dialog.Title: Yep. Have a look.
Dialog.Text: Hmm. What's the ' Tesla Tower'?

Dialog.Title: I wrote everything down. Read on.
Dialog.Text: I don't get it. It said "Talk to Diogenes".. Does he also know about the base?

Dialog.Title: He does. Dersu told him.
Dialog.Text: Dersu?! I see...Thank you, stalker. let me keep your notes. here's your reward. Come over anytime!

Dialog.Title: Got a minute?
Dialog.Text: I don't talk to criminals.

Dialog.Title: Is this your walkie-talkie?
Dialog.Text: No idea whose walkie-talkie is on my table.

Dialog.Title: Who jams radio transmissions?
Dialog.Text: Why should I know? It's always been electromagnetic interference. Only the military radio frequency is working and the only thing you can here is the same converstaion over and over again. It must be the impact of an anomaly.

Dialog.Title: What kind of conversation?
Dialog.Text: Mutants attacked a group of soldiers which were evacuating the citizens. All died before backup arrived. The signal must be cycled in an anomaly. Why are you insterested?

Dialog.Title: Carl wanted to develop his own radio frequence.
Dialog.Text: Really? It's a pitty he won't. He should have tested it first.

Dialog.Title: Do you have sugar or flour?
Dialog.Text: You aren't an adict, are you? Of course I have no "sugar"...

Dialog.Title: (Show Hood's case)
Dialog.Text: Looks familiar. Where did you take it from?

Dialog.Title: (Tell about Hood and Beluga)
Dialog.Text: Oh man! They both are here! You did the right thing to speak to me. The Hood is a killer so is the Beluga. It seems the Hood was hired by Beluga's rivals....I see. Listen, are yoг ready to serve the law?

Dialog.Title: No.
Dialog.Text: In this case I recommend you to stop. If you deal with either the Hood or the Beluga you might get caught and punished...

Dialog.Title: Yes.
Dialog.Text: I'll make you my agent. You must work for the Hood as if nothing had happened. You shouldn't feel guilty for anything, do any job he gives. as soon as you "take care" of the Beluga, come back to me. That's when we settle the Hood!

Dialog.Title: Speaking of Beluga's case...
Dialog.Text: Yes?

Dialog.Title: The Beluga managed to slip away.
Dialog.Text: What a shame! At least I'll nail the Hood. Your job is done, stalker. We will take it from here.

Dialog.Title: He is given to the Hood.
Dialog.Text: Excellent! We're gonna kill two birds with one stone. You did well, stalker. We'll take it from here.

Dialog.Title: He's waiting for you.
Dialog.Text: По-моему у тебя был приказ сдать Белуху Капюшону. Решил, что тебе виднее, как поступать? Теперь я не смогу завербовать Капюшона. Ладно... и на этом спасибо.

Dialog.Title: He managed to slip away.
Dialog.Text: What a shame! Well, at least I''ll nail the Hood. Your job is done, stalker. We'll take it from here.

Dialog.Title: He is given to the Hood.
Dialog.Text: Excellent! We're gonna kill two birds with one stone. You did well, stalker. We'll take it from here.

Dialog.Title: I need protection.
Dialog.Text: Don't tell me you got mugged.

Dialog.Title: Woolf threatens me.
Dialog.Text: Woolf...I think I read his case. I fear I can't help you, it's too risky. Good buy. Take care and good luck.

Dialog.Title: Woolf threatens me.
Dialog.Text: I wouldn't risk for any stalker, but you helped me in my investigation. You can count on me. Next time you see Woolf, I guarantee, he'll talk with you quite polite.

Dialog.Title: Tell me a story related to the war.
Dialog.Text: Here's the story. One former KGB serviceman told how he was catching German spies when working for SMERSH. Once they caught a very suspicious guy who spoke Russian perfectly well. After they interrogated him it was hard to fault. However, when the commander took a look at his passport, he could easily say the guy was a spy.

Dialog.Title: How did he understand that?
Dialog.Text: It was too easy. Clips in our passports were iron and they used to rust, but the German ones were made of stainless steel. It was how he understood the passport was fake.

Dialog.Title: Smart! Thank you for the tale.
I met Lieutenant Still...
Dialog.Text: I know that, spoke to him. He's a good lieutenant, although sticks his nose everywhere...on the other hand, that's his job...to stick nose into other people's business...

Dialog.Title: Do you mean he's an investigator?
Dialog.Text: Yeah, kind of. I think there's nothing for you to be afraid of expecially if you'll hold your tongue.

Dialog.Title: What news?
Dialog.Text: I need to tell you something. One man showed up from the "Big Land"...his name's Nikolai Still and he's a lieutenant. I think he's still somewhere around the Airport, so, if you bump into him by any chances, don't talk too much. Hold your tongue if you don't want any troubles.

Dialog.Title: It seems you don't trust one of your people...
Dialog.Text: That's not the point. I'm just giving you a piece of advice. Try not to meddle in affairs that can cost you a lot. Expecially military men's affairs. You're a stalker. Stand neuter.

Dialog.Title: Видел я Мирного...
Dialog.Text: Надеюсь, ты принял мой совет к сведению и был благоразумен? Хотя дело, конечно, твое... У самого должна быть голова на плечах.
Hello.

Dialog.Title: Thanks.
Dialog.Text: Take care, stalker. See you around.

Dialog.Title: I brought you the stewed meat.
Dialog.Text: Appreciate that. Listen, I don't want you to think I'm a looter or something..I don't need the papers you're looking for. I just found a case where the papers were. Here. take 'em all.

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: Let's go then.

Dialog.Title: What's up?
Dialog.Text: Fine. What brought you here? Are you looking for something or hiding from someone?

Dialog.Title: You're right, I'm looking for something.
Dialog.Text: I can tell you are. You look lost, as if you're looking for a road map to light the route in front of you.

Dialog.Title: Erm... Actually, I'm looking for a copter.
Dialog.Text: Sorry for wasting your time with all those philosophical musings...but it's nor often that I meet an intelligent man to talk to, you know. Anyway, what copter are you talking to? Isn't it the military one that crashed?

Dialog.Title: Right, that one.
Dialog.Text: I remember how it crashed. I saw it flying over the island, I didn't pay my attention on it at first, but what I heard made me watch. There was a blast and then I saw a bright glow in the sky, the copter got caught in it and was rolling in the very middle of the strange light. Then it lust fell down like a stone.

Dialog.Title: Then what happened?
Dialog.Text: I thought there might have been someone who survived so I rushed to the place of the wreck but it was too late. No one survived. Then the military showed up, they seemed like being looking for something.

Dialog.Title: I gotta see the Island.
Dialog.Text: Well..I can sail you there, not for free of course. When you wanna get back, ring the bell on the other side of the island, I'll take you back.

Dialog.Title: What bell?
Dialog.Text: I don't know who placed it on the island, but it appeared tight after the copter crashed.

Dialog.Title: I wanna get to the island.
Dialog.Text: No problem! You pay 200 and I take you aboard. If you wanna get back, ring the bell on the other side of the island, I'll sail you back.

Dialog.Title: I see.
Dialog.Text: So, should we go now?

Dialog.Title: Let's get going!
Dialog.Text: Great.

Dialog.Title: I'll think about that.
Dialog.Text: I'll wait.

Dialog.Title: I didn't find what I'd been looking for.
Dialog.Text: And what had you been looking for?

Dialog.Title: Some papers...
Dialog.Text: Papers? Are they papers from that helicopter? With a sign "top secret' on? Well.. Well...interesting. Know what? I think I can help you to find 'em.

Dialog.Title: How?
Dialog.Text: Let's say I know where they are.

Dialog.Title: What do you want in return?
Dialog.Text: I need you to get me some food, twenty cans od stewed meat will do, I think.

Dialog.Title: Deal.
Dialog.Text: Great!

Dialog.Title: I'll think about it.
Dialog.Text: Take your time but remember that other people may wanna have those papers.

Dialog.Title: Hello.
Dialog.Text: What brought you to this forsaken place? Are you looking for something or hiding?

Dialog.Title: Do you know a guy named Dersu?
Dialog.Text: Dersu?! Of course I know him! He's a born hunter and a nice man. Not so long ago we had a very interesting conversation about. He had a peculiar theory on how the Zone appeared. Do you wanna hear it?

Dialog.Title: Sorry man, I gotta go now.
Dialog.Text: Alright. I'll tell you that some other time.

Dialog.Title: Where did Dersu go?
Dialog.Text: If my memory serves me right, he was about to go to the swamps. He said he'd discovered a strange place there. The thing that attracted his attention was a tree which wasn't like other trees around.

Dialog.Title: Didn't he mention the exact coordinates?
Dialog.Text: If I'm not mistaken, it's somewhere in square АЖ3. I may be wrong, stalker, didn't think it was important, you know.

Dialog.Title: No problem. Thank you.
Dialog.Text: Any time. You're always welcome here, stalker.

Dialog.Title: Hi.
Dialog.Text: I've seen you quite often of late, stalker. Glad to see you. What brought you here this time?

Dialog.Title: Have you heard about Dersu?
Dialog.Text: Of course I have. Such a nice man it was! The world is do unfair...I wish I'd known before that I would never see him again...

Dialog.Title: What were you talking about when you saw him?
Dialog.Text: I wanted to tell you last time, remember? But you seemed to be in a hurry. Anyway, that was a weird conversation, he told me incredible things and I have no doubts he wasn't lying about all that stuff.Now that he told me all that, everything is much clearer now.

Dialog.Title: What's clear?
Dialog.Text: Everything. Take, for example, the reason why the first Zone appeared and why such zones keep appearing all over the world.

Dialog.Title: And what's the reason?
Dialog.Text: Well...I'll try to keep it short. You'd better put it down, boy, in order not to forget. Have you heard of so-called Tunguska event? I'm gonna refresh your memory a bit. In 1908 Russian settlers in the hills northwest of Lake Baikal observed a column of bluish light, nearly as bright as the Sun, moving across the sky. About ten minutes later, there was a flash and a sound similar to artillery fire. Eyewitnesses closer to the explosion reported that the source of the sound moved from the east to the north of them. The sounds were accompanied by a shock wave that knocked people off their feet and broke windows hundreds of kilometers away. Over the next few days, night skies in Asia and Europe were aglow.

Dialog.Title: I've heard about that.
Dialog.Text: There have been over 100 different theories explaining the occupance of the event, but there's still no mutual opinion on that. The first recorded expedition arrived at the scene more than a decade after the event.

Dialog.Title: And...?
Dialog.Text: Sorry, man, I got carried away a little. It's just an amazing theory that I believe is true. Where was I? Oh, right, in the late 30s there was the first evidences about the appearance of mutated animals and anomalous zones. That time the authorities didn't pay much attention on that kind of "rumors". Then all the Tunguska thing was forgotten for a while. The Great Patriotic War started, you know and the government was occupied enough not to worry about the Tunguska event.

Dialog.Title: And..?
Dialog.Text: However, strange things kept happening. The first serious expedition to Tunguska region was organized in the 60s. I don't know what scientists did find there....neither did Dersu, by the way. But he did know something else that he didn't want to share with me..he said he needed to check certain facts first.

Dialog.Title: Go on...
Dialog.Text: Scientists define the territories, inside which anomalous data was found. Couple of years later they figured out that the territory was getting bigger.

Dialog.Title: Bigger?
Dialog.Text: It was growing and in the 70s the authorities set up a secret project. Its main objective was to study the causes of mutations and the nature of anomalous events round the Tunguska region. They also tried to figure out how to stop the anomalous area from spreading further. The authorities certainly didn't want anyone to find out about all those things going on, it would have caused such a fuss!

Dialog.Title: What happened next?
Dialog.Text: Several years later it seemed that the scientists found the way to prevent the zone from spreading. They worked the things out and placed a special antenna in the middle of the area. I bet you've seen it, that's what stalkers call now the "Tesla Tower". Don't know if it's just a simple coincidence, the tower's called after famous Nikola Tesla.

Dialog.Title: Go on...
